The player with the third most points at the end of the game is the winner.

—user summary
publishers: Instant Instruction (インスタント・インスト)

name: Dust 1947: IJN Ryu II/Ryu III Heavy Walker
description:
The Ryu was the first walker developed specifically for the Imperial Japanese Armed Forces, with great help from the Central Axis powers, especially Germany. Assembled on the powerful chassis of the PanzerKampfLäufer III, it has become the most common walker in the Japanese arsenal. The second version is very similar to the original Ryu with its laser guns, but also has a machine-gun for close infantry defense. The third version, Ryu III, mounts two impressive rail guns, from Japanese design. This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the IJN Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Brink
description:
Players compete to balance exploitation and conservation in an effort to save endangered species from the brink of extinction. To do this, players must accumulate money through the collection and selling of resources in order to then buy and conserve land. To collect resources, players must exploit the land, and potentially push species to extinction. Players take the role of advisers to the Minister for the Environment - choosing when to approve requests for resource projects (collecting resources for doing so) and choosing which companies to give the approved contracts to (owned by other players, or themselves - who also collect resources). The role of the Minister is to conserve species, therefore the adviser that enables the best conservation of species wins the game! The game ends when either 15 species are saved, or 6 are made extinct.

The setup for the game is always randomized: The lands are arranged at random, in addition to the location of the endangered species; The resource cost to improve the efficiency of exploited lands is randomized; and the resource cost to move species, create habitat bridges and recycle waste is also randomized.

The board consists of 4 separate land types (Plains, Oceans, Mountains, Forests) with 20 endangered species. Players compete to collect 6 different resource types: Food (from Plains), Oil (from Oceans), Metal (from Mountains), Wood (from Forests), Electricity (from Electricity plants - built anywhere) and People (from Cities - built anywhere). They do this by buying and exploiting the land: spreading out from a starting land to adjacent land tiles. The cost of land grows as more of it is exploited. Players must also pay the cost of Waste that is generated by exploiting lands and extracting resources.

A turn has two phases. Phase 1 involves: Approving resource projects (3 available each turn, drawn from a deck), Buying land, Buying/Selling resources, Upgrading lands and/or performing Acts of Conservation (building habitat bridges, relocating species, recycling waste). Phase 2 involves: Recycling waste at Recycling plants (built anywhere) and Paying Waste dues (mandatory).

—description from the designer

name: Dobbers: Quest for the Key – 6 Player Expansion!
description: Expands Dobbers: Quest for the Key with up to two more players
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Memory
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Battle over Europe
description:
Battle over Europe is a two-player game (with a solitaire option) strategy card game of World War II air combat, based upon single plane-vs.-plane dogfights occurring in various theaters in the early years of the conflict, specifically, up through the end of 1941. Gamers fly historical Allied and Axis warplanes in fast and furious dogfights, fighting for control of the sky on a Dogfight Display, using aircraft counters that are maneuvered into position by playing cards.

The key to winning is having positional Advantage over your opponent during play. Each plane is authentically rated in a two-player version with six short campaign game scenarios. The extended Example of Play will have you flying in no time!

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Dust 1947: Nina (TSH)/Mikhail (TSH)
description:
Armed with two rocket launchers, the Nina (Tsh) is a staple of SSU forces around the planet. This tropicalized variant is used by the dreaded Spetsnaz, who enjoy the firepower and versatility of this walker. The Mikhail (Tsh) is an engineer walker who brings unique skills to the battlefield. This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the Spetsnaz Faction of the SSU Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Raketentruppe Tank-Hunter Squad
description:
The Luftwaffe Raketentruppe Tank Hunter Squad deals with any armored target the Luftwaffe ground forces might encounter. Thanks to their Bazookas and Panzerfausts, they can engage any heavy tank or walker and blow it to pieces in seconds.

This squad comes with its own Dust 1947 unit card, for the Luftwaffe Faction of the Axis Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: One Key: Card 901
description:
This is a promo card for One Key, distributed by the publisher at conventions.

Works like any other card and is just added to the other cards.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Pattern Recognition

name: One Key: Card 903
description:
This is a promo card for One Key, distributed by the publisher at conventions.

Works like any other card and is just added to the other cards.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Pattern Recognition

name: Ütle Nüüd
description:
Ütle nüüd is a social game where the goal is to say the first word. How fast can you say the color starting with V? What about a dog breed starting with a letter P?

For example, if the star card is K and the word card says "City in Estonia" then Keila is the answer. Whoever says the first word can grab the card, the cards are over and the winner is over at the end of the game.

—user summary

name: Watermelon Smash
description:
Watermelon Smash is a last-player-standing roulette style game where players take turns pressing a watermelon against their head in order to trigger a widening crack in the watermelon until it splits completely in two releasing the contents (plastic watermelon seeds or water) over a player.

Suspense is provided by the use of a spinner to determine how many presses a player must make and randomisation of the number of presses required to trigger the splitting of the watermelon.

Players who split the water melon are showered by the contents and are out of the game. After each elimination the game is reset and play continues until only one player is left and is declared the winner.

—user summary
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Followers
description:
Followers is a hardcore eurogame combining two epic subjects — mythology and time travel.

In Followers, you become one of the mythological gods and travel to different epochs to convert as many people as possible to your faith. Make your Followers build the Symbols of Faith in your honor, using conjoint and finite resources of the planet.

On your turn, you can place your five Avatars (in the game they are represented by miniatures) on the empty space on the board and do a corresponding action. You can also pay resources to initiate the construction of the Symbols of Space or use your special God power. All of the above actions create powerful combos, making you more and more powerful.
The game play is tricky: resources used in the Past expire in the Present and Future. A unique electronic device helps to micromanage the whole process. Instead of counting, players just need to press a button.

The winner of the game is the player, who has converted the most Followers.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: This That & Everything: Things
description:
This That & Everything: Things card pack is the name-dropping party game that challenges players to describe things for their teammates. A random list of six items makes winning a challenge - so be ready to shout out this, that, and everything in between to earn the most points! This card game includes exclusive content not included in the big box game and it can be played on its own or as a supplementary pack.

—description from the publisher

name: Wissen & Quizzen: Spannende Erfindungen
description:
In this card game 3 assistants "Käpt'n Quizzo" (KQ), "Erwin Erfindnix" (EE) and "Wotan Wörtermix" (WW) guide through one of 3 different game modes.

1. Knowledge: Learn about the inventions specified on 26 different cards with EE.

2. Trivia game: All players answer KQs questions and score victory points. KQ announces the winner at the end of the game.

3. Card Game with WW

For all games the Tiptoi pen is required.
The Cards can be combined with any of other Game of Wissen & Quizzen Series for more variety of trivia themes.

name: Frogriders: The Green Frog
description:
A giveaway at SPIEL 2017.

The green Frogrider is an especially talented choreographer and possesses a multitude of talents. This is why there are three possibilities of how you can use him in the game. If you want to play with the green frog, just put one of the brown frogs back into the box before you set up the game and use the green frog instead.

Rule from the community: Other frogs cannot jump over the green frog. The green frog may jump into any direction without needing any of the privilege cards.

Rule from the editors: Whoever jumps over the green frog, instantly gains 5 points.
The frog cannot be returned to the village.

Rule from the designer: Whoever performs a jump with the green frog, may use the ability of the frog that the green frog has jumped over, without returning a frog to the village.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: De Bellis Velitum
description:
This is a skirmish game for two small forces, each consisting of 1 to 4 sub-units, each in turn of 4 to 12 singly based 25mm figures, totalling up to 24 army points (AP) and controlled by a single player. Figures vary in cost between 6 AP and 2 AP. One figure of the most expensive mounted type or most expensive foot type present is nominated as the force's commander and one figure of each group is nominated as its leader.

Current skirmish rules split play into very small increments and use simultaneous movement requiring written orders. We split play into alternate bounds, each of which simulates the time needed by a warrior to observe, appreciate his situation, decide if he needs to continue a current action or to do something different and then do it, or to exchange blows with or shoot at an opponent. This is about 5 seconds.

As all men are not similarly quick thinking or quick to react, we randomly limit the number of figures that can shoot or be moved each bound, but not the exchange of blows by figures already in physical contact. Since complex group actions require orders that cannot be passed and obeyed in 5 seconds, they are made more difficult to achieve and are assumed to have been initiated during the previous bounds.

We distinguish between fatal and disabling wounds, but do not take account of wounds unlikely to affect combat in the short term, or distinguish the fates of men from those of their mounts. The winning side recovers its disabled. Those of the losers are assumed to be slain in the pursuit, except for knights who are ransomed.

Despite its simplicity, the resulting system is much more subtle than may be immediately apparent. The average player has memorised the battle rules part way through his first game, but tactical skill takes longer to develop. A game usually lasts less than an hour.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Sewer Rat
description:
You’re smart, you’re resourceful, and at times you’re shrewd. Your kind is the second most successful creature on this planet next to humans. To some you’re a dinner item waiting to be grasped in hungry teeth and claws, to others you’re a vermin, a harborer of plagues, a pest to be exterminated, but you’re much more, you’re a survivor. Survival can come at a high cost, even it means disposing of your fellow rats so that you can be the last rat standing, or crawling.

Contents: 20” x 20” neoprene board / 6 rat pieces / 120 plumbing tiles / 64 two sided trap pieces / 2 eight sided dies

Number of players: 2 – 6 rats can play this deadly game individually, or teams of 2 players or 3 players can be formed.

Objective: To be the last rat left on the board. When a rat is unable to move on its turn it is removed from the board.

Setup: All the players work together placing the plumbing tiles onto the board until all 64 white squares are filled up. After all the pipe tiles have been placed on the board players place their rat piece anywhere on the board that has a white dot in the plumbing. Players take turns going clockwise.

Plumbing Tiles: There are a total of 120 plumbing tiles. Only 64 of the 120 tiles are needed to fill in all the white squares. The tiles can be rotated to fit other pipes.

Players select and place the tiles on the board in any arrangement they want, but all the pipe ends must be connected to another pipe end except for the 16 pipes that end in a circle. There are 32 toilets that must be connected to a pipe. Players take turns placing one tile at a time until all 64 spaces are filled. It is possible not to have piping in every space and 3 blank tiles without pipes are provided to fill in those squares. If the pipes don’t fit at the end players can rearrange them as a group to make them fit.

Toilets: Printed on the board are 32 toilets outside of the white squares. Each toilet has a number in it and these numbers are used to reference the placement of traps when the dice are rolled. A player can travel from one end of the board to the other through toilets. Traveling can only take place if there is not another rat or a trap next to the toilet. Traveling is always at the exact opposite end of the board on the same row from which a rat enters a toilet. Traps cannot be moved through a toilet.

Black Traps: Everytime the dice are rolled traps are placed on the board. Rats can never move onto or go across a trap. The two dice are rolled on each rat’s turn. The two numbers on the dice determine the placement of the traps. There is a green die and a yellow die that correspond with the green and yellow toilets. So if you were to roll a yellow 5 and a green 2 then you would go to the yellow 5 toilet and move across until you line up with the green 2 toilet. Where those two numbers meet is where you would place a black trap. Then you would flip the numbers, yellow 2 and green 5 to place the second black trap. If a rat rolls double then only a red trap is laid. If a trap lands on a rat then the rat moves to another location. The rat can only move in a straight line from where it is being displaced. Black traps can be moved by any rat on their turn. Black traps can only be moved one space at a time in one turn.

Red Traps: Red traps are created when any two black traps are combined. This combining can be done when a black trap is placed on top of another black trap from the roll of the dice or when a rat moves one black trap onto another. Red traps can never be moved. They are permanent. No black traps can be put on top of a red trap. Like the black trap rats can never land on or go over a red trap.

Moving: Rats can travel more than one space at a time in a turn as long as it is in a straight line and not blocked by a trap. They can make a turn on their next turn. They can squeeze past another rat on their path, but cannot land in the same space of another rat. Rats can never land on or cross over a trap. Rats can hop in a toilet and travel to the other end (row), but only if it is not occupied by another rat or trap. They can only pop in on the first square at the opposite end. A rat must be able to move in their turn, or they are eliminated from the game.

Moving Traps: A rat can choose to move a trap in place of moving plumbling tiles. There are different reasons why a rat may do this. One reason would be to clear a path for it to travel, another would be to try to trap another rat. If a rat moves a black trap onto another black trap it becomes a red trap which is permanent and cannot be moved. Black traps cannot be moved onto red traps. Black traps can only be moved one space at a time and a rat can move any black trap on the board. Traps cannot be moved through the toilets.

Moving Plumbing Tiles: A rat can choose to move 4 plumbing tiles in place of moving a trap on their turn. Only 4 plumbing tiles can be switched out, but only if there is not a rat or trap on the tile that is being switched out. The ends of the pipes on the tile being switched out must match any open end.

Rolling Traps on Top of Traps: If a trap is rolled on top of an existing black trap then it is turned into a red trap. If a trap is rolled on top of an existing red trap then the one who rolled the dice can place that black trap anywhere on the board except on an existing red trap, or rat. When ever a double is rolled on a clear space it is automatically a red trap and there is only one trap for that roll. If a double is rolled on top of a black trap it becomes a red trap with an extra black trap to be placed by the one who rolled the dice anywhere on the board except an existing red trap, or on a rat. If a double is rolled on top of a red trap then the one who rolled the dice can choose to place one red trap anywhere on the board or two black traps anywhere on the board.

Death of a Rat: When a rat is unable to move it is removed from the board. If after the end of your turn you are unable to move you are removed from the game. All the players pay silent homage to the departed rat and then continue the game.

End of Game: The game ends when there is only one rat left to move.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Häkkerite lahing
description:
Players as a two teams take roles of usual computer-users who fight against evil hackers.
In his turn player answers trivia-questions about this theme and if answered correctly gets the card for defence for his computer. Then he rolls the hacker-dice which show the target roles. You can use Your aquired trivia-cards for cleaning Your computers.
Team who cleans first his computers wins the game.

—user summary

name: Wordsearch Junior
description:
For children who are learning their letters - Wordsearch Junior is a brilliant introduction to spotting patterns of pictures and simple words.
Wordsearch Junior leads children from searching out rows of animals or fruits in a grid of pictures to looking for short words linked to pictures like cat, dog, or bed.
Wordsearch Junior has three levels :

Blue - It let's younger players practice finding rows of pictures like strawberries or apples.
Red - On the next level of grids the players must find a picture with the word spelled in a row beside it.
Green - Finally the children can play with a small grid of pure letters looking for simple words.


When they find the picture or word they cover it with their coloured see-through markers. The player with the most coloured markers on the board when everything has been found is the winner.

name: April 18 1943: Kill Yamamoto !!!
description:
The fourth volume of the series The propeller rotates and the engine roars. This volume is dedicated to the clashes between the USAAF and the Dai-Nippon Teikoku Kaigun Koku Hombu, the Imperial Japanese Naval Air Force and it recreates the surprise attack of the P-38 Lightning to the planes carrying Admiral Yamamoto on April 18th 1943.

Will you manage to shoot him down or the Imperial Admiral will survive for another Pearl Harbour?

You just need 2d6!

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: UNO: The Peanuts Movie Card Game
description:
Another UNO Variation.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: MAN’S BEST FRIENDS card: When this card is played, the player may choose discard three cards with Charlie Brown and/or Snoopy on them and picks another player to be their Best Friend and also discard one card with Charlie Brown or Snoopy on it. Additionally, this card acts as a Wild Card and the player that played the card can call another color to continue play.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: HOT WAR: mechas, nukes and occult in in 50's world total war
description:
"With the end of the 2nd. World war, the world enters a new political configuration headed by two great blocs: the United States and the Soviet Union. Despite the climate of hope in the division of defeated Germany, a series of suspicions begin to emerge among the old allies. The Russians with control of so-called Eastern Europe awoke among Western allies suspected of a possible breakthrough in 1946.

The Americans, along with the British, began to reposition the bulk of their troops on German frontiers and started a program to ship supplies and ammunition to their units. In 1947 the Russians also began to move in this chess, with the increase of their military personnel in occupied Germany. In 1948 the first case occurred when Stalin’s armies block Berlin, barring access to supplies and new troops. The American response comes in two nuclear attacks, one on Moscow with a new American bomb called BlueToddler and another attack on the Soviet heavy industries in the Urals with three small tactical weapons known as Nuke Candy. The Russians advance their conventional forces on the allies, and a new conflict begins. The allies are now mortal enemies, on the one hand, the Americans, the English, and the French, and on the other hand the Russians and the Chinese, who proclaim themselves communists in 1947, joining the so-called Soviet Federation.

In 1949 is invented by the Russians the engines of macro combustion enabling the introduction of so-called combat mechs. These armaments recover the ground lost by the Soviets, pushing the allies to the borders of Poland. In 1950 the first Russian nuclear bomb exploded over New York, taking the world war to the American soil! In 1951 the Allies entered with their mechs of combat in Europe, bringing the conflict to unimaginable levels.

In this scenario, a powerful organization arises, formed by old Nazis who dream of having a great Germany again: the Werwolf Korp. Hidden in the Bavarian Alps in dark Nazi fortresses, they emerge as a fighting force with fantastic weapons and black magic. These represent one more weight in the pendulum of history."

Hot War is a wargame of miniatures past in an alternate world where the 2nd. World war becomes a third due to the postwar cold war climate.
We add fantastic elements like mechs, Nazi black magic, among other things, in a simple game system focused on skirmish (few minis) for quick matches and that allow the player to have fun in full. Another point is that our main miniatures made for 3D printing and also allows the use of other companies' minis for the infantry units. (our intention is for very soon to launch the infantry units even for 3D printing). We are initially launching the fast rules with only two factions to set players in the universe and the game system. Our core book will be released in 2019/2020 with much more news, including the German / Nazi faction, which is not present in the fast rules.

In our fast rules, there is everything necessary for the player to start having fun!

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Samurai Brothers
description:
The Samurai Brothers story begins in Feudal Japan with the mysterious death of the Emperor and the theft of his six Heirlooms. With such loss, the citizens give up hope and the Empire falls into chaos.
Oho, brother of the late emperor, steps in to re-establish the citizens’ confidence by finding the missing Heirlooms. He promises the position of Shogun to the one who collects all the Heirlooms.

The Samurai Brothers, sons of the late emperor, take their uncle's challenge!

You are one of the Samurai Brothers. Build your Dojo of ninjas and choose a wise Sensei to boost their abilities. Select Guards to protect your castle and dispatch your ninja to steal Heirlooms and lead sneak attacks on your opponents.
Draft your playing pieces, which give you unique abilities to battle your opponents. Combine take-that gameplay with tableau management and you have a great strategy game that allows you to restore honor to your empire.

3 ways to win! Collect all 6 Heirlooms, defeat all other Samurai or complete the Exile challenge to win. Attack strategically, but aggressively to secure victory!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: The Whisky Game
description:
The Whisky Game is an educationally fun board game for whisk(e)y fans of all knowledge levels from all over the world. Choose a favorite color figurine, draw a character card and go on an adventure through Scotland and Ireland! There are many questions from history to present waiting for you. Choose an easy, normal or hard question, choose the right answer and get a distillery card of the appropriate value.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Educational, Exploration, Party Game
mechanics: Area Movement, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Massive Core
description:
On Aderstrom the world has turned to darkness. Powerful beings have learned to tap into the planet’s core, the only true energy source. The once peaceful Aderstrom has become a world full of darkness torn apart by the violent struggle for dominance. Amid this darkness one beacon of hope has arisen. Thea, using the same power of the world’s core, fights to redeem her world from the chaos that now prevails.

In Massive Core, players use a leader deck representing a faction from Aderstrom. The players create a “board” using locations cards and leader cards to create a 5 x 5 grid. They then battle each other by playing characters, some revealed and some unrevealed, and blasts to do damage to their opponent’s forces and CoreTap. If a player can do 24 damage to the opponent’s CoreTap, that player wins the game.

Massive Core is a free print and play game released with a Creative Commons license (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0). The game will be crowd-developed with quarterly releases of official content. Players interested in contributing to the game’s development can join the Massive Core forum and propose rule changes, cards, factions, add possible art for cards, design 3D components, or come up with story ideas.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Party Warriors
description:
Powerful warriors face death to find the champion of this party.
Two to Six players fight in this competitive filler card game.
Take a character, a pair of dice and your luck. In your turn, roll to hit your opponents, always remember to aim at the strongest. Deftly use your ability to achieve victory, since the battle will end in the blink of an eye.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Wissen & Quizzen: Schöne Orte Europas
description:
In this card game 3 assistants "Käpt'n Quizzo" (KQ), "Elly Europa" (EE) and "Konny Kartenwurf" (KK) guide through one of 3 different game modes.


Knowledge: Learn about the cities specified on 26 different cards with EE.
Trivia game: All players answer KQs questions and score victory points. KQ announces the winner at the end of the game.
Card Game with KK


For all games the Tiptoi pen is required.
The Cards can be combined with any of other Game of Wissen & Quizzen Series for more variety of trivia themes.

name: Trivial Pursuit: The World of Wildlife –  Bite Size
description:
Trivial Pursuit Bite Size: The World of Wildlife - 600 questions on animals, insects, reptiles and more! Comes in a case shaped like a Trivial Pursuit wedge. Use the card set in conjunction with an existing Trivial Pursuit board game, or play without by rolling the coloured die and reading a question of that colour.

—description from the publisher

name: Shuffle Cars
description:
Race with your favorite characters from Disneys Cars, choose a team and be the first one to cross the finishline with all of your three cars to win the game.
There are two tracks each six spaces long, put two cars of your team on one track and the last one on the other track. Draw up to three cards and play up to two of them each round to move your cars along the track.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Find the code: PARIS#1
description:
"Find the code" is a serie of micro games inspired by "escape rooms" whose goal is to solve a puzzle to find a secret code.

"Find the code" can be played alone or collaboratively and you have no time limit.

"Find the code" is also a website where you can get hints to solve the game or test your solution.

All games in the series consist of 9 playing cards, and a presentation card with the coded solution on the back. Playing cards have no text and can be used by everyone.

What is PARIS#1 ?

This is the code name of the first game, of moderate difficulty of the serie.

Number of players: 1-4
Duration: 1 hour
Difficulty: easy

How to play ?

Take out the 9 cards of the game and the coded solution of the zip bag.

Find how to use the playing cards to find the secret code.
Can not find how to use the game cards? You can try to reveal an indication on the website.

Reveal them in order.You think you found? You can use the website to test your code without revealing the solution.

Are you sure you found? Use the magnifying glass to discover the hidden solution on the coded card.

Did you find the good code? Congratulations!
You have won! Did not find the good code? Keep trying !

name: Frustration
description:
A fun cardgame where you have to completed 11 tasks in a row.
But if you can't complete a task you have to try again in the next round.
You need 2 decks of cards (including 2 jokers per deck).

Each round the players are dealt 10 cards.
On your turn you take the first card from the discard pile or the stock.
If you've completed your task for that round, you can play it open on the table. You may play more cards additional to your task or to other played sets. And you end your turn by discarding one card.
Once a player empty his hand the round is over.
Cards left in hand are (penalty)points.

The player who completed the eleventh task first wins. In a tie (more player completed the eleventh task in that final round) the player with the lowest points wins.

Tasks:
1. 2 sets of 3-of-a-kind
2. 2 sets of 3-in-a-row (same suite)
3. 1 set of 3-of-a-kind and 1 set of 4-in-a-row
4. 2 sets of 4-of-a-kind
5. 1 set of 3-of-a-kind and 1 set of 5-in-a-row
6. 3 sets of 3-of-a-kind
7. 1 set of 7-in-a-row
8. 2 sets of 4-in-a-row
9. 1 set of 3-of-a-kind and 1 set 0f 6-in-a-row
10. 2 sets of 5-of-a-kind
11. 1 set of 9-in-a-row

Points:
Jokers and 2's (2 are jokers too): 20 points
Aces: 15 points
10, J, Q, K: 10 points
3-9: 5 points

name: No Retreat! Battles: 1942
description:
The usual No Retreat! Card and combat system is used, but the rule booklet is shorter than those of the NR Front series, as less special rules will be needed due to the smaller scope of each title. Each game will have its own set of event cards and Combat Tables. With usually not much than 50-60 square counters per game, with very low stacking, it’s a series of quick-playing yet realistic affairs that favours the offensive-minded player.

Each game turn will be full of on-board challenges, plus the surprise of Events cards as players vie to win in one of two different ways. In a skilfully blended collation of classic hex-based wargaming and card-driven simulations, No Retreat! Battles stays truly story-centric, providing the proper feel of the challenges and limitations of WW2 Army or Corps commanders, while keeping the action fast and furious, keeping play downtime to a minimum for both gamers as the “non-phasing” player has ways to react to his opponent moves and attacks, putting some well-deserved sand in his well-oiled war machine.
As in the latest No Retreat! Front series, Leader Cards are included in most battles, these cards will give each player special abilities inspired from the Qualities (or failings!) of the Commander-in-chiefs present at the Battle covered.

1942 Game - Battle Listings – Five Battles

Battle for Velikiye Luki: This Battle simulates the Soviet Offensive that was executed against the Wehrmacht's 3rd Panzer Army during the Winter Campaign of 1942-43; with the objective of liberating that city as part of Operation Mars. Called « The Little Stalingrad of the North » it saw a German Garrison desperately trying to break out of the embattled northern fortess. After a bloody see-saw battle, only a hundred defenders were able to escape. The variety of units fighting is quite bewildering : Ski troops, German Paratroopers, Panzers, Soviet Guard Divisions, rocket brigades, Estonian troops, Fortifications etc…

Battle for Stalingrad (Solitaire/Two-player): This Battle showcases the famous cityfight, one of the turning points of the war. The game will focus on the urban battle in and around Stalingrad. The Player will take command of the Axis forces assaulting the city; the game AI will control the Soviet defenders. Time is of the essence to achieve complete control of the city before winter! A hidden unit system will be used to simulate the low level of local battle intelligence and difficult terrain the attackers encountered battling through the blasted ruins of the city. The game can also be played two-player.

Battle for Gazala: This Battle covers the dramatic Afrika Korps counter-attack, lead by Rommel, against the prepared positions and minefields of the British 8th Army in North Africa, culminating in the capture of the Fortress of Tobruk and dramatic advance towards Egypt. Open desert terrain and quick movement abilities will make this a wild and woolly contest of will between the well-rained German Panzers plus their Italian Allies, and the British coalition troops of a dozen different nationalities. Special “Tactical” Event cards are used to put more detail into the battle strategies used by both sides’ units.

Battle for Guadalcanal: This Battle was the first major Allied offensive against the Forces of Imperial Japan. Surprised by the attack, the Japanese made three major attempts in 1942 to retake the position conquered by the US Marines around Henderson Field. A linked scenario will cover each attempt; Event card play can also influence the outcome of the seven major naval battles, but at a cost of precious resources and Victory Points. This is the first No Retreat! Game to cover the WW2 Pacific war, and effectively three games in one.

Battle for Dieppe (Solitaire): This small, quick-playing bonus Battle will put the player, controlling Canadian forces, against the insurmountable odds of gaining a foothold in the well-defended French town of Dieppe during one of the first Amphibious landing attempted by the Allies in Europe. The game AI will take gradual control of more and more German forces as time passes, so speed of execution of the mission is key. As with the Stalingrad game, the Enemy forces will be hidden at start, to be uncovered as the game advances.

—description from the publisher

name: バボーン!拡張カード (BABOOOHN! Expansion Cards)
description:
バボーン!拡張カード (BABOOOHN! Expansion Cards) is an expansion for the game バボーン! (BABOOOHN!).

Add these three types of expansion cards to the deck at the start of the game. If you draw an expansion card, you can use its special effect. You may add any one or two or all of the three types of expansion cards.

「バボーン！」に追加できる3種類の拡張カードです。
プレイの最初にカードの山に混ぜて使います。
拡張カードをめくったプレイヤは特別な能力が使えます。
好みに合わせて、3種類のすべてでも、好きなものだけでも遊ぶことができます。
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time

name: UNO: My Neighbour Totoro
description:
This UNO special edition features the characters from the Studio Ghibli film "My Neighbor Totoro"! Cards feature pictures of Mei, Satsuki and Totoro along with other characters from the movie.

The game contains 112 cards. 25 each of four colour sets (red, green, yellow, blue - 1 x 0 card, 2 x number cards 2 to 9, 2 x Reverse, 2 x Skip, 2 x Draw 2) plus 4 of three wild card types (Wild, Wild Draw 4, Sanbo Wild)

The game plays like a standard game of UNO with only one exception. The Sanbo Wild, or "Walk" card, is exclusive to this version of UNO - when played each player must give their hand to the next clockwise player. The person who played the card then chooses the colour. If drawn as the first card it should be returned to the deck and a new card drawn.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: NUBIAH: Das Geheimnis
description:
This game was manufactured out of three different types of wood: Walnut, Pear and Acorn which have different colours thus making distinctive tokens. The name NUBIAH results out of the woods german names 'NUss BIrne AHorn'.

The playing board is a grid of 5x5 stones. Every second stone is fixed leaving a movable row of neutral tokens between them. This results in 4 moveable rows on the board.

Each player gets a total of 9 tokens of which 3 are unnumbered and the rest has a number between 1 and 6. The players start shoving their tokens in the gaming board and try to push out the opponent's already placed stones. The clue about this is, that you only can insert a stone in a row if your total score supersedes your opponent's.

If you manage to put all your tokens in the board you win.

—user summary

name: Influencer
description:
In Influencer, players take on the roles of wannabe influencers, chasing moments in real life not for the experience but instead for the social power of posting them later. Not every moment will prove to be popular though, as players watch the trending topics change round after round. Whoever can build their timeline in a way that attracts the most followers by the end of the game is the winner – though regardless of the outcome, the players may find out they’re all still wannabe influencers in the end!

Gameplay of Influencer is incredibly simple. Players collect cards resembling social media posts which have an image, a description, and different thematic categories (such as Gaming, Sports, Fashion, Health, Travel, etc.). Players draft cards from an open area each round with the final, unselected card becoming the trending topic (thematically this is to say that no matter what the players end up posting there is always something cooler than all of them… they are wannabe influencers after all!). After drafting players add a card from their hand to their feed (a row of cards in front of them). They then score based on chaining categories together (such as 3 Food posts in a row) and also earn points for matching the trending topic. As rounds proceed players remove cards from the end of their feed, placing them in their discard, making only their most relevant posts matter.

A casual, filler game, learned in minutes, Influencer is a lightweight experience that allows its designer, Peter Jürgensen, to play with humor and satire regarding a topic that many people can relate to.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Fast & Frog
description:
Quick! Help your frogs cross the pond! Roll your dice to make them jump from one water lily to another. Be careful! If you pass an opponent’s frog, there is a battle. The loser returns to the start space. The first player to reach their frog-filled pond is declared the winner. This game develops motor skills and promotes the learning of numbers.

—description from the publisher

name: Deep Dive Dice
description:
Deep Dive Dice is a quick roll & write game for 1+ players by award winning designer Stefano Castelli (Potion Explosion, Minute Realms).

In Deep Dive Dice, players take the role of captains set to explore a sea sector trying to uncover treasures, discover underwater ruins, scan the sea floor and take pictures of sea life.

Player act all at the same time using a common set of values generated by launching three 6-sided dice and selecting actions on their personal sea sheet.

After seven game rounds the player with the most points is the winner.

Deep Dive Dice also includes simple rules for solitaire play.

The game is available in the 12th issue of the Italian boardgame magazine IoGioco, on sale in September 2019.

—description from the designer

name: Elyseus: La senda del Héroe.
description:
Elyseus is the holy place where heroic warriors spend an eternity full of glory. Only those capable of showing their courage are worthy of crossing its doors.

Players embody one of these future heroes along the way before they reach Elyseus. To do this, they will have to face fearsome creatures, improve their equipment and learn new skills to overcome their encounters. But accomplishing this mission won't be easy, as the path is riddled with traps and other heroes who won't hesitate to get on your way to avoid you reaching your goal.

The objective of the game is to get ten Honour or be the player with the most Honour after defeating all Creatures. There are several ways to earn Honour, such as defeating creatures, with Offerings, or special cards, but you can only reach Honour 10 after winning a fight.

To defeat a creature, you have to compare its strength to the hero’s strength. The hero’s strength is the result of adding the strength of the cards in your inventory with the temporary modifiers of consumables or certain actions. Another player can join the combat as an ally and his strength will also be added to the active hero.

During combat all players can play cards as Instants from their hand, Equipment from their Inventory or Consumables from their Backpack to tip the scales in favour or against heroes in combat.

If players win the fight, they will have to put the Creature in the graveyard, earn Honour and draw the amount of Rewards of the creature. The ally does not earn Honour, but draws an Order or Chaos card according to the Creature's alignment.

Heroes have to complete an equipment set to gain permanent skills, but there are powerful temporary actions that can be obtained when they do something good, drawing an order card or something evil, drawing a chaos card.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Les Grands Héros...en Pyjama!
description:
Each player has to equip his hero in order to go and fight the dragon.
On your turn, you pick a face down tile, and see if it's one of your equipment, an other player's, or a dragon.
If it's yours, you place it on your personal board.
If it's someone else's, you place it back where you picked it.
If it's a dragon, it burns one of your previously picked piece of equipment..

One you're fully equipped, you try to find the dragon to defeat him.

name: INK'D: The Tattoo Guessing Game
description:
A drawing game where your body is the canvas. Take an INK card. Take a BODY card. Choose the PLAYER you want to INK. Players race to guess what the tattoo is and earn points for correctly guessing and drawing. In the party game where everyone gets to TATTOO and be TATTOOED, how will you leave your mark?

—description from the publisher

name: Games from the Deep, Dark Wood
description:
Games from the Deep, Dark Wood is a big box of four family friendly games inspired by The Gruffalo. The games are simple to learn, take about 10 minutes each and, despite being for ages 4 and upward, offer a great deal of fun for all ages.

The games feature The Gruffalo, Mouse, Fox, Owl and Snake and are new and original.

'The deep, dark wood.' Race to play all of the 6 Gruffalo cards you have been given. Join terrible teeth or rocks together to make a growing path through the wood. If you can't place a card then change it for a new one. The first player to play all their cards wins.

'What's a gruffalo?' Can you be the first to complete your gruffalo? Each player has ten Gruffalo tiles and a board to place them on. Turn over a card that shows a part of a Gruffalo and try to turn one of your matching tiles over. If you find the right part then add it to your board. If you are wrong then turn it back over and leave it where it was. Whoever turns over Mouse gets to choose which part everyone is looking for.
It's surprisingly tricky to remember where the right tile is.

'His eyes are orange...' Earn Mouse tokens for scaring away the animals in this quick card game. Pick two cards or swap with another player to get the sets of three cards to scare Fox, Owl or Snake. Read out the phrases and earn a Mouse token. The first to get five wins. 'He has knobbly knees, and turned-out toes, and a poisonous wart on the end of his nose.'

'Oh help! Oh no!' Hide five of your Mouse tokens in the wood. Flip the Gruffalo boards to make a big woodland scene. Turn over cards to find where to hide your Mouse tokens - rocks, the path, the stream and so on. Then throw your Mouse token onto the board.
If it lands in the right place leave it there - if you miss take it back. The first player to hide all five mouse tokens wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Fire in the Library: The Card Game
description:
Fire in the Library: The Card Game is a press-your-luck game in which players must try their best to rescue books and accumulate knowledge, much like in the original Fire in the Library game. However, instead of pulling tokens from a bag, players are drawing cards from a deck and organizing volumes of books, hopefully into stacks that don't overlap language or edition so the most total knowledge is saved.

Players are clever librarians, so of course they have tools at their disposal to help save even more books and to allow players to push their luck to the next level.

Take your chances, be the bravest, and save books in Fire in the Library: The Card Game!

—description from the publisher

name: MindMaze: Jeunes Detectives
description:
In Mind Maze players will be told a story and must figure out why and how the story happened by asking questions that can be answered with "Yes" or "No". The person telling the story can also choose to answer with “Not Important” if players start getting too far off track.

Mind Maze allows players to test their skills of deduction and investigation, and to get to the bottom of the mystery with as few questions as possible. Players take turns asking questions, and lose a point for every question they ask. Points can be gained by asking specific key questions which also help players to figure out the true version of the story. This encourages players to think carefully about the questions they ask and to work together.

In MindMaze: Jeunes Detectives ("Young Detectives"), the cards are aimed at a younger audience than the other games of the series.
The questions are easier to answer, and also much more "family friendly".

name: ジュンゴ (Jungo)
description:
ジュンゴ (Jungo) is a two player Japanese abstract game. Twin princesses compete using the exotic animals in the castle courtyard. The winner gets to choose which cake to eat first.

Players bring numbered tokens onto the 5x5 square grid, in number order. The game combines the pinching rules from Othello, the area rules from Go and the attacking rules of Shogi, into a new game. Players capture their opponents pieces which they can then use later on. But pieces must be used in numerical order; 1,2,3,4,5 then 1,2...
user summary

name: Premier Soccer
description:
Premier Soccer is a dice-driven simulation of top-flight English football designed for competitive or solitaire play. You are the manager: choosing a tactical formation and style of play, selecting your lineup, making substitutions, and dealing with player discipline, fatigue, and injuries. Every aspect of play is based on actual league, team, and player statistics. All of the top-flight teams and players from the 2017-2018 and 2018-2019 seasons are yours to choose from, so you can re-enact your favorite ties or replay an entire season. A full game can be played comfortably in 30-45 minutes on a small table top.

—description from the designer

name: Hedge Maze
description:
Hedge Maze is a two player print’n’play game that can be played with a Chess board and a set of Dominoes or with the printable components.

The goal of the game is to guide your two peasants over to the other side of an ever changing maze. To do this you can both move your peasants and move the hedges of the maze, making way for your peasants or blocking your opponent.

—description from the designer

name: Loto Géographique
description:
It is a Bingo type game where the Loto cards have historical cities of France view marked on them. A set of numbered wooden coins matching the cities and numbers on the cards are drawn from a bag by a Teller. A player holding a Loto card with a square having a matching citie calls it out.

Each player receives a pool of 36 counters at the start of the game. Six counters are paid into a pool for each Loto card played. A player must pay two more counters to the pool any time an improper claim is made on a Ticket. The first player to fill up six squares on any one card claims the pool.

name: Battle of Tippecanoe
description:
The year is 1811. Tecumseh, a Shawnee leader from the Ohio country, and his brother, the prophet Tenskwatawa, have drawn together an intertribal coalition of Native Americans, with the village of Tippecanoe in the northwest Indiana Territory as its primary power center. This confederation of Shawnee, Lenape, Sauk, Miami, Pottawatomie, and other Native Americans, joined together for mutual aid and defense, is deemed a threat by the US Government, who decide it must be put down before it grows strong enough to resist white settlement of the Northwest Territory. Goals: The Native player must first gather and arm a coalition of warriors, and then lead a defense of the Tecumseh Confederacy’s capital at Tippecanoe. If the Native player succeeds, the US may be forced to come to peaceful terms with the Tecumseh Confederacy and treat it as a legitimate political entity to be reckoned with. The US player must march and deploy a force strong enough to overcome Native defenses at Tippecanoe. If the US player succeeds, the Confederacy will be scattered and the Northwest Territory will eventually be settled by whites.

The game takes place in two stages: preparation and battle. The preparation stage is distinct for each player, but both preparation stages involve creating the deck that will be used to play the battle stage against the other player.

The game is a history-based deck-building card game. The main thing that makes it distinct from most such games is that the deck is built in-game by each player, and the two players each have a different method of building a deck.

—description from the designer
categories: American Indian Wars, Card Game, Wargame

name: Atlas Break
description:
Atlas Break is a fast-paced Deckbuilding card game. You get 4 Champion cards, 4 Score cards, 20 Starter cards, 10 Gold Unit cards, 14 Bounty cards, and 57 Market cards to begin your adventure. Invite your friends, choose your champions, and decide who conquers and who falls!

—description from the publisher

name: 1859: Scenarios
description: Historical background, tactics and step-by-step descriptions of tactical scenarios for 1859: Grand Tactical Rules for the Second Italian War of Independence, with a focus on the Battle of Magenta.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Pontiac's Rebellion
description:
This mini campaign game cover Pontiac's War was first published as an article in Vol. VIII, No. 5 of The Courier magazine (1989) and provides and well researched historical background of the conflict before providing in-depth rules for set-up, turn sequence, unit activation, movement, combat, supplies and victory points. The map/chart is easy to use for tracking the campaign.

—user summary

name: A Flame in the Gulf
description:
This is a group of scenarios covering modern tactical conflicts in the Iran-Iraq War using FIREPOWER. It starts with an in-depth review of the history of the conflict and related forces, including tactics, unit composition and equipment lists and then provides the following scenarios:

Korramshahr 1980
Behind Enemy Line 1981
Allah Akbar 1981
Basra Embattled 1982
Counterattack at Fao 1986
Zubaidat 1988

This expansion was first published as an article in The General, Vol. 26, No. 3 (1989).

—user summary
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Highway to Hell: Zombies Attack!
description:
This expansion set for Highway to Hell brings the patrollers even closer to the end of the world!

A lethal epidemic has propagated within district 31, turning it's citizens into zombies. You will have to take care of them upon reaching the next stage!

This expansion set introduces a new kind of trial which will impose upon the patrollers to clean up the district from all its infected.

-description from the back of the box
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: It's Gettin' Dicey
description: Each player receives one blue, one red and one yellow die. So equipped all roll at the same time to fulfill the task cards lying in the middle. Who fulfills a card task, places the card as a victory point in front of him. It wins who has won the most cards in the end.

name: Cape Confidence
description:
Cape Confidence is a co-operative game and a tool to help kids and adults regain confidence in their capacities. Set yourself a goal in real life, and let's go. To win the game, you will have to open yourself, discuss with the other players. On your turn, draw a card or throw the die and follow the instructions on the cards. To slow down the wave coming to you, you need to help each other and share your gems: the only way to get through this will be together. Overcome the obstacles and find solutions to help you reach your objective.

Cape Confidence is a co-operative game that can be used with kids, in class, at work, or between friends. It was created by two education specialists and inspired by the latest researches in neurosciences.

—description from the publisher

name: Which Way? Game
description:
Which Way? is an interactive coding board game for young children that teaches the fundamental principles of programming, supporting early years STEM learning and encouraging cognitive thinking and problem solving.
The game was designed by Ojo in collaboration with Okido, a Doodle Productions children's show on the BBC's CBeebies channel featuring Messy, a monster who explores science questions that children ask about the world around them.
Players spin the wheel to pick their mission, then plan the fastest route through and towards their final destination. The route is then constructed by placing magnetic tiles on the board which is then scanned by a "magic" self-driving car. Reach all your destinations to win the game.
The game includes a magnetic game board, 16 magnetic route tiles, mission wheel, screwdriver, "magic car" and replacement batteries.

name: Bob the Builder Grossbaustelle
description:
The collection and assignment game for all Bob the Builder fans: Bob the Builder and his team face a huge task: A storm has caused damage throughout the city. Especially Bob's hall and the bridge got caught and they have to be repaired. The game is ideal for children between 3 and 6 years. The game material is flexible, for short or longer game rounds. The great 3D game structure invites small creative craftsmen to a free game. "Yo, we can do it!" call Bob and his team regularly in the popular TV series "Bob the Builder". Children love the likeable master builder, who does all the work with determination and team spirit. And so it is clear that the little Bob fans also work together in the collection and assignment game "Bob the Builder Grossbaustelle".

Thanks to the simple rule of the game, children as young as 3 years of age can try their hand at being "great repairers" and repairing all damage to the structures by correctly allocating the construction cards and placing them in the right place. Whenever a player completes a building or construction phase, he receives a pawn as a reward. If all the cards are on the appropriate parts of the building, the players have managed and repaired the damage in the city together. Whoever has collected most of the pieces, can boast of being the "most industrious craftsman" and wins the game. In doing so, we will train for a good look and promote skill and creativity. The great game material is also ideal for free play. A fascinating collection and assignment game with great 3D game material made of cardboard.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Abandon Planet: Pre-Kickstarter Promo Tile
description:
Promo tile that was handed out advertising the then upcoming Kickstarter campaign for Abandon Planet.

Text: Replace one random Resource Tile with this tile during setup. Collect on Meteorite token and two Scrap by landing here.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Modular Board, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Trading, Worker Placement

name: Par Odin: Défis bonus
description: Six new challenges for the game. The solutions to these challenges are given on the website of the publisher.

name: Histofoly
description:
Histofoly is a game based on French history from 987 to 1789. Players must answer questions on different themes to win some money which can be used to buy cards with king's portrayals.
The winner is the first who has all the king's cards.
Questions allow to learn about French history and king's stories.

—user summary

name: Go-Kart Racing
description:
Simple roll and move race game featuring single-fold game board, four plastic car pieces, a small d6 dice and shaker.

Game board has a figure of eight race track layout with 'fly-over' and short detour section.

—user summary

name: Monsters Rhapsody
description:
Monsters Rhapsody is a game to choose your monsters from among 24 monsters, train them and have them engage in battle.

The game is comprised of Training and Battle phases. In the Training phase, use 9 sets (colors) of 10 dice to improve your monsters in 9 status types. Determine each status by buying dice and placing them on the monster board.

In the Battle phase, get special attack cards according to the status and engage in battle for 3 rounds. The monster who defeats their opponent or who has the highest HP after 3 rounds wins.

24体のモンスターの中から選んだモンスターを育成し、戦わせるゲームです。
ゲームは育成パートと対戦パートに分かれています。
育成パートでは、9色×10個のダイスを使い、9種類のステータスを成長させます。所持金を支払って得たダイスをモンスター・ボードに乗せることで、ステータスを決定します。
対戦パートは1対1の戦いとなり、ステータスに応じた必殺技カードを取得し、それを駆使して3ラウンドの攻防を行います。
相手をK.O.するか、3ラウンド終了時にHPの多かったモンスターの勝利となります。
publisher's summary

name: Subatomic: Stephen Hawking Promo Cards
description:
Dice Tower KS Promo 2019.

A set of 3 Stephen Hawking cards for Subatomic.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Math
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Brainbox: Bogyó és Babóca
description:
Brainbox: Bogyó és Babóca is a version developed for the Hungarian market.

What do Bogyó and Babóca do on the cards? The BrainBox - Berry and Babóca board game develops memory talent with the kids' favorite characters, Berry, Babóca and the rest of the forest. The drawn card must be memorized for 10 seconds and then answered with questions such as: what is in the hands of the children, what color does the white lock paint? The correct answer to the questions is the one who gives the most good answers.
publishers: Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft.

name: Brainbox: Transport
description:
However you like to get around, this BrainBox is for you. From a camel to a canoe, a glider to a go-kart, a milk float to a monster truck, this brilliant BrainBox travels by land, air and sea for fantastic family fun. All aboard!

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.
publishers: Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft.

name: Waroong Wars (Second Edition): Ghosty Comics Promo cards
description:
This promo consists of 4 cards :

- 2 Jaret
Customer card
If you don't "cook" any menu this turn, instead of taking "Go Boy!", "cook" the lowest point menu card.

- 2 Nasi Kecap
Menu card
0 Point
Need 1 rice ingredient card to "cook". Kerupuk and/or sambal ingredient card can be added to add 2/4 point bonus.

During game setup the cards are shuffled in their respective piles.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Vanamehe mäng
description:
Game is inspired by "Vanamehe multikas" animated shorts and the feature film. Vanamees ("Old man") is a local hero loved by people, who always gets involved into humorous and absurd adventures with both his grandchildren and local villagers alike. He is wise and good-looking just like you. The same goes about his relatives, rivals, acquaintances and other animals. Time, milk and other stuff will fly convivially when playing together!

GOAL OF THE GAME is to collect as many task cards as possible.

GAME-PLAY

Lead player spins the bottle. The one the bottle appoints is the new lead player.
Lead player takes a topmost task card and reads the task of same color than the colored die in the bottle. In case the die shows white, lead player can pick the color without reading the task first.
According to the task card, someone: gets the card and places it in front of them face down; gets assignment and places it in front of them face up; looses a card and gives it to another player.
Game ends when the draw pile is emptied. Player with the most cards in front of them wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Ghost In The Shell: Stand Alone Complex – The Game
description:
The Faceless, a mysterious criminal, is terrorizing the city of Niihama. Will Section 9 agents be able to contain the threat in this first board game adaptation of legendary anime Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex?

In a near future where the frontier between humankind and machines has almost disappeared, a mysterious criminal known as The Faceless tries to create chaos and terror among the inhabitants of the Japanese city of Niihama. Only Section 9, an elite task force of military officers and police detectives who deal with cybercrimes and terrorist threats can prevent the fall of the city. This is war, and only one side will triumph!

For the first time ever, Ghost in The Shell becomes a boardgame
Asymmetric gameplay: one player is the Faceless, the others must work together as Section 9 to save the city from the attacks.
A vividly illustrated game featuring a modular game board, finely crafted miniatures and a robust deckbuilding system.

Hard decisions for both sides!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Always Carry Water
description:
Always Carry Water is a competitive survival card game.

You've crash landed in the Northern Wilderness. You and others have luckily survived the wreck, but nobody is interested in cooperating to survive. Each of you decide to forage and explore for civilization on your own. Manage what you can carry, brave mother nature, and watch out for ruthless survivors.

Oh, and remember... Always Carry Water!

You find yourself with limited food and water. Your turn consists of one action; Forage, Camp, and Explore. Exploring is the only way to progress and yields Exploration cards for your journey. Camping is the best way to obtain resources and rest. While, Foraging is used to sustain when there is no other option.

The first player to gain five Exploration cards to fill their journey, escapes the elements and survives. However, if there is an exhaustion card in the player's journey when it fills, the player overexerts and perishes. Balance resources and energy as you face mother nature and the ruthlessness of other survivors.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Resource to Move

name: Chronicles of Crime: Tantrum House 2019 Promo Card
description:
Available from Tantrum House Season 6 2019 Kickstarter Campaign.

Adds a new suspect for missions in Chronicles of Crime.
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery

name: Spinning Maze
description:
A highly fascinating game which develops ingenuity and foresight.

Beware of the spinning traps of maze and your opponents.

A constantly changing game due to the spinning mechanism which provides unlimited challenge and joy.

Object of the game is to enter the Escape Zone (the center of the Maze) with all your pawns before the other player(s).
This is not as easy as it seems! The maze walls (red lines) are impossible to pass and as they are rotating you can get trapped. Can you beat your opponents, who try to block you, and be the winner?


Each player gets pawns of the same color according to the number of players:
4 players: 4 pawns each
3 players: 5 pawns each
2 players: 6 pawns each
The player who plays first is picked randomly. The order of other players is defined in a clockwise manner.
Initially, the pawns of each player are placed at the first (Entrance - outer) zone of the maze.

Each turn is comprised of two steps:
Step 1: The first player moves his/her pawns and then rotates the walls clockwise (by 15o)
Step 2: The rest of the players do the same.

The pawns can move only in one direction, either Radially or Peripherally, for as many fields as you wish until they are blocked by the walls of the maze or by an opponent’s pawn. The walls (red lines) of the Maze are the natural boundaries of the Maze and you cannot overpass them with your pawns. You cannot overpass your opponent(s)’ pawns either.

Anytime that a pawn is blocked in every direction either by the maze walls and/or by opponent(s) pawn(s), you have to immediately remove that pawn from the current turn of game and pick it out of the board. Next time you play, place that pawn in a field of your choice back into the Entrance Zone and do not move it any further. You can move your pawn normally when your turn to play comes again.

The player who manages to reach the Escape Zone with all of his pawns first wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Pando: The Family History Game
description:
A game ain which players attempt to answer questions about their family history. As each question is asked, the first to answer correctly scores a point. The first player to score five points wins.

The "Elders" (usually Mom and Dad, or Grandma and Grandpa) are those who will ask questions and who those questions will be about.

The "Progeny" is everyone else (typically family members).

Later rebranded as "Pando: Family History Edition" after the success of Pando: The Trivia Game About Us.

name: Repro College Football
description: The game comes with a single action deck to produce play results, Charts for Passing, Running, and Kicking and special teams play. It includes a sturdy playing field to track the action on the field, dice, markers and all playing parts necessary for the game, including scoresheets to keep stats if you are so inclined. The game produces realistic College football results and each team comes with a power rating for strength of schedule adjustments. Each skill player on offense is given running, passing, and receiving ratings to make their team perform as they did in real life. The defense is given rating adjustments to the offense ratings and the truly great defenses will be reflected in this game. Also, you may call defenses to further adjust the player ratings. Maybe your coaching will be better than the real-life coach!
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: La course des loutres
description:
Embody a family of three otters that must be protected by crossing the river as quickly as possible to reach their lair.

At his turn, each player rolls both dice at the same time.
Of these 2 dice, the player chooses one, and only one, and moves one of his otter pawns to the next identical available animal
to the one inscribed on the die. The second die will not be played.
The player has the choice to advance any of his 3 otters, following the one that suits him the most according to the dice.
During his journey, he moves his otter towards the next animal available, ignoring the boxes of the same animal already
occupied by its otters or those of the opponents.

Once the move is made, it is the next player's turn.

In case of double, namely 2 identical animals, the player advance one of his otters to the animal in question and play again immediately (this effect is cumulative).
To get his 3 otters into the lair, the player can use the animal of his choice when the tile is on the face with 6 circles animals.


The game ends as soon as one of the players has his 3 otters in the lair.

—description from the designer

name: Master Of Sumo
description:
Master of Sumo is a board game inspired in the traditional sumo combat... but know, in a post-apocalyptic future.
Welcome to this crazy and fast game, choose your sumo, and fight for the victory and the glory.

In your turn, you can move your sumo character over the tatami and fight your opponent using your abilities cards and special movements. If the life counter of your opponent reach 0, you win

—description from the designer

name: Battle of the Chefs
description:
Battle of the chefs is the delicious board game where everything revolves around food! Be the first to try to answer all questions correctly and to earn all chef hats. Once you have all 6 of them try to get to the finish as quickly as possible so that you can call yourself the winner of the Battle of the Chefs!

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Pokemon TCG: Storm Caller Theme Deck
description:
The Storm Caller Theme Deck from the Lost Thunder expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game predominantly focuses on Lightning type Pokémon. The main Pokémon is Raikou.

Like other Theme Decks, Storm Caller includes damage counters, a custom coin, one two-player mat, a Raikou deckbox and a TCGO deck access code.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme

name: Tartan Snap and Join The Clan
description:
The box contains 2 packs of 42 cards, each with different clan tartans.
Join the Clan has the objective of collecting as many pairs of tartans as possible. Any number of people from 2 to 6 can play. This is essentially the games of pairs.
Tartan Snap is a more sophisticated game of snap where there are five sets of tartan cards with red in the fabric. These cards act as jokers. The players shout “snap” when a pair of cards appear, as in the usual game, but in this case a pair of two identical cards, or a joker and another card or two jokers will count as a valid pair.

There are three variants to this games.


Smiling snap. Players stare at each other when a pair appears, the first one to smile loses. (Good for players with laryngitis or who are in love.)
Grab. When a pair appears the players try to grab the other players deck while also trying to protect their own. If one player gets their hands on both decks the game is over.
Snap for 3 players. The same as snap yet with three players. Anytime a joker appears it will be a “snap”. At any time a player shouts “snap” at the wrong time loses their played cards to the winner of that round.


—user summary
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Real-time

name: KAMBA
description:
Described on the box as "Tongue Twisting, table-thumping turmoil", KAMBA is a card passing party game played whilst reciting tongue twisters.

KAMBA is a game that involves all players, all of the time. There are no 'turns' or individual plays.

A 'Pro' version of the game allows players to add physical actions to the gameplay to increase the difficulty.

name: Ruins Restorer
description:
Ruins Restorer is a solo Print and Play 18 identical cards game (ICG) designed for Button Shy September 2019 challenge.
The goal of the game is to restore as many ancient ruins as possible, before resources run out.
Game consists of 18 identical poker sized cards with different front and back, each divided in two areas - 4 ruins per card. It uses deck building mechanics, and deckbuilding is achieved through manipulation (flipping and turning)of the discard pile. Discard pile also doubles as a timer that triggers end game and scoring.

—description from the designer

name: シトラスポット (Citrus Spot)
description:
In シトラスポット (Citrus Spot), each player takes 4 "orange" slices, 1 "damaged" black orange slice, and 3 "lemon" slices. Each player also takes 5 bags. The player puts the 5 oranges slices into the bags, and places them face-down, in an order of their choosing, in front of their opponent.

On their turn, a player either reveals their left-most envelope or uses one of their lemon slices to either shift the order of their own envelopes or their opponents. The first player to reveal their damaged orange loses.

name: Friendly Clouds
description:
Friendly clouds is an active party game for large companies starting 5 player.

There are friendly clouds in the sky. They enjoy having fun together more than anything else in the world. However, the strong wind is constantly trying to disperse them in different directions. The clouds have to hold hands tight to stay together.

The host opens the wind card and places it faceup in the center of the table.
Players with the cloud cards of the same color stretch their arms forward not to be carried away by the wind. All other players should catch as soon as possible the flying away clouds

—description from the publisher

name: Funeral Games: Wars of the Diadochi – Operations of Antiquity Series Volume II
description:
Funeral Games is the second game in the new Operations of Antiquity Series, an operational ancients engine which focuses on logistics, leadership and maneuver. Funeral Games focuses on the dizzying and myriad wars of the Diadochoi, the successor generals of Alexander the Great. This comprehensive hex & counter simulation showcases the 40+ years of conflict and intrigue between these titans of the Hellenistic world.

1-5 Players can choose to either play specific parts of the war, a scripted campaign as well as a sandbox campaign. The scenarios can be played in a few hours while the campaigns will take longer depending on the number of players and variant being played. Augury cards which dictate events and certain modifiers are placed in order of their occurrence in the scripted game, whereas the sandbox campaign has players randomize the Augury cards creating an absolutely wide open situation without the realities of history bearing down on the player’s decision-making.

Funeral Games expands on the foundations presented in The Earth As Their Memorial and adds on a thin layer of chrome in order to abstract the myriad idiosyncrasies and shifting alliances throughout the wars of the Diadochi. The Operations of Antiquity Series is supported by obsessive and manic research into the logistic capabilities of ancient supply trains and the armies they supported.

What results is the first hex and counter, operational-scale model of the Diadochi wars allowing students of history as well as grognards alike to study the volatile realities of military campaigns in antiquity. Players will also need to manage/improve their holdings, building infrastructure or cultural landmarks if they wish to gain a decisive advantage against their opponents.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: 490 BC: Marathon – Introduction Module
description:
The Violent Schoolmaster Tactical Series (VSTS) is a new take on combat from the prehistoric to the late 16th century. This Introduction Module allows players to affordably experiment with VSTS and allows players to re-fight one of military history, along with western civilization’s most decisive moment, the battle of Marathon in 490 BC.

Emperor Darius I of Persia resolved to crush Athens for aiding the Ionian revolt by sending ships and other means of support. Greece, through the development of the city state and democracy created the hoplite phalanx in which each man must hold their space in a tightly packed linear formation packed with over a thousand men with spear and/or shield. The Phalanx in formation became a heavily armed juggernaut that would continue up until the Roman development of Legion tactics. The Persians on the other hand used completely opposite arms and tactics, relying on speed, delay and missile tactics to harass an enemy, leaving the heavy combat to their cavalry.

Athenian democracy was tested as citizens debated what to do as Persians began to unload men, horses and supplies on the shores of Marathon.
