After 5 days of debate and noticing that the Persian cavalry was being reloaded onto ships for redeployment likely to ravage the rest of the Athenian suburbs, the Athenians decided to act offensively against the Persians while at a numerical disadvantage.

At the beginning of the battle, the Athenian center were pushed back but quickly rallied and outflanked the Persian forces before they could unload enough troops proficient at shock combat. Unable to delay and harass the Greeks by withdrawing and using ranged combat, they ended up getting totally slaughtered by the Greeks as they were completely ill-prepared for hand to hand combat with heavy infantry. Driven back into the sea, the Athenians had achieved a major symbolic victory, managing to severely damage the Persian attempt at establishing a beachhead for a further invasion of Attica from Marathon. The Greek way of war had proven itself as superior to the Persian, which had been the dominant power in the region before this point in history, that all changed with Marathon.

VSTS is inspired by the PRESTAGS set of games from SPI, GBOH from GMT, and Battle Hymn by Compass Games. Wings of each army are activated by chit pull; the combat phase is also initiated by a chit pull followed by an ongoing melee phase after all chits have been pulled. While ranged combat uses a traditional CRT type mechanic, melee combat has players rolling a handful of d10s in search of “hits” against their opponent. dividing the number of dice thrown between all enemy units in front hexes. The base chance for hits depends on the morale of the units involved as well as facing, terrain, the presence of leadership, and more. Units absorb Disruption Points and as they do so, become progressive susceptible to Routing, automatically routing once they reach a level of DP equal to their SP. Exclusive Rules for Marathon are focused on recreating the various speculative conditions academics have argued about in relation to Hoplite combat, Phalanxes drift to the right when mobile, Phalanxes advance at variable rates towards an enemy, Locking Shields as a tactic to create a more shock-resistant Phalanx, as well as loose-formation rules for Phalanxes which allow for limited stacking combined with more maneuverable units. Many of these exclusive rules, if not all, will be present in the first full game of the series considering 4 Battles from Lacedaemonian (Spartan) history.

-description from publisher's website

name: Shaun das Schaf: Das Kartenspiel
description:
The animals of the Mossy Bottom Farm would like to take a nice group photo - but it is not so easy to get a nice motive together! Each player has his own card display, in which he collects different animals with the highest possible card values. But the teammates can quickly change their own display and their card values!

Each player has three cards on his hand. On his turn he plays one card in his or an opponents display. He can start a new pile or place the card on a pile with the same colour. The value of a display can be increased but also reduced. Afterwards he draws a new hand card.

Important: It always counts only the top card of a pile! And if at any point in a player's deck two cards or stacks of cards show the same number, these two cards (stacks) must be combined into one stack!

The round ends immediately when the first player has a display with six stacks OR the draw pile is empty. Players get points for the top card on each stack - but only if they have managed to collect all three colours!
The game ends when one or more players reach 150 points.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sweet Dreams
description:
It’s 9PM on Halloween and swarms of kids are still running around trick-or-treating. 9PM! This is way too late for someone to stay awake. Time to get rid of these sweets and get to sleep!

Sweet Dreams is a game where you are adults trying to give out all their candy on Halloween. The kids have specific sweets they want and arrive in a particular order. Whoever arranges their candy bowl the best wins the game.

Each player randomly gets 3 cards that you place facedown in front of you. After the game starts, you may not look at your cards again, except when cards are traded. Match the 3 Favorite cards better than your opponents to win! Toothpaste doesn’t help towards victory, unless you collect 3 of them. Then, you win with a Dentist’s Halloween!

This game is part of a thematically linked trilogy of games. In Sweet Dreams, players are adults trying to give away all their candy first on Halloween. In Trade-or-Treat, players are kids trading the candy they got from trick-or-treating. In Cavity Calamity, players are dentists cleaning the teeth of the kids after Halloween.

—description from the designer

name: Conspiracies
description:
An electronic buzzer Party board game of hidden roles, bluffing and deductive thinking!

Tonight, every noble in the kingdom has gathered at the King’s Palace for the annual Masquerade Ball!
Colourful costumes, rich feathers, intricate masks, plenty of food and drink, and of course, crazy dancing! Unfortunately, not everyone has come to have fun... Some of the guests secretly plot against the king and have come to the dance to kill him.

Will the nobles loyal to the royal family manage to stop them, or will the king, like his predecessor, end up dead?

Bluff, “read” the other players, guess who’s your ally and who’s your opponent, speak the truth or lie - whatever suits you best - everything is allowed in your attempts to triumph in Conspiracies!

Just be careful... don’t poison the wrong person!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Real-Time, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Voting

name: Five Sisters
description:
Five Sisters is a game developed according to the same name novel from Taiwan, as in Chinese "有五个姊姊的我就注定要单身了啊".

Chasing the five sisters, you will move among the three locations on the board to seek every chance to gain favorable degree with the characters. When you have enough favorable degree towards one certain character, you can show your love to her, and whether you'll success or not depends on the result of dice roll. If you succeed, you'll gain victory points.

In this game, you can show your love to different sisters simultaneously and even if any character has been shown love by other players, do not worry, you may have a duel with them to retrieve the situation!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Fantasy World
description:
This is a game to elaborate your imagination, creativity and teamwork. Let you imagination soar by acting different characters and using strange items in this alien world! Do pay special attention for storyteller's clue, which tells you how to solve different obstacles and riddles, and how to win the game!
—description from the publisher

In Fantasy World players take turns being a story narrator. Each turn the narrator designs a problem scenario for the other players to solve. Each other player then selects an item from their hand and explains how that item solves the problem. Once completed all players then simultaneously point at the player who they think has the most convincing solution (besides themselves). If the player recieved either the most votes or no votes their card is discarded, otherwise it is kept. Item cards come in various colors if one player gets a complete set or 3 of the same color they have won the game.

In the story mode variant, narrators must continue the story each turn.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Voting

name: Penny Paardenspel
description:
Together with Rakker, Penny de Pony, Shadow and Sarah de Shire you go on an adventurous adventure. But first your horse must be ready for it! Take care of it by brushing, jumping exercises, apples, roots and water and making sure your horse feels completely at ease. Take care of your horse and win the game.
—description from the publisher (translated)

Samen met Rakker, Penny de Pony, Shadow en Sarah de Shire ga je gezellig op avontuur. Maar eerst moet je paard er helemaal klaar voor zijn! Verzorg het door borstelen, springoefeningen, appels, wortels en water en zorg dat je paard zich helemaal op zijn gemak voelt. Verzorg je paard het best en win het spel.
—description from the publisher (Dutch)
categories: Book, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Age of Tyrant
description:
Players represent workers oppressed by a tyrant bent on fulfilling his architectural greed. How do you live through such tyranny? By shirking the work and trying to get others to do it instead.

By claiming action spots, players try to get the most inefficient combination of resources to fulfill their assigned projects. As players complete projects, they signal their stance against rebellion and sacrifice themselves to the work, further weakening their resolve to overthrow the tyrant.

The player with the fewest anti-rebellion points wins. Congratulations! As a true rebel, you will be exiled and will never return.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement
publishers: Southern Cross Games (サザンクロスゲームズ)

name: The Memory Game
description:
The host lays out 10 picture cards face up on the table. The players then have one minute to try and memorise as many of the pictures as they can. Once a minute is up, the host covers the cards and the players have a further minute to recall and write a list of objects in the pictures. Each object judged as correctly recalled by the host scores a point.

Play can get more in depth with the host asking questions such as how many objects were on a specific colour background, or to name them, or how many were linked to a particular theme (e.g. food or holidays).

Can rotate the host until all plays have completed the role, and most points then wins.

—user summary
publishers: Ginger Fox Games, Hacche Retail Ltd.

name: Concept Kids: Animals – Fantasy Animals Promo Cards
description: Five new cards (fantasy animals: yeti, dragon, unicorn, werewolf and griffin) that can be add to the game.

name: Great Hall Burning: Adventure During the Viking Age
description:
THE OPEN SEA AND A STRONG WIND…

Great Hall Burning allows you to adventure during the Viking Age, the period from the late 8th century to the mid-11th century. If you succeed in battle and in your raids, you can raise your Social Standing and gather more men. As your Fame grows you rise in rank until someday, you are King. Or you could be…

The journey is long, with many twists and turns, but if you keep your eye on the prize, it is attainable. But before you can be King, you’ll have to start at the bottom. Not the very bottom, but close to it.

YOU START IN COMMAND OF ONE WARBAND.

Inside you’ll find:

Rules for fighting small Raids to large Stand Up Battles.
Four Army Lists covering the people of the Viking Age.
Rules for combat that work just as well for small skirmishes or big battles on the land and sea.
A complete, but easy to track campaign system to give meaning to your games.
A variety of pre-generated games.
A complete Viking Settlement with different characters that allow you the option to play a little RPG-Lite.
A low bookkeeping system to track how well you are doing.
Retirement rules to determine how well or badly you ended up after your career has ended.
All this and much more.


Great Hall Burning can be played solo, same side with everyone against the game, or head to head against your friends. Play with any figures you already have in any scale, metal, plastic or paper. Play with counters or pen and paper. Play it as a Campaign where all your battles are linked together or as a one-off game. Bottom line; just play it…you’ll be glad you did!

Collect your crew; grab a boat and catch the wind. Your time has come, it’s time to see the …

GREAT HALL BURNING!

—description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: No Context
description:
"How well do you know your friends?"

Pick someone you think you know well. Randomly pick a card from the deck and read it aloud (doesn't matter who). From the choices on the card, write down your choice under the "Me" column and write down what you think your teammate wrote down under the "Not Me" column. Repeat for all 8 question cards in the round. Once you're done with the round, compare answers question-by-question, team-by-team. If you and your teammate pick correctly for each other (you get theirs right and they get yours right), you get 1 team point. Anything else is 0 points. The team with the total number of team points after all 3 rounds wins the game.

There are two main additional ways to play: Party Mode and 1-on-1. For Party Mode, one person reads each question out loud and people shout out what they would choose. Then everyone argues about why they're right and everyone else is wrong. For 1-on-1, you and that someone you think you know well are the only team playing. Which one of you knows the other person better?

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Art of Spots
description:
Art of Spots is a strategic abstract game that comes in a compact form with only 18 cards. The game follows the ICG or Identical Card Game format, which means that each card in the game is identical, making it easy to learn and play. The objective of the game is to create the longest lines and rectangular areas, and have as many spots of your color on the board as possible by placing cards on the table.

If you're a fan of abstract games like chess, Othello, or Go, then Art of Spots is a must-have addition to your collection. It's a game that can be enjoyed by players of all ages, making it perfect for a family game night. With rules that take no more than a minute to explain, you can jump right in and start playing with your friends, parents, or even grandparents. Get ready to test your strategic skills and have fun with Art of Spots!

name: MOD: Genel Kültür Oyunu
description:
MOD is a trivia game supported by a mobile application that contains questions in five different categories with two different game options.

The game features a mobile device, double-sided gaming platform and five pawns in different colours. The current category and difficulty on the platform are selected in the application to see the question to be answered. The game platform consists of three rings and is based on the level of difficulties with the questions.

Each round, the player is asked three questions. Players will receive a random category and wildcard by pressing the dice button in the app and select a difficulty level of their choice. Each well-known question is advanced by one household, by medium household by two households, and by difficult households by three households.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Koz Oyuncak Sanayi ve Ticaret Limited Sirketi

name: Caveman!
description:
Billing itself as a "Prehistorically Inaccurate Wargame", Caveman! pits miniature cavemen in savage combat against one another and an assortment of dinosaurs, terror birds, and UFOs.

Movement allowances are based on the players' hands (so the figures of players with larger hands move faster), and missile attacks are resolved by throwing things on the opposing player (not their figures).

—user summary

name: Jumble Order: Old Tales
description:
“Jumble Order Old Tales” is an extended set of “ Jumble Order ”.
The new sets “Dwarf” and “Old Kingdom” bring new developments to the game. You will also be able to play some selection rules. ◆ Expansion Set Overview Expansion sets “Dwarf” and “Old King” are card sets equivalent to Jumble cards (additional / advanced). By selecting a new card set, you will be able to play jumble orders with a different feeling of play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Pack the Essentials
description:
Pack the Essentials is a lightweight, abstract strategy game about packing cats in suitcases.

Throughout the game, players work to score as many points as possible by drafting and placing tiles in their suitcase to pack items, cats, and kittens; collect cat toys; and use the friendly neighborhood Pack Rat Service. Players also attempt to complete "To Do" list goals and create the largest sections of each color tile. The game plays over twelve rounds, then the player with the most points wins.

When playing with fewer than four people, players will additionally compete against The Cat Ladies Club, a simple AI opponent that creates the sensation of a four-player game by removing tiles from the draft pool just as other players do.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Open Drafting, Tile Placement
publishers: Pudgy Cat Games, Wacky Wizard Games

name: Brainbites: Landmarks
description:
Be the first to fill your brain with brain cells in this game for all the family!
In this quirky quiz each card refers to a famous landmark. There are three questions per card worth either 1, 2 or 3 brain cells. You choose the level of difficulty and the correct answer fills your brain card with either 1, 2 or 3 brain cells.
The first to fill their brain card is the winner!

name: Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Alpaca Wanderer Promo Card
description: This foiled promo Hero card was offered as a reward for certain tiers of the Dized Kickstarter campaign in December 2018.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Gone Flying
description:
Gone Flying is a game about flying. Although invented by a pilot, players need no prior knowledge of flying, only basic aviation terms will be used and each will be fully explained. Played individually or in pairs, Gone Flying combines skill and chance to provide hours of entertainment for family and friends.

The object of Gone Flying is the be the first pilot(s) to fly your airplane from Terminal A to Terminal B.

—from the back of the box

name: Alert! All Hands On Deck
description:
Your planet is under attack. Using your fleet you must defeat all incoming threat waves and save your planet. The game ends if you defeat 21 threat waves or if you lose all 3 ships. After that, you will calculate your high-score and acquire Pilot Rank.

It is a solo game, played in hand, without a table. To defeat each wave, you need to use your ship’s actions to move and shoot threats. You can also collect power-ups and use ship’s special abilities!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: White Castle Bold Move Challenge
description:
The rules and game board are on the bottom of a Crave Case (a suitcase-like corrugated cardboard box used to package Sliders sold in lots of 30). Here are those rules:


Pick a game piece; get creative.
Use the Slider Box Challenges to play and make your moves.
Accept the challenge yourself and move ahead, or give it to a friend. (If they don't take it, they go back a space.)
Continue around the group, and the Craver who makes the boldest moves wins!


Share with #boldcraver for an extra move.

The Challenges published on the Slider boxes change over time, and the spaces moved vary depending upon the boldness required to complete the Challenge, ranging from 1 to 3.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Party Game, Racing
mechanics: Acting, Events, Lose a Turn, Movement Points, Take That, Track Movement

name: Override
description:
Override is an abstract game for two players. The goal is simple: get five in a row in your color. What makes it interesting is that you and your opponent each have the option of controlling each other's pieces rather than your own on any given turn.

All 30 pyramids begin off the 5×5 board. Each turn, a player may bring a piece onto an empty square on the board or move a piece that is already on the board one space orthogonally. Larger pieces can cover up smaller pieces of either color; same-size stacking and smaller-on-larger stacking is not permitted. Pieces covering up other pieces are fair game to move orthogonally just like solo pieces. Players may make these moves with either their own color or the opposing color. A group of two or three pieces on the same square count as the top color for purposes of the five-in-a-row goal. It is possible for a pyramid to be temporarily blocked in due to its being surrounded on four sides by larger pyramids. Players are not allowed to directly undo an opponent's last move, but they are allowed to create a very similar board-state. For instance, if there are four yellow pyramids in a row and the active player moves a medium yellow pyramid out of line, the next player is not allowed to move the medium yellow pyramid back into place, but is allowed to bring an identical medium yellow pyramid from off the board into that square.

The first player to create a line of five in a row, diagonally or orthogonally, wins the game. In the case of two lines of opposing colors simultaneously being created, the active player wins.

Requires a 5×5 grid and 30 pyramids: fifteen each in two colors.

—description from the designer

name: Jim Henson's Labyrinth: The Card Game
description:
Trick-taking game for two teams of two players. Points are scored for cards in tricks that are won by the team. Tricks are won by having the highest "Labyrinthe" in a trick or the highest card in the minor suit that was led, if no Labyrinthes are played. A hand consists of 19 tricks. The team with the most points in a hand wins the hand. The team with the most hands won after 4 hands are played wins the game. If the game is tied after 4 hands are played, then one more hand is played, with the winner of that hand winning the game.

Rules for 2, 3, and 5 players are available at the publisher's web site.

—user summary

A game for the whole family. based on medieval card games and set in the magical world of Jim Henson's Labyrinth.

The deck of the Labyrinth Card Game includes 80 beautifully illustrated tarot-sized cards, divided into 24 Major Suit cards ('Labyrinthes') and 4 x 14 Minor Suit cards ('Owls', 'Clocks', 'Orbs", and 'Books').

The simple core rules allow 4 players to have a quick, fun game, suitable for all the family. The advanced rules turn the game into a more sophisticated, highly tactical experience, more suitable for grown-ups. The game is designed for 4 players.

—description from the back of the box

name: DEAD OF NIGHT
description:
デッドオブナイト (DEAD OF NIGHT) is a Japanese partnership game with limited communication.

Assassins are trying to murder the king, and only one side will survive the night. The King and his two Guards must try to defeat the three Assassins.

Each player can choose one of three actions each turn (Attack/Guard/Sleep), but must Sleep after using two other actions in a row. Additionally, no one can communicate. Only the King can choose to declare which action the King will play, but the King must be truthful. Teams score points based on the number of surviving members of their team. First to seven points wins!

味方の心を読み、敵の心を探れ。
デッドオブナイトは、敵味方に分かれて心理戦を行うゲームです。暗殺者側は王の暗殺を試み、王家側は暗殺者の殲滅を図ります。敵の行動はおろか、味方の行動さえも知ることはできませんが、場の状況や相手のプレイスタイルをよく読めば、自ずとどんな行動を取るかが見えてくるはずです。各プレイヤーの個性を把握し、数手先を読むことができれば、勝利はあなたのものとなるでしょう。
user summary
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Communication Limits, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order
publishers: FREAKY DESIGN (フリーキーデザイン)

name: The Mennonite Game Card Game
description:
Find your connections to various characters with this family friendly strategy game! Whether you are Mennonite or not, you will find this game fun and entertaining!

" The Mennonites play a game predictably called "The Mennonite Game," in which people try and discover how they might be connected. For example, I might find out that you were my brother's roommate's sister's ex-boyfriend's high school teacher. The game that I have created is a card game inspired by the Mennonite game, thus the title "The Mennonite Game Card Game."" - Description by the designer

Each person begins with a Starter Card, which is you! The object of the game is to be the first to collect 10 Character Cards.

The Character Cards you acquire branch off of the Starter Card to form your character tree. The trick of the game is collect characters that benefit you, while also fitting into your character tree.

You gain characters by turning in Connection Cards. There are 4 different types, and a wild card that can be used for any one connection type.

The third type of card is the Event Card. These cards can be played at any time during your turn to draw cards, block someone's Character tree, remove effects, and much more!

name: Nachtwacht: Duistere Helden
description: He who can beat the dangerous monster from the underworld wins the game, but it is not as easy as some can imagine. First, you have to start looking for objects in Schemermeer, objects you'll need to beat the monster. Each turn you roll a die and can either move your pawn or attack a monster. Each monster in schemermeer is guarding an object. Beating the monster (also dice-rolling) grants you the object. When you have found the needed objects, go down to the underworld (game board under the table) and battle much more dangerous monsters to find the potion needed. With the correct objects, the potion and a little bit of luck, you can beat the final boss-monster.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Awkwords
description:
Awkwords, the delightfully uncomfortable party game

Awkwords is a card pairing, narrative writing, answer judging, situational party game...with consequences!
Awkwords is a satire party game. None of the situations are based on real life.

—description from the publisher

name: Tired of London: the party game for miserable Londoners
description:
"When a man is tired of London, he is tired of life", said 18th Century writer Samuel Johnson, who clearly never paid £1,200 a month for a studio flat above a fried chicken shop.

This is the adult party game for people who are tired of London, and maybe of life as well. It's really simple - one player picks a Question Card, and the other players submit one of their Answer Cards. The best answer wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Celestial Stories
description:
This is one of the games featured in Dice & Ink: A Roll & Write Anthology, and exists as part of that compilation.

In Celestial Stories, players fill the skies with constellations together and tell their stories in this cooperative storytelling game. Instead of taking turns, most of the game is played simultaneously in real time.

Here’s how it works:

Each player has a player sheet and a six-sided die.
All players first chart their first star on their sheet.
Then a one minute timer is set.
All players now pass their sheet to their neighbor.
All players then roll their die and chart a star that many spaces away from the first star, following certain guidelines.
Then all players pass their sheet to their neighbor again.
This process repeats until the timer ends.
All players then finish the constellation they have in front of them.
When all players are done, they each tell a story about how their constellation got in the night sky, and how it relates to the others.
Come together and spin fantastical stories, enjoy each other’s stories and find out how each constellation became the stuff of legends. For once, it is not about winning, but about sharing a story.

Celestial Stories requires a standard six-sided die for each player. Components include one player sheet per player.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Storytelling

name: Fury of Gozmar
description:
In Fury of Gozmar, each player takes control of a group of ruthless and greedy goblins who, with the help of their pickaxe and sword, are fighting to be crowned lords of the underground world. On your way to victory, you will have to collect valuable gems, train goblins to prepare them for battle, conquer enemy zones, cast powerful spells and make irresistible offerings to calm the fury of Gozmar, a frightening demon living in the heart of the caverns.

Fury of Gozmar is a strategy game for 2 players, for ages 14 and up. Games take approximately 30-40 minutes to play.
The objective of this game is to defeat your opponent, either by conquering his goblin burrow, killing all his creatures or conquering a greater number of territories at the end of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Moving Multiple Units, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: ダイジョブ迷宮 (Fine Job Labyrinth)
description: In ダイジョブ迷宮 (Fine Job Labyrinth), players lay out the walls of a dungeon (printed on paper), then take turns placing vertical wooden slabs (representing stone statues) within this dungeon to create a labyrinth. Gems in the dungeon represent touchpoints that you must visit while making your way through the labyrinth to the final gem on the far wall, and to traverse the labyrinth, you must start with at least one finger on the table near the entrance, then trace a continuous path through the corridors, not knocking over any stone statues along the way or else you'll take damage!

name: Wortblitz Kartenspiel: Free Demo version
description:
A small demo version of Wort Blitz Kartenspiel with a smaller number of cards packed in shrink wrap.

The players have to find a word which starts with the letter of the first card and belongs to the category of the second card. The player who finds a valid word first, collects the card, uncovers and reads the next pair of letter and category.

The player with the most gathered cards wins the game.

name: Doomseeker: Snorri Nosebiter Promo
description:
Available at GenCon 2018 or included with online orders from the Ninja Division store.

Adds Snorri Nosebiter as a slayer card. His ability states 'When you take a wound that would kill you, roll a dice. If you roll a 4 or higher, you ignore the wound and do not gain a wound token.'
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: IGBÓ
description:
IGBÓ is an abstract strategy board game that teaches sustainable thinking. IGBÓ translates to 'forest' in Yoruba.

To begin, each player gets 36 "seeds" and 4 "desert" pieces. The game starts by flipping the IGBÓ piece. If IGBÓ lands face-up then the youngest player starts. The IGBÓ piece can be used as a neutral seed by both players, but neither player can stack on top of it.

Next, players now take turns to place pieces on the board. Desert pieces prevent growth and can be used defensively/offensively during the game. The seed pieces are used to form IGBÓs.

An IGBÓ is formed in the following ways:

Plant 5 seeds in a row, the center seed becomes the IGBÓ trunk AND/OR:
Plant two intersecting rows of 3 seeds, the center seed becomes the IGBÓ trunk.

Methods of scoring a single IGBO:

The center of each shape gains another seed and becomes the stacked trunk of the IGBÓ. Once an IGBÓ is stacked and formed, the other seeds in the formation are turned over to signify that they have become roots. Players add more symmetric root branches to their IGBÓ to take it to be a Double, Triple and Quadruple IGBÓ.

The scoring is simple and works as follows:

Single IGBÓ gives you 2 points
Double IGBÓ gives you 4 points
Triple IGBÓ gives you 8 points
Quadruple IGBÓ gives you 16 points

Another strategic element is the wind. Seeds that are not "rooted" can be blown in the wind and travel a maximum of 5 spaces on the board moving horizontally and vertically. This can be used to disguise your strategy to your opponent. On your turn, you may either plant a new seed or move two existing seeds.

name: Au Nom de la Loi
description:
Au Nom de la Loi - Western rules, is a simulation of skimish action in the Old West, for 15/25mm miniatures.

Play sequence:
1- Movements, simultaneous
2- Combat, simultaneous
3- Moral, simultaneous

Scale:
1 mini = 1 man
2cm = 1m
1 play sequence = a few seconds

Published in French, in Vae Victis magazine issue 11.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Le Grand Cirque
description:
Le Grand Cirque are Aerial miniature combat rules for the period 1938-1940.

Miniatures of any scale (1/300, 1/72...) can be used, or the markers provided in the Vae Victis issue.

Sequence of play:

Activation per plane (not per player), then:

Movement phase
Firing phase


Hexagons can be used to simplify resolution of maneuvers.

Scale:
1 miniature = 1 plane,
1 sequence of play = a few seconds
playing surface is infinite, no end of the world effect

Published in French, in Vae Victis magazine.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, World War II

name: L' Empire Des Mers
description:
L'empire des mers is a simple miniature tactical naval wargame rule for the period 1740-1815

Play sequence:

Wind - sails setup
Command phase
Movement phase
Boarding preparation phase
Firing phase
Boarding and mêlées
Sails selection and ammo phase


—user summary
categories: American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Fistful of Lead: Viva la Revolucion! – Wargaming the Mexican Revolution
description:
Viva la Revolucion! is a Scenario Supplement for Fistful of Lead for the Mexican Revolution. Not only do you get period specific rules, but 10 scenarios that follow the timeline of the war. It's the Wild West meets the new Industrial Age of warfare.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Fistful of Lead: For a Fistful More
description:
For a Fistful More - Scenarios for Fistful of Lead

Strap on your shootin' irons, and step into the Wild West! What's in this book....

20 Action-packed scenarios for the Fistful of Lead, Wild West wargaming rules.
Included are:


2 multi-part linked scenarios
Lots of one-off, stand alone scenarios
5 character driven scenarios
The special "Revenge of Boot Hill", which allows you to add a little "weird" to your Wild West


While written with Fistful of Lead in mind, you can easily adapt these scenarios to your own rules.

—description from publisher
categories: American West, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Point to Point Movement

name: MIG 5
description: Fifth new version of the original M.I.G. quiz-game. As the previous it contains 1560 questions in five categories. New questions (2012) made for the swedish market and players over 15 years.

name: 5150: New Hope City PI
description:
A stand alone game that may be played can be played with 5150 Back Alleys, Bright Lights; 5150 No Limits; 5150 Fringe Space; and Chain Reaction!.

What: Private Investigating in the 5150 Universe.
Scale: 1 figure equals 1 man.
Your Role: You're a Private Investigator or Police Detective; your choice.
Playability: Designed for solo, same side and head to head play.

When the Cops Just Won't Do.

In New Hope City PI you’re a Private Investigator. When the cops won’t do, they hire you. If you want to be a Police Detective instead, you can still use these rules. In fact you can use these rules for investigating in any gaming period, with any Two Hour Wargames rules.

As a PI you’ll be offered a variety of Crimes to solve from Robbery to Murder. The way to solve a Crime is to find a certain number of Clues based on how difficult the Case is. The more difficult the Case the more Clues you need to find. This can be either finding an Object or Questioning a Person of Interest.

Sounds simple enough but you’ll be facing twists and turns as you’ll be moving through all the levels of society in New Hope City, from the Movers and Shakers to the Criminal Element as well.

Inside you’ll find:

The 5150 Basic Sci Fi Combat rules making this a standalone game.
Details on five types of Crimes and how they differ.
A system to generate and solve Clues, based on your Character's abilities.
Eleven different neighborhoods to adventure in plus a Transit System to move from area to area seamlessly.
Thirteen Alien Races including eight new ones.
Mechanics to generate hundreds of Cases with no two ever being exactly alike.
Over 50 Professions to generate Victims, Suspects and People of Interest.
Info on the Operators from the Department of Home Security and their mysterious prey, the Cyndees.
Introducing the Gene Altering Xenoform or GAX for short. Seeing isn't always believing.
All this and much more...

-description from publisher's website

name: Old Trousers II: Warfare in the Horse & Musket Era – Battalion Level Napoleonic Warfare
description:
Old Trousers is a set of battalion-level miniatures battle rules for the Napoleonic period.

Each base of 2-4 figures represents one infantry company, cavalry squadron, or artillery battery.

The rules are freely available online.

—user summary

name: Cannon, Cross and Crescent
description:
Cannon, Cross and Crescent

A quick playing set of Renaissance naval rules covering the period 1450 to 1600, allowing small and medium sized games with 30 ships a side or more to be completed in a couple of hours or less. They have been written with 1/1200 models such as those from Navwar and Langton in mind, but could be used with larger or smaller models with appropriate changes in ranges and movement. Bookkeeping is minimal, using simple markers to indicate ship damage and crew casualties.
Data for 20 different broad ship types is included, from bergantines and galiots up to large Lanternas and Galleons.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Tempus Quest: Episode 6 – Old Debts
description:
After their narrow escape from Sytynas with the liberation, The Tempus Crew Finds themselves back home in the Roza system. Shortly after landing, they are rounded up and dragged to the lair of mid-level mob boss, Calister Mayvins, previous owner of the Tempus, who offers them an ultimatum.

Games in the Tempus series work similarly to roll and write games where players roll dice and use the results to fill in a sheet. In the Tempus System, instead of using dice, players will use the date and time to randomize setup and available actions.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: ARISAKI DANCE et Ballet
description:
ARISAKI DANCE et Ballet is a trick-taking game where each card shows a ballet move or idol singer choreography in addition to the rank. The cards include visual illustrations of the moves, as well as instructions in Japanese, French, and English.

The winner of a trick will distribute one card from the trick to each player, and the players will need to remember the choreography on the card received.

In addition to points from tricks, after a hand is complete, each player attempts to perform the moves on the cards they've collected from memory. Additional points may be received for the dance portion.

The rules urge you not to use the game as a punishment, and in public places, perhaps only dance with the upper half of your body, so as not to cause a disturbance.

—user summary

アイドル女子になりきって振り付けダンスが踊れるパーティゲームです。振り付けカードにはアイドル歌手、アニメ、バレエおよび日本古来のポーズが書かれています。基本的に大きな数字が勝つトリックテイキングで得たカードを組み合わせて制限時間内に正しく可愛く踊りましょう。日本語・英語・フランス語に対応します。
2021年秋に新装版、拡張カード紫・黄色を頒布します。
publisher's summary

name: Tempus Quest: Episode 7 – The Point of No Return
description:
With their compulsory thieving behind them, the crew of the Tempus picks up a distress call from a crashed liberation fleet. With some reservation, they decide to answer the call, knowing this will end their days of avoiding sides in this war.

Games in the Tempus series work similarly to roll and write games where players roll dice and use the results to fill in a sheet. In the Tempus System, instead of using dice, players will use the date and time to randomize setup and available actions.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 天才画家ボン (Genius Painter Bonn)
description: In 天才画家ボン (Genius Painter Bonn), one players builds an image with some or all of the eighty colored playing cards included in the game — ten copies each of cards in eight colors — and everyone else tries to guess what they created.

name: Rapid Fire! German Tank Units – Russian Front 1941 - 1942
description:
German Tank Units on the Russian Front 1941 to 1942


40 full colour pages Graphic orders of battle Includes:
panzer units at Kharkov and Stalingrad,
the organisation of early kampfgruppen and
lots of specialist units


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Fire on the Waters
description:
Fire on the Waters is a naval warfare simulation.

It portrays tactical naval surface warfare in World War II.

The simulation presents aspects of this warfare through a series of scenario sets.
Each scenario set also includes a scenario generator to create scenarios typical for the time and place that the set covers.
The game presents these battles on a tactical, ship-to-ship level.
The game is for two sides: one controlling the Allied ships and one controlling the Axis ships.
Ships are represented by cardboard counters or 1/6000 scale miniatures, with any 4' by 6' level surface serving as a playing area.
Movement and combat are conducted in accordance with the rules of play.

Scale:
1 turn = 4 min
1 inch = 1000 yards.

The game components include:

The rules of the game,
The tables for the game,
The designer’s notes,
Game counters, and
A scenario for the game.


Also included are some random ship counters for those without miniatures. Don't try to match them to any particular scenario.

In Fire on the Waters, the rules provide the basic mechanics of play. Each scenario specifies the ships, relative position of opposing forces, victory conditions, and special rules for a particular battle.

At present, 80 scenarios for Fire on the Waters have been posted.

The scenarios are organized into 8 scenario sets, with each set collecting scenarios from a particular place and period.

Rules can be downloaded at api.geekdo.com/weblink/284568.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Sankaku Goita Clear (三角ごいたクリア）
description:
Goita is a traditional game played since the early 20th century in Ushitsu, a district of Noto town, Ishikawa region in Japan.

Sankaku Goita Clear' is a　development of the classic game Goita,which can be played with "Sankaku Goita".(This is normal Goita, made of triangle wooden piece, packed in the small case, of which bottom board is usable as a scoreboard.)
The clear pieces make you see through half of the pieces at hand so that you can enjoy different strategies from the normal one!

[How to play]

Prepare the half of Sankaku Goita (16 normal pieces) and Sankaku Goita Clear (16 clear pieces).
Divide those 32 pieces to the players in either way below;
Half & Half: Put all the clear pieces in the bag and pick them up in order so that all the players have 4 clear pieces each. Then put normal pieces in a circle face down and pick them up in order again.
Random Deal: Put all the pieces of normal and clear in a circle and pick them up in order. (In this case, the number of clear and normal pieces at hand are at random.)

Play as normal Goita with those divided pieces.


—description from the publisher

name: The War in Vietnam: Map Campaign for 2 Players
description:
The War in Vietnam

The War in Vietnam is a map campaign representing the entire war at a strategic scale. These rules focus on quick and easy play, and are designed for 2 players, or solo play.

Forces on the map are considered to be unspecified until they are engaged in combat, at which point both players secretly choose the forces they wish to take, and then compare their results and roll off to inflict casualties depending on the types of units chosen. For example the US player might choose a Long Range Recon Patrol, who specialize in keeping a low profile and gathering intelligence, but can engage enemy forces if they desire. Meanwhile the Vietcong player has chosen Artillery. The players roll off and the LRRPs win the roll, spotting the artillery and forcing them to become "locked" as artillery so that other forces can engage them this turn and know what they're dealing with. The LRRPs can also choose to engage directly, potentially inflicting casualties on the artillery, but risk taking casualties if they do.

Each faction has 11 different types of forces to choose from, and the combinations chosen have different outcomes, making for 121 different types of battle. Artillery vs Armor, VC Screening Forces vs US Marines, Air Strikes vs Civilians, just a few examples.

Both factions track casualties and morale as a whole, and depending on their total casualties, their war support and morale will be effected. For example, too many US casualties will result in war support dropping and less troops will be deployed each turn. Rules for capturing cities are included, and they also have an effect on morale and war support.

The game ends when one faction takes over 60,000 casualties, or if the Vietcong hold Saigon for 4 turns in a row.
A printable color map with hexes is provided, 9 A4 sheets in size (3 X 3), but the author recommends that you get a large color map printed and laminated at your local print shop.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Print & Play, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Lightning Reaction: ReLoaded
description:
Lightning Reaction: ReLoaded is a party game that tests players' reaction speed--with a shocking surprise for the slowest player.
To play, each player grabs one of the handles from the base. When all players are ready, someone presses the Start button in the center of the base, which activates a blinking red light and suspenseful and anxiety-provoking music. Wait for it...when the red light turns green and the sound stops, all players try to press their trigger button as quickly as possible. If you're the last person to hit your trigger button, you get an electrical shock. As an added bonus, if you hit your button too soon (before the center light turns green and the music stops) you give yourself an electric shock.

OBJECTIVE: To have the quickest draw and the best timing of your opponents to avoid the shock.

Lightning Reaction: ReLoaded differs from the basic Lightning Reaction game in that this version allows player to adjust a variable shock control on the machine--to determine whether the loser will receive a shock of low, medium, or high intensity (although still only provided by three AAA batteries).

name: Robot Run
description:
A fun matching game for all the family. Players take turns to be the first to get rid of all of their cards by matching them by robot type, robot colour, or use their paintbrush card to change the colour in play! The winner is the first player to get rid of all their cards.

This fast paced game develops matching and colour skills as well as introducing first gameplay skills such as turn taking and social interaction. Players young and old will enjoy playing this quirky game!

—description from the publisher

name: ¡Espana!: For Chain of Command
description:
¡Espana! contains all of the lists for the conflict which tore Spain apart between the years of 1936 and 1939 and still leaves its legacy with Spain today.  

The rules and army lists remain close to the original principles within Chain of Command, relying on reflecting the way in which the troops were organized and trained to fight. This provides us with some very different forces and  really gives us an insight into the strengths and weaknesses of the forces present. 
                           
¡Espana! for Chain of Command results in a game which is fun and challenging in equal measures.

—description from game introduction
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Tempus Quest: Episode 9 – Surprise Attack
description:
The crew of the Tempus find themselves in a liberation fleet assaulting a dynasty stronghold. The battle could turn the tide of the war, but it is by far the most dangerous mission they have ever attempted.

Games in the Tempus series work similarly to roll and write games where players roll dice and use the results to fill in a sheet. In the Tempus System, instead of using dice, players will use the date and time to randomize setup and available actions.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Tempus Quest: Episode 5 – Big Damn Rescue
description:
Despite their best efforts, the crew of the Tempus find themselves toe-to-toe with the Dynasty yet again. An outgunned, out-of-supplies outpost of liberators is rapidly losing ground to an invasion force. Knowing they are the liberation's only hope of escape, our heroes prepare to take a stand.

Games in the Tempus series work similarly to roll and write games where players roll dice and use the results to fill in a sheet. In the Tempus System, instead of using dice, players will use the date and time to randomize setup and available actions.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Micro-Mini Basic Rules: An Ultra Rules Light Miniatures Wargame
description:
Micro Miniatures Basic Rules is an easy to learn and rules-light tabletop miniatures skirmish game.

Micro-Minis is a rules-light miniatures gaming system intended to help new gamers more easily jump into the world of tabletop skirmish warfare.

The game is intended to be an inexpensive entry into gaming. Players can use any gaming figurines or miniatures they have on hand. The game only uses six-sided dice (referred to as D6 in these rules). Finally, gaming terrain and buildings aren’t necessary (but can add some neat flavor if you have them).

These bare-bones basic rules act as a great starting place for the system. It is intended as a completely open-ended game. Play with any miniature you want in any universe or genre you want. Mix up genres if you feel like. The point is to simply have fun.

This specific rulebook offers only the very base concepts and ideas for the game system.

It is also perfect for experienced gamers looking for an easy, fast, and fun beer and pretzels style game they can pull out on the fly without very much time to invest in setup and lengthy game times.

Later rulebooks will offer expanded rules and options as well as specific themes, genres, and unit types.

—description from the publisher

name: Micro-Mini Advanced: An Ultra Rules Light Miniatures Wargame
description:
Micro Miniatures ADVANCED Rules is an easy to learn and rules-light tabletop miniatures skirmish game.

Micro-Minis is a rules-light miniatures gaming system intended to help new gamers more easily jump into the world of tabletop skirmish warfare.

This ADVANCED rulebook included rules for purchasing weapons, armor, and items. Additionally, it includes new rules for Confidence and Retreats not featured in the basic version of the rules.

The game is intended to be an inexpensive entry into gaming. Players can use any gaming figurines or miniatures they have on hand. The game only uses six-sided dice (referred to as D6 in these rules). Finally, gaming terrain and buildings aren’t necessary (but can add some neat flavor if you have them).

These ADVANCED rules build on the FREE basic ones and act as a great starting place for the system. It is intended as a completely open-ended game. Play with any miniature you want in any universe or genre you want. Mix up genres if you feel like. The point is to simply have fun.

This specific rulebook offers slightly more ADVANCED concepts and ideas for the game system.

It is also perfect for experienced gamers looking for an easy, fast, and fun beer and pretzels style game they can pull out on the fly without very much time to invest in setup and lengthy game times.

Later rulebooks will offer expanded rules and options for specific themes, genres, and unit types.

—description from the publisher

name: Bahamas: Raph Promo Card
description:
A promo card to add to the game.
Rule:
Choose a player. He divides his Action cards into two piles. Choose a pile you take and leave him the other.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Zhen Mian Dui Jue: San Guo Sha Trading Card Game
description: This is a trading card game with the background of San Guo Sha. The military divisions and generals appeared several times in the Three Kingdoms kill, and you turned into a heavenly messenger and fought alongside them. You will also control the newly set characters, cards, arrays, avatars and other cards that are rich in the Three Kingdoms of China, and build them into your powerful powers, competing with other destiny messengers and competing for the world. In each actual battle process, you will command the various army branches to fight. The careful layout of each position will bring thousands of changes to the entire battle. The active battlefield is in your palm, a magnificent epic You write it yourself.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Civil War, Novel-based

name: Solitaire Spellbook Swappings
description:
"Solitaire Spellbook Swappings" is a minimalistic 9 card PnP puzzle-based game submitted for the 2019 Solitaire Print and Play Contest.

Game Summary/Premise: As an apprentice magician, you have been tasked with sorting the Royal Magical Library. Fortunately, the library’s magical tomes have several useful “Swapping” spells available to expedite the process. Prove your magical mettle by successfully sorting the arcane spellbooks!

Components: 9 Cards (numbered 1 through 9 with unique “Swap” abilities on each one). You may print the colored version or the low ink version and use either one.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Pattern Movement

name: Word Sleuths
description:
Word Sleuths is a tabletop game of secret word deduction,
for families and team building. Somewhat loosely described as multiplayer "Hangman", the game uses a proprietary deduction form to help players decode the words of their opponents.

Two to seven players attempt to guess each other's increasingly longer secret words in several rounds and accumulate the most points to win.

In this engaging and very vocal game, players have fun communicating and deciphering random letters into words.

The game can be played in any Roman-based language.

—description from the designer

name: Warbands & Warfare
description:
This is a low maintenance wargame. All you need is one to two D20s per player, a pencil, and the player sheet in the back of the PDF. Miniatures are strongly encouraged, but are not required.

Players assemble teams from a list of 27 historical warriors. Players take turns attacking their opponent, and their opponent rolls for defense. Each turn is split into a ranged round and a melee round. Each warrior has certain stats and advantages that players will have to utilize to overcome their opponent.

The players can choose from the following soldiers to put in their warband:

Apache, Assyrian, Aztec Jaguar, Centurion, Commander, Crusader, Diplomat, Gaul Warrior, Israelite Slinger, Janissary Turk, Knight, Longbowman, Maori Warrior, Mongol, Musketeer, Ninja, Persian Immortal, Pirate, Roman Legionary, Samurai, Scottish Highlander, Shaolin Warrior, Spartan Hoplite, Templar, Varangian Guard, Viking Berserker, and Zulu Warrior.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Beer & Pretzels Game: Modern Micro Armour
description:
Beer & Pretzels Game - Modern Micro Armour

A great way to test the rules and get a feeling for them before buying the full rulebook.

Tank rules organized in such a way that players can learn how to play Modern Micro Armour: The Game. Once acquainted with the mechanisms of the game, players will be ready to use all the elements of WWII combined arms warfare found in the full rule set.
The most important is, for everybody to have a good time !

Sequence of Play:

Initiative Phase
First Joint Fire Phase
Second Joint Fire Phase
Joint Movement Phase
Marker Removal Phase


—user summary
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: Green Army Men: Plastic Men, Steel Resolve – Dexterity Combat Between Plastic Soldiers
description:
Green Army Men: Plastic Men, Steel Resolve is intended to be a simple and straight forward ruleset for playing dexterity based wargames.

Combat and movement resolution is based on a dexterity "flick" or "flip" mechanic instead of a traditional dice or card mechanic.
In addition, the game requires no templates, rulers or special materials to play.
It also features a WYSIWYG results mechanic that makes each game dynamic and different.

The rules are scale and model neutral and dispenses with the usual concepts of ground and time scale and other intricacies.

All that is needed to play are these rules and a handful of plastic toy soldiers per player.

This is a great gateway game for kids and those unfamiliar with the normal conventions of wargaming.

—description from the publisher

name: Rampant Stars
description:
Rampant Stars is a scale and model agnostic sci-fi squad vs. squad skirmish game.

It is designed to be played in about an hour with fully customizable forces from your favorite Sci-Fi universe.
The rules can accommodate infantry, power armored units, and vehicles.
Players choose generic units and customize them using a Sci-Fi traits list.
Most weapons and equipment is abstracted into simple to use Sci-fi Traits for the units.

The mechanics are straight forward, streamlined, and easy to learn. Rampant Stars uses a d6 vs. a target number to resolve orders, actions, morale, and other results. The degree of success impacts the level of damage inflicted. Turns move quickly between players.

Victory in Rampant Stars focuses on completing mission objectives. These are randomly generated prior to the game and come complete with twists and turns to make every gaming experience unique. Each gaming experience will be unique.

Rampant Stars is ideal for experienced gamers and new players getting their feet wet. Speed and ease of play were the priorities in the design process without sacrificing decision making. In the Rampant Stars units do not always perform exactly as intended so the Friction of War will force players to react accordingly.

Enjoy your journey through the 'Rampant Stars!

—description from the publisher

name: Blood and Rust: Man on the Run – Free Quick-Start Rules
description:
Blood and Rust

The world as it was is gone.
The big cities are crumbling, full of death and cannibals.
There's no safety or respite.
People live and die by shiv, bullet, and by the internal combustion engine.
Brutal gangs run the highways, preying upon anyone not fast enough to get away or well-armed enough to repulse them.
Dry sand and cracked ground make up the harsh landscape, only broken up by mountains or rusting remnants of the before time.
Even the weather is harsh and cruel with severe storms destroy anything that gets caught in the open, tossing grown men around like ragdolls.

Welcome! The beta is done. Please enjoy our complimentary quickstart rules packet.

Inside you will find:

trimmed down version of the core rules,
2 starter scenarios,
5 characters,
4 vehicles,
1 blank vehicle card,
templates,
& tokens.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Halt the Hun!: World War I – 1918 Western Front Skirmish Rules
description:
Halt the Hun!

Late World War One Western Front Skirmish Rules

Halt the Hun! is a relatively quick, simple skirmish game for 28mm figures set on the Western Front in late World War One (1918).
Players use 10-sided dice to determine the results of actions including attacks & panic checks.
Each side - which can consist of one or more players - controls units of either Allied or Imperial German troops.
You can build your own “army” using a simple system or use one of the premade battlegroups provided.

There are three PDFs provided with the game.

The first is the rules set (25 pages plus a quick reference sheet).
The second contains army lists, unit cards, tokens, and templates (54 pages).
The third is a sample skirmish game described in detail with lots of examples of the rules in action (13 pages).


The Halt the Hun! rules include

a unique initiative system,
simple combat resolution,
rules for morale,
smoke and gas, and
special rules for officers, NCOs, chaplains, nurses, and tanks.


The rules are packed with photos of figures from this period as well as contemporary recruiting posters. There are more than 100 unit cards included to create a wide variety of British, French, German, Australian, Canadian, New Zealand, Scottish, and American battlegroups; there are also sample battlegroups provided in three sizes for the British/Scottish, French, Germans, and Americans.
Guidelines are provided for small, medium, and large skirmishes.
There are scenario ideas as well as a 1-page quick reference sheet.
Optional Event Cards are also included if you’d like to add some interesting twists to your game (including strafing runs and calling in artillery).

Heed the call, assemble your troops, and head to the front! Halt the Hun! is a perfect excuse to get some of the wonderful figures available for this period onto your tabletop!
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Monster Wars: A Hex and Chit Micro Wargame of Monster Battles
description:
Monster Wars is a micro wargame that sees two to four players taking command of armies of vampires, undead, werewolves, and hunters—fighting it out to see who will come out on top.

Monster Wars is heavily inspired by the Golden Age of Monsters—A.K.A. the black and white horror and monster movies that were made during the 30s, 40s, and 50s. Hence, you’ll see that the game map and all monster art is portrayed in the traditional black and white style.

In particular, this game is a sendoff to the monster “mash-up” movies that were popular in the fifties. In these films, two or more popular Golden screen monsters were joined up and often battled it out by the end of the movie.

A micro wargame is an easy to learn, fast to play, and inexpensive game for fans of wargaming who may not have enough time for a full-blown kitchen table spanning battle.

A micro wargame can be played over a lunch break, on a train, on a plane, or just in the comfort of your own home when you have a free minute.

All the micro wargames consist of 5-10 printed sheets of paper: Including rules, 1-2 playing maps, and one sheet of counters.
categories: Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame, Zombies

name: Supermarina I: The First Part of WWII in the Mediterranean, June 1940 to July 1941
description:
While Rommel’s Afrika Korps was capturing the attention of the world, its fate was being decided in the Mediterranean. No matter how brilliantly the general and his troops performed, they could not win without the supplies and equipment necessary to fight.

Supermarina I protrays the struggle for naval supremacy in the Mediterranean Sea as the Allied forces tried to break the vital supply link for Axis forces in North Africa.

Containing 24 scenarios, Supermarina I runs the gamut of submarine versus convoy actions to battleships and cruisers slugging it out off Cape Teulada (Spartivento). Famous battles like Taranto and Matapan are included, as well as several scenarios suitable for solitaire play.

This supplement for the Command at Sea tactical WW II miniatures game allows the player to make the kind of decisions a ship or a battle group commander faced in combat. Victory depends on understanding the situation and making the right choices.

This supplement uses the ships and aircraft from Mediterranean Fleets and Home Fleet.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Blitzfreeze: A Five Men in Normandy Supplement
description:
Blitzfreeze - a Five Men in Normandy supplement

The outskirts of Leningrad, 1944

Army Group North is in full retreat. Overloaded trucks and tanks stream towards the Panther Line, with columns of dejected landsers trudging in their wake.

The offensive launched in December ‘43 shattered the Wehrmacht’s tenuous hold on the city and allowed the Red Army to relieve the city’s emaciated inhabitants.

Abandoning tonnes of military materiel, the crippled Army Group North races for the battered remains of the Panther Line at Narva. Blitzfreeze pits your band of half-starved, bone-tired veterans against the elements and the encroaching Red Army in a battle for survival that can only have one winner.

Blitzfreeze is a narrative campaign expansion for Five Men in Normandy, building on the fantastically successful combat mechanics to give players the tools to create narratives worthy of the silver screen.

Players will take command of a desperate band of unlikely heroes against the encroaching Red Army and the bone-chilling winter weather.

Down to your last pack of iron rations, with half your squad ready to drop from exhaustion? Better trade some bullets for food and hope you've got enough rounds to make it through the next battle.

Heroic veteran sergeant with a bullet in his leg slowing you down? Cut him loose and divide his gear between the survivors.

Every man ready to drop after a bitter brawl with some hulking Siberians? Order most of your men to lay up and hope the remainder can survive the next battle.

Blitzfreeze is a game of tough decisions where your tactical choices have ramifications that affect the whole campaign.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Eadgar: Wargame Rules for Warfare 450 - 1100
description:
Eadgar is an easy to play set of wargames rules focused on European warfare from 450 AD to 1100 AD.

It is easily adaptable to a couple of hundred years earlier or later and an expanded geographic area. The rules do not use a fixed figure scale, allowing players to adapt games to their individual collections. Both small and large scale actions are easily handled.
The rules as written are designed for using 25mm to 28mm scale figures, but are adaptable for smaller scales.
The rules are D6 driven with modifiers reflecting an increase or decrease in available dice.

The turn system is dynamic with players contending for control of each phase.
The dice mechanics are a little different, but it is still best to roll high.
Players must continually adapt as they will not know if they will move first or second, or shoot first or second. At times movement, shooting, and melee can even be suspended and skipped during a turn.

Leadership plays a part in the fight with leaders being able to get more from individual units when needed. This can come in the form of additional movement, a additional shooting, launching an unexpected assault or just inspiring men to fight harder.

If using individually based figures the rules do not require the use of markers of any kind, allowing for an uncluttered battlefield. If not using individually based figures players will need to provide some method of recording unit losses. Other than that no markers are needed.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Turn Order: Random

name: De Sumer à Constantinople
description:
De Sumer à Constantinople

Miniatures wargame rules covering battles from Antiquity to the Middles Ages.

For 6 to 15mm miniatures, basing is compatible with DBx type rulesets.

Sequence of play
- phasing player:

Movement phase
Missile phase
Mêlée phase (simultaneous)
Rout phase


- Change phasing player and repeat

Contains 280 Army Lists

Published in French

name: Rendezvous with Destiny: The Battle of Carentan 1944 – A Campaign for Chain of Command
description:
Rendezvous with Destiny - Battle of Carentan

Recreate the epic struggle between American and German paratroop forces for the town of Carentan during the Invasion of Normandy.
This campaign is designed to be used with Too Fat Lardies' Chain of Command, however it can be readily adapted to your preferred WWII miniature ruleset.

Contained in this book you will find:

Complete campaign setup, duration, and special rules to add variation to play
Platoon layouts for both Allied and Axis forces, as well as campaign-specific Support Lists
Six campaign scenarios based on period maps and actual geography
Pre-generated character names, custom Patrol Markers, and optional blinds rules


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Ampsicora: Campidano Plain 215AC – Scenario for Centuria Miniature Wargaming in the Ancient Period
description:
Ampsicora supplement for Centuria

There are many events of antiquity that deserve to be explored. One of those is the first great uprising in Sardinia. Not so much for the outcome (the defeat of the Sardinian-Punic, Carthaginian, and Iliese coalition by the Romans led by Titus Manlius Torquatus), but for the fact that this event represented, at the very least, the first sign of recovery by the Romans after Hannibal’s climatic victory at Cannae. By regaining possession of Sardinia, the Romans were better able to control the western Mediterranean, and able to gain access to Sardinian wheat, which was used to feed their growing armies. One similarity between Hannibal and Ampsicora was that after their defeats, their cities of origin—Carthage and Cornus, respectively, were razed by the Romans.

A copy of Centuria is required to use this supplement.
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Das Fußball-Quiz
description: This soccer quiz contains questions and answers about the world of football: data, facts, records, highlights, quotes and anecdotes. The small and compact box contains 50 cards in an updated edition.

name: Pocket Apache: A Micro-game with Mega-Explosions
description:
Take to the skies anywhere in this 8-card wallet-sized microgame.

You are the pilot of an apache gunship on a mission of destruction in an enemy controlled airspace.
Fight your way past dozens of aircraft and ground forces to strike your target and get to safety.
Play aggressively to destroy your enemy and drive up your score or play safe and pick them off from a distance with your missiles.

And when you're ready, go head to head with more player's on the same battlefield in a battle for the high score.


Dynamically built battlefields for unlimited replayability
Simple mechanics that force you to balance survival vs. scoring
Fully playable using only the included cards and scratch paper.
Play it anywhere, anytime. It fits in your wallet and can be played on napkins or paper placemats.


—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Modern Warfare, Print & Play

name: Black Company: Operation Camelot – Miniature Wargaming Scenarios for FiveCore Skirmish and Five Parsecs from Home
description:
The Synod Security Services are on the back foot and cut off from their reinforcements. For the last few weeks freed prisoners of theirs have been all over the local media net telling stories of midnight abductions, torture and the killing of other prisoners. The SSS know they are in a bad situation and to make matters worse they have abducted the planetary governor and are using him as a shield against retaliation from the growing resistance movement. They are holed up in an old planetary defense fort far up in the mountains to the west of the capitol.
Mr. Johnson has tasked Black's Commandos with finding and rescuing the governor before he is killed as a propaganda piece by the Synod. Mr. Johnson has provided satelitte surviellance data about the fort and its defenses. He didn't say where he got this data from and we know better than to ask. The data seems solid but then again no intel is perfect. However, it is enough to formulate an ops plan.

This PDF provides a short campaign of 4 linked scenarios for the FiveCore Skirmish Gaming Evolved and its supplement Five Parsecs from Home.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Classic Brio: Clown Game
description:
Memory game, where there is a ring representing a circus arena, randomized 12 sections with 4 different colors. All the sections are face up during the setup, but they are turned face down when the game starts.

Player rolls a dice, which defines the color player needs to guess/remember. He can choose which face down section of the three sections of that color he wants. The face down section is then turned face up. If player is correct, the section stays face up and player receives a corresponding token. Otherwise the section is turned face down. Players take turns until all the sections are turned face up. The player with most points win the game.

name: Final Combat: Flower of Our Youth – Vietnam War Skirmish Scenarios for Final Combat
description:
Flower of Our Youth is a supplement for the Final Combat Skirmish System.

It contains 14 missions within 7 different operations that cover a period from 1965 to 1975 during the Vietnam War.

It also introduces rules for "booby traps," new armored fighting vehicle data sheets and assorted small arms of the period.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: Culture Collection Expansion
description:
The Culture Collection Expansion contains 31 additional cards for Keep, Merchants of Muziris, and Neolithic which were unlocked during the initial funding campaign.

Keep:
6 character cards & 4 item cards.

Merchants of Muziris:
2 market cards. 4 produce cards. 4 character cards.

Neolithic:
2 Explore cards, 1 Developed Resource card, 2 Gathered Resource cards, 3 Hunt cards

name: GeekmeQuiz: Le Retour
description: GeekmeQuiz: Le Retour will test your geek culture. Choose your specialty from 6 themes: cinema, comics, japanimation and manga, video games, literature and TV shows. Combine your skills with those of your friends to answer many questions!

name: 山手線SPEED (Yamanote-sen SPEED)
description:
Yamanote-sen SPEED (山手線SPEED) is a real-time card game for two players. (The rules suggest three is possible, but do not explain any rule differences.) The deck contains two cards for each station on the real-life Yamanote line that encircles Tokyo, along with two "new station" wild cards. The cards are shuffled and divided evenly among the players. Each player forms a tableau of four cards from their deck.

The players simultaneously reveal a starting card from their deck. At this point, players attempt to play cards from their tableau, either by playing an adjacent station on the Yamanote line, making a transfer through another real-life rail line (printed on the cards), or playing the new station card. The first player to verbally call out their route gets to play the card. If a player plays the new station card, only that player may play the next card on that pile.

If there are no legal plays remaining, each player simultaneously plays a new starting card, either from the deck if possible, or from the tableau if the deck is empty.

The player who plays all their cards wins, and scores points equal to the number of cards unplayed by their opponent.

Decks using the same ruleset exist for the Keihin-Tohoku, Chuo and Sobu lines, and since the lines overlap in real life, the decks can be integrated together.

—user summary

name: The September War Part One: the German invasion of Poland 1939 – A Campaign & Scenario Booklet for I Ain't Been Shot, Mum!
description:
The September War is a collection of thirty-three scenarios for I Ain’t Been Shot, Mum covering the German invasion of Poland 1939.

Divided into eight mini-campaigns, the pack begins with the battles at the border, then covers the fight for the Polish corridor, the Polish Thermopylae at Narew, the Siege of Warsaw, the climactic battles at Bzura and Tomaszow Lubelski, and the actions of the 10th Motorised Cavalry “Black” Brigade and the Independent Operational Group Polesie. There are attacks, counter-attacks, encounter battles, desperate defences…there’s even an armoured train or two.

No need for any preparation, each scenario contains:

a brief background history,
maps,
a full game briefing, and
a full briefing for each player.


Simply print out the pages you need from the PDF, make up the deck from the list of cards required, unpack your figures and dice, set up the table and away you go!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: 京浜東北線SPEED (Keihin-Tohoku-sen SPEED)
description:
Keihin-Tohoku-sen SPEED (京浜東北線SPEED) is a real-time card game for two players. (The rules suggest three is possible, but do not explain any rule differences.) The deck contains two cards for each station on the real-life Keihin-Tohoku line that connects Saitama, Tokyo and Yokohama, along with two "new station" wild cards. The cards are shuffled and divided evenly among the players. Each player forms a tableau of four cards from their deck.

The players simultaneously reveal a starting card from their deck. At this point, players attempt to play cards from their tableau, either by playing an adjacent station on the Keihin-Tohoku line, making a transfer through another real-life rail line (printed on the cards), or playing the new station card. The first player to verbally call out their route gets to play the card. If a player plays the new station card, only that player may play the next card on that pile.

If there are no legal plays remaining, each player simultaneously plays a new starting card, either from the deck if possible, or from the tableau if the deck is empty.

The player who plays all their cards wins, and scores points equal to the number of cards unplayed by their opponent.

Decks using the same ruleset exist for the Yamanote, Chuo and Sobu lines, and since the lines overlap in real life, the decks can be integrated together.

—user summary

name: Twice Upon a Time: The Story Telling Game
description:
A mostly co-operative game where young children have to use their word cards to complete a story against the timer which is set shorter and shorter.

—user summary

The Story Telling Game sees each player start with five words on their cards and when the clock starts, the first players starts telling a story using one of their words.
