Then it's the turn of the next player who has to incorporate one of their words into the former player's story... and so it goes on with each player adding to the story with one of their words at a time until the buzzer declares that it's 'The End' for the player who's talking when the buzzer sounds. When this happens, the player has to pick up all the cards used by the other players and begin a new story, this time with the opening 'Twice upon a time'. The story doesn't have to win awards or be a work of literary genius - it can be about anything but has to include one of the words on each of their cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Army Dudes
description:
In a world of molded plastic, discarded toys, and junk terrain, one squadron prepares for its deadliest mission yet. Time is limited, and survival rests on the whims of chance. Sarge fights to keep his team alive, Lucky keeps an eye on his rabbit’s foot, Sweep never loses a soldier to a minefield... and no soldier takes a shot until the spotlight is on him. 12 men, 2 squads, 6 minutes, and no mercy: these are ARMY DUDES.

The game is designed to be played with the classic green army figures, and puts players in control of action movie-like squads filled with characters like “Brick,” “Sarge,” and “Hotshot.”

We’ve been wanting to release a small-sides tactics game for a long time, said Army Dudes designer Drake Sherwood. The game is designed to be easy to learn and easy to play, but still offer a lot of tactical depth and decision-making. We wanted this to be a fun, playful experience with lots of replay value.

Players will have to stop by a dollar store or toy store to pick up some green army figures, and make use of whatever they have for terrain, said Sherwood. He thinks the game will have a nostalgic aspect for many players. I think the experience will remind a lot of players of games they made up as children -- except your friend can’t change the rules on you.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Best of the Naval Sitrep: Articles from Issues 1 - 13 – October 1994 - October 1997
description:
Best of the Naval SITREP collects articles on naval history, technology, wargaming techniques, book reviews, and of course, scenarios for Command at Sea and Harpoon (we hadn’t published FG&DN yet). First published from October 1994 to October 1997 (issues #1 to #13 of the Naval SITREP), the twenty-plus year old articles have been updated the current edition of the rules. Some articles that covered then-new foreign platforms have also been updated to current statistics, so that the reader can compare what we knew at that time with our current intelligence. Other articles describe how we calculate to create the gunnery ratings used in the games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Axe Age
description:
Axe Age has been worked on for several years now.

Extensively play-tested, the system holds up well to both skirmish level and large scale battle level.
The system uses d10s, and was designed with 25mm-28mm scale models in mind.
In addition to extensive folklore research, we had a very good official/unofficial historical consultant with a lot of knowledge and practical ideas on warfare back in the day, and we actually listened to him.
For this reason, the combat system is fairly realistic and plays well.

The game takes place in a dark age fantasy setting. Law and order have broken down and you, the player, are a small time warlord trying to carve out a kingdom for yourself.
Multiple tribes, weapons, armors, and much more are the tools of your trade. The various tribes that make up your warband are all drawn from history and folklore, with special abilities and available gear that reflect this. Your warband can be made up of units from different tribes, or from only one, it's all up to you.

—description from the publisher

name: Ragnarok: Age of Wolves
description:
Ragnarok: Age of Wolves is a skirmish-level game for novice and experienced tabletop gamers alike that emulates the desperate small-scale actions that might result during the unending winter that is the first stage of the Viking Apocalypse.

As crops fail and food grows scarce, banditry becomes rife as formerly good folk are driven to extremes and bad men take advantage of chaos and hardship. Monsters haunt the wilds and prowl the outskirts of palisaded settlement and isolated steading alike. Huldrfolk, never easy neighbors, but generally peaceful if left undisturbed, now move to defend their sacred groves and to seize places once devoted to gods who now seem absent. Trolls and their ilk gather, marauders sweep brigands and more into their bands, and whispers abound of gaunt giant wolves and worse, glimpsed in the swirl of a snowstorm. And where such beasts and everlasting winter hold sway, the Frost Giants cannot be far behind ...

Ragnarok: Age of Wolves is a set of fun, fast-playing, and evocative rules that allow you to fight out the desperate battles and skirmishes of the Fimblvintr. It also includes a four-part campaign to take you through the struggle of one man trying to preserve something of his honor, his life, and the people and creatures who depend on him for survival. Finally, we have given you everything you need to expand the strife to include the other creatures and Sagas of the Ragnarok!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Cuboro Tricky Ways: Cards
description:
Expansion set to the game "Tricky Ways". Cards reshuffle the game! The cards are to create surprising game variations and other players can intervene in your game! Who creates the longest paths by using the cuboro elements from the "tricky ways" game? Be carful! Cards set you a lot of rules and other players can put a spoke in your wheel!

—description from the publisher

name: Father Tilly: Escalade – Skirmish Rules for the Seventeenth Century
description:
Escalade is a set of skirmish rules designed for keen Father Tilly players - and anyone else interested in seventeenth-century warfare. Escalade takes the basic mechanics used in Father Tilly and incorporates that extra layer of detail required for battles at the skirmish level.
The rules feature organisation at the company level and focus on the role of officers and NCOs in low level engagements. Also included in the rules are a number of different troop types: those interesting and exotic units that are too small or rare to feature in most big battles. Players can field units of Jägers, Shützen, Sturmtruppen and Trabanten.

For the experienced Father Tilly player, Escalade contains several familiar features.
Rules for movement, morale, shooting and combat have the same basic mechanics but with additional detail.
The sections on terrain and scenario generation are also included plus a new section detailing mortars, incendiaries and other methods of mayhem and destruction.
The popular "war-tokens" section is also included, this describes how players can use their existing Father Tilly tokens and apply them to skirmish games.
And because of the more uncertain nature of skirmish games, the initiative system has been modified too.

Despite its similarities to Father Tilly, Escalade is a game that can be played on its own without any prior experience of other AB One games.
Players of Father Tilly will already be familiar with many of its processes, however, new players will quickly find an easy to use, exciting and enjoyable system ideally suited to fighting skirmish level games in the seventeenth century.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Micro Sci-Fi: Time Warrior
description:
A ziplocked expansion army set for Tabletop Games' 1977 release, Micro Sci-Fi.

—user summary

This force comprises a mixed force of various barbarian tribes. The majority of the weapons are of close combat types but most of the units possess the ability to leap back a few seconds in time. The Psychs do not have weapons, nor can they time jump; their only ability is in being able to control the minds and wills of enemies.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Strike Legion: Platoon Leader – Strange New Worlds
description:
This expansion to the Strike Legion: Platoon Leader tabletop game adds dozens of new unit and situational rules options, allowing players to recreate their favorite Science Fiction/Science Fantasy gaming genres with as much (or as little) detail as they wish to include. Platoon Leader: Strange New Worlds includes:

New unit types: Large Creatures, Large Vehicles, Partisans, Off-board Support (Artillery, Ortillery, cruise missiles and Air Strikes), Armor Leaders, Civilians, Hordes, and genetically modified ‘Organic’ and Hybrid units.
Unit and Weapon Variants: four new weapon classes, three missile variants, Unconventional Electronic Warfare, Psionics, multiple special munitions and missile warhead types, Mines, Physical Weapons, and special rules and damage tracking for Large Walkers.
Orbital Insertion rules, including the use of Drop Pods, Drop Capsules, Dropships and Teleportation.
Variant movement rules including Displacement Movement, in-game Teleportation, and Tank Riders.
Over two dozen new troop attributes and vehicle systems.
Ten additional Optional Rules, including simplified vehicle damage, environmental conditions, night fighting, and more!
Seven standard scenarios that can be played with the forces included in the book, or those created by the players.
Rules and scenarios for Black Ops Missions, permitting players to use Strike Legion: Platoon Leader to play low model-count skirmish games.
Additional Unit Construction routines that help players create units using all of the new features found in this book.
Conversion parameters to port your Strike Legion Tactical units to Platoon Leader stats.
Loads of unit data cards and markers.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Strike Legion: Module One – The Genome Gambit
description:
Strike Legion: The Genome Gambit increases the depth and scope of your fictional wars by adding fully customizable xenomorphs (or plain old "bugs" if you prefer), genetically modified "super soldiers", and bio-mechanoid units and technology.
Specialized command rules for truly "alien" species provide new challenges and opportunities to play out in front of you on your tabletop.

New rule and scenario additions include

naval and submarine movement/combat,
tunnel movement,
mine warfare,
biochemical and
nuclear weapons,
fielding personalities or special characters,
and more.


Lower and higher "mechanical" technology systems and unit construction rules are also included, allowing players to field either more advanced units or create forces analogous to existing modern/near-future terrestrial military hardware.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Strike Legion: Module Two – The Clockwork Armies
description:
Strike Legion: The Clockwork Armies provides everything needed for players to fight battles in an alternate or historical past.
Drawing from both historical sources and Victorian-era science fiction, players can field armies of sky, land, and sailing ships alongside troops armed with rifles and muskets, swords, bows, and spears.

New rules additions include

advanced air combat,
galleys and sailing ships,
skyships,
dirigibles,
landships,
small aircraft and
aircraft carriers,
chariots,
formed infantry and cavalry,
ancient siege artillery,
cannons, and
fortifications.


Each is fully compatible with all other units created for the Strike Legion gaming system and can be fielded against or alongside any other force created for the game.

And for those not inclined to the past, the highest level of mechanical tech is included, along with experimental rules to depict forces capable of temporal displacement to gain advantage in the field, and combat with or against beings of pure energy.
Complete construction rules are included, along with additional unit designs and scenarios to get you started as you march to the sound of the guns.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Strike Legion: Skunk Works
description:
Strike Legion: Skunk Works brings new optional and "advanced" rules to your gaming table. The fourth volume in the Strike Legion tactical series includes:

Rules for Scout EW, Tank Riders, Psionic combat, capturing enemy vehicles and troops, Aimed Shots, Ambushes, Drones, and more.
Complete rules for rail movement, trains, and land trains.
Solitaire gaming rules for the Strike Legion tactical game series.
New types of missiles, missile warheads, and artillery payloads.
Many new systems, weapons, and attributes.
A preview from an upcoming Strike Legion sourcebook of two opposing forces - The Omani Imperium and the Rikai'ishi'i Empire - including brief backgrounds and Data Cards for these two combatants.
Four new scenarios pitting these forces against each other in interesting tactical situations.
A consolidated construction section that includes all of the construction data from all Strike Legion tactical books to date.
Additional reference charts and game markers.


Strike Legion: Skunk Works is not a complete game. Ownership of the Strike Legion Main Rulebook is necessary to use the information enclosed in this volume; ownership of Strike Legion Module One: The Genome Gambit and Strike Legion Module Two: The Clockwork Armies is necessary to utilize some of the information presented herein.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: ICE
description:
ICE is our home.ICE is our world. ICE is corrupted. ICE is dying.

ICE is a mega-city. Ice is dying from within. Before our history began, the Gods created this world and seeded a civilisation that spread to cover the entire planet. They raised us up - the eight exalted families, they gave us a sun that would never dim, they gave us technology. Then they left.

Why they did so is a question that has had no answer, until now. For our sun is dying, the corrupted machines are spreading. But after eons away, the Gods have finally returned. To help us battle for survival? Possibly.

In ICE players take on characters representing one of the exalted families born from the genetic seed of the ancient Kchemic Gods. They must work together (semi co-op play) as powerful agents of the Gods in mission-based scenarios to hunt down and defeat corrupted threats in the dying city. A clever AI mechanism in game will keep players on their toes as they try to zero in on the location of the final enemy. With many NPCs to interact with and city sectors that change position and purpose, no two games will ever be the same!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Gridblock
description:
Gridblock is an abstract card driven game, where players have to move on a tile grid and try to place markers in order to score victory points. Each player has a deck of six cards, which show a combination of movement points from 1 to 3 and one of six symbols. Markers may only be places, if the symbol on the played card matches the symbol on the tile their movement ends on. Bonus points may be scored if a player manages to place multiple markers on a single tile.

The game is played with the components of the Green Box of Games. The Meeple Mini Expansion is not needed to play this game.

Gridblock won the Best Original Game category of the 2018 Green Box of Games Design Contest.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Cold War 3! Rules for Modern Warfare 1960-1990
description:
COLD WAR3! Rules for Modern Warfare 1960-1990 allows you to field a tabletop army (and fight with it) in 6mm, 15mm or even 20mm (or any combination thereof!) from the early Cold war right up to it's finish in 1990.


This comprehensive rulebook includes TWO complete orders of battle for the American and Soviet forces split into three sections:
1960-'70 -Early;
1970-'80 -Middle; and
1980-'90 -Late COLD WAR if you will.




This book covers rules for armoured, mechanised and infantry assaults, movement, firing, night fighting, engineers, scouts, snipers, medics and battlefield recovery.
It also includes rules for modern anti-tank weapons from the AT-3 through to the TOW II and Milan ATGM's as well as modern armour such as ERA (explosive reactive armour), Composite (such as Chobham) and things such as side skirts and improvised armour.



Rules for artillery, including all of the sub-munitions such as FASCAM (scaterable mines), DPICM (boosted rounds), Copperhead (guided rounds) and High Explosive, chemical and smoke rounds as well!



Rules for air support and even surface-to-air-missiles, aircraft firing on ground targets, straffing runs, bombing runs and avoiding ground fire are all included as well as such ordinance as smart bombs, high explosives, rocket pods and even napalm! Loitering, air to air combat and re-arming are also included. Rules for helicopters, gunships and even medical evacuation are covered in depth as well.



A comprehensive air craft armoury lists is included covering everything from the A1 Skyhawk to the A-10, the F14, F15, F16 and even F-18, the F-104 through to the Phantom and even A6 crusaders!For the Russians we have the Mig-15 through to Mig-29, the Su-25, Su-11 and even Su-7 ground attack, the Tu-11 and Tu-95 bombers to bring added carnage to the battlefield!



Optional rules can take your COLD WAR 3! Battles to new, hotter, levels with the inclusion of chemical, biological and even nuclear effects are covered as well as on-table explosions, loitering times, decontamination, detection and even on-table nuclear explosions!



Modern armour from the T34/85 through to the T-80u, the M48a1 right through to the M1a2 and all manner of armoured vehicles in between such as the BTR family of wheeled APC's, the BMP-1 and BMP-2 and the ubiquitous M-113 family of armoured personnel carriers and the modern M2 and M3 Bradleys!


These rules are compatible with other popular 15mm tabletop games such as TY and FoW as well as other titles produced by Dean Wilson.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Eggmuhl 1809: Army Lists for Imperial Eagle
description:
The complete historical lists for the Eggmuhl campaign in 1809 with a Bonus scenario including three maps in full colour to play the first day of the battle of Eggmuhl.

The book contains the orders of battle of all the troops involved from the French and their many allies and the Austrian Army.

These are presented in organigram style showing each division and their brigades with leaders with their command values and each regiment and battalion.

Although they are specifically for Imperial Eagle Napoleonic rules they could be used generally.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Battle for the Hidden City: Hidden Wars Volume I
description:
Battle for the Hidden City is a micro war game for two players. In it, one player takes on the role of the French Foreign Legion seeking fame and treasure in 1930s Egypt.

Meanwhile, the other player will control the Brotherhood of the Ank, a fictional ancient organization of warriors whose sole job is to protect the Hidden City and its secrets.

The Foreign Legion has just recently located the long lost Hidden City deep in the sands of the desert. The Brotherhood has learned of the Legion’s presence and has set out to remove the intruders once and for all.

The small regiment of the Legion is far outnumbered in this battle, not foreseeing any push back, but they have the benefit of already being in the ruins of the city for cover, while the Brotherhood is coming in from the open desert--making them potentially easy targets.

Who will prevail in the Battle for the Hidden City?

—description from the publisher

name: Bohica: Fast Play Rules for Mass Fleet Battles
description:
BOHICA: Fast Play Rules for Mass Fleet Battles

Core set of miniature wargame rules for Science Fiction Star Fleet combat.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Regiment: Mission Briefs 2
description:
The Regiment is sometimes hired for a single important mission inside of a wider campaign. These missions are high risk but high reward and the Regiment has been hired because local forces are incapable of accomplishing it.
The missions could be in support of a colonial kleptocrat who is under siege by rebel groups or in protecting vital infrastructure for corporate bloc oligarchs.
This missions in this brief are four typical combat missions an can be used to "fatten up" a campaign of storyline missions. The missions are pretty generic an can be used in any previous published campaign compatible with either Dirtside II or FUBAR. They can also be used in homebrew campaigns or as stand alone missions.

This PDF provides 4 complete missions for Dirtside II and FUBAR as well as complete stats for 5 Regiment vehicles and their Dragoon infantry Squad. It also includes a quick points calculation for creating your own vehicles using the FUBAR rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Regiment: Hostile Takeover
description:
The Rytec Interstellar Corporation and the Colfire incorporated mining companies both have claims to mineral rights on the planet Zapotec. The planet was initially discovered by a scout probe over a hundred standard years ago and promised untold mineral wealth to anyone willing to invest significant amounts of money in infrastructure and initial colonization. Rytec and Colfire both launched survey ships with an initial load of miners and some basic equipment. The mineral wealth of Zapotec was even more than initial scans indicated.
Both Rytec and Colfire invested heavily over the next three decades and eventually constructed a space elevator together in order to save on transportation costs. At first things went well and miners and equipment flooded into the new colony. In the last few years a new CEO was hired at Rytec Interstellar, Joseph Halsey, and the corporation has become more aggressive in its mining and Colfire has filed numerous protests over claim jumping. Miners have gotten into fist fights with rival miners from both companies. Last month a full blown riot erupted at the space elevator when Rytec personnel insulted a group of Colfire truckers. The final straw was when armed Rytec security personnel seized the lucrative ruby mine #59 on the shores of Lake Nazca.
Rytec has hired Parker's Panthers to seize the remaining mines and raze the Colfire Incorporated executive compound. Colfire has hired the Regiment to secure its assets from Rytec's extremely hostile takeover attempts.

This PDF provides a complete campaign of 12 linked scenarios for both Stargrunt II and Dirtside II. It also proveds stats for Parker's Panthers vehicles used in the scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Regiment: Local Forces
description:
Mercenaries often work with indigenous forces on their many contracts. These forces are often reservists or poorly trained regulars equipped with second hand equipment that is obsolete more often than not. These forces however are not to be completely discounted as effective fighting forces and can provide a mercenary a cheap bu effective method to hold less important objectives. They can also be used to provide cheap anti-aircraft defenses, artillery support or VTOL reconnaissance and attack capability.

Opposition forces are often armed with the same equipment as the local forces a mercenary has been tasked with supporting. In these cases mercenaries and their supporting local forces often paint stripes on their vehicles to help mitigate friendly fire.

This PDF provides complete stats and description of 11 different vehicles and a TO&E for a local Company level combined arms team for both Stargrunt II and Dirtside II. There are also pictures of models that can be used with the stats.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Regiment: Mission Briefs 1
description:
The Regiment is sometimes hired for a single important mission inside of a wider campaign. These missions are high risk but high reward and the Regiment has been hired because local forces are incapable of accomplishing it. The missions could be in support of a colonial kleptocrat who is under siege by rebel groups or in protecting vital infrastructure for corporate bloc oligarchs. This missions in this brief are four typical combat missions an can be used to "fatten up" a campaign of storyline missions.

The missions are pretty generic an can be used in any previous published campaign compatible with either Dirtside II or FUBAR. They can also be used in homebrew campaigns or as stand alone missions.

This PDF provides 4 complete missions for Dirtside II and FUBAR as well as complete stats for 5 Regiment vehicles and their Dragoon infantry Squad. It also includes a quick points calculation for creating your own vehicles using the FUBAR rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Regiment: Rolling Thunder
description:
Miller's Marauders, simply known as the Regiment to it's members, has been hired by the government of Del a' Zhou to prosecute a war against its neighbor the Rhineland Republic. The two states control a competing interests in the harvest of a local seaweed which has amazing healing properties. Neither are content to share in the planet's bounty and have been prosecuting a trade war with one another for nearly a decade. The government of Del a' Zhou controls the spaceport but the Rhineland republic has been constructing its own port for a few years now and intends to bypass the Zhou controlled spaceport altogether. The Zhou government does not want to lose the revenue from port fees and tariffs by allowing the Rhineland Republic to build another port facility.
The port facility is being constructed near the city of Heimdal and is 95% complete. The Zhou government has hired the Regiment to launch an invasion of the Republic across the DMZ and take the city of Heimdal and destroy the port.

This PDF provides a complete campaign of 12 linked scenarios for both Stargrunt II and Dirtside II. It also provides stats for Regimental vehicles used in the scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Regiment: Roughneck Country
description:
Johnson's Rock is a planet in the Signus system and is rich in heavy minerals and industrial gemstones. The Olepak Corporation sponsored the first colonization efforts in an attempt to exploit the natural resources of Johnson's Rock. Olepak invested heavily in infrastructure and tranportation costs for miners and their familes to relocate to Johnson's Rock. In the past two hundred years the Olepak Corporation has steadily erroded the pay and rights of the workers in order to maximize profits and increase mining quotas to fulfill increasing demand for raw materials, especially metals and industrial grade diamonds. The workers have endured a stagnation in pay and an increase in workhours to the point where the average worker works 70+ hours a week in horrific conditions. Olepak Corporation has also instituted a company store policy and most miners are indebted to the Olepak Corporation for the next decade just to put food on the table and a roof over their families heads. Mining on Johnson's Rock is extraordinarily hazardous and miners have a 10% death rate per year. The mining families are trapped on world and sons an daughters with no other options hire on with the Olepak Corporation as miners or support staff. In the last few months miners have begun protesting their treatment and many mines have temporarily shut down due to strikes by miners. The Olepak Corporation hired thugs to break the strikes and more than a few arms as well. A few ringleaders for the miner's groups have been found murdered or dead in a mine shaft and no one has been charged with the crimes. In the wake of the deaths, the various mining groups have hired the Thunderbolt Division with the promise of a percenage of the profits if the miner's take over operations themselves. The Olepak Corporation in turn has hired the Regiment to squash the rebellion and push the Thunderbolt Division off planet.

This PDF provides a complete campaign of 12 linked scenarios for both Stargrunt II and Dirtside II. It also provides stats for Thunderbolt Division vehicles used in the scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Black Company: Meeting on Ysgard
description:
The Black Company has been approached by agents of the Terran Alliance Diplomatic Corps. The main thrust of the Alliance military efforts are in securing the Hevan's Gate system and establishing a beachhead in the next sector. There are still systems within the Sol Sector that have yet to be pacified or occupied. The Ysgard system contains a Bifrost Bridge and could be used as a base of resistance by the Synod or their allies. The Deputy Undersecretary of State for the Terran Alliance has hired the Black Company to supplament the Diplomatic Protection Service in protecting the diplomats sent to negotiate a treaty with the planetary Administrator of Ysgard. The DPS will protect the ambassador directly while the Black Company will be acting as a backup and heavy extraction force in case the ambassador is attacked.
The Synod Security Services (SSS) maintain a substantial presence on Ysgard and would go to extreme lengths to kill,capture or compromise the ambassador. The DPS has strongly urged Commander Black to be prepared for any situation.

This PDF provides a short campaign of 4 linked scenarios for the FiveCore Skirmish Gaming Evolved and its supplament Five Parsecs from Home.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Black Company: Operation Mongoose – Miniature Wargaming Scenarios for FiveCore Skirmish and Five Parsecs from Home
description:
Now that the diplomatic overture as been made and rejected by the Ysgardians, Mr. Johnson approached Commander Black for a new set of missions for the Company on Ysgard. The Synod Security Services have a tight hold on the Planetary Administrator who will not agree to any treaty as long as the SSS is onworld. The Planetary Administrator needs to have total deniability and suggested to Mr. Johnson during the treaty talks that if the SSS were no longer a viable threat that he would seriously consider signing the treaty. The intel that Bravo Squad acquired during their last visit to Ysgard was significant and has allowed Mr. Johnson and his team to formulate a plan to undermine and weaken the SSS and at the same time winning the loyalty of the people of Ysgard. As former citizens of the Synod of Worlds the Black Company is the perfect choice to infiltrate the world and conduct the mission without arousing suspicion.

This PDF provides a short campaign of 4 linked scenarios for the FiveCore Skirmish Gaming Evolved and its supplement Five Parsecs from Home.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: This Weak Piping Time of Peace: A War of the Roses Game with Toy Soldiers
description:
Simple rules for playing out War of the Roses skirmishes with 54mm toy soldiers on the tabletop. Ordinary six-sided dice and so-called "average dice" (numbered 2, 3, 3, 4, 4, 5) are used to resolve command, movement, shooting, and close combat.

—user summary

name: The Exiled: Butchers
description:
This expansion introduces 3 new Heroes into the game for the Defenders to use. These are the criminals who - while still at large - were known as the "Butchers Gang". Their leader, a man called Adam Hermand, occupied the post of the city surgeon. He specialized in killing his patients in painful and gruesome ways and cutting out some of their internal organs to sell in the black market. Necklaces made of nails and ears of his victims were found in his sister’s room – the wretched woman was a partner in her brother’s atrocities. The last gang member is Olsen, a grave robber, who acquired for Hermand more… stale, but still necessary body parts.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Relic Worlds Expeditions
description:
Seek out ancient treasures and battle your enemies in Relic Worlds Expeditions.
But beware, secret traps and fierce monsters await within the ruins of an ancient alien civilization.
Build a list and play as treasure hunters, pirates, corporate armies, spies, and more from the vast Relic Worlds universe.
Then send them out on a custom made board against your friends or in a solo game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Relic Worlds Showdown: Corporate Armies
description:
Back when humanity was on Earth, populations were ruled over by countries. As it spread into the cosmos, corporations took charge of colonies, and soon they were the ruling class of human civilization. Their armies clash with each other, and other factions for dominance over the galaxy. They are the strongest and most powerful of all factions, bringing the most firepower and leadership to any conflict.

Relic Worlds Showdown uses the Showdown miniatures rules by Pinnacle Entertainment to recreate skirmish battles in the Relic Worlds universe. In it, players find artifacts and other treasures left behind by long-lost alien civilizations. But the characters must be careful, as these alien races also left behind traps, and fierce monsters remain that will prove a deadly challenge to your faction.

In these pages, you will find rules for turning your Showdown game into a Relic Worlds one, and the faction information for Corporate armies.
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Relic Worlds Showdown: Corporate Spies
description:
Living in the shadows and working for the highest bidder, corporate spies use cunning and wit to focus their attention on their target. They are experts at getting in, accomplishing the mission, and getting out, hopefully with as little notice on them as possible.

Relic Worlds Showdown uses the Showdown miniatures rules by Pinnacle Entertainment to recreate skirmish battles in the Relic Worlds universe. In it, players find artifacts and other treasures left behind by long-lost alien civilizations.
But the characters must be careful, as these alien races also left behind traps, and fierce monsters remain that will prove a deadly challenge to your faction.

In these pages, you will find rules for turning your Showdown game into a Relic Worlds one, and the faction information for corporate spies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Relic Worlds Showdown: Dark Agents
description:
Known by some simply as The Dark Ones, this cult of fanatical authoritarians believe all evidence of past alien civilizations must be destroyed, and those who have been exposed to it must be terminated. (Though they themselves collect the occasional artifact that could help the greater good.)

Relic Worlds Showdown uses the Showdown miniatures rules by Pinnacle Entertainment to recreate skirmish battles in the Relic Worlds universe. In it, players find artifacts and other treasures left behind by long-lost alien civilizations. But the characters must be careful, as these alien races also left behind traps, and fierce monsters remain that will prove a deadly challenge to your faction.

In these pages, you will find rules for turning your Showdown game into a Relic Worlds one, and the faction information for the Dark Agents.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Relic Worlds Showdown: Space Pirates
description:
Some folks prefer the freedom of “independent contracting” and open space to the restrictions of corporate governments. These wayward spirits are often on the search for untold treasures and riches on the myriad planets across the galaxy.

Relic Worlds Showdown uses the Showdown miniatures rules by Pinnacle Entertainment to recreate skirmish battles in the Relic Worlds universe. In it, players find artifacts and other treasures left behind by long-lost alien civilizations. But the characters must be careful, as these alien races also left behind traps, and fierce monsters remain that will prove a deadly challenge to your faction. In these pages, you will find rules for turning your Showdown game into a Relic Worlds one, and the faction information for the pirates.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Relic Worlds Showdown: Treasure Hunters
description:
Though most people overlook ancient artifacts left behind by extinct alien civilizations, treasure hunters know their true value. Whether xeno-archaeologists or other scientists trying to understand them, or looters searching for treasures they can turn over for a quick buck, these adventurers are trying to recover as many relics as they can.

Relic Worlds Showdown uses the Showdown miniatures rules by innacle Entertainment to recreate skirmish battles in the Relic Worlds universe. In it, players find artifacts and other treasures left behind by long-lost alien civilizations. But the characters must be careful, as these alien races also left behind traps, and fierce monsters remain that will prove a deadly challenge to your faction.

In these pages, you will find rules for turning your Showdown game into a Relic Worlds one, and the faction information for the pirates.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Survey and Explore: A Starport Scum Expansion
description:
One more rock floating in space.

Welcome to Survey and Explore, an expansion pack for the Starport Scum game rules.

With this expansion, you will be able to land on any uncharted world and explore, using random scenery, sights and encounter tables to find interesting things to loot, explore or get eaten by.
This emulates the "hex-crawl" gameplay style used by some fantasy roleplaying games, where you explore a world map one hex, grid or region at a time seeing what you find.
This can be used as a travel mechanic for an existing campaign, as a diversion or even as a solo-campaign.

Random animal stat generation is included as well as well as a few notes to explain core rules terms to those using this with another rules system.

Survey and Explore is easy to use with other science fiction role playing games and campaign games, though any rules references are for Starport Scum.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: BRAINGASM
description:
Think of BRAINGASM as a game of finding a “Needle in a Haystack,” only instead of a needle, you might be finding two unicorns f!@#ing or a pile of cocaine.

—descripiption from the publisher

(or also, R18+ version of Spot It!)

name: Cat and Mice: Allez-hop
description:
In Cat and Mice, the players try to place their four mice on the cheese swing, building a mouse pyramid. Successful placement is rewarded with point tokens.

—user summary

name: Rifles in the Peninsula: The Duel
description:
This minigame, inspired by the movie The Duelist, is an optional set of rule for Rifles in the Peninsula that allows you to introduce a more personal perspective to the game.

—description from the rulebook

The Dual is a minigame that is played between scenarios of the Rifles in the Peninsula's Campaign Game. The game consists of checking initiative, stamina and wounds after each attack and defense during a duel between the player and the Nemesis.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: ToppleRocks Challenge
description:
A set of 6 irregularly shaped angular blocks that stacks in an unstable fashion. Players take turns building structures from the blocks under time pressure from a sand timer. Points are awarded for including many blocks, stacking two blocks on one block, and placing larger rocks atop smaller rocks. Multiple sets can be combined to create larger structures.

The boxed edition under the title "ToppleRocks Challenge" includes a timer, scoring rules, and is packaged as a game for 2+ players. The bagged edition under the title "ToppleRocks" does not include scoring rules or a timer and advertises itself as a building toy.

The blocks are manufactured from scrap wood, so the materials and coloration varies from set to set.

name: Rally Cross
description: Rally Cross is a racing game across a winding track on the wooden board. Every turn, players select their movement by picking a stick of a certain length - and then use that stick to meter out their move, preferably without rushing into anything!

name: Battle of the Bards: Tantrum House 2019 promo card
description:
promo card available through the Tantrum House 2019 kickstarter campaign

This is an audience card :
cost : 3 performance tokens (any color)
VP : 5
ability : When you use the Roadie's ability, you may gain another tune token
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Music
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: TACTIX: Universal Wargame Rules
description:
Tired of the same old game with no flavor and no balance?
Restricted with your army list and the options you have?
Struggling to get the most out of your miniature collection?
Looking for a system that allows for large-scale wargaming and skirmish level campaign play?
Love the models in your collection but hate the rules made by that company?


Look no further! This is the wargame you've been searching for. TACTIX is a wargame that allows for ultimate customization for each and every model in your collection while providing a balanced and streamlined ruleset for you to use for any genre or type of wargame!

—description from the publisher

TACTIX is a generic system that supports two or more players using any type of forces, from historical to science-fantasy. A simple procedure is used to assign individual models several ratings, including Assault, Shoot, and Quality. Models' size is determined by the physical base size of the figure, and is divided into seven categories (each category other than Normal has an assigned Trait). A relatively simple method is then used to calculate the model's cost in points, and players take (roughly) the same number of base points for their army.

Play proceeds in turns, round-robin style. Games have a pre-determined length and end when the time is reached (or when all but one player concedes). Games have pre-determined objectives with associated points; alternately, victory can be determined by remaining model points. During their turn, players have several options available for each model, depending on the model's individual Trait(s).

The game is distributed as a rule book only. Models used during play can be derived from nearly any source, as desired, and may be of almost any scale, though 32mm through 400mm bases would by typical.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Winterborne: Tantrum House 2019 promo card
description:
Promo card available through the 2019 Tantrum House kickstarter campaign.

This forest card lets you spend any resource and take a sacked spoils token.
categories: City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Astral Empires: Battleshift
description:
Big space battles are one of the coolest sights in science fiction movies and television, but there aren't many rules systems that really do it right. Most top out at running ten or so ships effectively, a few make it to twenty, but none of the other available rule sets really let you drop a couple hundred on the table and decide the fate of the galaxy!

Battleshift does....

Battleshift was born in a thread on The Miniatures Page. People were looking for a fast, enjoyable space game that would let them field real fleets. Not just a dozen ships, but scores or hundreds of ships.

That's what Battleshift is....

"Battleshift" refers to ships shifting into and out of battle through hyperspace. It allows units of ships to disappear from the table, and then re-enter the battlespace a few turns later making maneuver important, as fleet commanders can't just focus on what's on the table.

Battleshift also features a suppression system, which causes squadrons to lose accuracy as they take fire. Suppression has traditionally been critical in battle. In naval gun engagements, near misses on enemy ships were still useful as they made crews flinch, rocked the ship to spoil aim and obscured targeting. Few starship miniature games have even looked at suppression's effect on a battlefield.

Battleshift does...

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex – Grey Knights
description:
Chanting rites of banishment, the elite brotherhoods of the Grey Knights stride fearlessly into battle against the worst horrors of the galaxy. They wear blessed silver battle-plate and wield potent weapons of purgation, each a master-wrought relic whose worth can be measured in worlds. Every battle-brother of this Chapter is a powerful psyker, his will an adamant fortress and his mental powers a honed blade. As the galaxy becomes ever darker, the selflessly heroic Grey Knights fight unbowed.

Codex: Grey Knights contains a wealth of background and rules – the definitive book for Grey Knights collectors. Within this 102-page hardback, you’ll find:

Background

- The Emperor’s Gift: a glimpse into the mysteries of the Grey Knights, their secretive history, the fortress on Titan where they are created and laid to rest and the rituals and canticles that define their struggle against daemonkind; - The unique organisation of the Grey Knights – defined by their struggle against the Dark Gods, this Chapter is split into 8 Brotherhoods, each detailed here;
- Heraldry of Titan: details of the unique heraldry and armour etchings borne by this Chapter;
- A timeline of the Grey Knights, from their origins beneath a veil of secrecy, major battles and struggles leading up to the current dire state of the galaxy – and the Grey Knights’ potential, drastic strategic response to this;
- Background and details on each character and unit available to a Grey Knights army;
- A showcase of beautifully painted Citadel miniatures, depicting the colour schemes of the Grey Knights expertly painted by the ‘Eavy Metal team.

Rules

Everything you need to get a Grey Knights army primed for heroic combat against the daemonic threat in games of Warhammer 40,000 is here:

- 32 datasheets containing rules for every Grey Knights unit;
- Army abilities reflecting the Grey Knights’ methods of war;
- The Armoury of Titan: wargear both ranged and close-combat used by the Grey Knights;
- Points values for all miniatures, weapons and wargear for use in Matched Play games;
- The Hammer of Daemons: rules for Battle-forged armies:
- 6 unique Warlord Traits,
- 16 unique Stratagems (with a focus on the psychic might of this army),
- the Relics of Titan (6 rare artefacts unique to the Grey Knights),
- the unique Sanctis psychic discipline, available to all Grey Knights psykers;
- 6 unique Tactical Objectives.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Final Combat: Ardennes – Skirmish Scenarios
description:
Final Combat: Ardennes is a set of 12 WWII skirmish scenarios that covers the period during the last great German offensive in the west, December 16–26, 1944.

It will take you from the defense of the Elsenborn Ridge through the siege at Bastogne.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Anthology of Armor: A Final Combat Supplement
description:
Anthology of Armor is a supplement for the Final Combat skirmish wargaming system.

It adds game-play data and statistics for 196 armored fighting vehicles of WWII (AFV's are not included in Final Combat).

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Bartered Bride: A Game Module for SOF Warrior
description:
Bartered Bride is a game module for SOF Warrior, but it will translate to almost any modern skirmish set.

It revolves around the Somali Pirate hijacking of a crude oil ship named "Bartered Bride."

A multi-national counter terrorism unit known as MECT must recover the ship and rescue its 25-member crew.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Chef-du-Pont: WWII Skirmish Scenarios for Final Combat
description:
Chef-du-Pont is a campaign that emphasizes the enormity of the task facing the airborne forces on June 6, 1944.

Ten scenarios chronicle the major engagements that helped determine the outcome of the Utah landings that fateful day.

Fight alongside Captain Roy Creek and Lieutenant Colonels Arthur Maloney & Edwin Ostberg as they battle the Germans to secure a bridge across the Merderet River near the little town of Chef-du-Pont.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Final Combat: Little Stalingrad – 37 Scenarios that Chronicle Canada's Victory at Ortona
description:
"In one blood-soaked, furious week of fighting, from December 20 to December 27, 1943, the 1st Canadian Infantry Division took Ortona, Italy, from elite German paratroopers ordered to hold the medieval port town at all costs." (Zuehlke 1999)

This book of 37 skirmish scenarios is taken directly from Mark Zuehlke's book, Ortona, and it chronicles Canada's most epic World War II victory.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Final Combat: Rudi Brasche – Skirmish Scenarios
description:
Final Combat: Rudi Brasche contains a series of ten skirmish scenarios that recreate the heroic exploits of a Second World War Knight's Cross recipient.

In this tribute to Rudolf Brasche, the player will be able to relive the harrowing firefights and experience the manner in which he overcame insurmountable odds in the prosecution of his duty.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: All Star Family Fortunes: Card Game
description:
Based on one of the nations favourite TV game shows. Predict the survey results to win BIG! Who will be crowned Family Fortunes Champion. Our survey said....

Contents: 2 rules cards, 1 buzzer card, 3 lost life cards, 5 spot prize cards, 70 question cards

It's just like the TV show. Two teams (or individuals) must try to guess the most popular answers given by the British public when asked everyday, but entertaining, questions.

The players split into two teams. One full game comprises three single money rounds, two double money rounds and one final Big Money round.

The single and double money rounds are the same - the teams race to give the first answer, and if they don't come up with the top answer, the other team can try to beat the first team's answer to win the chance to play or pass. Then the playing team tries to give all the answers that feature on the card, until either they finish the card, or lose three lives. If they lose three lives, the other team has a chance to steal by supplying one of the remaining answers.

The big money round is the finale, and each team nominates one player to represent it. This round is a quick fire round - the players have to write down an answer to five of the cards, and win points for answers that are on the card, with bonus points for getting the top answer.

The teams add up their points and see who is the winner.

name: Final Combat: Medal of Honor – Skirmish Scenarios Vol.1
description:
Final Combat: Medal of Honor is a series of skirmish scenarios that allows you to recreate the heroic exploits of Second World War medal recipients.

In this Western European Theatre tribute, you will be able to read the extraordinary accounts of how these soldiers overcame insurmountable odds in the prosecution of their duty.
The character sheets will endow you with the attributes of these great men.
Just fill in your name and see if you can replicate their conspicuous gallantry and intrepidity at the risk of life above and beyond the call of duty.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Tier One: 15 Modern Skirmish Scenarios for SOF Warrior
description:
Tier One contains 15 modern day skirmish scenarios designed for SOF Warrior.

Although these scenarios are largely fictional, they are taken from real world events.

It is recommended that a game master take the part of the insurgents, while the players assume the role of the SOF operatives.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Final Combat: Trench Raiders – Supplemental Rules for World War One
description:
Trench Raiders is not a complete set of rules (you must have Final Combat for it to be useful), but rather a supplement that enables you to experience the horror of trench warfare in Western Europe from 1916–18.

It introduces new rules and includes one historical scenario based on a British trench raid in 1916.

So, whether you play as a Doughboy, Poilu, Tommy or Storm-trooper, the strength of Final Combat is the manner in which it simulates mêlée on a gaming table; thus providing the perfect venue for a close quarter battle trench raid.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Wopono
description:
The Story: The Wopono alien family lands on earth !
Their arrival brings about an upheaval in the region. Madness seizes the inhabitants even changing their earthly appearance. These mutations are the direct consequence of the energy, coming from the cubes, which hovers above cereal crops. Join this crazy adventure at home.

The Goal: Win a maximum of zap in 3 rounds or more.
Move your character in the neighborhood to collect 5 cards.
With them, make a story to win medals of the most thoughtful story, funny or crazy!
By a voting game, win the round by accumulating the most medals! The winner of the game is the one that gets the highest score.
The game time is flexible, depending on the number of challenges. But not only that ! You will be able to modulate your all game too.

—description from the publisher

name: Hot Tub High Dive
description:
In Hot Tub High Dive by Hasbro Games, players spin the spinner, then press the big red button the number of times shown to send the diver up or down the ladder. Every press of the button increases the amount of foam in the tub. Once the diver reaches the top of the ladder, he will fall into the tub, launching a ball of suds at the unlucky player. The only player not to cause the diver to fall and the foam to fly wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Rampant Swords: Fantasy Skirmish Combat
description:
Rampant Swords is a scale and model agnostic fantasy model vs. model skirmish game.
It is designed to be played in about an hour with fully customizable forces from your favorite Fantasy universe.
The rules can accommodate infantry, cavalry, and monsters. Players choose generic units and customize them using a Fantasy traits list.
Most weapons and equipment is abstracted into simple to use Fantasy Traits for the units.

The mechanics are straight forward, streamlined, and easy to learn.
Rampant Swords uses a d6 dice pool vs. a target number to resolve most actions and mechanics.
Failure to activate moves play between players.
The game moves quickly and rapidly.
If you are familiar with Rampant Sun, Lion Rampant, or Rampant Hordes you will have a core understanding of how these rules function.

Victory in Rampant Swords focuses on completing mission objectives. These are randomly generated prior to the game and come complete with twists and turns to make every gaming experience unique. In addition, the rules have campaign rules for linking game results together into a larger campaign.

Rampant Swords is ideal for experienced gamers and new players getting their feet wet. Speed and ease of play were the priorities in the design process without sacrificing decision making.
In Rampant Swords models do not always perform exactly as intended so the "Friction of War" will force players to react accordingly.

Enjoy your Fantasy adventures with Rampant Swords!

—description from the publisher

name: L'Assassino: Feud & Vendetta in the Italian Renaissance
description:
In the renaissance families like the Medici stood up to seize power.
People like Machiavelli wrote books about Utilitarianism and real-politik.
Condottieri roamed the Italian landscape searching for fame and fortune.
It was a time full of feud and vendettas.
Even Shakespeare wrote a piece about love and hate between two families in Verona, the Capulets and the Montagues (better known as Romeo and Juliet). What better time and place to set up a skirmish game?

L'Assassino contains the rules for a miniature tabletop skirmish game for 28mm scale miniatures set during renaissance.
It focuses on urban strive.

This game can be played with one player. But you may want to add a little competition when played with more than one player.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Spinglas / Meine Party
description:
Didactic game produced by an university, to help understand the nature of spin glasses or other complex optimization problems, like organizing a party.
The main target is to choose the favorite orientations of the spins/party guest and their interactions such that each player maximizes the number of spins/guests exhibiting the orientation of the player, respectively.

Via some additional action cards you can increase the number of strategic operations.

name: Cardslingers
description:
Cardslingers is a trick taking game of bluffing and deduction for 2-4 players. Each round players secretly choose which Wild West character to play and then reveal them simultaneously. The winner of the round will collect a poker chip. Once all 13 chips have been collected, the player with the highest value in chips wins the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Trick-taking, Variable Set-up

name: Mochi Mochi Peach Cat Card Game
description:
The Mochi Mochi Peach Cat Card Game is family boardgame. In the game, the players will playing cards at the same time, the winner is who can grab more game cards.

The rules of the game are very simple and suitable for playing with children.

One set game include 72 cards and 1 rule sheet.

—description from the designer

name: Boom! Roasted
description:
A party game where you roast your friends.

BOOM! Roasted begins with each player drawing 7 cards from the top of the deck in the “Roasts” pile. The youngest player in the group assumes the role of the Honoree and gets the first verbal beating—take your medicine and shut up about it!

The remaining players serve as the Roasters for the round, while the Honoree draws a “Setups” card and reads the set-up aloud beginning with their own name, and ending with “Roast Me.” Each Roaster then chooses the “Roasts” card that best corresponds with the setup and hands it face-down to the Honoree, who then shuffles the responses.

After shuffling, the Honoree inserts their first name while re-reading aloud the “Setups” card in conjunction with each of the “Roasts” cards, and chooses the funniest or most clever combination. The Roaster responsible for the best burn must point their finger at the Honoree and say, “Boom! Roasted” and is awarded the Setups card, which counts as one point.

Twofers: On “Setups” card scenarios requiring two answers, place the “Roasts” card for your first answer on the bottom with the second answer on top so that it may be read by the Honoree in the order you intended.

Roasters will replace any card(s) used during the previous round; the Honoree from the previous round is now free to roast the shit out of the next person.

The person to the Honoree’s left is the next in-line to be trashed by their friends. The Roaster with the most “Setups” cards/points at the end of the game wins the coveted title of Roastmaster or Roastmistress.

This game is intended for entertainment purposes only. BOOM! Roasted is not responsible for any depression, lack of self-worth, wallowing pity, OR any therapist expenses incurred as a result of playing this game.

If you don’t know what a word in our instructions or deck of cards means, you must be the type of person who doesn’t know how to Google things.

Note: If you’re already an asshole before playing this game, our material is not intended to serve as a form of realistic hazing or degradation. In other words, don’t be a bullying dickhead to people in real life.

—description from the designer

name: Das Adam Riese Spiel
description:
Arithmetic game for 1, 2 or any number of people

In addition to the basic form - BINGOLETTE - the game contains six other rules. In the basic form, the aim is to achieve a number between 1 and 36 with the three dice rolled using any arithmetic operation (adding, subtracting, multiplying, dividing, exponentiating or rooting). This is then covered on the game board and the player receives the points according to the number on the edge. When all game board spaces are covered, the player with the highest total points wins. The six other rules of the game are: 1. Raffkes Los, 2. Holzauktion, 3. Stall fürs Pferd, 4. Graben und Brücke, 5. Gewinn-Mühle, 6. Der Rechenmeister.

—user summary
publishers: M. Hornauer Verlag, Verlag Bert Schlender

name: Go For The Gold
description:
This game is trick-taking game.
The game consists of a 49 playing card deck. The game features top runners and swimmers between 1908 and 1980. The runners and swimmers are ranked on the cards 1 through 48.
Players bid the number of tricks they feel they can take. They try to take tricks they bid.

—user summary
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: DICE-Tractions: Dice Wars
description:
Players customize armies by selecting dice from their personal collections. Each die costs points equal to the number of sides it has, and both players spend an equal number of points. In a series of battles, players roll all their surviving dice, line them up from highest to lowest, and eliminate dice facing a higher rolled value. Dice with no opponent automatically survive the round. Repeat until one side is eliminated.

Part of the DICE-tractions series of games.

name: Ready, Set, WOOF!
description:
The Puppies at the Park have been playing all day long and now they need a snack!

Shake the Dog Bowl Randomizer to find out which playful pup gets a bone. Then, search the board for the matching dog. Find the Pup with the matching colors first and give it a bone. Find and feed five dogs, and you win in this four-legged find-it game? Sharpens visual discrimination-a key pre-reading skill-and boosts concentration and focus!

When he's not busy inventing board games (Ready, Set, WOOF! is his 105th!), Ivan can be found playing a different kind of game-tug of war with his daughter's Chinese Sharpei, Lola! From Wolfie and Punk to Basco and Lola, there have always been dogs in Ivan's family. Wolfie, Ivan's first dog, is even a key player in his published autobiography, The Puzzlement.

—description from the publisher

name: Smokies-Opoly
description:
How do you make a game about the great Smoky Mountains? While it's impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Smokies we could into this box. It's full of big adventures, family attractions, breathtaking views and of course...a black bear or two - a little something for those who love the mountains! Looking for a fun way to experience the Land of Blue Mist?

—description from the publisher
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Sex, Drugs or Rock-N-Roll
description:
Sex, Drugs or Rock-N-Roll is an outrageous adult party card game where you can get down and dirty with your friends!

How it works:
Draw a card - this card determines the letter that's now in play for the round.
Say your word - If the letter B is drawn, every answer needs to start with the letter B that is related to Sex, Drugs or Music (Rock-n-Roll only for advanced play)...Boobs, Bong or Banjo
Keep going - players say words until 1 remains, if a player can't answer they are out for that round.
Score - The winner of the round earns the letter card and the next player draws.
Win - The player with the most cards at the end of the game is the champion of SDR!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia

name: Amaze-A-Tron
description:
Amaze-A-Tron is an electronic board game with eight variations that revolve around a hidden computer-generated maze. The board consists of a five-by-five grid of squares numbered 1 to 25.

At the beginning of the "Opposite Start" game variation, the computer selects a starting square (identified by number) for each player. The players then race to see who can get through the maze first and reach the opponent's starting square, through trial and error. The players alternate taking turns moving through the maze. A player can move through any number of squares until the player runs into a wall, at which point the other player gets to take a turn.

There are two solitaire maze games and six two-player games. In the "Blind Alley" variations, the maze includes dead-ends that force a player to backtrack to get back on the correct path. In the "Back to Start" variations, when a player runs into a wall the player's pawn is returned to the starting square, adding a memory element to the game. In the standard "Maze" game, both players start on the same square and are racing to reach the same destination square.

The plastic game board features a two-digit LED readout, red and green LED's (which correspond to the color of the opposing playing pieces), and a storage compartment for the four playing pieces (plastic pawns and start/finish space markers). A 9-volt battery or AC adapter is required.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Memory, Race, Variable Set-up

name: Close Quarters: Skirmish
description:
SpecOps missions. Prisoner rescues. Data retrieval. Ambush the enemy, sabotage his equipment and installations. Completing your mission is critical; any casualties are acceptable.

Close Quarters: Skirmish, based on our boardgame of the same name, is a fast-paced SciFi miniatures game of small-scale combat operations, suitable for 15mm to 28mm figure scales.
Each model represents an individual trooper, vehicle, or crewed weapon;
game sizes can range from 12 to 50-60 models (a reinforced platoon of infantry, or a cross attached armored or airborne company), and last from 45 minutes up to a couple of hours.

During each game turn, players activate a variable number of models in one of four segments (couplets) in an effort to complete each mission’s objectives – or to prevent their opponent from completing his.
The game includes:

Easy to play game mechanics, with most functions resolved by the roll of a single die.
Basic rules for infantry, support weapons, vehicles, crewed weapons, and indirect fire (including off-board artillery)
22 optional rules for players wanting a more detailed or varied game
Dozens of weapons, troop attributes, and vehicle systems to choose from Field officers, NCOs, snipers, hackers, sappers, MBTs, tank destroyers, IFVs, VTOLs, antitank guns, power armor troopers, and a number of possibilities for some very non-human opponents
11 standard scenarios that scale in both table size and number of game turns depending on the forces chosen for use by each player
A campaign game system that allows your men to improve over the course of the conflict
Complete rules for creating and fielding forces of your own design
Four pre-generated forces, representing human and alien factions in the late 25th century, along with TO&E and unit stats for each
Two playable sample campaign game forces
Blank, edit-enabled troop/vehicle and campaign game roster PDF forms
All necessary game markers, templates, and charts


Whether your mission takes place in an industrial complex, in the open field, or within the confines of a starship’s corridors, Close Quarters: Skirmish places the success or failure of each mission into the most capable hands: yours.

—description from the publisher

name: Close Quarters: Infestation
description:
Close Quarters: Infestation allows players to re-create the overrun of the Earth Protectorate research outpost Contego by a previously unknown alien race, the Llysa'ath.

This Close Quarters module includes:

New terrain rules, including outdoor terrain such as trees, depressions, bushes, and low walls;
Rules for operating the Llysa'ath, a reptilian peoples with four distinct classes of troopers;
A section on Night Fighting, plus new equipment specifically for use in dark environments;
5 new scenarios depicting the action in and around Contego Base, some of which occur across multi-level scenario maps;
15 pages of new room and corridor tiles rendered at 300dpi, including bonus tiles not used in the enclosed scenarios, and new counters and markers for the Llysa'ath;
Guidelines for converting Close Quarters into a 15mm- or 28mm-based tabletop miniatures game, including tabletop measuring templates and a point-based troop builder to help balance your miniatures-based scenarios.


The CARDS print product option contains all of the game counters, charts, markers, room and corridor tiles pre-printed on 8.5" x 11" heavy stock sheets, ready to be mounted on backer board (or used as they are), to play all of the scenarios from this Close Quarters module.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Absolute Dice: Sport
description:
This is a themed version of Absolute Dice. Players take turns rolling dice. Just like in Absolute Dice, one die determines the category for scoring and another determines how many attempts are given. Then, six other dice are rolled to score. The only difference to Absolute Dice is that one of scoring dice has a silver icon and a gold icon, which double and triple the score, respectively.

The first player to reach 101 points wins the game.

—user summary

name: Absolute Dice: Kids
description:
Very simple dice rolling and matching game. After a special die is rolled to determine the target category, and another die determines the amount of rolls, the remaining dice (6) are rolled for points. The dice features simple pictures to make it easy to spot matches. The eight dice come in a small velvet pouch which has the instructions attached as the tag.

—description from the publisher

This is a slightly simplified version of Absolute Dice.

name: Roll 'n' One
description:
Roll 'n' One Golf is an exciting Golf-Dice Game favored by golfers worldwide.

Roll 'n' One Golf is a genuine game of golf played by rolling five (5) different dice. All the dice are rolled at the same time. Players can compete in Medal Play (player with fewest number of strokes at end of a round) or Match Play (player who wins most holes). Also Team versus Team, with one (1) point scored for Low Ball and (1) point for the team with the lowest total. A number of other game variations are possible. There is no limit to the number of players.

The dice are read as follows: Red - White - Blue - Black - Green. Count the number of strokes indicated on the dice including penalties and extra shots. Reading all the dice may not be necessary! When the dice are read in order and either red, white, or blue indicates "on the green", no matter which die it is, go to the green putting dice, adding the indicated number of putts to your score. For example, if the first (red) or second (white) read "on the green", putting strokes are added even if the blue or black dice read, "holed out".

Lowest possible score per hole is one (1) - highest score is nine (9). A Hole in One occurs when a solid dot appears on all dice rolled.

—description from the rulebook

name: Johnny Reb 3: Variant for 15mm AWI Wargaming
description:
A FREE variant (with John Hill's written permission) of the Johnny Reb III rules set for use with American War of Independence (AWI) 15mm figures.

Requires ownership of the JR3 rules.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Royal Navy: Instructions for Tactical and Strategical Exercises 1921
description:
The Royal Navy's Instructions for Tactical and Strategical Exercises, 1921

Essentially, a set of Wargaming rules for Officer Training using wooden ships (or Cardboard equivalents).

Also includes the "Details of ships of the principal Naval Powers" Appendix.

In simple terms, it is a set of rules for running naval wargames, used to examine strategic or tactical problems. However, it contains useful information on the capabilities of RN ships as well as then-current naval thinking.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: BibleQuote
description:
BibleQuote is a game based on a player's knowledge of the Holy Scriptures.
By answering challenges about Bible stories and teachings, players can be victorious!
Categories include:

About whom?
Who to whom?
Complete the quote
Identify the reference


—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: El Juego de la Vuelta Ciclista
description:
Each player manages a team of 4 cyclists ( best on the flat, ... uphill rider, ... downhill rider, team marshal ). The race course is formed of different types of tracks. Game turns are divided in phases 8 Escape, Cancel Escape, Accelerate, Cancel accelerate). Each action results in expenditure of energy points depending on the cyclist's speciality and the type of track.

—user summary

name: 王様の新しい街 さいころニュータウン (Saicolo New Town)
description:
You are a house builder in this magic country, where houses are all built by magic. There are 4 types of house-building magic, namely the "White design magic" for designing houses that fit in the land, "Green movement magic" for carrying housebuilding tools and materials to the destinations, "Red formation magic" for forming resources and re-doing other types of magic, and "Black building magic" for converting and assembling materials. The player who can most effectively use these 4 types of magic will receive the honor to be called the house-building master.

The game takes place over four rounds, each of which has three phases:
1) Preparation - determine the turn order and supply the Materials to the players
2) Dice Distribution - roll all the dice, then draft the dice one at a time in turn order until all dice are taken.
3) Builders' Actions - in turn order, players use their dice one at a time to take actions.

At the end of the game, the player with the most honor points wins.

The game also contains rules for an advanced game or an easy game if you prefer to shift the difficulty.
publishers: iop games (イオピーゲームズ)

name: PQltistes
description:
It's lockdown time. The PQltistes rush to the supermarket to burgle the last packs of toilet paper and make offerings to the One-who-sleeps-on-the-Throne. You're one of these cultists and your goal is to make the biggest offering and be saved from the lockdown.

PQltistes contains 55 cards: cards numbered 2-10, with two 2s, three 3s, etc. and 1 police card. Shuffle these cards, then spread them out face down on the table. On your turn, choose a card and turn it face up. You can stop here, collect all the cards you've revealed, and end your turn, or you continue turning cards face up. If you reveal the police card or a card with a number that's already face up, you must gather all face-up cards and three face-down cards from the table, shuffle them, then place them wherever you want on the table. Your turn then ends.

Some cards when revealed give you the ability to peek at a face-down card or swap a card in your collection with a card in someone else's collection.

When five or fewer cards are face down on the table at the end of someone's turn, the game ends. Each card is worth 0-2 rolls of toilet paper as depicted on those cards. Additionally, you score points equal to the number of which you have the most tiles, e.g. if you have four 8s and three or fewer of each other number, you score a bonus of 8 points. In case of a tie for most tiles, you score the lower value.

Whoever has the most rolls wins!

name: Brick Crime (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
Entirely made as an amateur, Brick crime is a scenario for t.i.m.e stories, directed between 2019 and 2020. It brings the players into a parallel dimension, in 1980 in the United States.
