Players will be led to investigate an assassination that could tip the world into chaos.

Some information:

The game is in French (English translation in reflexion)
It contains 212 cards
Rather, it is a scenario based on reflection, deduction and analysis.
The game is relatively difficult, and requires several runs to unravel the different plots.


Feel free to contact the author if you have any questions, if you are stuck in the game, or to give feedback on your game experience.

—description from the designer (translated)

Intégralement réalisé en amateur, Brick crime est un scénario pour t.i.m.e stories, réalisé entre 2019 et 2020. Il amène les joueurs dans une dimension parallèle, en 1980 aux états unis.

Les joueurs vont être amenés à enquêter sur un assassinat qui pourrait faire basculer le monde dans le chaos.

Quelques informations :

Le jeu est en français (traduction en anglais en réflexion)
Il comporte 212 cartes
Il s'agit plutôt d'un scénario basé sur la réflexion, la déduction et l'analyse.
Le jeu est relativement difficile, et nécessite plusieurs run pour démêler les différentes intrigues


N'hésitez pas à contacter l'auteur pour toute question, si vous êtes bloqués dans le jeu, ou pour faire vos retours sur votre expérience de jeu.

—description from the designer (translated)
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Murder/Mystery, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Storytelling

name: Годо
description:
Board game "Годо" (Godo) - best game for any party! This game develops imagination and creativity. It can be played both in teams or individually.

Goal of the game: score the most points by explaining words in 2 minute, using different methods (speech, drawing, pantomime or using one word). For each method of explanation a different number of points is given.
categories: Party Game, Racing, Trivia, Word Game

name: Red Fleet at Dawn: Cold War Combat in the North Atlantic
description:
These are my 1980's fast play modern naval combat rules. Whilst the mechanisms are very different to my other rules sets the idea of making them as fast and fun as possible remain the same, even though missile armed warships are by their nature immensely complicated

I am making this set of rules FREE. 2 reasons for this.


1st I am using them as an introduction to my other rules sets which are all a lot of fun to play and very cheap to buy! So download for nothing and if they peak your interest check out my other rules sets put "Dawn Gaming" in the search bar and see what you like, many of them have a free sampler and I cover a number of interesting periods in history.


I am not going to go into great detail about these rules.... they are free! Just download the whole set.


And the 2nd reason is that they are not exhaustive, I have put stats in for a number of Soviet and US ships subs and aircraft but this is certainly not an exhaustive set of data.


If people like the game I may do additional data sets (for free) but you can probably knock your own up anyway.

—description from the designer / publisher
categories: Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Antietam Army Lists: A Wargamer's Guide to the Opposing Forces Engaged on America's Bloodiest Day
description:
Order of Battle for the Battle of Antietam / Sharpsburg during the American Civil War.

Includes:

regimental strength estimates,
regimental and battery armament,
suggested morale ratings,
a sample scenario for Johnny Reb III,
bibliography, and
human interest stories from the battle participants.


—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Digital Mecha Warriors
description:
Digital Mecha Warriors is a game of giant robot tabletop combat. It is a tactical miniatures game where one player takes the role of the evil Pax Imperialis and the other players are Federation Mecha pilots. The game has a multiple mission campaign and uses an 8-bit video game art style.

—user summary

name: Schmitz 21
description:
A Blackjack inspired card game with 55 cards:
10 times the numbers 1, 2, 3, 5 and 6 [yes, there is no 4!] and 5 times the number 10.

Each player starts with four cards. A talon is formed from the rest of the cards. It is played in turn. The player plays one card, calls the total value of all played cards and draws one card. If the sum of the played cards is exactly 21, that player wins all played cards to a face-down pile. A player cannot play a card if the total value would exceed 21. If a player cannot play a card, the previous player wins the played cards.

The game ends when the talon is empty and all hand cards have been played. The player with the most collected cards wins the game.

name: Loża szyderców: Candy
description: Loża Szyderców Candy is another installment of the iconic party game. Female-male relationships reflected in a distorting mirror, this time in a pink, but still mocking glow.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: One Page Cthulhu: Volume 1 – Miskatonic Tunnels
description:
1922 Arkham, Massachusetts, A Letter from Herbert West, Professor at Miskatonic University

Dear Friend,
It has always been rumored that there are tunnels running under the campus of Miskatonic University. Long have students and faculty alike speculated about the strange possibility that these tunnels exist--and yet no one has ever proven their existence. Many have speculated that the tunnels were originally built for use by the faculty more easily and quickly move about campus, but I hardly believe that to be true. Others think it is a remnant from the Civil War--something the south had dug. Again, I disagree. Further, students have whispered about a far more sinister origin for the tunnels.
This is the theory I agree with. My research and investigation into the case brings me to the conclusion that the tunnels were made like a labyrinth--something once used by a cult to summon and harness unimaginable horrors from another world. Now, it acts as a prison for those secrets. That is why I need you. I have found an old and incomplete blueprint which reveals the entrance to the tunnels.
That’s where you come in. I want you to go down and investigate, find clues to what happened there, and map out the tunnels for me.

Welcome to One Page Cthulhu. A simple and easy 1920s horror role-playing-game you can play with a single sheet of paper. Perfect for a plane ride, hotel room, or anywhere else. You can even compete with your friends to see who can get the most clues and solve the mystery of Miskatonic University.
Based on the same system as One Page Dungeon, One Page Cthulhu takes your solo roleplaying to the streets and locations of Arkham. This version of the system introduces sanity rules, investigation, and Lore Points. Additionally, it offers a new and frightening way to level up your character.

— description from the publisher.
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Dice, Exploration, Horror, Maze, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Role Playing

name: Puppy Park: 3-4 Players Expansion
description:
Let’s walk the dogs in the park. Hopefully they’ll make some new friends!

In Puppy Park, players take turns placing dogs next to each other. If you place them so the breeds match they will become friends and you can bring more dogs to the park. The first player with no more dogs at home wins the game (and gets the bone!).

This set expands Puppy Park by adding the following: 8 additional tiles (with a new breed: shiba inu), 2 more dog houses, 4 tree-poop tiles.

The tree-poop tiles are optional and prevent/force players from/to place dogs next to them.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game

name: The War of 1812: A Campaign Guide for Sharp Practice
description:
This Guide to the War of 1812 for Sharp Practice is includes a guide to the history of the war, a comprehensive over-view of the forces involved from Britain, Canada, the United States and the First Nation Indian forces.

Their organisation structures and a wide range of Army Lists and full Force Rosters cover the vast majority of troop types for this interesting and varied conflict.

In addition, the author, Mike Hobbs, has followed the exploits of the 41st Regiment of Foot and produced seven scenarios to cover the period 1812 to 1814.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Indian Wars, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Phalanx of Fire
description:
Phalanx of Fire covers the North Vietnamese offensive in Quang Tri province during the spring of 1972. This was a large armored assault with 21 NVA armor companies and several supporting divisions.

The game has 18 turns covering March 30th to April 30th; the first four turns are one day each and the remainder are two days. The map is 32 by 28 hexes.

Units are company-level but the game is primarily operational. There are special armor rules. Weather comes in four levels. There are extensive air rules.

name: Tiwanacu
description:
The players are architects who, over nine rounds, will compete to build the greatest temple that the god Inti has requested. Each player will be drafting tiles, in order to score the most points at the end of the game.

Will you build the legendary temple Tiwanacu and be rewarded by the gods?

The game is played in 9 rounds. Every round, each player will receive tiles that he must place in his temple, to try to score the most points. At the end of the 9th round, players will add up all their points and the player with the most points is the winner.

Each game two random God cards will be picked that will change some of the basic rules or add ways to score points at the end of the game.


Round structure
1. Place tiles in each turn order position as indicated in the current round marker. The tiles that are where the row selector is, will be the active tiles and are available to purchase this round. The other tiles will be available next round.
2. Starting with the player in first place and following player order, each player takes his turn.
3. All the tiles available in the active row that were not picked, are returned to the box.
4. Move the row selector to the next group of tiles (if it was on top, move it to the bottom. And vice versa)
5. Move the round marker to the next space.
After 9 rounds, the game ends.Player turns
On their turn, each player in player order will the following:
1. The player moves his piece from their current order position to an empty position in the player order track.
2. He pays (or receives) the amount indicated on the position. If he doesn’t have enough money to pay, the player will get a loan token and 10 coins.
3. Takes the 3 tiles from that position and place them next to their temple board.
4. The player must put the 3 tiles he has next to his player board. The rules for placement are as follows:
a. He can place in any position in his grid.
b. He can choose the order of placing the tiles, but the 3 tiles must be placed this turn.
c. If he wishes, he can pay 1 coin to place it on top of a previously placed tile.
d. The grid can have empty spaces.
e. After placing a tile, it cannot be moved for the rest of game.
Note that some God cards and rounds may change the number of tiles you need to place and change some of the tile placement rules. God cards rules always take precedence over the rules above.
5. After he has placed all his tiles, the next player in player order does the same.
End of game
After the last player has finished his turn in the 9th round, the game will end. The players will add up their scores and the player with the most points is the winner.

Scoring
At the end of the game, players will score points depending on the layout of their board and the god objectives. Each type of tile score in the following way.
Color Tiles (Red, Blue. Yellow and Green)
Red tiles scoring in two ways:

1 point per color tile, regardless of figure. If a player has more than one colored area, they only score for their biggest one.
Points according to the number of figures and multipliers. If there are Multiplier tiles next to a colored tile (that have the 2x in the same coloredbackground) they will multiply the number of figures on the tile by 2 for each multiplier tile surrounding it.


Monolith Tiles

Monolith tiles score depending on how many different ones you have in a set. There are 6 different monoliths designs, an a set of 1/2/3/4/5/6 will score 1/3/7/12/18/25 respectively.
If a player has more than 1 set of monoliths, each one of them will be scored separately. For example, if a player has 2 sets of different monoliths, one with 3 tiles and the other with 2, he will get 10 points (7 for the first one and 3 for the second one).


Extra scoring
After all types of tiles have been scored, each player will receive additional points for the following criteria:

1 point per Gold coin still in their possession.
1 point per tile in their biggest zone (can coloured tile or a monolith tile).
10 points if they have at least one tile of each of the five colours (red, yellow, green, blue) and a Monolith. If a player is missing of the types, he doesn’t receive any points.
Points awarded by completing God cards, if applicable)


Penalties
Each player will receive negative points for the following criteria

-15 points per Loan token.


Final score
Each player will add up their points and the one with most points at the end of the game, will be the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Piecepack Matchsticks
description:
The piecepack matchsticks are a set of pieces designed to open up new gaming possibilities for the piecepack game system. Originally inspired by the little colored sticks used for route-building in games like Settlers of Catan, the piecepack matchsticks provide a wide variety of options beyond (but including) network and route building.

The matchsticks come in 4 suits and 6 lengths that correspond to the suits and values of the piecepack. Each stick's length represents a relationship between the grid squares on the back of a piecepack tile- from "null" cubes that represent a single point in space to "5" sticks that represent the full diagonal length of a tile.

The matchsticks can be used for many different mechanics including:
-Connections and pathways
-Walls and barriers for area enclosure and maze building
-Spatial mechanics that go “outside the box” of the square grids that define many piecepack games
-Resource tokens that match up with piecepack suits and values
-Additional movement tokens for games that require more pieces of one type than a single piecepack can provide
-And as many other uses as a designer can imagine.

Like the piecepack, the piecepack matchsticks are a public domain game system, which means that anyone is free to make and even sell a set without paying royalties.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Game System, Print & Play

name: Drogi do Niepodległości
description:
The plot of the strategic board game Drogi do Niepodległości ("Roads to Independence") includes the most important historical events from 1795-1918 and shows the heroes of these events.

The main goal of the game is the implementation of one of the five political missions of an independent country. Players strive for their actions to shape the country as close as possible to the objectives of the mission. During the game, they play the part of family members living under the partitions. There are different routes for players. In several stages, they themselves decide what events they take part in, look for allies, use the help of heroes. The game is fought in three partitions and in exile. The family can get involved in political, military and socioeconomic activities.

name: Totolospi
description:
Totolospi is a traditional race game in the public domain. The game has been played by the Hopi Indians and others in Southwestern North America for generations. (It has been documented in many sources of game research.)

The game is played on a straight track of 11 spaces, each player having but one pawn. By tossing casting sticks or coins, a player's pawn must be moved to the opposite end of the track and back home to win. Hindering this effort is the center space, which can only be occupied by one pawn at a time. There is also a push-your-luck aspect to the game, offering players some strategic choices.

NewVenture Games includes this game in a series of ancient games called "Peg Pastimes." These games are reproduced with wooden boards and pegs, and include a brief history of each game.

name: The Game of Billionaire
description:
Players try to have the most money at the end of the game. The board has two tracks'. One is a circle track around a spinner which is used to determine how many spaces the player can move. This circular track is used to collect funds. Once a player has accumulated $300,000, the player can move to a track along all 4 sides of the board.

This outer track has spaces corresponding to various cities. Players bid in auctions to own a city and be able to build a building in it. Players can also add stories to an existing building. If a player lands on a city space that is owned by another player, the owner must be paid.

There are also 3 stock market spaces on the outer track. Landing on these spaces enables a player to buy a stock certificates which have a monetary value at the end of the game.

—user summary

name: Pizza Wars
description:
A game of conquest played on a pizza where the toppings represent combatants and the pieces represent territories to be conquered.

—user summary

A game of conquest and supremacy, for gamers and Pizza lovers alike.

Includes all rules necessary for conducting your very own PIZZA WAR. Requires a Pizza, toppings, toothpicks and one or more dice to play.

No longer must you break from your game to enjoy Americas' (sic) favorite food!

The manufacturers, distributors and retailers of PIZZA WARS are not responsible for adverse effects due to over-zealous conquest. Conquer at your own risk!

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Tempus Quest: Episode 11 – Frying Pan / Fire
description:
By the skin of their teeth, the Tempus leaves the Dynasty Armada behind them. The only obstacle in their way now is... an even larger armada. Now trapped between an overwhelming number of foes, the rag tag Liberation Fleet has no choice but to fight their way to the Liberation's rendezvous point.

Games in the Tempus series work similarly to roll and write games where players roll dice and use the results to fill in a sheet. In the Tempus System, instead of using dice, players will use the date and time to randomize setup and available actions.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fight the Virus
description:
Fight the Virus is a roll and write game, where player are fighting a global pandemic. All over the world scientists are working hard to find a cure and a vaccine for this unknown virus. At the same time governments try to contain the pandemic, using tests and various measures. Who will be the first to succeed in this race against this common threat?

This roll and write is designed to be playable with nothing but printed sheets, pens or pencils and two d6 (preferably with pips not numbers). The number of players is in theory not limited, but since the active player gets a small bonus, with more players, the active player's dice roll should be shared with others.

Gameplay:

The active player rolls 2 dice and uses both to fill the four areas on the player sheet. The other players may use one of the die results. The four areas are Virus analysis, Research, Tests and Flattening the curve. In order to analyse the virus, players have to fill the area with polyominos based on the die result. The other areas are filled with numbers according to rules, that are slightly different from area to area. For each area there's a specific goal that must be achieved in order to win the game.

name: There's a Narwhal in my Noodles
description:
Lay the bowl on a flat surface. Arrange the noodles in a criss cross pattern resting them on the edge of the bowl. Place the narwhal on top of the noodles and you are ready to start.

Take it in turns to remove a noodle using the chopsticks. If the narwhal drops into the bowl, the player involved is out. The narwhal is repositioned and play carriers on. The winner is the player left who's not dropped the narwhal.

Contents: 28 noodles, 2 chopsticks, 1 narwhal, 1 noodle bowl, and instructions.

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Disciples of Tzeentch
description:
Tzeentch’s minions revel in manipulation – after all, it is not for nothing that their patron is known as the Architect of Fate. Within great cities lurk hidden Kairic Acolytes, while vicious Tzaangor flocks stalk the warped wilds. The daemons of Tzeentch are especially strange, often casting forth gouts of aetheric fire. Tzeentch is the greatest patron of sorcery among the Chaos Gods, and so it is little surprise that many of his followers are mighty wizards, their sorcerous power rewriting the very laws of reality.

Bring the malefic madness of the Tzeentch’s daemonic legions to Warcry with this card pack! This set lets you use a variety of daemons in your skirmish battles. Blow your enemies apart with magical warpfire or descend upon them in a chittering, squirming horde. The Changer of Ways, after all, is all about choice…

This set contains:
- A faction ability card, allowing you to harness tactics, tricks and abilities unique to this warband, including the runemarks you need to use them. The reverse allows you to identify the fighters in your warband. The set contains a faction abilities card in each of the following languages: English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian.
- Fighter cards for 8 types of fighter, including Blue Horrors, Brimstone Horrors, Pink Horrors, Flamers of Tzeentch and Screamers of Tzeentch
- 2x divider cards, used to keep track of any tokens that apply to fighters in games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Tzeentch Arcanites
description:
Tzeentch’s minions revel in manipulation – after all, it is not for nothing that their patron is known as the Architect of Fate. Within great cities lurk hidden Kairic Acolytes, while vicious Tzaangor flocks stalk the warped wilds. The daemons of Tzeentch are especially strange, often casting forth gouts of aetheric fire. Tzeentch is the greatest patron of sorcery among the Chaos Gods, and so it is little surprise that many of his followers are mighty wizards, their sorcerous power rewriting the very laws of reality.

Master the magical mayhem of the Tzeentch Arcanites with this card pack! This set allows you to use Tzeentch’s bestial and mortal followers in your games of Warcry – a varied warband equally at home incinerating foes with warpfire and getting stuck in. After all, dead to alive is change enough for Tzeentch!

This set contains:
- A faction ability card, allowing you to harness tactics, tricks and abilities unique to this warband, including the runemarks you need to use them. The reverse allows you to identify the fighters in your warband. The set contains a faction abilities card in each of the following languages: English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian.
- Fighter cards for 16 types of fighter, including Tzaangors, Kairic Acolytes, and Tzaangor Enlightened.
- 2x divider cards, used to keep track of any tokens that apply to fighters in games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Beasts of Chaos
description:
The Beasts of Chaos have long dwelt in the wild places of the Mortal Realms. Even during the Age of Myth, these creatures menaced the civilised lands, and their alliance with the primal essence of anarchy has only made them more deadly. Their marauding Greatfrays contain all manner of bestial warriors; the cunning gor-kin of the Brayherds are master ambushers, while the brutes of the Warherds are cursed with an insatiable bloodgreed. Warring alongside them are the Dragon Ogors, ancient inhabitants of Azyr banished by the God-King and empowered by the touch of lightning.

Unless the savage wrath of the Beasts of Chaos in Warcry with this card pack! This set allows you to find the rules for a host of brutal Beasts of Chaos fighters, from cunning Ungor to towering Dragon Ogors. If you're looking for a warband that’s fast, hits hard in close combat and has a vast range of fighters to choose from, this is the one for you.

This set contains:
- A faction ability card, allowing you to harness tactics, tricks and abilities unique to this warband, including the runemarks you need to use them. The reverse allows you to identify the fighters in your warband. The set contains a faction abilities card in each of the following languages: English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian.
- Fighter cards that give you the rules and points for 17 different fighter types, including Gor, Bestigor, Bullgor, Dragon Ogors and Ungor with a variety of weapons
- 2x divider cards, used to keep track of any tokens that apply to fighters in games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Hedonites of Slaanesh
description:
Lead the dreaded hosts of Slaanesh – the Chaos God of excess and pleasure – in their conquest to bend the Bloodwind Spoil to their twisted will.

Revel in bringing pain and suffering to warbands all across the Eightpoints. Combined with the Core Rules and your miniatures, this set brings the Hedonites of Slaanesh to your skirmish games. An abilities card lets you use deadly in-game tactics and powers, while a set of nine fighter cards provide profiles for two types of Daemonettes, two types of Seekers, two types of Fiends and three types of Hellstriders.

This set contains an abilities card in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese and Russian, as well as two divider cards to keep track of tokens that apply to fighters in game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Sylvaneth
description:
The children of Alarielle have arrived to seek revenge for the rampant despoiling of the Mortal Realms. They're not driven by glory or conquest, but rather bitter hatred for those who would destroy their natural homes.

Unleash nature’s fury with this card pack! Combined with the Core Rules and your miniatures, this set allows you to summon the spirit of the forests to fight in skirmish battles. An abilities card lets you use deadly in-game tactics and powers, while a set of 12 fighter cards provide profiles for two types of Dryads, two types of Spite-Revenants, two types of Tree-Revenants and six types of Kurnoth Hunters.

This set contains an abilities card in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian, as well as two divider cards to keep track of tokens that apply to fighters in game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Age of Ulysses
description:
Beyond the horizon to the West. Find the golden fruit. A port of peace and happiness.

This is not the dawn of the mythical age.

Our stage is the 13th century. Europe’s marine navigation technology was developing. The East Indian route was still outside reach, nevermind the route through the Gibralter Straight in the direction of England-France.

The pioneering development of this route came by the fleet of Genoa, a rapidly evolving city. The merchant vessels that sailed from the Republic did not head west immediately, but rather swung left from the Straight of Messina, striking the Aegean Sea, the Black Sea, and the Eastern Mediterranean. They buy spices and dying agents from Islamic merchants, and then bring them to the Flanders to make a profit: beautiful Flemish textiles.

There are no dazzling golden sheep and no exciting battles with monsters, but in search of “the wealth that is right there,” the traders pursued their dream of adventure through grueling voyages.

You are responsible for either the prestigious Spinola family or the Doria family, and aim for economic development of the family through maritime trade. There are 10 harbors beyond Naples, Antioch and Barcelona. Keep your fleet intact, rich in cargo to gain rights of trade at ports of call.

The opponent is not only the enemy. Local merchants are also rivals. Align your ship’s progress with the shifting importance of the regions and deliver trade goods and victory to Bruges.

Using a regular deck of cards, some cubes, and a couple simple boards, players will use hand management and fortunate draws to outpace their opponent's trade.
publishers: Southern Cross Games (サザンクロスゲームズ)

name: Tempus Quest: Episode 8 – Setting up Shop
description:
After aiding the downed Liberation ships, the Tempus follows them into space, her home planet no longer safe. A nearby moon has been chosen for the Liberation's new headquarters. These ships are loaded with supplies and crew to build it, but any help would be appreciated.

Games in the Tempus series work similarly to roll and write games where players roll dice and use the results to fill in a sheet. In the Tempus System, instead of using dice, players will use the date and time to randomize setup and available actions.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Tempus Quest: Episode 10 – The Asteroid Scene
description:
Having completed their attack on the Dynasty outpost the Liberation fleet attempts a hasty retreat but are cut off by an armada of Dynasty reinforcements. Seeing an escape route, the Tempus leads the other ships into an asteroid belt, hoping the armada wouldn't be so bold as to do the same.

Games in the Tempus series work similarly to roll and write games where players roll dice and use the results to fill in a sheet. In the Tempus System, instead of using dice, players will use the date and time to randomize setup and available actions.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Big Score
description:
A dicey game about getting in and getting out.

Inspired in the cult film Ocean's Eleven.


The Big Score is a competitive craps-like dice rolling game about attempting to rob a casino and get out first.

The game is played over multiple rounds, with each round having the players take turns trying to move their crew to the vault, or out past the lobby, while the non-active players place bets on what they will roll, trying to get a bonus advancement for their own crew.


The Big Score is the postcard game from Button Shy's April 2016 edition of the Board Game of the Month Club.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Tubthumping
description:
Get knocked down, but get up again in this barroom brawl.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song Tubthumping by Chumbawamba.

Chip Beauvais and Sara Beauvais team up again for the third(?) Button Shy project, and I imagine there are more to come too. In Thubtumping, players will try to get one of each drink (coin) by fistbumping a player that has a smaller coin than you. Being realtime, it can feel like a barroom brawl, and with all of those fists flying, it could accidentally turn into one.

—description from the publisher


Tubthumping is a simultaneous play competitive game of drinking and brawling. Players supply coins or tokens to play, and attempt to win mini-brawls with each other in order to collect one coin or token of each color. The first one to do so wins.


Tubthumping is the postcard game from Button Shy's June 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month Club.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Real-Time, Set Collection

name: What's Your Number?!
description:
You have something to hold onto, but are a few digits short.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song 867-5309 / Jenny by Tommy Tutone.

Ryan Cowler designed a game about missing digits, for what may be the most famous phone number ever, 867-5309. Tommy Tutone (remember them? or him? Nope.) caused some chaos for a few unlucky people that actually had this phone number in the 80's and 90's, and now you can cause some of your own by trying to mix up the digits for your opponent.

—description from the publisher


What's Your Number?! is a Mastermind type game of one player setting a pattern, and the others trying to figure out the pattern, all themed around figuring out the phone number that Jenny wrote on your hand at the club last night... All you can make out is 867-XXXX


What's Your Number?! is the postcard game from Button Shy's July 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month Club.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Flo'Busta
description:
Try not to drop the beat.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song Ice Ice Baby by Vanilla Ice.


Flo'Busta card-drafting game of making mixes in the club for 2-4 players. Each turn you draft a card matching either the suit or rank of you previous card, taking a face down card if you can't match. The player with the longest run of matched cards after 10 rounds is the winner.

Flo'Busta is the postcard game from Button Shy's August 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month club.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Lost in the Shadows
description:
Inspired on the cult film The Lost Boys.


Lost in the Shadows is a hidden role game where the players take on the role of citizens of Santa Carla who are suffering the wrath of a vampire. They must work together to uncover who among them is the head vampire and stop them before time runs out.


Postcard release in the January 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Candyland: Willy Wonka & The Chocolate Factory
description:
All your favorite locations from the classic film Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory come to life on the custom illustrated Candy Land game board. Be the first player to reach the Wonkavator by landing on the multi-colored rainbow space at the end of the path to win!

Contents:
1 Custom Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory Game Board
66 Cards
4 Oompa Loompa Movers
Rules

- description by the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Bulls Bears
description:
The board game bulls-bears about the stockpile. In the game you have to buy and sell stocks. The one who buys more than 50% of the shares wins. This is a board game with website interface. Website of the game is needed for make game mechanics easier.

At the beginning of the game all players have the same amount of money and shares. Player can buy or sell min 1 and max 9 shares on the turn. The share price changes depending on the players' decision. If more shares were sold than purchased, the price falls; if the opposite is true, the price rises.

After a few days of trading, the shareholders' meeting begins. Participants choose the amount of dividends.

The game ends when one of the participants buys more than 50 shares or becomes bankrupt.

name: Hex Code
description:
In Hex Code, players take the role of computer hackers competing to break into each others' computer the quickest. Each turn players hack their way into their target's firewall by placing shapes dependent on the roll of dice. Once the firewall grid has started to fill, players can start guessing their target's password. If the player's six-letter guess contains any characters in the correct position, the target must say so; however, if a player's guess shares similarities to their target's security layer or firewall code, they trigger a trap. The target can immediately connect a node on their microchip, eventually allowing them to discern individual letters in their target's password. Overload firewalls, rewire microchips, and catch people in security traps to guess your target's password and prove you're the fastest hacker around!

Hex Code is a free-to-play printable game designed during the COVID-19 crisis, and will remain available here and through the publisher's website forever, with continued support.

—description from the designer

name: Tokyo Washi Game Cops
description:
Take on the role of a Japanese police officer as you find evidence and solve crimes! You can eat ramen to boost your energy and execute special moves, and when you find the criminal, draw their face!

This game takes place on a roll of Washi tape, and is thus endlessly modular and scales up to any player count.

—description from the publisher

name: Mecha Brawl
description:
This game was attached to issue 13 of the ioGioco magazine.

Year 2811: Earth is a dead planet and the world population has sought survival in colonies outside the world. After a series of bloody wars to dominate the solar system, fought with huge battle mechs, the colonies have lived in precarious peace for decades. The memory of the last Great War remains alive and is celebrated with a tournament that takes place annually on the surface of the devastated planet Earth: the Mecha Brawl.
Mercenaries, ex-soldiers and adventurers challenge each other on board their mechs for glory and money, led by generals hired by the Colonies. You are one of them, and you have been called to manage the team that will represent your colony in the next tournament: choose two teams of mercenaries, deploy your team and prepare for battle!

name: Skirmish Elite: The Russo-Polish War 1919 – Battle of the Borderlands
description:
Skirmish Elite: Russo-Polish War 1919 - Battle of the Borderlands is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the opening months of fighting in the Borderlands between Poland and Soviet Russia in 1919.

The book includes eight scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of three campaigns.

Maximum Replayability: the Skirmish Elite system features a realistic variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the Russo-Polish War of 1919. This book also features a bibliography of sources.

Includes:

8 Scenarios,
3 Campaigns.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Herbalism: 2 Player Variant Rule
description: Herbalism: 2 Player Variant Rule is a postcard-sized promo card with official rules for how to play Herbalism with only two players.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Medical, Memory, Mythology, Puzzle
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Memory, Trading

name: Herbalism: Communicating Action Card
description: Herbalism: 2 vs 2 Variant Rule is a postcard-sized promo card with official rules for how four players can compete against one another as two teams of two players each.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Medical, Memory, Mythology, Puzzle
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Memory, Trading

name: Fatal Flaw
description:
Fatal Flaw is a dice-rolling real-time battle game for 2-4 players published by Button Shy Games and sent to Patreon Backers of it's Board Game of the Month Club. It consists of 4 character cards and a PDF of rules page. Player will need to provide up 2 8 dice and 40 tokens or chips in order to play.

Players each select a character and begin rolling their dice, when they think their dice are both higher than another player's they can call Hit, the game is paused and the hit is resolved. There are special rolls for blocks, heals, and special moves for each character. If a player gets 6 hits against them, they have to contend with their fatal flaw and play at a disadvantage. If a player gets 10 hits against them they are out. Last one standing wins.

name: Banned Books: Lennie
description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from Of Mice and Men by John Steinbeck, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club February 2018 package.

Lennie:
(1) Forget: Take the action of any face down card.
(2) Strength: Roll the die. If you roll a 1, 2, or 3 you may stall all of the powers. Nothing happens if you roll a 4, 5, or 6.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Banned Books: Bernard
description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from Brave New World by Aldous Huxley, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club October 2018 package.

Bernard:
(1) Rise: Move a power token and a progress token each forward two spaces.
(2) Fall: Move a progress token back 2 spaces and another forward 2 spaces.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Banned Books: Guy
description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from Fahrenheit 451 by Ray Bradbury, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club August 2018 package.

Guy:
(1) Pride: Take the lane 1 action three times, then move it to the end and flip it over.
(3) Burn: Lose up to 3 stamina to progress one space for each stamina lost.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Versteckt! Entdeckt?
description:
Versteckt! Entdeckt? ("Hidden! Found?") is an associative memo game full of creative and affectionately arranged picture cards. This compact memo game transforms every-day objects into faces in no time at all – or, the other way around, challenges the players to discover the oftentimes well-hidden elements in the faces. Here, spaghetti turns into an impressive head of hair, a pancake takes the shape of a face, and a belly button suddenly becomes a mouth. Hidden! Found? is the smart successor of the MeterMorphosen memo game classic What is this?, where every-day items are transformed into different animals. The artist behind both games Antje Damm has written several philosophical children's books (i.e. Frag mich!, Nichts und wieder nichts) and has earned various prizes for them.

Also available with English sleeve.

name: Was ist das?
description: Discovering something special in every-day life and transforming it creatively – with the new memo game What is this? and a bit of skill anyone can achieve it. With motives by the renowned children's book illustrator Antje Damm, MeterMorphosen is finally introducing a memo game for children that is more challenging than the usual memo games as its pairs consist of two different motives. When you find everyday items like carrots, a clothespin or soap on the sturdy memo cards, the question is: What is this? With the matching second card, these every-day objects are transformed into animals: a sausage becomes a dachshund, and a popsicle unexpectedly turns into a penguin. The 24 pairs of What is this? promote associative thinking and thus support intelligence development through effortless play. This memo game is not only an assembly of marvellous ideas, but also an encouragement to examine the world more closely, to get creative and to use one's imagination.

name: Sooth Sayer: A Character Expansion for Five Leagues from the Borderland
description:
This expansion pack adds the Sooth Sayer: A magic user capable of predicting the future.

Sooth Sayers can be added to any war band, whether you are just starting a campaign or far along your adventure.

Included are character creation and campaign notes, new items to bolster your magical recruit and abilities that are beneficial both on and off the battle field.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Heads or Tails: The Monster Dating Game
description:
Looking for a new hot date and don't mind them having fangs or claws?

Heads or Tails is a card game in which you’re a bachelor on a dating game show, trying to win a smoking hot monster date! This game encourages improv comedy, laughing, and being social.

The game is played with a player selected as the game show Host, another as the Bachelor, and the rest as contestants!

Each contestant will draw a random Monster card and Personality card. The Bachelor will ask a question, which will be answered by each Monster in clockwise turn order. The Host is encouraged to play up the game and mediate, but it's not required.

Monsters use their Personality cards to add to the humor, while trying to answer questions cleverly as the monster they are. At the end of three rounds, the Bachelor must guess each monsters identity. For each correct guess, the Bachelor gets a point. If the Bachelor guesses incorrectly, than the Monster gets the point unless the Host determines the Monster gave too vague of answers. Additionally, the Bachelor will reward 3 points to their favorite Monster, which can be determined for any reason they see fit (which could also mean, monsters purposely give away their identity, going "all in" for the 3 points.

The game continues, passing the roles of Host and Bachelor clockwise until every player has gotten to play those roles.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins!


Features & Benefits *


• Over 1,000 combinations of cards, leading to every experience being a different one! • The entire game in one box, making it extremely easy to carry and play anywhere, any time! • 32 unique monster cards with listed traits to help inform players. • 32 unique personality cards that will encourage comedic results! • 3 prompt cards to help those who struggle with creating questions on their own. • 1 monster reference card to help those that struggle with memorization. • Quick rule card and easy rules to learn, so you can get to playing immediately and never have to read the rulebook again!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game

name: Super Dungeon: Masterclass – Princess Citrine
description:
With her commanding presence, Citrine found her calling as a warrior and general. She possesses a keen insight for battlefield maneuvers, and her boisterous and bawdy personality ingratiated her immediately with the soldiery. Joining her father on many campaigns, her mere presence serves as a rallying cry to the soldiers of Crystalia and her strength at arms turns many a battle in the King’s favor.

CONTENTS:
1x Princess Citrine Masterclass Miniature
1x Princess Citrine Hero Card
1x 25mm Black Base

Take your Super Dungeon hobby to the next level with Super Dungeon: Masterclass! This premium line of resin models is specifically designed for hobby enthusiasts and gamers alike! Featuring Heroes and monsters from throughout the realms of Crystalia, these finely detailed miniatures bring the world of Super Dungeon to life as never before. Each Masterclass miniature includes cards that allow it to be used in your games of Super Dungeon!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Dungeon: Masterclass – Blind Swordsman
description:
For years, people from every walk of life have employed or assisted this pleasant, helpful man. He has worked as a chef, a healer, a tutor, a masseur, and more. Few people know that the exploitative landlords, corrupt magistrates, bandit leaders, and gangsters left maimed, ruined, or slain in his wake owe their demise to this humble man.

CONTENTS:
1x Blind Swordsman Masterclass Miniature
1x Blind Swordsman Hero Card
1x 25mm Black Base

Take your Super Dungeon hobby to the next level with Super Dungeon: Masterclass! This premium line of resin models is specifically designed for hobby enthusiasts and gamers alike! Featuring Heroes and monsters from throughout the realms of Crystalia, these finely detailed miniatures bring the world of Super Dungeon to life as never before. Each Masterclass miniature includes cards that allow it to be used in your games of Super Dungeon!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Battlespace: Memorial Day Mission
description:
The Battle of Takur Ghar was a short but intense military engagement between United States special operations forces and al-Qaeda insurgents fought in March 2002, atop Takur Ghar mountain in Afghanistan.
For the U.S. side, the battle proved the deadliest entanglement of Operation Anaconda, an effort early in the War in Afghanistan to rout al-Qaeda forces from the Shahi-Kot Valley and Arma Mountains.
The battle saw three helicopter landings by the U.S. on the mountain top, each greeted by direct assault from al-Qaeda forces.
Although Takur Ghar was eventually taken, seven U.S. service members were killed and many wounded.

The battle is also known as the Battle of Roberts Ridge, after the first casualty of the battle, Navy SEAL Neil C. Roberts.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Scenario 1: The Sunken Temple – For Use With Five Leagues from the Borderlands Second Edition
description:
The map shows there's an old ruined temple out here somewhere. Sure to be loaded with treasure and if nobody else has looted it yet, it can't be too heavily guarded. Right?

The Sunken Temple is the first Scenario for Five Leagues From the Borderlands 2, allowing you to go treasure hunting in an old temple ruin.

Of course, first you need to find the place and deal with bandits, wolves and the cursed remnants of the temple itself.

Instead of providing you with new encounter tables, this Scenario plays out more like a role playing adventure, as you move from stage to stage.
Consisting of a few encounters with dice challenges in between, the Scenario should give you an entertaining long afternoon or a few evenings, depending on pacing.
Ideally suited for a relatively inexperienced war band, there's something here for everyone with some sweet loot at the end.
You also get a chance to pick up a new NPC with a useful quirk of their own.

Note that this is an expansion for the Five Leagues miniatures rules.

The scenario is written for the second edition rules, though first edition players should be able to use it without too much trouble.

It is NOT a stand alone game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Micro Pack 1: "Old Corwyn" – A New Character for Five Leagues from the Borderlands Second Edition
description:
Welcome to Micro-Pack 1, a mini expansion that can be slotted into any Five Leagues From the Borderlands 2 campaign.

The idea of the Micro-Pack is a snack-sized gaming add-on for the price of a candy bar. Something to give you a little gaming rush mid-week, without having to sit down and read a 50 page rulebook.

This pack offers a new character, Old Corwyn - a tough but quiet old woodsman, that can be hired into any war band adding a new, interesting character (and modelling/painting opportunity) to your game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Character Pack 2: For Five Leagues from the Borderlands
description:
This character pack offers 3 new Hero types for your games of Five Leagues From the Borderlands.

The bitter Oath Sworn, the aloof Northern Ranger and the crafty Half-Man Burglar, these new types can be added to any campaign giving you a bit of high fantasy flair.

Each character has its profile, two unique advantages and a unique drawback.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pitch Four
description:
A game using a standard 52 card deck.
Four players as two teams of two.
Six cards are dealt to each player.
Players bid for the right to declare trumps.
Winning bidder plays a card.
The suit of that card declares trumps.
Players must follow suit or trump in.
Object of each hand is to gain up to four points.
One each for: Highest Trump, Lowest Trump, Jack of Trump (may not be in play), Most high card points (may be a tie).

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Chaos Battletome – Beasts of Chaos
description:
The earth trembles as the beastherds approach. Plants wither and rot, animals are filled with an instinctual fear and the air grows thick with the taint of raw Chaos energy. Then the bloodthirsty braying begins. The Beasts of Chaos emerge from woodland knots and rocky outcrops, bellowing their savage battle cries as they fall upon their prey. They are the true children of Chaos, and through them anarchy and ruin are spread across the lands of the civilised races.

In the 104-page hardback Battletome: Beasts of Chaos, you’ll find:


From the Wilderness They Come: an introduction to the Beasts of Chaos, savage and twisted creatures that spread anarchy throughout the Mortal Realms;
Primaeval Origins: the Beasts of Chaos pre-date even the earliest records by any scribe, and the oral traditions describing them have long faded into memory – but legends persist, and are presented here;
The True Children of Chaos: Beasts of Chaos’ inherent ferocity is not a gift bestowed by the Dark Gods, and nor is it due to enslavement – they embody Chaos in its purest and most anarchic form;
The Way of the Beast: while the Beasts of Chaos are as varied as the wildlands in which they gather, certain traits – violence, mercilessness and predation – are common to all;
Detailed explanations of the Greatfrays and beastherds of this faction, their motivations and (known) histories; * Annals of Entropy: a chronicle of the recorded events in which the full savagery and fury of the Beasts of Chaos was unleashed;
Gathering of the Greatfrays: explanation of the organisation of the Beasts of Chaos armies, including an example of how a particular beastherd is organised, along with descriptions of 7 legendary Greatfrays (Allherd, Darkwalkers, Gavespawn, Skullfrays, Twistfrays, Rotfrays and Slakefrays), including their heraldry and colour schemes * Explanation and background of each character and unit available to a Beasts of Chaos army;
A showcase of beautifully-painted Citadel miniatures, with an example army and comprehensive painting advice from the experts. This advice covers a huge variety of examples and techniques, showing you how to achieve effects like glowing runes, mutated flesh, horn striation, scales and liver spots, and add icons and beast markings to your miniatures. On top of this, there are step-by-step guides to the colour schemes of the following Greatfrays: Allherd, Gavespawn and Darkwalkers, as well as specific effects for each Chaos God.


Rules

All the rules you need in order to get your Beasts of Chaos army ready for the gaming table are here:


25 Warscrolls, covering every miniature available to the Beasts of Chaos faction and including 3 Endless Spell warscrolls – Doomblast Dirgehorn, Ravening Direflock and Wildfire Taurus – for use with Malign Sorcery;
Allegiance Abilities representing the Beasts of Chaos’ methods of war – including Command Traits, Battle Traits and 3 separate types of Artefacts of power;
Lore of the Twisted Wilds, a spell list available to Brayherd wizards; and Lore of the Dark Storms, a spell list available to Thunderscorn wizards;
Specific Abilities, Command Traits and Artefacts of Power for the following Greatfrays: Allherd, Gavespawn and Darkwalkers;
A Battleplan, including objectives for both sides, deployment map, special rules and victory conditions;
Rules for creating a Beasts of Chaos warband to use in a Path to Glory campaign, including a Followers Rewards Table and Champion Rewards Table;
8 Warscroll Battalions conferring advantages for fielding certain combinations of models;
Pitched Battle Profiles for all units featured in this Battletome, including unit sizes, points values and battlefield roles.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Turn Order: Random, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Bayala
description:
The magical land of Bayala is in danger. As the dragons have almost become extinct, magic is also disappearing from Bayala.

Work together to transport the dragon egg on the back of the unicorn to its parents in the Dragon Mountains and unite your fairy tribes at the magical Dragon‘s Feast. This is the only way to once again seal the bond between fairies and dragons. An exciting race game with some initial strategic elements.

Players take turns in clockwise direction, resolving one of their 3 active cards’ actions revealed from their personal deck. The cards show 1 of 4 different actions:

Take 1 die from the reserve dice pool and perform the action shown on the selected die,
Take 2 dice from the reserve, one after the other, and perform their actions (re-roll all dice once the dice pool is diminished),
Re-roll all dice, then take 1 to perform its action,
Move the unicorn one space forward and perform the action shown on the tile the unicorn moved to.


Actions are to either move the players’ playing piece or the unicorn forwards: Some of the actions are immediate (move your piece to the next eagle symbol; 1-3 spaces forwards), some are delayed (collect 3 wolf tokens to move 4 spaces forwards) or are luck based (flip a coin to see if you move to the next raccoon symbol or stay put).

If players don’t manage to get the unicorn to the Dragon Mountains before the first player reaches the festival ground with their fairy tribe playing piece, players lost the game together.

Manage to get the unicorn to the Dragon Mountains first to restore magic. The game is won by the first fairy tribe that reaches the festival ground. All other tribes join in to celebrate the magical Dragon‘s Feast together: Bayala is saved!
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Action Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Hegemony: Struggle in the Middle East
description:
Middle East Struggle is a card-driven board game of geopolitical conflict simulation of actual events.

Players represent the three regional powers in the contemporary Middle East: Iran, Israel, and Saudi Arabia.

They compete for influence on the region’s map while maintaining internal cohesion and securing support from world superpowers.
Card play covers all the tools available: intrigue, covert operations, extreme ideologies, oil, propaganda, technology, espionage, and proxy wars.

Four scenarios, one for each decade since the Iranian Revolution, plus a Campaign Game covering 1979 to present are included, plus a tutorial game of the events of 1978-1979 to assist new players in learning game mechanics.

The player who scores the most victory points wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Life is Rolling Stones
description:
Life is Rolling Stones is a life simulation game that takes place over each player's "Junior", "Adult", and "Senior" stage. Each player has a starting character card, and will, after rolling, place a die in each of 4 colors on it: red (passion), blue (logic), yellow (lust), and green (harmony). Each player also receives a hand of cards which represent their aspirations, and these cards will grant the player special in-game abilities and end-game scoring opportunities.

The game takes place over 3 rounds, each with 3 turns. Players draft turn order, with those going later receiving certain bonuses, and then draft life events from a public pool. In addition to the chosen card, each player will have one life event "happen" to them from a blind draw. Each round will also feature an event that will affect each of the players.

Much of the game centers around "tipping" the dice. For instance, if a card is to be placed into a player's tableau, you must try to place it next to the card that currently has the corresponding die on it; the die is then "tipped" onto the card, changing its value accordingly. In the game's theme, the higher the value of a die, the more fulfilled a player is in that aspect of their life.

After 9 rounds, the player with the most points wins.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Monopoly: Pionnenparade
description:
This is the classic Monopoly Belgium game, but with 16 pawns in one set! The game contains 8 gold pawns. Buy and trade assets, rent and let your opponents go bankrupt. In addition to the 8 classic pawns, this Monopoly Pawn Parade contains 8 extra golden pawns. Buy and trade assets, rent and let your opponents go bankrupt.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dit is het klassieke Monopoly België spel, maar dan met 16 pionnen in één set! Het spel bevat 8 gouden pionnen. Koop en verhandel bezittingen, in huur en laat je tegenstanders failliet gaan. Deze Monopoly Pionnenparade bevat naast de 8 klassieke pionnen nog 8 extra gouden pionnen. Koop en verhandel bezittingen, in huur en laat je tegenstanders failliet gaan.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading

name: ブルータス (Brutus)
description:
ブルータス (Burutasu) (Brutus) is a Japanese abstract game for two players, with the theme of 'to let betray.'

The game is played on a 7 x 5 grid. Each player move their tokens to slay their opponent's king.

A player who catches a opponent's token between their own tokens can let that token betray its faction; flip it and so make it belong to other side (similar to the game Othello. In this way, the opponent's tokens become traitors and slay their king.

『裏切らせ』をテーマにした２人用のアブストラクトゲームです。
プレイヤーは7×5マスの盤面にて、交互に駒を動かし合って、お互いの王駒を打ち取ろうとします。
その過程で、自分の駒で相手の駒を挟む事ができると、相手の駒をひっくり返し、その場で裏切らせて自分の駒にすることができます。

相手の駒を裏切らせて、相手の王を打ち取る、そんなゲームです。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Enclosure, Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid

name: Tear-a-Form on Mars
description:
It has been years since colonization! Mars now has an atmosphere and your team is moving full throttle to build cities!

Tear-a-Form on Mars is a “Speak-and-Write” variant on the Roll-and-Write genre.

In Tear-a-Form on Mars, players are building a utopia on mars!
In Tear-a-Form on Mars, each player will be managing two private grids which represent two separate plots of land:
1. Their Building Site.
2. Their Exploration Site.

We have learned from our missteps on earth and on mars we are doing it right, everyone has equal say! This means when a player builds, all players must build in that way. Of course, the new world also values individuality and artistry, so all players may also equally express flexibility in their decisions. Surely, this should be easy for you!
Happy building! Oh, and watch out for underground gas pockets!

Each turn the active player will choose two areas to fill-in on their Build Site
1. A private area that only they fill-in.
2. A public area that all players must fill-in.

When players fill-in enough of their grid to match the shape of a polyomino Building Card they own, they may discard that card to gain the benefits and points it offers. Plan accordingly because your space will become more limited as the game unfolds!

Players will also find themselves using Redirect Cards to manipulate the areas they are required to fill-in to their advantage.

But that's not all! Each player has been issued a Mars-Rover! The spaces you decide to fill-in on your Building Site will dictate its movement through the exploration site. This will gain you valuable resources, but watch out for gas pockets!

The game's end is triggered when a player no longer has space to fulfill their Building Cards. At this point all players may spend their remaining resources to build whatever last few buildings they can!

Tally your score with your private objectives, subtract points lost due to gas pockets, and the player with the highest score wins!

Welcome to Mars! You'll love it here!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Multiple Maps, Pattern Building, Relative Movement, Square Grid

name: Theatre in a Box: The Musical Theatre Board Game
description:
Theatre in a Box is the party board game for musical theatre lovers.

With your combination of performance skills, general musical theatre knowledge and a little bit of luck you can be the ‘triple threat’ that collects the most tickets to win the game.

Interactive card categories like ‘Songs’, ‘Alpha-theatrical’, ‘General Knowledge’ and ‘Entertain’ provide the chance to shine like the star you are! Whilst the ‘Tears and Cheers’ are chance cards that can quickly alter the outcome of the game.

Simple set up. Easy to play. Just roll the dice, move your piece and complete the challenge. Collect tickets. The most tickets wins - it's that easy (and great fun!)

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Music, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing
publishers: (Self-Published), Theatre in a Box Pty Ltd

name: AFFINITY
description:
アフィニティー (AFFINITY) is a game of fantasy medieval war and politics, from Japan. Players build up armies to fight for the kingdom, using bluffing and bargaining. Using psychology to out-think the opponents is needed, as the ending is never certain.

After a long war, the feudal system has declined, and leading aristocrats began to fight for the right to inherit the throne. Soldiers engage in combat seeking specific rewards.

Practical rewards often cause betrayal and secession and end the era of loyalty and justice. In such an era, you must become one of the leading aristocracy. Form an army stronger than anyone in an arms race, for the war will bring in troops and mercenaries owned by other aristocrats.

Only players can see their units targeted for the competition, so it is fun to have a psychological battle with such bluffing or bargaining. Without knowing the enmey well enough, players cannot forecast the winner.
user summary

長く続いた戦乱の末に封建制度は衰退し、有力貴族は王位継承権を巡る争いを始める。兵は報酬など具体的な見返りを基に戦役従事する事となった。実利的な見返りは裏切りや離反を多発させ忠誠と正義の時代は終わりを告げる。そんな時代の最中、あなたは有力貴族の一人となって、他の貴族が所有する部隊や傭兵を抱き込み来る戦争の為に軍拡競争をして、だれよりも強力な軍隊を編成しなくはなりません。

・競の対象となる部隊は親のみが見る事が出来るのでブラフや駆け引きといった心理戦が行われる所が楽しい。

・最後まで競り取った部隊の内容が見れないので最後まで勝者がわからない。

・手札の報酬カードには競りで有利になる能力がある物もある為、手札の中で自分なりの戦略を構築するのが楽しい。

・部隊を集め軍隊をコレクションしている感じが楽しい。
publisher's summary

name: Q-Bits
description:
Q-Bits is played with 16 tiles divided into sections of two colors. (These are similar if not identical to Pantactic Squares.)

Players get dealt tiles and take turns placing one tile at a time on the board. Each tile is scored as it is placed based on its pattern and orientation; one side of the board is designated the "top" and tiles are read from that direction.

In one version of the game tiles must be placed so that colors match. In another they must be placed so that they do not match. A solitaire game is also provided

name: Run, Fight, or Die!: Running Late But We're Worth It Expansion
description: This expansion includes 4 new Female Characters, a custom Pink Die, 4 Fleeing Cards, 4 Reference Cards, 8 Loot, the 'Cat Burglar', 5 Events, and 4 Locations.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Pizza Wars & Pizza Wars Imperium
description:
A special plastic-bagged edition containing the scrumptious duo of Pizza Wars and Pizza Wars Imperium, which were previously sold separately.

—user summary
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Garakutarium ~Artifact or Fiction~
description:
- This World

Far, far north from the Steam Kingdom, people says there is an ancient ruins at the foot of mountains and in those ruins a large quantity of wonderful relics, though in general seems "junk parts", is disposed.
According to legend, magical power from assembled relics, that have the power beyond human understanding, will grant any and every requests.
However quite a few searcher only can find out those ruins.
You are the searchers teaming up together and coming to those ruins. You also have skills to draw out magical power from assembled relics found here.
However, you know that. Only one person, you or your company, will achieve his/her dream...

- Goal of the game

Each player aims for gathering the power of relics by assembling them to activate. The player assembles relic cards and gathers 30 points of magical power, wins the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Evilpact
description:
- Story

You are an wisdom seeking "investigator" who was enchanted by a grimoire that you found one day.

As you collect more grimoires, you realize that someone else out there is doing the same.

Some follower of a cult must be planning a conspiracy.
To stop the conspiracy, you must collect more grimoires than they do.
Even if that meant relying on unspeakable powers...

- Objective

The objective of the game is to collect more grimoires than your opponent, while also making a contract with a demon. The player who has more magic powers than their opponent in the majority of the elements wins. However, if only one player did not fulfil their contract by the end of the game, that player loses regardless of their magic powers.

Win a victory over magical powers or trick the opponent into unconditional defeat… Plan a spell-driven stratagem and enjoy thrilling tricks.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Closed Drafting, Open Drafting

name: Hail Caesar: Contest of Champions
description:
The stage is set for eight of antiquity’s greatest combatants (that are made by Warlord Games) to square off in a duel to the death. We’ll be putting the brand new Contest of Champions through its paces. Before the clash of blades, let's meet our combatants.

Inject some drama into your games of Hail Caesar with a brand-new minigame which allows your commanders to clash in heroic duels. Simple card-based mechanics create dynamic engagements where literally anything can happen!

Contest of Champions works equally well as a standalone minigame, or into a big game of Hail Caesar with minimal changes.
We're running this tournament as a standalone, to give you an idea of how everything works on the tabletop!

Alexander the Great
Alfred the Great
Ariovistus
Arthur
Julius Caesar
Leonidas
William of Normandy
Vercingetorix


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: A7V: The German Tank Offensive at Villers-Bretonneux, 1918
description:
A7V depicts the first large scale use of German A7V tanks during the battle for Villers-Bretonneux, April 24-25, 1918.

The battle for this key town happened several times before because it was a key railroad junction that led to Amiens, a British\French occupied city.
Knowing this, the Germans planned their tank attack comprising of 13 A7V and assault troops after their major offensive, Michael, had failed by late March, 1918.

—description from the publisher
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: Dr. Mario
description: In the Dr. Mario game you'll have to extract the viruses from the holes in the board acting with the skill of a skilled surgeon. But... just one mistake and the buzzer will end your turn! Gather the viruses of the right color and shape and you will be the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: Mobil Ball-
description:
Football simulation from 1949.

Players alternate using their cards to move the ball in the opponent's goal.

name: Tom's Party
description:
Today is Tom the mouse's birthday and his friends are preparing a surprise birthday party. Place the different elements and guests in the party before Tom appears. If he arrives early, quickly release a ballon so that he can linger to play with it, and you'll have time to finish the surprise.

Cooperation game.
All the guests and elements of the party are inside of a bag, all the players, one by one, should extract one wooden piece from the bag, if it's a guest or an element, we are preparing the party, but if we take Tom, then we use one of the four balloons then he can linger to play with it. We have 4 balloons.
If we can put all the guest before we use the four balloons, then we win, otherwise we lose.

—description from the publisher

name: Virtual Reef Diver
description:
Experience the beauty and wonder of the Great Barrier Reef while learning about the dangers this national treasure currently faces, and the solutions data scientists are providing for its defence. Work as a team of citizen scientists on a quest to classify the corals, identify the organisms, and help protect the seventh wonder of the natural world.

The game features fast paced gameplay (pick a card and identify it for points), beautiful reef imagery and educational content.

Sales of this game directly contribute towards future print runs of this game as it is a not for profit.

Virtual Reef Diver is based on an Australian Government-funded citizen science website, where people can go to play a digital version and contribute useful data to scientists across Australia and across the world!

Whether for teaching, learning or just for fun, Virtual Reef Diver has plenty to offer everyone.

name: Run Fight or Die: Reloaded – Solo Campaign Deck
description:
The Run Fight or Die Solo Campaign allows you to play through a one player adventure using a base game copy of Run Fight or Die: Reloaded. The campaign spans four missions where you’ll need to gain the Followers, Leadership Points and Loot necessary to eventually defeat the Mutant Zombie, all while avoiding traumas that will hinder your efforts.

Contains:

15 Action Cards
15 Trauma Cards
4 Upgrade Cards
2 Mission Reference Cards
1 Supply Cache Card
1 Experience Card


Note: This was included in the Run Fight or Die: Reloaded – Kickstarter Edition, but is sold separately for Retail editions via the publisher's website.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: LookSee
description:
LookSee is a fast paced visual perception game where players simultaneously compete to win a card. Roll the dice, figure out the missing number and color, then race the other players to find the object that matches that on the card! You find it, you grab it! When taking a Looksee at the two dice, determine if the numbers and colors are either all alike or all different. Then find the missing attirbute and players must race to find the item on the card that shows up in that color the exact times of the number. For example, if the two dice are both blue and both number 2, then players must find the item pictured twice in blue on the card (all alike). If the two dice are blue and green, and show the numbers 1 and 2, then players must find the item pictured red three times on the card (all different).

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Speed Matching

name: Color Coordinated
description:
In Color Coordinated, players take turns playing matching colors or effects, building up a big pile of cards! If a player cannot or chooses not to play a matching card, the previous player gets all of the cards in the pile added to their hand! Beware though, the bigger the hand, the bigger the target as players will play effects to reduce cards in your hand and add to theirs!

Each player is dealt a hand of 5 cards and the remaining deck is then shuffled and placed in the center of the playing area.

The player who is wearing one of the game's four colors will go first. The beginning player can play any card to start and the card's effect must be followed. Players will then begin to play a matching color OR matching effect. This cycle continues until a player has no matching color or effect, OR chooses not to play a matching card or effect. The previous player then receives all of the played face-up cards to their hand.

The player with the biggest hand when the deck runs out, or when a player reaches 21 cards, wins!

-description from designer
publishers: Meet Me At The Table Games

name: Score
description:
Score is a Dutch football game played by two players.
Each player has 11 cards: 8 with the value 1, 2 with the value 2 and 1 with the value 3. Each player makes his line-up by placing the cards on the squares on the board.
Each turn the players may take turns to perform an action: two players change positions (keeping the player in possession of the ball) or play the ball to another player. All actions are done via the black lines on the game board. If the player is in one of tehe 5 forward positions with the ball and he has a higher value than his direct opponent, he will score a goal. If there is no goal scored within five actions, the possession will change to the other player.
The winner is the player who has scored the most goals after an agreed time.

—user summary

name: Five Parsecs: Salvage Crew
description:
The adventure continues.

With Five Parsecs : Salvage Crew you can try your luck at planetary salvage.

Search crashed ships and alien ruins, deal with hazards and fight off other claimants (and the odd mutant gang or alien critter).

Create a unique crew with character and identity, load them up and set them lose on the universe.

Character creation follows the very popular method from Five Parsecs From Home but with tables adjusted for the types of characters you'll find in the new style of campaign.

Salvage Crew is written for campaign play, allowing you to watch your crew develop and grow (hopefully!) as they survive encounters, learn their trade and loot the universe.

New rules are included for revealing unexpected encounters and scouting the area for bad guys.


The game engine is intended for solo play from the get go:
