This means we've avoided complex rules that are easy to lose track of, kept the number of exceptions and special cases to a minimum and all solo play mechanics are integrated directly into the core rules.

No need to flip back and forth between Movement and the Solo mechanics any longer.

This is a complete, stand alone game.
categories: Adventure, Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Caught on Tape
description:
A player takes a piece of tape from a roll of adhesive tape, which rolls the two wheels of adjectives and nouns, creating an unique category, for example "adorable compliments", "shocking foods", "confusing stores".

Each player in turn must name a thing in this category, the first player to fumble, hesitate, or unable to find will get the piece of tape on their face.

—user summary

Try not to get caught up in a sticky situation! The Caught on Tape game is a hilarious, laugh-out-loud game that's not about winning — it's about not losing! Pull a piece of tape to spin the randomizer, which will combine two words into a unique category for the round. Players then take turns, quickly shouting out terms that fit within that category. The challenge might be to name irritating celebrities, or embarrassing hobbies, but if players draw a blank or take too long to answer, their opponents get to place a piece of tape on their face! Get ready for loads of laughs as players get stretched lips and wacky eyebrows. The first player with 5 pieces of tape on their face loses the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Open Combat: Sword Masters
description:
Open Combat - Sword Masters

Extra skills, abilities, weapons, scenarios and rules to expand your games of Open Combat

The full colour A4 supplement for Open Combat includes:

New skills and abilities specifically for sword fighter models to capture the sense of drama and/or flamboyance often associated with them
Extra skills for general use
New items of equipment
New terrain rules including: swinging from chandeliers/rigging, low obstacles (trip hazards), improvised projectiles (such as kicking/throwing things from tables) and more
New scenarios to play including The Duel, For Honour and Brawl
Plus sample profiles, two new actions, guidance for setting up terrain using the new rules for maximum mayhem and advice for linking games together into a micro campaign.


Scenarios include:

'The Duel', one versus one combat (perfect for a super quick game or to try out new approaches to creating profiles).
'For Honour' where warbands fight for the honour of their clan/school/family in ritual combat and
'The Brawl', where we see a fight erupt out in an otherwise relatively peaceful environment (models start unarmed but they can scrabble to grab a weapon as the fighting gets under way).


Also included are hints and tips, Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) along with sample profiles for a selection of combatants to help inspire you (or to pick from if you're a bit short on time).

THIS IS A SUPPLEMENT. OPEN COMBAT IS REQUIRED TO USE THIS PUBLICATION.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: これっくらいのお弁当箱に(In this OBENTO Box!)
description:
A mail appeared suddenly on Mama's cellphone. It's from another mum who has her son in the same school as you. Did you know our sons have a school trip tomorrow? What? Tomorrow?! He didn't say anything to me! I need to prepare a lunch box with whatever now!

Players are playing the part of the mothers who need to prepare lunch-box with aleatory foods from their fridge.
Each player have a player mat where they need to place food cards on. On each cards are written some Victory Points that will be counted at the end of the game but also, in case of a food that has a smell, contains liquid or its color, will have bad influence and decrease VP of the adjacent card.

To prevent this bad influence, you will be able to put some foliage between those cards. You will also need to put ice cards adjacent to food that needs to be kept cold.

At the end of the game each player count their VP and get a bonus if they got all the cards colors and/or they manage to fill up all the entire bento box area.

name: Advent of the Wyrms
description:
A sect of conjurers has unearthed a dangerous tome, which speaks of the primordial wyrms that once ruled the mortal world. These conjurers believe that if they are successful in bringing about the calamity, a mythical event that foretells the return of the wyrms, they will be able to craft a new world over which they will preside. Having discovered the conjurers’ plans, you must stop them from bringing the ancient wyrms back to consume all living souls.

A decktet solitaire set collection game where you have 4 cards in your hand and need to create 4 sets of ascending cards; however, anytime a wyrm suit card is drawn, it must be negated.

name: SEEKRIEG 5: Ship Logs – Italy 1880-1945
description:
This collection of the SEEKRIEG 5 ship logs, originally released on CD in 2009, represents the majority of the vessels comprising the navies of Italy during the years 1880 to 1945. Any subsequent corrections made to the original release are included in this set of files.

A total of 986 ship logs are included and, wherever possible, planned warships, conversions and never completed vessels are also included and based on available information. In most instances, one or more logs are provided for individual ships within a particular class. Major refits or other modifications significantly affecting the fighting capability of a ship are reflected in the multiple logs available for some ships, however, details regarding individual modifications to some of the smaller vessels (torpedo boats, submarines, gunboats and MTBs) are not generally available so a single ship log is provided to serve for the entire class.

name: Battle of the River Plate
description:
Battle of the River Plate is a fast play introductory set of WW2 naval rules covering the famous battle of the same name, fought in December 1939 off the coast of South America. It was the first naval battle in WW2.

It opposed, in the South Atlantic, the German heavy cruiser Admiral Graf Spee and one of the British Navy hunting groups composed of HMS Exeter, Ajax, and Achilles.

It is a fast play introductory set of rules, including ship counters (or you can use your own models).

Scale:
1"= 500 yds
1 turn= ~4min
1 hull damage point per 500 tons displacement.

Turn Sequence:

Initiative Phase
Movement Phase
Player A moves their ships
Player B moves their ships

Gunnery Phase
Player B resolves their gunfire
Player A resolves their gunfire

Torpedo Phase
Move any torpedo counters on the table
Player A launches torpedoes
Player B launches torpedoes

Damage Control
Both players roll to see if they can repair any damage



- User summary
categories: Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Ironclad and American Civil War Naval Wargames Rules
description:
Ironclad and American Civil War Naval Wargames Rules:
A set of miniature rules to simulate combat on the seas

Play goes in a succession of:

Movement
Firing + Ramming & damage resolution


It contains raw data but ships information will have to be calculated by the players.

Scales
1" = 100 feet.
1 move = 1 minute
1" = 1 knot
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Szalone Gary
description:
Guess what's hiding in your pot!
Before the game fill the pots different opponent delicacies.
It depends on you, what the other players will have to try.
Will it be sour lemon or a piece chocolate? Or maybe something else?

Escape with your pots outside the board, close your eyes, open up
pot and try the contents! If you can guess, you get a point!

Who will guess all your flavors first, wins the game!

name: Trézors
description:
Trézors is a luck based card game for 2-4 players. Each player starts with an identical hand of cards, playing through them over the course of the game. A row of treasures is revealed and all players play a card out of their hand simultaneously claiming a type of treasure. If only one player claims a type of treasure in the row, they win that treasure. If more than one player claim the same treasure the first to tap it with their finger wins it. Unclaimed treasures are discarded.

The game is over when there are no more "chest” cards. The players count the number of stars present on the cards won (with rarer treasures being worth more points) and, if needed, subtract a point per "hook" card drawn. The one with the most value points wins the game.

Contents: 59 cards

name: Marvel Heroes Breakout DVD Game
description:
25 villains have escaped from jail and you have to recapture them in the Marvel Super Heroes DVD game!
Join your favorite super heroes like the Incredible Hulk, the Fantastic Four and more in a race against time! You'll have fun as you capture villains, jump from rooftop to rooftop and build a super hero! Includes footage from such series as Spider-Man, the X-Men and more!
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Speed Matching

name: So Many Problems: Your Mission
description:
So Many Problems is a lightly competitive and deeply hilarious storytelling party game for 2 to 8 players. Your Mission (should you choose to accept it) is the first Deluxe Box, including four themes that won't self-destruct:
• Improvising Secret Agent is a master of physics and chemistry who can combine materials in unimaginable ways to escape from the most dangerous espionage assignments.
• You Meddlesome Youths bought a van, adopted a dog that sounds like he is trying to talk, and started a detective agency with some high school friends.
• Long Shot Astronaut and their crew face everything that can go terribly wrong in space, thinking on their feet while floating in zero-gravity.
• Not-So-Super Hero is fighting villains alongside heroes gifted with extreme strength or speed, even though they are basically just really good at a hobby like archery or martial arts.

Every round, each player gets three story elements to secretly distribute and a far-fetched problem to solve, all coming at random from the four themes. You'll try to give the other players elements that might help to solve their problems, but they don't actually want your help.

Before you look at the three elements you receive from others, shuffle in two random elements from the deck. Choose just three of those five possibly-helpful elements to use, trying to avoid those you suspect came from the other players, as you improvise and share a hilarious story that solves your problem.

You'll earn one point for each element you contributed to another player that was used in a solution. Each random element from the deck that you used in your own solution is worth one point, too. After three rounds of problems, the player with the most points wins! Optional advanced game modes add trophies to reward stories that are especially funny or creative, and actions like the challenge flag to throw down and crank up the competition.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Conspiracy Theory Travel Edition
description:
Conspiracy Theory tests your knowledge of the world of Internet conspiracies.

Answer questions to collect conspiracy cards to win, but be careful of Cover-Ups. A QR code is printed on every conspiracy card if you want more details (like when the ghost of JFK revealed that all dolphins are aliens).

The perfect party game for 2 to 6 players (or teams). This travel edition of our popular Conspiracy Theory Trivia Board Game, contains 200 all-new questions and a game die to easily play on the go (or use it as an expansion pack for the full board game).

-description from publisher's website

name: Minimaxo
description:
Similar to Domino one picture has to be placed next to the other one. The motive, which has to be added as the next one to the picture, is decided by rolling the two motive dices. This can be the same size of picture, a bigger or smaller one. The player, who has put down all motive cards first, has won that game.

—description from the box

name: Micro Impérios
description:
In Micro Impérios, each player takes on the role of leader of a civilization that must progress and develop more efficiently than its enemies. While evolving technologically, players can use the maximum population limit they can get, in addition to taking action against possible disputes from their neighbors because they don't steal their technologies and break their strategy.

On the player's turn, he must play Development cards without violating the amount of available resources generated by previously played cards. Win a game or player that accumulates the most Influence points.

name: Diskwars: Acolytes of Timorran
description:
A Fantasy themed miniatures wargame without the miniatures. Will you play as the ubiquitous Elves, the barbaric Uthuk Yllan, the stalwart Dwarves, the vile Undead, the medieval Knights, the desert dwelling Acolytes, the mighty Dragon kin, or the vicious Orcs? Players choose a faction from the eight available in the base game and an army point value for the battle. Each must then build an army using the double-sided cardboard disks and battle it out. At least half of the army points must be from one faction and the remaining points are made up of like aligned or neutral disks and spells.

Each double-sided disk represents either a faction homeland (your starting area), a terrain (ruins, forest, swamp etc... with effects on combat and line of sight), a spell(levels 1-3), a missile or one unit with its alignment (Good, Neutral, or Evil) with values for its Attack, Defense, Toughness, Movement and the army point cost of the disk. The disks have varying sizes (Giants and Dragons tend to be larger) and most units have a wide variety special abilities such as flying, the spell-casting ability or the missile ability to launch boulders, bolts, arrows or fireballs for example. Players take it in turn activating 3 units(disks) and resolving battles, casting spells, and firing missiles.

Activated Unit disks are moved around the table by flipping them end over end a number of times up to their movement value. If the disk lands on top of an opposing army disk a battle ensues with the top disk (the attacker) doing its attack damage value to the lower disk (the defender) who applies its defense value to the attacker if the damage is equal or greater to either unit's toughness it is either wounded or killed. Combats can involve numerous disks upon top of each other and are resolved top down. Missiles can be fired by missile capable units at disks within range by dropping them upon the target from a foot above the table. Those which land upon the target do damage otherwise they miss or can hit other disks they land on. This can result in 'friendly fire' damage on your own troops and adds an element of luck/dexterity to the game.

The game rules come with multiple scenarios that accommodate 2 to 8 players. The victory goal of each scenario can vary from king of the hill, to enemy elimination, to just about any combat scenario victory condition one could imagine.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame

name: Seven Years War: Wargames Rules
description:
These Seven Years War: Wargames rules were spawned from a free online set which had itself been based on DBM (Wargames Research Group rules).

They had lots of modifications since, and work with battalions of 16 figures and Regiments of horse of 9-15.

Designed for 15mm.

Sequence of play:

Each game turn consists of 2 alternating phases, the attacking player being the first phasing player, the defender is the second phasing player in a turn.
Command changes (Phasing player).
Movement (Phasing player), testing to Charge.
Shooting (Phasing player)
Shooting (Non-Phasing player)
Charge moves (Phasing player)
Close combat (Both players)
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: The Fire Ant Mow Down at Dirty Ankle
description:
The Fire Ant Mow Down at Dirty Ankle is a Roll & Write game where you help Cleephas Spangler mow his yard and eliminate all of the fire ant hills in his yard. Each turn you will roll and choose a path to mow. You also have broken down trucks in the yard that you have to mow around. Though your prized mower is faithful, its only faithful in the fact that it gives you headaches! These headaches are problems that arise with your mower that you have to contend with during the game. If you get all the spaces mowed, eliminate the ant hills, and make it home, you win!

-description from designer

name: Who's the Dude: Now's Not Time for Correctness
description:
Now's not time for correctness!
During the five years of his life in Russia, Dude learned a lot of new words and expressions. Now he knows that "get a bream" is not always about fish, and you can throw more than confetti on the fan. Dude is ready to play with the most daring adult company! In this game — 336 new words, including many ambiguous and obscene. They can catch you off guard right after something innocent like ping-pong or ventriloquism. You can adjust the degree of the game and guess ambiguous words using a direct or figurative meaning.

Do you know Dude?
Who's the Dude is a hit party game where you have to explain words and phrases with gestures and an inflatable Dude. Together, you find yourself in strange situations: reincarnate as different people, act out scenes from movies or famous sayings. Dude is ready to become a tool, an object, an animal — use it as you like, as long as the players name the correct answer! The winner is the one who after the fourth round will score the most points for the guessed words.

Take Dude:

To a wild party." And don't forget to take your camera — it's should be capturing.
As a gift to a friend with a good sense of humor.
In the company that loves of charades.
For a stag or hen party. As a gift to the newlyweds, too!


—description from the publisher

name: Lost Worlds: Knights of the Dinner Table – Bob "Knuckles"
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


From inside front page with User Summary:

This book represents "Knights of the Dinner Table : Bob "Knuckles"" in the LOST WORLDS combat book games and is playable, with all other LOST WORLDS books. Each book is unique and has its own special qualities.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost Worlds: Knights of the Dinner Table – Brian "Teflon Billy"
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


From inside front page with User Summary:

This book represents "Knights of the Dinner Table : Brian "Teflon Billy"" in the LOST WORLDS combat book games and is playable, with all other LOST WORLDS books. Each book is unique and has its own special qualities.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost Worlds: Knights of the Dinner Table – Dave "El Ravager"
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. This book represents "Knights of the Dinner Table : Dave "El Ravager"" in the LOST WORLDS combat book games and is playable, with all other LOST WORLDS books. Each book is unique and has its own special qualities.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost Worlds: Knights of the Dinner Table – Sara "Thorina"
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


From inside front page with User Summary:

This book represents "Knights of the Dinner Table : Sara "Thorina"" in the LOST WORLDS combat book games and is playable, with all other LOST WORLDS books. Each book is unique and has its own special qualities.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Fate vs The Devil
description:
Fate vs The Devil is a solitaire card game that features set collection as the key task during play. This coincides with careful hand management and deck building on your part.

During this game you represent Fate, who is in a race against the Devil to collect the most souls from the medieval place known as the realm. Collecting cards to place in your crypt will earn you those souls. At the end of the game, soul points are calculated to determine the winner.

The Devil is a game-controlled opponent that only maintains a crypt and discard pile; whereas, you maintain the equivalent, along with hand cards and a player deck.

Aside from providing you with soul points, realm cards can serve you in other ways, such as acting as currency to purchase more cards, or as a way to perform special actions. Card purchases are made from the realm or from the Devil, with the latter requiring a higher premium.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer 40,000: Gathering Storm I – Fall of Cadia
description:
Gathering Storm: Fall of Cadia is a campaign supplement for the Seventh Edition of Warhammer 40,000. It is a 1st part of the Gathering Storm series.

For ten thousand years Cadia has stood firm against the horrors spewed forth by the Eye of Terror. There are no records of how many valiant souls have fallen defending the fortress worlds of the Cadian Gate — but by their sacrifice, the tide of horror stemmed. But there is no sacrifice big enough to stop what is coming.

Abaddon has unleashed the full might of his thirteenth Black Crusade and little hope remains. On Cadia itself, Ursarkar Creed and manifold Imperial forces mount a desperate defence, and they are soon to be joined by the strangest and most powerful of allies. Their arrival spurs a chain of events that will change things forever – the pylons will fall, the Eye will open, and a storm will come.

Full rules for fielding Saint Celestine, Belisarius Cawl and Inquisitor Greyfax with any army of the Imperium:

Saint Celestine confers Act of Faith on nearby units
Belisarius Cawl confers the Canticles of the Omnissiah on nearby units

Inquisitor Greyfax brings 6 new Inquisition Tactical Objectives

The Triumvirate of the Imperium – a formation bringing these three characters together;

6 new Ecclesiarchy Relics and 6 Arcana Mechanicum, usable by Adepta Sororitas and Cult Mechanicus forces;

The Grand Convocation and Imperial Crusade detachments – combine Cult Mechanicus,Skitarii and Mechanicus Knights in one army, and Black Templars and Adepta Sororitas in another;

Battlezone: Empyric Storms – rules for raging Warp Storm effects, some of which can be quite drastic: potentially removing invulnerable saves, or halving the effective range of psychic powers...

4 new Echoes of War missions.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Respect
description:
Here you will find the worst criminals, thieves and scammers in the country. You must make a hole in the prison, earning the respect of the rest. It will not be easy, but not impossible!

Take advantage of the special abilities you have, complete missions, learn to defend yourself, win battles against other prisoners, buy your protection, get involved in the mafia, manage your money well and get to be the master of "LA PERLA" no matter what.

Players will become prisoners, seeking the utmost respect, taking on the role of Mario El Fuerte, Moe El Soplón, Harry El Loco, Jack El Carterista, Mr. White El Estafador and Qiang El Yakuza.

The player who gets 15 respect points wins.

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Eldar – Harlequins
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Eldar – Craftworlds
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: El graduado
description:
An old game from the 80s set in a school. This game consists of collecting diplomas. 2 to 4 players compete during 6 very random and fun mini games.

Contains general culture questions for children. Comic imitations, performances and representations.

No dice are used, it has a roulette wheel to determine how much each chip advances. It has an illustrated board.

—user summary

name: Fightdrome: Panama Rose
description:
Fightdrome: Panama Rose is a fast-paced combat card game based off of the 2002 cyberpunk Altered Carbon novels by Richard K. Morgan.

This game places gamers at the heart of the infamous Panama Rose combat arena, with Panama Rose being the first in a planned series of Fightdromes. Players take on the role of competitors who fight it out to determine which of them is superior. Before starting a game, players agree how to be declared winner: by playing until one player is out of cards, or by being the first player to reach an agreed number of "fame" points. Each round is referred to as a bout, and playing for "fame" points involves a series of bouts.

Each player has their fighter's digital consciousness (known as a stack) placed in an engineered or augmented body (known as a sleeve) for each bout. Your card deck will be customized depending on which combination of stack and sleeve you are using. Competitors must then kick, punch, and grapple their way to the top, attempting to outwit their opponent, place killing blows, and become the champion of the Fightdrome.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Apocalypse Second Edition
description:
Imperial Armour - Apocalypse Second Edition is a book published by Forge World to replace Imperial Armour - Apocalypse. It contains updated and brand new rules for using Forge World's models in games of Warhammer 40,000 and Apocalypse, as well as three new Apocalypse missions.

The book has 128 pages and is printed in colour.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Apocalypse
description:
Imperial Armour - Apocalypse (2013) is a book published by Forge World to replace Imperial Armour - Apocalypse Second Edition. It contains updated and brand new rules for using Forge World's models in games of Warhammer 40,000 and Apocalypse.

The book has 170 pages and is printed in colour.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Aeronautica
description: Imperial Armour Aeronautica is a Forge World supplement book for Warhammer 40,000 that contains 6th Edition rules for 34 flyers and 13 anti-aircraft units fielded by the Imperial Navy, Space Marines, Orks, Eldar, Tyranids, Tau Empire, Necrons, Dark Eldar and Chaos. Also included are the wargear and special rules unique to the aircraft of the 41st Millennium. It also features a narrative campaign, the Scourging of Kerrack, which provides six Warhammer 40,000 missions. The book is concluded by an Apocalypse rules appendix, updated for the 6th edition of Warhammer 40,000
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Travel Europe
description:
The goal of each player is to get the most points possible. Players are tourists who travel by train, ship, or plane through the most famous cities in Europe. During these visits, the players take part in interesting events: cultural, sporting, musical and entertainment. They also visit many important attractions, including historical, scenic, museums, entertainment, and restaurants. In the game, it is especially worth visiting Spain, Poland, and Italy. The winner of the game is the person who creates the best trip planner by visiting interesting places and participating in interesting events.

Game releeased as a part of the project "Playing to learn, learning to play." with the support of the Erasmus+ Programme of the European Union.
Project coordination: NGO Amics

Game published as Print&Play and small amount of boxes.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Print & Play, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex Supplement – Farsight Enclaves
description:
The Tau are a new force in the galaxy, optimistic and bright. Yet even they have their dark secrets. When the Warrior hero Farsight conquered the worlds of the Damocles Gulf, he learned forbidden truths that would divide the Tau Empire forever.
This supplement to Codex: Tau Empire allows you to tailor your collection of Tau miniatures into a force from the Farsight Enclaves, armed to the teeth and ready for battle.

Within the 72 pages of this softback book you will find:

The history of the Farsight Enclaves, from O'Shovah's first conflicts to the brink of their destruction
A showcase of beautifully painted miniatures , presenting the colours and insignia of those under Farsight's command
New missions that recreate Farsight's most famous battles, as well as additional rules to customise your games of Cities of Death and Planetstrike
A series of narrative missions that enable you to play through O'Shovah's military career, alongside a set of Altar of war missions that showcase the Farsight Enclaves' favoured fighting styles


Farsight Enclaves: A Codex: Tau Empire Supplement is designed to work alongside the rules found in Codex: Tau Empire, which you will need in order to field a Farsight collection on the tabletop.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Astra Militarum
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroic Echoic
description:
A colourful light-hearted superhero-themed standalone family card game with serious depth.

Echoics are the sound effects in comic books. In Heroic Echoic, you collect echoic cards and use them to bid for superhero cards. The aim of the game is to be the first to win 5 heroes, but each hero you win before that gives you a power to help you win more, so it's worth taking risks to win heroes early.

You're thinking 'Do I have more echoics for The Chemist than she does? I've seen her pick up a few. Hmmm but look how shifty she is. Maybe I can bluff and make her think I've got more than she does and she might as well not bother!' Then when the bidding begins, you'll be shouting things like 'BIFF!' and 'BLEUGH!' and 'SPLAT' and 'AH HA!' across the table and wondering how it came to this.

There are 88 echoic cards and 27 hero cards. With thousands of different combinations of powers that you can try out or take on, each game plays quite differently, ensuring maximum replayability.

-description from designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Race, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex – Necrons
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Gamebook: An Interactive Book of Board Games
description:
Gamebook is a hybrid, both an interactive book and a collection of board games. Gamebook contains eight abstract strategy board games, carefully selected from the rich gaming heritage that represents human history, our intelligence, wit, strategy and appetite for fun, play and socialising - all gathered in one uniquely designed interactive book, for you to see, to read and most importantly - to play.

It also has one new game, Be Humble, which is a racing game of four levels for two to six players. Each player has three figures of his own colour. The winner is the first to pass all their figures off the board. Be humble: if you progress too fast with one of your figures, the others will find it hard to follow.

Gamebook includes:
9 board games
1 booklet History & Rules (Eng/Slo)
72 figures, 6 two-sided sticks, 1 dice

name: Cities and Mercenaries: Renaissance
description:
In the 15th and 16th centuries, the struggle for control of Europe seemed to have reached its peak. The Great Powers, using mercenaries gathered from all over Europe, have torn her to pieces. The borders of the Great Powers were constantly changing, and cities were passed from hand to hand like hunting trophies...

In this strategic game, players need to build a common Game Area out of City Tiles and establish control over cities to gain more Victory Points.
Key features:
1) In the Core Game uses 42 unique City Tiles. Each City has 4 ways to connect to other Cities. Therefore, in each game, the players create a new Game Area.
2) Instead of the usual resources (wood, stone, iron, etc.), the game uses mercenaries: Infantry, Shooters, Cavalry and Artillery. Each type of mercenary has 3 levels - the higher the level, the higher the ability of the unit. In total, there are 12 Unit Tokens in the game. Tokens have two sides and can be placed secretly. This creates huge opportunities for bluff and tactical combinations.
3) The main way to obtain Unit Tokens is to create Political Ties between cities. The more complex the Political Ties, the more and better the Unit Tokens the player receives. This process is like playing Domino. Additionally, Unit Tokens can be bought or obtained free of charge upon conclusion of Alliances.
4) The gameplay is divided into 5 Phases, which reflect the main aspects of the politico-military life of the Renaissance rulers and are consistently repeated in each Round. All phases are interconnected: the decisions made by the player in each phase have a definite influence on his subsequent actions. The strict sequence of phases allows players to carry out long-term planning.
5) Each phase consists of several special actions available to all players. On a turn, the player cannot perform more than one action in a row. After each action, the turn is passed to the next player. All this speeds up of the gameplay, removes downtime and ensures high interaction between players.
6) The competition of the gameplay depends on the skill of the players and their intentions. Usually errors are not critical if you are playing with players of your level. You can make up your failure to do some things by successfully doing others.
7) The game can be completed in the First Round if at least one player can gain control of 5 or more Cities around their Capital City. Otherwise, the Round becomes the Final when there are fewer cities than the players.
8) Victory Points are calculated only at the end of the game. Victory Points are awarded for different tasks, so there are different ways to achieve Victory.
9) The Core Game (2-4 players) is a well-balanced strategy, with a simple and clear gameplay that can be easily mastered by casual players. However, the results of the game depend on the skills and experience of the player.
10) Expansions increase the number of players to 5-6, and increase the depth and asymmetry of the gameplay.

The game has adjustable gameplay complexity, modular design, high replayability and interaction. The game is especially suitable for players who like mechanics Tile Placement and Area Control.
categories: Bluffing, Negotiation, Renaissance, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Closed Drafting, Dice Rolling, Loans, Market, Tile Placement

name: Before the Gates of Troy: A Skirmish Game for the Trojan War
description:
Skirmish miniatures wargame rules for the Trojan War.

Achean (Greek) vs Troyan.

name: Shehkuh
description:
Hexagonal cards with seven different faces are drawn at random or traded with opponents to build patterns. Each player tries to collect the cards necessary to build their secret pattern consisting of initially two, then three, four, five and finally six cards. The first player to build their six-card pattern wins.

—user summary

name: Apothecaries (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
As a result of a recent plague, apothecaries have arrived and been set up within the cities of Carcassonne. These apothecaries rely on the surrounding countryside for supplies of particular herbs, to be distributed to the population, and to the alchemists, who use the herbs’ strange properties for experiments of their own…

Deploy your followers as alchemist on an apothecary, collect herbs and see how alchemy works. Maybe you earn points or you can move your follower to another feature or or or ...
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Adventure Game Starter Set: Woman Warrior
description:
Box blurb:

"ADVENTURE GAME STARTER SETS are a complete introduction to the hobby of Fantasy Adventure Gaming, all in one box. Each ADVENTURE GAME STARTER SET contains ten paintable plastic action figures in the standard 25mm size, a set of non-toxic water-based paints with instructions and brush, and a complete set of fast, playable rules for playing out your own fantasy adventures. Even the gaming die is included. (For two or more players, ages 10 and up)."

Each contains two leaflets, one containing the rules and adventure; the other, a painting guide for the miniatures. Though each game has a unique background story and series of encounters, the rules of play are identical. On the last page of the rules leaflet is a promotion for Heritage's soon-to-be-released (at that time) RPG, Swordbearer.

Gameplay consists of running two characters through a series of four encounters (combats). Each side in a combat takes turns. During a turn, all characters on the active side fight, then all characters on the active side may use magic, pick up or throw things, or run away.

Fighting is resolved by cross-indexing the roll of a six-sided die with the letter code of the attacker's weapon (A, B, C or D) on a table corresponding to the defender's armor (which may be light, medium, or heavy) in order to find how much damage, if any, was done to the defender.

The miniatures aren't necessary to play, and aren't even mentioned in the game rules.

The Woman Warrior - "the adventures of a young woman warrior and her friend as they do battle with Bandits, Kobolds (small fierce dog like creatures), giant Bugbears, and a huge fearsome Ogre, in a quest for treasure and glory."

name: Shieldwall: A Fantasy Mass Combat Game
description:
Shieldwall is a fast play set of fantasy mass combat rules. Designed for print-and-play, Shieldwall is an easy to learn and teach system that you can utilize for any collection of miniatures. A 17 page pdf includes:

- Rules for creating an army.
- Six scenarios that can be played alone or as campaigns.
- Print-and-Play deck of Special Event Cards.
- A complete magic system.

Army Composition
Armies are composed of 12 units total - a variety of infantry, skirmishers, missile troops, cavalry, generals and monsters. The game is model agnostic - so the number of models in these units is entirely up the players.

Scenario Forces
There are six scenarios included in Shieldwall. Once players decide on which scenario to choose, they randomly generate a force from their army dependent on the rules of the scenario. S

Combat
Units roll a number of dice dependent on their type, and results of 5 or 6 indicates a HIT has been scored on the enemy unit. Once a unit accumulates three or more HITs at the end of a turn, they are eliminated.

Special Event Cards
The friction of battle is represented in Shieldwall with a deck of Special Event Cards that can be printed from the pdf. During a game, players will draw hands of cards and then play them to modify attacks, execute special maneuvers and cast powerful spells

Magic System
The magic system in Shieldwall is directly tied to the Special Event Cards. Players can wield the powers of Order, Chaos, Life and Death to scatter their enemies from the battlefield. Shieldwall assumes every army has wizards steeped in arcane knowledge or clerics beseeching the Gods for miracles, so you are never penalized for not bringing a wizard. However, if you choose to, you can make your General an Arcane Master which unlocks additional spell effects if you play cards associated the proper school of magic that the general has pre-chosen.

So raise your shield, lower your spear, and join the ranks of the SHIELDWALL!

name: Tour d'Flick
description:
Tour d´Flick is a flicking race simulator, where 2 team of 3 riders compete in a vintage steampunk style cycling race.

The 3 riders are 1 Sprinter, 1 Climber and 1 Team Player. Each one has its own skills and attributes.

The game can be played by 2, 3 or 6 players. Each variant has its own caracteristics.

In the 2 player´s game, each player chose a team and play with it

For 3 players game, each player choose one kind of rider: Sprinter, Mountaneer or Team Player) and control those riders.
This variant represents an interesting asymetric twist where players will need to deal with different riders habilities.

With 6 players version, each player controls a single rider during the game, at the same time as partying with the other 2 players un his team, giving this version a mix of cooperative and competitive approach.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Flicking, Measurement Movement, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation

name: DOOM ON YOU: Safari Expansion Pack
description:
DOOM ON YOU is a friendly game of strategy, bribery, and destruction. The SAFARI expansion pack adds new animals, new battle cards, and new doom! Your GI•WRATH and RHI•NOPE are ready for battle!

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: DOOM ON YOU: Rainforest Expansion Pack
description:
The RAINFOREST expansion pack adds new animals, new battle cards, and new doom! Your ORANGU•DANG and TWO•CAN are ready for battle!

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Siege
description:
A one player game using a standard 54-card deck and one to three dice.

Send your castle's armies to protect it from the attackers and roll the dice to know the result of each fight. If the sum of any suit you couldn't stop top 25 points, you lose the game. Will you be able to finish the pile before it's too late?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Les bois d'Alkekan
description:
A two player game using a standard 54-card deck.

Each round, the top card of the draw pile is turned face up. It can be a treasure, a magic object, or a thief! Each player choses a card in his hand to try to get it or avoid it.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points win.

name: Loonacy: International Tabletop Day Expansion
description: An expansion for Loonacy containing five new cards featuring the International Tabletop Day logo paired with images from the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time

name: Crimson Skies: Spicy Air Tales – Volume 2
description:
Supplements to FASA's 1998 Crimson Skies (a game of aerial combat), the two volumes were more than just flavor text. Spicy Air Tales Vol.1 and Spicy Air Tales Vol.2 provided additional scenarios to play with the base game, adding some of the features disclosed in the contained stories.


This entry is for the Volume 2.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Pirates

name: Necromunda: Slave Ogryn Gang Tactics Cards
description:
Expand your games of Necromunda with these 26 cards, representing the myriad tricks and schemes that can be used to gain an advantage in the underhive. As well as 18 gang-specific Tactics cards that perfectly encapsulate the way that Slave Ogryn gangs fight, there are also 8 blank Fighter cards for you to keep track of your gang.

This box contains 26 100mm x 75mm cards for used in games of Necromunda:


18x Slave Ogryn gang-specific Tactics cards
8x Blank Fighter cards


You will need a copy of Necromunda: Underhive, or Necromunda: Dark Uprising, and Necromunda: House of Chains to use the contents of this set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Those Magnificent Men
description:
In 1923 a coalition of nations embarked on a convert mission of genocide. Deep in the Pacific Ocean the Last of the Strange forms of Man {Vampire, Werewolf, Merman, Mummy and Tinman} Tried to Fight off the Invaders.

You Play as a Three Man Crew of a Bi-plane Delivering goods, Rescuing Survivors and Shooting Down the Invaders.

The game plays in two phases. After selected the objective card, the first phase, the players draft cards one at a time a choose whether to hire the crew, or build the map. Once all players have 3 crew, the game moves to phase 2.

In phase 2, the players execute one of three action rows to pick goods, deliver goods, rescue survivors and shoot down invaders.

The game ends when the objective card is completed and the winner is the one with the most cash.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: 5150 Back Alley Bright Lights
description:
Welcome to New Hope City, where everyone deserves a second chance.

Back Alleys, Bright Lights is the blend of lite Role-Playing with a quick and easy set of combat rules. Combined, these will enhance your games and move your Story along at a brisk pace. New Hope City is home to over a dozen different Races, some friendly and some not so. You can choose to play as one of over a dozen Professions, where what’s legal is up to your interpretation.

Totally playable solo with rules for a Campaign with a simple way to gauge how well, or bad, you’re doing! Compatible with our other 5150 rules.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Compound
description:
Each card is a fragment of a real molecule. Create your own organic compound before it evaporates.

The goal of the game is to win as many cards as possible.

You have 6 pieces of molecules in your hand.

During their turn, each player must place one card from his hand.
The card placed must match the bonds of the other cards on the table, these bonds are used to build molecules.
When all the bonds have been connected, the molecule is complete.
The player who has put down the last card of a complete molecule wins the molecule.

When there are no more cards in the draw pile, the game ends.
The player with the most points and therefore the most cards wins.

name: Team Yankee: Yuri's Wolves – Soviet Forward Detachment
description:
The war Yuri had been training his men for had arrived, and though he had little doubt of the savage fighting to come, he was supremely confident in his men and their equipment.
He signalled the advance and his T-64 tanks rolled forward.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Clan War: Naga Army Expansion
description:
Clan War: Naga Army Expansion is a source book containing all the information needed to play a Naga Army in Clan War.

The Way of the Willow.
Bloodlines.
Rules additions.
Naga forces, units, and personalities.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Clan War: Scorpion Army Expansion
description:
Clan War: Scorpion Army Expansion is a source book containing all the information needed to play a Scorpion Army in Clan War.

History.
Rules additions.
Scorpion Clan treatise, forces, units, and personalities. Ishkawa's Allegiance.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Clan War: Toturi's Army and Yoritomo's Alliance
description:
Clan War: Toturi's Army and Yoritomo's Alliance is a source book containing all the information needed to play a Toturi's Army and Yoritomo's Alliance in Clan War

A Dark Path's Beginning.
Dawn of Storms.
Rules additions and errata.
Toturi/Yoritomo forces.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Clan War: Phoenix Army Expansion
description:
Clan War: Phoenix Army Expansion is a source book containing all the information needed to play a Phoenix Army in Clan War.

This 64-page book covers history of the house of the Phoenix; Strength of the Clan; Additional rules; Additional expansions; Rules errata; Phoenix Clan forces and Phoenix Clan philosopy, army structure and battle strategy.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Phoenix Command King Tiger: World War II Heavy Tanks
description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


This supplement to the Phoenix Command Mechanized Combat System provides the Status Sheets for the primary Heavy Tanks of World War II. Included are the German Pz VI Tiger, the Pz VI King Tiger, the Soviet KV1 with 76mm gun, the "Speedy" KV1S, the KV-85 with 85mm gun, the Joseph Stalin IS2 and IS2m Heavy Tanks with 122mm guns, and the US M4A3E2 "Jumbo" Assault Sherman.In addition, special rules for Vehicle Systems specific to World War II Tanks and Second Shot Accuracy are presented, along with full Vehicle Descriptions.

-from the back of the book
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Phoenix Command: Russian Roulette – The Breakup of the Soviet Union
description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


From the Baltic Republics to the Black Sea to the barricades in Moscow, Russian Roulette takes players to the scenes of the critical military events that led to the vast changes underway in the Soviet Union. Six historical and hypothetical battles are presented in this Scenario Pack, including:Soviet Intervention in Baku: When ethnic strife between Armenians and Azerbaijanis went out of control in early 1990, Soviet troops were called in to bring order to Baku, Azerbaijan's capital. This Scenario is a night street battle between Soviets and a crowd of well-armed Demonstrators.

Crackdown in Latvia: In January of 1991, the Soviets sent troops into seven different Republics in an attempt to end nationalist movements. In this Scenario, Soviet Special Forces fight Latvian police for control of the Interior Ministry building, in a battle that was televised internationally.

Other Scenarios cover Black Berets in Lithuania, Vigilantes in Azerbaijan, and Ethnic Strife in Georgia. There is even a Scenario for what might have happened if the Soviet military had tried to kill Boris Yeltsin during August's failed Coup. Each Scenario includes a detailed Map, special rules, and full data for all the combatants. Also included is background material for each of the Scenarios, plus an overview of the Soviet military and security forces.

-from the back cover
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Phoenix Command: World War II Weapon Data Supplement
description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


Now the Phoenix Command Small Arms Combat System lets you join the battles of World War II, with more than 80 of the most memorable weapons used during the conflict. All the major powers are represented: France, Germany, Great Britain, Italy, Japan, the Soviet Union, and the United States. Included are:- Pistols, from the Japanese 8mm Taisho 14 to the British Webley Mk6 .455 Revolver
- Sub-Machine Guns, from the German MP38/40 Schmeisser to the Allied Sten Mk2 and Mk3, and the famous Thompson "Tommygun"
- Bolt Action and Semi-Automatic Rifles, from the U.S. Ml Garand to the German KAR 98K
- Machine Guns, from the British Vickers Mkl to the German MG42 7.92mm Mauser
- Explosives, from the German Stick Grenade to the U.S. "Pineapple" Grenade

Fully illustrated, this supplement allows Phoenix Command players to include World War II and many post-war conflicts in their gaming.
-from the back cover
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Cuddly Cockroaches
description:
Cuddly Cockroaches is a player elimination tabletop card game, inspired by the game maker’s real-life cockroach infestation that happened during the quarantine of Spring of 2020.

In Cuddly Cockroaches, players are neighbors in an apartment building with a Cockroach problem. Every turn starts with more cockroaches getting added to the game. Some cockroaches have special abilities that make them more desirable roommates - but they are also worth more points. The goal is to be the last apartment standing with less than ten roach points.

During a turn, players can use their cockroaches to infest their neighbors' apartments or play supply cards like bug spray or Exterminator to kill their roaches and send them to the basement. If a player has more than ten roach points at the end of their turn, they’ve lost the game! Losers turn over the apartment mat to reveal they’ve been fumigated, and their roaches scurry off to remaining apartments. The last apartment standing wins!

Infesting is the central mechanic in Cuddly Cockroaches. To infest, players pick a target neighbor, select any number of roaches from their apartment to infest with, and roll a die. To successfully infest, the dice roll has to be higher than the total value of roach points they’re infesting with. If successful, those roaches get sent to the target neighbor’s apartment. Roll equal or lower than the point value of roaches chosen for an infestation, and those roaches stay in the player’s apartment. Either way, the player attempting the infestation gets to draw a supply card.

Infesting challenges players to gauge their odds as they gamble to get rid of roaches. Bet conservatively, and risk the chance of getting fumigated before your neighbors over time. Take too much of a gamble, and risk never getting rid of your roaches. Supply cards can pass roaches from your apartment to your neighbors, add points to your dice roll or actions to your turn, or kill roaches and send them to the basement. But the only way to draw supply cards is by infesting, so players are rewarded for playing aggressively. Players get two actions per turn, any combo of infesting, playing a supply card, and shuffling their hand into the deck, and drawing three. Just like a real-life roach infestation, it’s a losing battle of bugs - but a lucky roll can be a game-changer!

Be a good neighbor, and share your roaches!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Agincourt
description:
Agincourt is a simple game designed for the novice wargamer that allows you and a friend to control the opposing armies involved in the battle to see if you can change history.

While the game is aimed at the introductory level player it includes more complex rules such as ranged combat and blocking terrain effects.

The English victory in the 1415 battle of Agincourt crippled the French army and the nobility at its foundation. Unfortunately for English King Henry V, his son did not capitalise on the victory he bought with so much blood. Both these factors played a big part in extending the ‘hundred years war’ for another 4 decades.

—description from the publisher

name: Zug um Zug
description:
This game belongs to a series of three Selecta games for kids and adults where planning, combination, evaluating and deciding are important.
Every token is put on one of the eight fields. Step by step the player gets nearer to the correct order of the tokens.

name: Galactic War: Starship Rules
description:
A game of battles in deep space stats are included for a number of human and alien factions.

The rules use a simple system of opposed dice rolls any advantages or disadvantages simply add more dice, the game uses various different dice D4,6,8,10 and 10 and ideally you will need a couple of each/player.

Hopefully fun and easy to play the different factions abilities should make for some varied games with different challenges.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Color Wheel
description:
Each player has a "color wheel" card.

6 cards are removed from the deck to create the "degrees pile"

Players, via the Color Wheel card, must choose as quickly as possible the color card they think is closest to the degree.
When all players have drawn their cards, they turn the card over and see who is closest.
The closest player wins the point.
In case of a tie, no one gets a point.

A new round begins.

The player who won the point in the previous round takes the card from the top of the "degrees pile" (it symbolizes his or her point), otherwise it is discarded.

The game ends when the "degrees pile" is empty.

name: Taxi! Board Game: Aberdeen FC
description: A fun and educational game for all the family, themed around the shift of a taxi driver. Players (drivers) race from destination to destination picking up passengers and fares. Trivia question stops (based on the theme of each version of the game) allow for gaining £2 or £4 tips. Sound Off topics allow for players to gain more money by mouthing off on a subject to match key words for a minute. But watch out for the diversion! You don't want to get stuck there and lose out on fares! You can play for as long and short as you like. The player with most money at the end wins.

name: Taxi! Board Game: Glasgow
description: A fun and educational game for all the family, themed around the shift of a taxi driver. Players (drivers) race from destination to destination picking up passengers and fares. Trivia question stops (based on the theme of each version of the game) allow for gaining £2 or £4 tips. Sound Off topics allow for players to gain more money by mouthing off on a subject to match key words for a minute. But watch out for the diversion! You don't want to get stuck there and lose out on fares! You can play for as long and short as you like. The player with most money at the end wins.

name: World War III: Team Yankee – British Starter Force: Challenger Armoured Squadron
description:
With its usual professionalism, the British Army had prepared for war.
Now, as the Soviet Army flooded across the border into West Germany, it was ready and waiting.
Fox, Scorpion and Scimitar recon vehicles skirmished with the Soviet forward detachments as the Challenger and Chieftain armoured regiments waited. The infantry held the towns and woods, forcing the enemy into killing zones, new Warrior infantry fighting vehicles in fire support. If anything broke through, the airmobile troops in their Lynx helicopters would hold them. The British Army is ready.

Includes:

Five Challenger Tanks
Two Chieftain Tanks
Two Warrior with Milan Anti-tank Vehicles
Two Scimitar or Scorpion Light Tanks
Four Fox Armoured Cards,
Two, MLRS Rocket Launchers
Two plastic Lynx helicopters
Eight rare-earth magnets
Four decal sheets
One Complete A5 Rulebook,
One British "Start Here Booklet"
Eleven Unit cards
One set of Death Or Glory Tokens
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Dragon Dice: 2-Player Starter – Firewalker VS Treefolk
description:
2-Player Starter Set- All the dice you need to begin your adventures! 66% more health than our previous starters! (30 health of each race and 4 Dragons!)

Bring the flaming might of the Firewalkers and the sturdy power of the Treefolk to your battlefield.

The Starter Set has all two players need to begin their campaign: 28 six-sided unit dice, 4 ten-sided monster dice; 4 eight-sided terrain dice; 4 twelve-sided dragon dice. It also contains two paper play mats and the Starter Rule Book. You can combine starter sets or add more dice from kicker packs to expand your armies.

name: Clue: Riverdale
description:
The idyllic town of Riverdale has a secret. You must discover WHO killed Jason Blossom, WHAT weapon they used, and WHERE they killed him. Take on the roles of your favorite Riverdale characters to solve the mystery.

Contents:
Custom Game Board
6 Suspect Movers
6 Personality Cards
21 Rumor cards
18 Intrigue Cards
Custom Score pad
Envelope
6 Custom Zinc Tokens
2 Dice
Rules

-description from publisher's website
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Team Yankee: NATO's First Line – NATO Tank Company
description:
NATO's troops stand ready on the border awaiting the Soviet onslaught, confident in their abilities and equipment they have been given.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Team Yankee: Durand's Devils – French Rapid Action Group
description:
Durand's Devils is a great way to begin building your French force with three AMX-30 tanks and two Gazelle helicopters, it provides some fantastic models that can fill many roles in your army.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: ASCII Planets
description:
ASCII Planets is an open source board game--written in LaTeX--in which 1–7 players lead an entire planet through the modern age into a warp-capable civilization by advancing Technology and Culture, training Population, constructing Starships, and interacting through Trade or inter-planetary conquest.

—description from the designer

name: Best 11 Board Game: Atalanta Bergamasca Calcio
description:
Your goal in Best 11 Atalanta Bergamasca Calcio is to field a personal formation of your favorite team.
Each player receives a game form that he must complete by purchasing the most suitable players, hiring a coach and possibly also completing the stadium.
Scoring goals is essential to decrease your opponent chances of winning and increase your own.
The use of Management, Event and Action cards will make the game always unpredictable.
Each box allows a maximum of 5 players to participate in the game, but it is possible to play BEST11 by challenging friends with teams other than yours.
All the Best 11 boxes contain the official squad of the chosen team, only the Juve one also contains some players from the past (such as Del Piero, Trezeguet, etc ...).


Best 11 è un gioco in scatola il cui obiettivo è quello di mettere in campo una personalissima formazione della propria squadra del cuore. Ogni giocatore riceve un modulo di gioco che dovrà completare acquistando i giocatori più adatti, ingaggiando un allenatore ed eventualmente completando anche lo stadio. Cercare di segnare dei gol agli avversari è essenziale per diminuire le loro possibilità di vittoria ed incrementare le proprie. L’utilizzo di carte Gestione, Avvenimento ed Azione permetterà di rendere il gioco sempre imprevedibile. Ogni scatola consente ad un massimo di 5 giocatori di partecipare alla partita, ma è possibile giocare a BEST11 sfidando amici con squadre diverse dalla tua. Tutte le scatole Best 11 contengono la rosa ufficiale della squadra scelta, solo quella della Juve contiene in aggiunta anche alcuni giocatori del passato (tipo Del Piero, Trezeguet, ecc…)

name: This Is Not a Test: Absolutely Dangerous The Big Book of Relics, Robots, and Other Deadly Technologies !
description:
Absolutely Dangerous: The Big Book of Relics, Robots, and Other Deadly Technologies is an expansion for This Is Not a Test', a 28mm wargame set in a post-apocalyptic United States, where warbands fight for survival, power, and greed.
A celebration of the hubris of man and the danger of technology run amok.
It features:

Full Robot Warband Rules: own full warband for robots
Special Rules: 30 upgrades for robots
Freelancers: Available to all warbands, these robots bring the party.
Robot Relics: ONLY for robots
6 Scenarios
30+ Relics: for everybody
Power Armor Upgrades: a new type of relic option
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Snowball
description:
The game is played on an 8x8 board. There are two players: White and Blue. Each player has 16 Discs that are arranged on their second and third rows, respectively.

A Disc moves by taking a single step in any direction to an empty space. A Disc may also hop over a single, friendly piece to the empty space just beyond. But it may not hop over an enemy piece.

A Disc captures enemy pieces by withdrawal. This means if a Disc begins its turn with an enemy Disc adjacent, it may take a single step backwards, in the opposite direction, to the empty space just behind it. The enemy Disc is then removed from the board.

For its first turn, White makes one move, followed by Blue making two moves; White then makes three moves, and so on – creating a “Snowball Effect” of moves.

The player who eliminates all of his opponent’s pieces wins.

-description from designer

name: Fair Game
description:
Roll a set of colored dice trying to match combinations on the cards. Be the first to make a combination, and it's Fair Game to take a card -- from the center or from other players. First to collect 4 cards wins the game.

Contents:
24 Dice (4 Sets of 6)
26 Combination Cards
Instructions
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Take That

name: Micro Chapbook RPG: The Board Game
description:
Micro Chapbook RPG is a board game of fantasy adventure using the popular Micro Chapbook RPG game system. Players will create their own characters from scratch using the ultra-simple rules included here. Those heroes will set out on grand adventures across the land of Hellik Water.

Travel in the open overworld hunting monsters for gold and picking up quests. Enter the dungeons of the land to kill mighty villains and earn clout and fame.

This game stands on its own as a complete adventure board game BUT may also be used as a supplement for the Micro Chapbook Roleplaying Game system.

Included in the print and play version is:


A two-section square board game. The World Map and the Dungeon Map.
A Deck of Character Portraits.
A Deck of Quest Cards.
A Deck of Location Cards.
A Deck of Spell Cards.
Damage Cards
Character Sheets
Game Instructions
Build Tips
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Events, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Fuga dalla Preistoria
description:
It Is a Escape Room game for children.
It is an educational game to learn history.
In that case we would be catapulted in Prehystory.
We have to help the main character to find a professor disappeared in a time vortex solving riddles.

name: Tag Team: Uptown Jailbirds vs. Downtown Bullies
description:
These days it's not enough to be the toughest crew on the streets; you need to make sure everyone knows it, too. Bring enough cans of spray paint to tag walls all over town, and enough muscle to make sure no one else does. There's nothing quite as satisfying as watching little punks drop their spray cans and run at the very sight of you — just make sure that there isn't someone even bigger right around the corner!

In Tag Team, you play as a crew of Eagles, Bulldogs, Alligators or Gorillas, defending your turf by bluffing your way through battles each day. Players simultaneously reveal their leader characters, and, if nobody backs down, their backup characters join the fight. The winner tags their opponent's territory as a reward. In the end, the crew with the most tagged territory wins.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Alchematch
description:
It’s your first day at Potion school! Can you mix and match the elixirs to create the most magical brew?

SETUP
Group all of your Blinks together to create your bubbling cauldron. The game begins the moment you do!

GAMEPLAY
Each turn, rearrange your Blinks in an attempt to create matches. A “match” is 3 or more Blinks of the same color in a cluster. Matched Blinks get replaced by new colors. Sometimes, new colors will immediately create a match, and these matches will cascade one after the other if you position your Blinks correctly.

You’ll notice as you make matches that your Blinks will begin bubbling - this shows how alchemically activated each Blink is. Each time a Blink is matched, it increases in alchemical power, which causes it to bubble more and more intensely. Eventually, after 10 matches, a Blink can become a Bomb.

Bombs appear as spinning points of color. To activate a Bomb, click the Blink. This will cause an alchemical explosion, turning all adjacent Blinks to the color of the bomb, and automatically creating a huge matching cluster.

But be careful - Bombs only last a few seconds before they revert back to their basic form. If you miss it, you’ll have to power up that Blink again.

If you are playing with 12 or fewer Blinks, it is possible to end up in a situation where no matches are possible. If this happens, simply triple-click a single Blink to change its color, potentially creating a match.

WIN CONDITION
Alchematch has no explicit goal, and can be played endlessly!

VARIANT RULES
Alchematch can be played by a stricter set of rules for greater challenge. First, place 12 Blinks in a 3 x 4 rhombus formation, with distinct rows and columns.

During gameplay, instead of moving Blinks freely, you must instead break off rows or columns of the rhombus and re-attach them to the opposite end. You may rotate the rows or columns, but must always maintain the overall shape. This requires you to think spatially to make matches each turn.

name: LoveLive!: School Idol Collection
description:
LoveLive! School Idol Collection is a trading card game of LoveLive! project.
This card game is different from most other trading card games, it can be player by 2 or more players.
In this game, players do one action each turn, play a character card, draw cards until have 4 card in hand or hold a live with characters. Each live card has a score, and the player who get 9 scores will win the game.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: たぎる交差 (Tagiru Kōsa)
description:
In たぎる交差 (Tagiru Kōsa), two players compete to deduce each other's scoring criteria, and the one who is able to do so first, wins.

More specifically, each player has a set of nine strips of paper; three each in three colors, with each color having one strip of A's, B's, and C's. Each player takes three scoring chips at random from a selection of twelve and assigns them point values of +2, +1, or -1. These criteria will look at the number of intersections of certain combinations, such as A strips crossing B strips, or red strips crossing other red strips.

The first player begins by playing one of their strips. The second player continues, placing a strip such that it intersects the first strip. Each player will then place one additional strip in turn, which must cross at least one strip, and may not make an intersection of more than 2 strips.

Once this is complete, each player calculates their sore. They then communicate to their opponent how many times in total their three criteria were triggered, and how many total points were earned. They only report these 2 numbers in total, and not broken down by each of the three criteria.

A three-minute deduction phase of the game then begins, as the players try to deduce which three scoring criteria the other player has in which slot. If a player attempts a guess and is wrong, their opponent secretly looks at one of the unused criteria.

If neither player guesses correctly, the crossing pattern and scoring results remain, and the players play additional rounds as necessary (up to 4 total rounds) with the same scoring criteria and their remaining strips, until one player wins or the game ends in a draw.

name: Run Fight or Die: Reloaded Promo Pack 2
description:
This pack includes:

1 Zombie Cosplayer
1 Diner
2 Energy Bars
2 Flamethrowers
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: History Heroes: World War II
description:
History Heroes: World War II educational card games contain individual cards of forty of the most significant characters in World War Two. Each card is fantastically illustrated to represent the relevant character and shows their dates, their flag of birthplace and seven memorable and often moving facts about them.

History Heroes: World War II characters are ‘heroes’ AND ‘anti-heroes’ unsurprisingly. They range from the key political and military figures, such as Chamberlain, Churchill, Roosevelt, Eisenhower, Hitler, Stalin, Mussolini, Emperor Hirohito, Field Marshal Montgomery, Rommel and the like to many others, who shaped and influenced World War Two. Great innovators, such as Barnes Wallis, institutions and courageous people, such as Oskar Schindler, Evacuees, The Women’s Land Army, Raoul Wallenberg and Kindertransport all appear on cards in the game. The sweep of characters in the game is stark, moving and often inspiring.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts about each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Educational, Trivia, World War II

name: Brúnó Budapesten Dunafutam
description:
Brúnó visits his parents at the Budapest Zoo, and then they go by car to the Kopaszi Dam, where they also run into the Orsi family. Players also have to go along the road, through the bridges of Budapest. Who will reach the finish line soonest? The journey may be long, but it’s no wonder there are plenty to see. Little travelers have to roll the dice first, then follow the instructions on the given field and move towards the goal!

The rules are simple and easy to follow and you can play a game in an average of 15-20 minutes.

The drawings of Erika Bartos acquaint the children with the famous buildings, public spaces and bridges of Budapest in a simplified, yet perfectly recognizable way.

After the highly successful Brúnó board game collection in Budapest, now the Danube and its bridges have taken the lead.

Board games can be easily and wonderfully linked to Brúnó Budapest books. Playing to get acquainted with the image and sights of the capital as a young child.

name: シネマトペ (Cinematopoeia)
description:
シネマトペ (Cinematopoeia) is a communication, party game from Japan, where players make sounds to match scenes in a movie. The game is in English and Japanese.
