You are in the movie theatre, but the sound effects have disappeared. So you must make the sounds yourself! Did the vase break? Did you get in the time machine? What kind of sound do you hear then?

It's a game where you freely say the sounds you imagine and match up ideas! The game is in Japanese and English, with illustrations, so playing with foreigners is easy. Discover fun new expressions!

There is no wrong answer for sound effects. Feel free to express your own sounds and have fun!

There are themes for actions, like 'broken vase' and themes like 'falling in love' or 'riding in a time machine'. It is a fun game to show your individuality. Hitting the right card for other people's sounds is exciting too.

The game has 30 cards with themes written in Japanese and English, and 30 cards with illustrations of movie scenes. A player makes the missing sound effect from the theme, and the others try to pick the matching scene card as fast as they can. The game is very simple to learn and play. Children can play as easily as adults, so it is a good family game.

花瓶が割れた？タイムマシンに乗った？その時、聞こえる音ってどんな音？
イメージする音を自由に言って、みんなで当て合うゲームです！
英語にも対応しています。外国の方と遊んでも表現が変わって楽しい！

ここは効果音が消えた映画館。

なぜなら、音をつけるのはアナタだから！

お題カードの場面の音を想像して、自分で好きな音をつけましよう！

他のプレイヤーはイラストカードからどの場面か探してタッチしましょう。

カルタ形式のゲームなので、ルール簡単ですぐに遊べます。

お題カード、イラストカードは30種類あります。

子供から大人まで楽しめるゲームなので、ご家族にもおすすめです。

効果音に正解はありません。自分の音を自由に表現して楽しんでください！

「花瓶が割れた」などの擬音語や、「恋に落ちた」「タイムマシンに乗った」などの擬態語のお題もあり個性がでるのが楽しいゲームです。

他の人の音を当てるのも、わいわい盛り上がりますよ。

簡単なルールですぐに遊べる、コミュニケーションゲームです。
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Real-Time, Speed Matching

name: Battle of the Nations 1813: Connewitz & Wachau
description:
Expansion 1 (Connewitz) contains a rule (additional actions). The tiles that are needed to play the expansion are inside the base game.

Expansion 2 (Wachau) contains wooden figures (and a new rule). It allows to play the game with 3 players.

-description from designer

name: Artificial Life 101: Creating Monsters for Undergrad Students
description:
Each player has to gather sets of resources to build a monster from fantasy or sci-fi as a semester thesis. They only have 15 days (rounds) left.

The players gain victory points by turning in sets of resources described by their thesis cards, which are unique to each player and to be kept secret as long as possible. Each thesis emphasises three of the five available resource categories: Science, Magic, Components, Flesh and Energy.

To gather resources, they have to build a laboratory which transform, splits or fuses resources or teleports them all over the place. The players vie for space and race against time to gather the right material in a chaotic card game with a modular playing field and engine-building elements.

Each turn consists of three phases: In the first phase a player adds a tile to or modifies a tile of their laboratory to give it more functions, like turning certain resources into others, duplicating resources or fusing certain resources into more resources of another kind. A smartly planned lab can set of chain reactions to create lots of the wanted resources from any kind of original resource.

In the second phase, they can choose to either feed a new, randomly determined resource into their lab, or let resources in the lab go into the next stage of a reaction.

In the third phase, they can turn in resources gathered in their lab for points or special action cards, which can help them or hinder other players through various bonuses. Turning in resources for points reveals a players thesis to other players, so they can better try to sabotage their labs.

After fifteen rounds, the player who turned in the most relevant sets for their thesis wins. There are multiple strategies to build a functioning lab with their own risks and rewards, and until the last turn there can often be dramatic changes in the score.

-description from designer

name: Limelight
description:
Limelight is played on a 4x4 grid with the corners cut off using pieces in two colors. White plays first and has 11 pieces, black has 10.

On a turn a player enters a piece on one of the edge spaces, pushing a piece there to the next space and so on. However, pieces may not be pushed off the board.

When all pieces have been played the board will be full. The player with the most pieces in the nine central squares wins.

The game can be played on a larger board with more pieces. If the center region has an even number of spaces and the players tie, the first player wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Subbuteo Shuffle Card Game
description:
Subbuteo Shuffle Card Game


Pass the ball from player to player by matching the balls on the cards, then shoot for goal!


The first team to score three goals wins

Includes 45 Player Cards, 6 Goalie Cards and 1 Coin Card


Rules:
1. Pick up your four Players.
2. Work out how many Players you can play in a horizontal line (your ‘pass line’) on the table in front of you. (You can only play a card if the ball on it matches the position(s) of the ball(s) on the card(s) next to it ) when two Player cards are played next to each other, they make a complete ball..
3. If you can play one, two or three Players to start your pass line, do that. If you’re able to play all four Players, only play three onto the table and skip to the Shoot for Goal!
4. At the end of your turn, pick up new cards from your Players pile so that you’re holding four again. Play switches to the other team. Continue taking turns until you can play your fifth Player card into your pass line, It’s time to Shoot for Goal!
You can play all four of your Players on your first turn, OR if you can play a fifth Player on a later turn, it’s time to Shoot for Goal. Choose which Player you’re going to use to shoot for a goal.
The Opposing team: Look at your opponent’s pass line and work out where you think the ball might go next. Choose which of your Goalies you think will save the shot!
Both teams: Play your chosen cards onto the pass line at the same time.
Did your goalie save the ball?

Yes! Give the Goalie back to your opponent and remove your last two Players from the pass line. Put your two Players to the bottom of your pile. Play switches to the other team.
No! GOOOAAAL! Remove all cards that have been played by both teams and put them to the bottom of your Player piles.



Start playing again, with four new Players each, The team that let the goal in takes the first turn.
Then there are special moves Tackling, Substitutions and Passing Back.

The winner of the game is first player to score 3 goals.

name: セメタリーセメラレタリー (Cemetery Conqueror)
description:
セメタリーセメラレタリー (Cemetery Conqueror) is a game from Japan. You are the caretaker at an old cemetery. You hear the voices of the dead call out for their families to visit. But all the graves are dirty and overgrown. You set to restoring the graves, so the families will return again and honour their ancestors.

During the game you use your dice to make money, and then bid in auctions to complete work patterns using cubes, restoring the different graves in the cemetery and expanded your influence over the graveyard.
user summary

name: ボードゲーム工場～魔女と弟子たち～ (Boardgamemill ～Witches and Apprentice Fairies～)
description:
ボードゲーム工場～魔女と弟子たち～ (Board Game Koujou ～Majo to Deshi Tachi～) Boardgamemill ～Witches and Apprentice Fairies～ is a speed co-operative game produced by a Japanese company that actually manufactures boardgames for doujin circles.

In this game, the players are apprentice fairies working under craftspeople in the witches' board game mill! The number of Blueprint cards to complete and ship in 5 minutes will determine the players' level of craftsmanship.

Place the tiles on the Mill board according to the Blueprint cards, inspect and then ship them!

The tiles come in 4 shapes, 5 colors, and 3 different surface textures (glossy, embossed matte, and embossed grain), so try to identify them carefully. The craftspeople basically work with one hand!

First, choose a witch or senior fairy's magic to help your work. When you begin running out of the tiles, start on the fun supply mission to get them back.

職人の妖精の見習いになって、魔女のボードゲーム工場で働こう！
５分間に、設計書カードを何枚完成して出荷出来るかで、プレーヤーの職人レベルが決まるよ。
設計書カードの通りに工場ボードにタイルを並べて、検品したら出荷！
タイルには４つの形、５つの色、３種の表面加工（ツヤツヤ、絹目エンボス、石目エンボス）があるからしっかり見極めよう。
職人の作業は基本片手で行います！
作業を助ける魔女や先輩妖精の魔法を最初に選んでね。
使えるタイルが少なくなったら、楽しい仕入れミッションをして、タイルを取り戻します。
publisher's summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Fantasy, Industry / Manufacturing, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Coverage, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement
publishers: Banjo Yugi Seisakujo BGM (盤上遊戯製作所 BGM)

name: Banned Books: Old Major
description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from Animal Farm by George Orwell, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club July 2018 package.

Old Major:
(1) Inspire: Shuffle and re-deal the action cards.
(2) Revolt: Skip the Powers this turn.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Corsair
description:
Only one pirate can have the honor of the Pirate King. Unfortunately, the Pirate King's seat is empty, but you need to pay attention to other pirates to get that place. Can you be the first pirate king?

This game is for 2-4 players. Your goal is to earn more honor than anyone else and become a pirate king.

There are times when someone will take a risk to gain fame, and some will predict their own victory through reasoning. But be careful. Pirates always endure sacrifices.

A card that you think is a good card can be a bad card. Conversely, bad cards can give off a light that you thought was impossible.

Everything is in the hands of the Pirate King candidates.

<Purpose of the game>
1. The one with the most Corsair fame by summoning pirates wins.

<Game ready>
1. Distribute cards according to the number of players.
ex) 2 people: 8 sheets, 3 people: 6 sheets, 4 people: 4 sheets

<Game play>
1. Select a line, point to the player playing the game on the line, and draw one of those cards.
2. Then place one of the cards in the center (sea). This is the end of the turn.

Players with 1 card cannot be selected.
When placing in the center (sea), it cannot be deployed if there are hostile pirates.


3. All players play until one card remains.
4. All players reveal the cards in their hand if they have played until one card is left. The player who reveals the lowest numbered card wins. Players who win this way receive 1 fame chip.

If (12) and (1) or (2) are played together, the player holding the (12) card wins.
If (0) and (1) or (12) are played together, the player holding the (0) card wins.


<Game ends>
1. The player with 2 fame chips wins.
mechanics: Induction, Lose a Turn, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: MAGUS NOVATUS
description:
Once a year, the renowned Ludikah School of Witchcraft choose a student to turn them into a great wizard. The apprentice that displays their magical skills will be the chosen one!
Cast spells by mixing potions correctly and by using some magical items. Be careful! Some spells may have unexpected effects and they may bring chaos among the novice wizards.
MAGUS NOVATUS is a family game with the perfect combination of decision, chance and interaction. It guarantees a great fun to all players in their role of novice wizards.

The goal in MAGUS NOVATUS is to be the player with the most point at the end of the game. In order to do so, players will try to get as many Spell cards as possible, which will grant 2, 3 or 4 points depending on their difficulty.

The components the boardgame are cards, dice and Measuring Cylinder marker.

MAGUS NOVATUS is a boardgame for 2-4 players, 30 minutes and +8 years old.

Una vez al año, la prestigiosa escuela de magia Ludikah elige a un alumno para convertirlo en un gran mago. Aquel aprendiz que demuestre sus dotes mágicas será el elegido.
Realiza hechizos combinando las pociones de forma correcta y haciendo uso de algunos objetos mágicos. ¡Pero cuidado! Algunos hechizos pueden tener efectos inesperados y desencadenar el caos entre los magos novatos.

Magus Novatus es un juego para toda la familia con la mezcla perfecta de decisión, azar e interacción que asegurará una gran diversión a los jugadores en su papel de magos novatos.
El objetivo en MAGUS NOVATUS es ser el jugador con más puntos al final de la partida. Para ello, los jugadores intentarán conseguir todas las cartas de hechizo posibles, las cuales otorgarán 2, 3 o 4 puntos según su dificultad.

El juego está compuesto por cartas, un dado y una probeta para marcador de duración de la partida.

MAGUS NOVATUS es un juego para 2-4 jugadores, de 30 minutos de duración y para jugadores a partir de 8 años de edad.

name: Die Olchis: Wer bin ich?
description: Ask questions to the other players to find out who you are.

name: Alfa i omega
description:
Promotional item added to Mӧller's products. This game is a clone of Spot it! but with only 31 cards and 6 symbols on each card. Each card features eight different symbols, with the symbols varying in size from one card to the next. Any two cards have exactly one symbol in common. The rulebook explains only one micro game in which players are dealt all cards and 1 card is left in the middle. Then all players try to get rid of their cards by matching symbols with their card and the current card in the middle. The winner is the player that gets rid of their cards first.

—user summary
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game, Real-time

name: White Steeds and Seax
description:
An adaption of the Dark Age Infantry Slog rules adding cavalry, White Steeds and Seax is a simple set of miniatures wargaming rules for Dark Age / Arthurian Britain.

The combat system, inherited from DAIS, is unusual; in each combat, a single die is rolled to see which stat (aggression, formation, or strength) is "trumps" for that round; the side with the lower relevant stat suffers damage to its stats. The table rolled on to determine trumps changes from turn to turn, with agression being most important at the beginning of a combat, gradually losing importance to first formation and then strength.

name: Shadow Oracle
description:
Aside from being an esoteric guide, Shadow Oracle is a fully playable solitaire card game that involves building card sequences as a means to win; not unlike many games that use traditional playing cards. Card suits are referred to as the voices, which encompass five categories (evolution, hedonism, reason, science, and shadow). These categories help distinguish associated card text.

A session of Shadow Oracle consists of two segments, the game segment and the esoteric segment. The game segment is necessary for performing the esoteric segment. However, the esoteric segment is not necessary for a full game experience (the game can be played strictly on its own).

The game involves building three columns of cards before a game-ending trigger occurs. If the game segment is completed successfully, a follow-up procedure narrows down the cards used in the esoteric segment. The final step involves reading and interpreting the card text. The card text draws on the wisdom of non-hallowed disciplines to provide insight for your decision-making conundrum.

—description from the designer

name: Devolution: The Game
description:
Inspired by the Max Brooks novel, Devolution.

You are a resident of Greenloop: a small, high-tech eco-community nestled in the Cascade Range. Since the Mount Rainier eruption, you have been cut off from the outside world, trapped in the wilderness with beasts of terrifying strength and ferocity.

CAN YOU SURVIVE THE SASQUATCH ATTACK?

Your objective is to survive the longest while exploring for resources. But the threat of a Sasquatch attack looms in the trees...

A survival game for two to four players. Combine two decks to play with up to eight people.

-- Description from the publisher.

Gameplay: players start with an alarm card (that they can use once to escape a Sasquatch), and two other cards in-hand. The cards are resources that you can use to fend off a Sasquatch attack.

On your turn, you draw a card. Then you have the option to: draw a second card, trade one of the cards in your hand with one of the cards in the discard pile, or end your turn. However, if during your turn you drew a Sasquatch card or two, now you have to deal with it! Hopefully you have the resources you need in hand in order to either flee from or kill the Sasquatch(es).

If you kill a Sasquatch (by discarding javelin cards), you keep the Sasquatch card near you as your score and you get to take any item from the discard pile. If you flee from the Sasquatch (by dropping rations, sounding your alarm, or using torch cards) then the Sasquatch card(s) get shuffled back into the draw pile.

If you cannot flee from or kill the Sasquatch, then you have been killed and you are out of the game. The last player remaining in the game is the winner.

name: Only the Strong Survive
description:
Only the Strong Survive is a game of Dinosaur vs. Dinosaur combat!
You lead either a single dinosaur or small herd of them in the battle for survival! This is a scale and model agnostic system that works with any size dinosaur models or toys you own.

Each dinosaur has a pool of Instinct Dice that it allocates to different actions as you play.
The core mechanic is an opposed dice roll with non-replenishing pools.
Battle is swift, mobile and full of decisions.
Fluid game mechanics keep all players in the game as play moves quickly between players.
The simple (but not easy) game mechanics work great with new gamers or seasoned tabletop pros.

Join the battle for dinosaur survival today! Only the Strong Survive!

—description from the publisher

name: Dig Down Dwarf (Second Edition): Gems of Norcia!
description:
Gems of Norcia is an optional expansion for Dig Down Dwarf. It adds a catch-up mechanic to the base game.

You gain these gems on your turn if you happen to come up empty on your dice rolls. Some of the gems are more rare than others and each are scored a bit differently.
categories: Deduction, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Five Klicks Upgrade Pack
description:
Time to power up your game. The Upgrade Pack adds the following content to Five Klicks

Talents - 20 special skills for the battle field and off of it, to help make your characters cooler and more distinctive.
Enhanced encounter table, updating the rulebook table to be tougher, more challenging and more interesting.
Story Points to tweak the outcomes of your games.
Gun upgrades. Tweak your firearms to create the perfect gun for your hero.
Chapter 1.1. Continue playing after you win, with increased difficulty.


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Mortem et Gloriam: Battles of the Great Commanders 1 – Age of Attila
description:
Mortem et Gloriam: Battles of the Great Commanders 1 – Age of Attila covers campaigns around the Fall of the Roman Empire. This companion book covers the context, notable leaders, armies, history, campaigns and major battles of a specific period of ancient history, combining the latest research into a guide to the period. The books contain much detail that is useful to any Ancients gamer and, in addition, ready-made refights and campaign ideas for use with Mortem et Gloriam ruleset.

This book is a supplement for the Mortem et Gloriam Compendium Edition; it is not a standalone set of rules.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Reactor No.4
description:
Comrades! Disaster has struck the city of Meeplersk! REACTOR No.4 at the Boris Yeltzin Nuclear Power Facility has exploded. A tumultuous fire has started spreading radioactive material into the air and the explosion has compromised the dam at the water cooling reservoir. The situation is grave and the Soviet high command is looking for someone to blame. We must rescue our loyal comrades and prove to the Premier we should not be the one sentenced to the Gulag!

In Reactor No.4 players take turns to mitigate disasters occurring as a result of an explosion in a Nuclear Power Plant. Each round the map is modified by wind blowing fires and nuclear fallout across a map as well as new fires and floods breaking out.

The players then take two of the following actions in an attempt to score points:

Move up to 2 adjacent locations
Evacuate survivors (score 1 VP per survivor)
Extinguish fires (score 1 VP per fire)
Pump out flood water (score 1 VP per flood)
Clean up radiation (score 1 VP per radiation)


The available actions change each round and some locations provide modifications to scoring, or allow additional actions to be taken.

At the end of each round the level of disappointment felt by the Soviet High Command is modified based on the number of deaths as well as unresolved disasters on prized locations.

Once the disappointment level reaches 20 the game ends and the lowest scoring player is sent to the Gulag!

—description from the designer

name: トポロメモリー3 (Topolomemory 3)
description:
トポロメモリー3 (Topolomemory 3) is a stand-alone expansion to トポロメモリー (TOPOLOMEMORY). It follows the same gameplay but introduces even more complex shapes, including English words and detailed images. The game also has an improved quality cardstock to the original edition. It can be played alone, or mixed in with Topolomemory, and/or トポロメモリー２ (Topolomemory 2).

トポロメモリー (TOPOLOMEMORY) is a Japanese card game based on the traditional matching game Karuta.

Topolomemory is a concentration game in which you have to match shapes using the principles of Topology. In it's basic form, topology shows us that a doughnut is the same as a coffee mug.

Lay out the tiles with various images on them and whoever most quickly identifies pairs that match topologically gets to collect the pair. The player with the most pairs wins the game. The game game be played by more than five players, especially in teams.
User summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Party Game
publishers: Banso Inc. (株式会社バンソウ)

name: The Siege of Chipyong-Ni
description:
The second issue of the Mini Wargame Magazine contains a wargame that simulates the battle of Chipyong-Ni during the Korean War.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Chipyong-ni

name: Top Wing: Island Rescue Game
description:
Based on the children's animated series Top Wing, players traverse the board while completing missions to gain badges and earn their wings. Take on the role of one of the four cadets and race to the rescue.

On each player's turn, they spin the spinner and move their chosen cadet. Players must earn badges by landing on the appropriate spaces on the board. Once a player has earned one badge of every color, the game is over and that player is declared the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Adult Choices
description:
Choices transports players into the world of decision making. It is an adventure of thought that begins with a dilemma and ends with a choice. Tucked in between is competition, verbal action, and a lot of guesswork.

—description from the back of the box

name: North Dakota-opoly
description:
Buy your favorite North Dakota properties, increase your rent by collecting Cabins and trading them for Lodges. Sound easy? Well, add in some lawnmower racing, the IRS and a drought and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: BelLiguria! (Fan expansion for RisiKo!)
description:
Print and Play fan expansion for RisiKo!

Includes a map of Liguria, 54 territory cards (with 3 wild cards) and 14 secret objective cards. You will need a RisiKo! box to play.

The map is divided according to suggestions from the Independence Movement of Liguria.

—user summary
categories: Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Now That's What I Call Music Card Game
description:
Re-live the last few decades of great music in this fast moving card game based on the chart topping Now That's What I Call Music albums.
Players rolls a die to determine which question they will answer. If they get the answer right they keep the card and place it in front of them, showing the letter on the back.
The first player to spell "N O W !" using the cards wins.

A game of escalation where everyone can lose.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song 99 Red Balloons by Nena.

Our second month of One Hit Wonders is based on 99 Red Balloons, which was a one hit wonder in the US, but one of many in Nena's native Germany. Other hits include Irgendwie, irgendwo, irgendwann and ? (Fragezeichen).

Designed by Suzanne Zinsli (of Cardboard Edison) this is a neat trick taking game where players are trying to reach the end of the cold war track (9 spaces) before the world war track reaches 9, with 9's being trump!

—description from the publisher


A standard deck of cars is dealt evenly among the players.

A token for each player is put at the beginning of the Cold War track, and another token is put in the World War track.

In each round, every player clockwise takes an action:
- Escalate: play a higher card in the same suit, or any card if you don't have any in suit.
- Stand down: pass until next round.
- Challenge: Play a 9 card (trump, black 9s, and super trump, red 9s).

Play continues until all but one player passes, or if two same-color 9s are played. The player who played the highest on-suit card (or trump or supertrump) takes all the cards played this round.

Set aside all 9s played each round. When all four 9s are played, the hand is over. At the end of the hand, discard any cards in your hand, then add up points for the cards you collected by winning rounds.

If your score was positive, advance your token in the Cold War track. Then, if any player has negative points, take the lowest score and add it to the World War track. If any player reaches the end of the Cold War track, they win. If the World War track reaches its end before any player wins, everyone loses.


99 is a postcard game sent to Board Game of the Month Club subscribers in the February 2017 package.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dove sei, piccolo Giallo?
description:
Game inspired from the book "Little Blue and Little Yellow" it is a simple game in which there is a course based on the roll of the dice.
It is a two players game for little children in which there are boxes to balance the game.

—user summary

name: Alias: Ensimmäinen Muumi
description: A word explanation game in Finnish starting from ages 3 and up. The game has cards with pictures and the words are written both in Finnish and in Swedish. The game itself is set in Moominvalley and many characters are presented in playing cards.

name: Blah Blah Blah
description:
Finally, a way to make practicing phonics fun!

Master decoding words using phonics with these three decks of increasing difficulty. Race to get rid of your cards by matching sounds and letters, and play wild cards to trip up your opponents!

Blah Blah Blah is a hilariously fun card game, perfect for kids who are just starting to learn to read. Master decoding words using phonics with these three decks of increasing difficulty. Race to get rid of your cards by matching sounds and letters, and play wild cards to trip up your opponents!

How does Blah Blah Blah work?

Every card features a word consisting of three letters (or groups of letters). Each player takes seven cards. One card is placed face-up on the table with the rest of the deck in a pile, face-down. Players must play a card from their hand that contains at least one of the letters that are in the word on the table. The first player to get rid of all their cards wins. But beware! Wild cards hidden in the deck can force you to skip your turn or draw more cards.

—description from the publisher

name: SiegKrone
description:
SiegKrone (means Victory Crown) is a trading card game published by famous Japanese SNS company GREE. The game contains a lot of mobile game ip and anime ip like attack on titan.

Like most tcgs, in this game, players should construct their own deck with 50 cards to fight with the opponent. Players play character cards to fight and use skill cards to help. Some character cards can evolution or awake. The player who causes 5 points of damage to the opposing player will win the game.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That

name: MechAge: The Stand
description:
The enemy base is yours and repairs are underway to restore it to operations as your new HQ. However, it would seem that the creators of the Nova radiation are anxious to remove the evidence of their activities. Recon reports huge waves of enemy mutants headed straight forward for you and their intent is clear, wipe out the base at any cost. Stand your ground and bring the defenses online, things are going to get rough...

Adventure scenario expansion for MechAge.


The scenario consists in 1 Scenario card and 2 Mech cards:

Rules booklet
The Stand Scenario card
Light Rail Gun Mech card
Shield Mech card


Players are expected to provide their own tokens for this scenario:

8 Tracking tokens



Released in the August 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: We're In
description:
The firewall is down, but they know you got in. Now, it's a race to grab the most valuable information as the network shuts down around you. But be wary of the other hackers, as it's just as easy to steal from each other as from the system.

We’re In is a small route-planning game for 2 to 4 players. Each player controls an avatar moving around an ever-shrinking grid of tiles representing a nodes on company’s network, such as email servers or security cameras. When you move onto a tile, you hack the node to extract a token of information secretly worth 1, 2 or 3 points. Once all of the company’s secrets have been looted, you steal from each other instead.

With each move, tiles are tagged for suspicious activity and eventually shutdown, leaving gaps in the network and limiting your movement. When you move onto an occupied node, you are forced to share information with those players, surrendering your hard-won tokens. Your spoils are only secure after you logout of the system, either by running out of possible moves or waiting until the network gets small enough to slip out. Once everyone has logged out, the winner is the player with the most valuable set of tokens.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hidden Victory Points, Map Reduction, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Square Grid

name: EcoGoGo!: Grand Canyon Nat'l Park
description:
EcoGoGo! is an educational and entertaining card game designed to inform and inspire interest in our world’s ecology. It highlights the roles of food chains, feeding, mating, and migration in the lives of organisms in a wide variety of ecosystems.

The Grand Canyon National Park deck is built on extensively researched food chains comprising real organisms found in their native habitats. Includes the Great Horned Owl, Common Kingsnake, Grand Canyon Rattlesnake, Golden-mantled Ground Squirrel, Common Earless Lizard, Darkling Beetle, and Poop. The environmental threat is Toxic Waste.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Puzzle
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Trick-taking

name: Tag City: Graffiti Token Promo Tile
description: A promo graffiti token. Just add it to the other graffiti tokens. You can choose it when you set up the game.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle

name: EvenQuads: Deck 1 of 4
description:
Play any of five new mathematical games with this double-sided deck that commemorates the 50th anniversary of the Association for Women in Mathematics! EvenQuads games use symbols representing four major mathematical organizations and EvenBetter games use the flip sides featuring amazing women mathematicians.

All five games are mathematical. EvenQuads games challenge your matching speed as you collect Quads, as solitaire, with friends or in a rummy version. EvenBetter games help you learn about the featured women. All five games are specially designed to accommodate our unique double-sided cards.

Deck 1 (of 4) of EvenQuads includes 64 cards, and an insert with instructions in both English y Español, and a description of the EvenQuads mathematics.
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Speed Matching

name: Combate aéreo: Pabón-Benítez
description:
On December 4th, 1932, a Bolivian pilot named Rafael Pabón Cuevas shot down his Paraguayan adversary Trifón Benítez Vera in what is known as the first aerial battle between two nations in South America. The game Combate aéreo reenacts this fight.

The game reenacts this battle on a map of 8 by 8 squares. Each player has a personal board with controls of their plane, plus a sketch of the enemy plane. On this they plan their movement and attacks, adjusting altitude, speed, zones of attack and so on. The players can use various tokens to mark their plans on their respective boards. Afterwards, the move their planes on the map. The relative position and altitude of the two planes determines the zones that can be attacked.

Combat is modified by dice rolling. The goal is to either entirely destroy a section of the enemy plane, or deal enough damage overall to shoot it down. The game ends in a draw if both planes end up in the same position at the same altitude and crash.

name: Die Maulwurf Company Demo
description: A 2-3 player demo version of Die Maulwurf Company (The Mole in the Hole) from a Kellogg's box containing only 3 floors.
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Race

name: Cache Me If You Can! (4th Edition)
description:
There are an estimated 6 million people geocaching and now you can bring that kind of fun to your living room. For those times when you and some friends just want to go on the hunt without going out, now you can.
It’s all here! Caches, geocoins, hazards, multi-caches, puzzle caches, and even muggles.
Just like real geocaching, there are surprises along the way!
Cache Me If You Can! will never play the same way twice!

This edition adds health points, battery life, cache, and terrain difficulty.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: 暗夜之光 (Light in the Dark)
description:
暗夜之光 ("Light in the Dark") is a tactical board game that supports 2 to 4 players. The story is set in a parallel world of medieval Europe. In this world where swords and magic exist at the same time, one player plays the role of a dark legion headed by vampires to control the powerful dark night creatures invading the human world, and the other player plays the human guard and leads the heroic royal knights to defend the kingdom of Italia Border town.

Players form a legion according to certain rules (both sides have the same number of troop recruitment points to form a legion with equal total strength), deploy troops on the map, and command them to fight. The types of troops in the game are very rich. Players need to make various adjustments according to the characteristics of the troops and combined with the terrain, and reasonably issue various instructions such as attack, active defense, retreat and rest. At the same time, each player constructs his own battle deck, and players can use these battle cards to greatly influence the battle.

【Victory conditions】

1. If the Dark Legion destroys the human town within 12 rounds, the Dark Legion wins, otherwise the Human Guard wins.
2. At any time, repel all opponent forces, then our camp wins. (In "Light in the Dark", victory is calculated by camp. As long as a camp meets the above conditions for victory, all players in that camp are deemed to have won the victory together.)

—description from the publisher (translated)

《暗夜之光》是一款支持2〜4人的版图战术游戏，故事背景设定在平行世界的中世纪欧洲。在这个剑与魔法同时存在的世界中，一方玩家扮演以吸血鬼为首的黑暗军团，统御强大的暗夜生物入侵人类世界，另一方玩家扮演人类卫队，率领英勇的王家骑士团保卫伊塔利亚王国的边境小镇。

玩家根据一定规则组建军团（双方拥有相同的部队招募点数，组成总实力相等的军团），在地图上部署部队，并指挥他们进行战斗。游戏中的部队种类非常丰富，玩家需要根据部队的特点，结合地形进行各种调动，并合理下达攻击、主动防御、后撤休整等各种指令。与此同时，每位玩家分别构筑自己的战斗套牌，游戏中玩家可以使用这些战斗卡牌极大影响战局。

【胜利条件】

1.黑暗军团在12回合内摧毁人类小镇，则黑暗军团获胜，否则人类卫队获胜。
2.任意时刻，击退所有对手部队，则我方阵营获胜。（在《暗夜之光》，胜利以阵营来计算。只要某阵营达成上述胜利条件，则该阵营的所有玩家视为一起赢得了胜利。）

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Take That

name: Conflicto
description:
The Game has a board of a part of Europe where the main battles of WWII occurred. There are 12 cities and 6 bridges strategically placed.

This is a game for 2-4 players. Each player has an army of 5 Main Battle Tanks (20 points each), 5 Artillery Pieces (15 points each) and 5 Troops Transport Trucks (10 points each). The units must be placed in their start point accordingly to their color.

In each turn, a player rolls a dice and then can advance their units accordingly. When two or more enemy units reach the same place, a battle can emerge. When the attacker have the same points than the defender, the defender's units return to their starting point, when the attacker have more points, then the defender's units are removed from the board. A player can't attack with less points than the enemy.

There are 4 ways to win in this game:

a) Total anihilation of the enemy.
b) Cities occupattion
c) Invading the enemy's starting point
d) Bridges occupation

name: Quick Play Pro Hockey
description:
Quick Play Pro Hockey was designed by Michael Owens to quickly and accurately replay N.H.L. seasons, playoffs and any kind of tournaments the gamer wishes. Each game takes a few minutes to play, which allows for many games to be played in a short period of time.

Game play is activated by two standard dice (of different colors or sizes) read separately. For instance if the red die is 4 and the white die is 2, it is to be read as "42", or if the red die is 2 and the white die is 1 to be read as "21". This gives thirty-six different possibilities from 11 to 66. If you are familiar with APBA games, it is read in the same fashion.

The basic steps are:

Select Visiting and Home teams
Determine "Base Score" (including normalization) for each team
Determine Scoring Chance range and Home/Visitor Chance ranges and enter them on your scoresheet
Determine Close Game Factor difference and select the applicable CGF range
Record CGF details on scoresheet
Start game


When playing the game, you roll two dice. The first dice will be used for time management based on a timing chart. The combination of the two dice will then be used to determine if a scoring chance takes place. If a scoring chance takes place, then another roll of the dice will determine which team has the scoring chance. Once a team is determined, a third roll will be matched against a scoring table to determine the outcome of the scoring chance.

The game consists of three periods and the team with the higher score at the end of the game wins.

name: Rune: The Third Master
description: Play the game with three players.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle

name: Personal Space: The Circus Moon
description:
The Circus Moon is an expansion for Personal Space and requires the base game to play.

The Circus Moon is a new moon that you can visit during your games of Personal Space.

Orbit: 4:00-5:00 AM/PM
Popular Attraction: The Big Top
Local Cuisine: Ice Cream Zone

New Neighbor: You will gain one of four new neighbors:

Casper The Laughable
Hector The Impossible
The Magnificent Twitch
The Mighty Siri
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Personal Space: The Farming Moon
description:
The Farming Moon is an expansion for Personal Space and requires the base game to play.

The Farming Moon is a new moon that you can visit during your games of Personal Space.

Orbit: 5:00-6:00 AM/PM
Popular Attraction: Buck's Farm
Local Cuisine: Sprouts

New Neighbor: You will gain one of four new neighbors:

Donny Briarpaw
Maddy Torndawn
Scooter Applestone
Sierra Smallpetal
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Personal Space: The Drive-In Moon
description:
The Drive-In Moon is an expansion for Personal Space and requires the base game to play.

The Drive-In Moon is a new moon that you can visit during your games of Personal Space.

Orbit: 1:00-2:00 AM/PM
Popular Attraction: Zorp's Diner
Local Cuisine: Zip Corn Dogs

New Neighbor: You will gain one of four new neighbors:

Candy Bitterwort
Night Boxwood
Raven Milfoil
Rock Bindweed
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Ping Promo Card
description: Deal 1 damage to target monster.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: 東京Resistance (Tokyo Resistance)
description:
Setting

Tokyo - 2048

In Japan, which was occupied by Country C by World War III, a puppet government was established by the Co-New Party. On the other hand, the Resistance aiming for independence has started anti-government activities. And in order to crack down on this and destroy it, the Ministry of Interior has organized a special armored unit, commonly known as "special armored unit", for the purpose of maintaining security.

In this way, a fierce battle between the Resistance and the Special Armored Corps was fought in the capital, Tokyo.

Overview

Tokyo Resistance is a game about the struggle between the resistance, who are trying to overthrow the government, and the security forces, who are trying to prevent them from doing so.

The core of the game is card-based action, with each side playing cards to determine who will attack first and who will attack second.
The game is based on card actions, with the first attacker executing the action of the card they played.

The victory condition for the resistance side is to destroy five bases of the security forces.
The victory condition for the Security Forces is to find and eliminate the Resistance leader and his hideout.

The Resistance is outnumbered, but outmobile.
The Security Forces are superior in offensive power and mobility, but they are small in number.

You must lead forces of different nature to achieve victory!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hidden Roles, Square Grid

name: A Year In...
description:
You are the mayor of a brand new village! Place features to attract villagers, then welcome them to town.

Each turn, you draw a card from a deck of standard playing cards. All players use the card value or suit to place features, welcome new villagers to town, or construct a store.

Once the deck runs out, the game is over and the player with the most villagers and shopkeepers wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: AtomBlitz: The 1st Anticrusade
description:
The Great Global Depression of the 2020s destroyed the Free World. The economy is in permanent bankruptcy. Scientific and technological progress has reached the end of line. Education and culture have degraded.
The European Union and NATO have ceased to exist. Former allies are now preparing to tear each other apart.
The year is 2038. A new era of war begins with the clash of Islamist France and neo-fascist Spain. What kind of fanaticism is less repulsive to you?

AtomBlitz: The 1st Anticrusade is the first installation in a new series of tactical wargames about local nuclear wars of the near future. Take command of the army of obscurantists armed with the latest technology, and walk through the ruins of Western civilization with fire and tracks!

The mini-game set contains 1 A4 map depicting the border area of France and Spain, and two sheets of 14 mm counters for infantry units, ground and air combat vehicles. The four-mission campaign allows players to participate in a fierce two-day border battle of the post-hybrid warfare era armies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Tee oder Kaffee: Refill Kartensatz
description:
This upgrade contains six Refill cards. These are added to a copy of Tee oder Kaffe to convert it to Tee oder Kaffee Refill.
Also included is a card with rules in German and English.

name: Klaus die Maus entdeckt den Wald
description:
During his foray through the forest, Klaus the mouse finds fruits and leaves, animals and tracks, different animal families and much more. A good memory helps to sort everything and find pairs.

The youngest forest pro starts and takes the top search card and looks at it. The task is now to find the matching forest card. The forest card has the search card printed small as the solution. So you have a check if you are right. You now go with the search card to one of the forest pieces. Lift up the forest piece and look underneath to see if the matching card is underneath. If the forest cards are still hidden under the forest piece, you may uncover them- They remain face up underneath. If you find the matching card, you get to keep it. The forest card is now placed in front of you. If you have six different forest cards, you can use them to lay a tree. If you don't find the matching card in a passage to the forest piece, it's the next player's turn. The search card goes back face up next to the search card pile. The next player moves to the next pile with Klaus the mouse. The game ends when 3 trees can be formed. The player who has the most search cards in front of him - that is, who has successfully found the most pairs - wins the game.

name: Munchkin: Coasters
description:
A set of six drinks coasters, which are designed to both protect your table and to make it a little easier for everyone at the table to determine which player is playing which colour. The six designs included in the Munchkin Coaster Pack not only feature the six basic player colours, but each coaster also gives you a small bonus when playing the game!

Rule: If you kick open the door and it's the monster on your coaster, go up a level (can't be the winning level). If someone else gets your monster when they kick the door, you draw a Treasure.

name: Smoke & Mirrors: Double Backed Swirls Card promo
description:
It's a double backed card for the Swirls suit. This one forces some tough bluffing, counts as a 0 when played, and you might even be able to pull off some actual magic tricks with it!


A double backed magic card for the Swirls deck:

More bluffing!
Counts as a 0!
Maybe try some actual magic tricks!



Kickstarter stretch goal promo.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Tesla Science Race
description:
The Board Game Inspired By Nikola Tesla.

Tesla Science Race is an educational tabletop board game that teaches players about Nikola Tesla’s inventions and his life’s journey one dice roll at a time.

The game can be played two ways - with a smart device or without. Special cards with QR codes were created to be used with smart devices in addition to the standard cards. The cards with the QR code include a link to the next task.

Players compete to collect as many of Tesla's inventions as possible. The inventions come in the form of a card, and on the back of each is one piece of Tesla’s infamous coil. This was one of his most significant inventions. Each player attempts to recreate the Tesla coil by assembling the cards like pieces of a puzzle. The player who first puts together the coil is the winner.

The game is interactive, and educational as each player tests their knowledge of Tesla’s many inventions. The game also challenges players to think on the spot, as they make strategic decisions to not only move forward but to collect valuable invention cards.

-description from publisher

name: The Spawn of Xichtul
description:
The Children of Chaos are Here!

Chaos has made of Qaarra a wasteland. The unholy forces unleashed by the Drau Derleti – the Dark Elves – have brought the downfall of the Qaarran civilization. The few survivors have succumbed to the taint of chaos. Now warbands of mutant degenerates and bandits roam the wastelands in search of powerful magic and loot, trying to win the appreciation of their dark god Xichtul. Each warband worships a different aspect of the chaos god, but all are ready to kill and maim in his name.

This campaign for Advanced Song of Blades and Heroes includes 6 scenarios and all the rules and traits required to create chaotic bands. It is intended for 2 players.

This is NOT a stand alone book. In addition to this book, a copy of Advanced Song of Blades and Heroes is required to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Шифр
description:
Nano game on one card (board on a side, rules on the other side) for two players or more. For playing this game you also need to provide mobile phone or paper with pen for each player. Each player get the encrypted code from another player and try to decode it. It's a simple game with an encryption mechanic.

KOZAK Games Publishing shared this game as a gift for their customers in 2020 (COVID-19 Pandemic).
Contained in Casual Game Insider Magazine CGI#42(2023).

name: Ale Pary: Misz Masz
description: Ale Pary: Misz Masz features gameplay identical to that of Spot it! 1,2,3, with the game consisting of 31 cards, each showing six images. Any two cards have exactly one image in common, and your challenge when playing is to spot what that matching image is before anyone else.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Dragon Braggin'
description:
"You and other players are in a tavern, boasting about who can kill the biggest dragon without getting burned. Careful, though... your opponent can chicken out and make you face the dragon instead|"

This two player game has you going back and forth deciding to take on the dragon by rolling your three dice or chickening out and forcing your opponent to roll against the dragon. Score points for beating the dragon or when your opponent loses. First to 5 points wins!

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

name: Deadly Dig
description:
"You and the other players are all treasure hunters, exploring a dark and deadly crypt. Each step into the crypt will be more valuable, but also more dangerous!"

This is a six round game to attempt to get treasure. You choose whether to continue or not gaining treasure along the way. If you choose to go back (or get through 6 turns of rolling winning each time), you score the dice you collected. If you get chased back, you lose all the treasure that round.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Blue's Snack Match Game
description:
MINIATURE REFRIGERATOR WITH BLUE: Press down on Blue to see what snacks are in the fridge. The snacks in the refrigerator will spin, giving you a new combination of snacks with every turn!
NOT YOUR EVERYDAY MATCHING GAME: Players take turns making matches between the refrigerator and their lunchbox. If, on your turn, a snack in your lunchbox matches what’s displayed, place a token on the item!

BASED ON THE SHOW BLUE’S CLUES: Blue is back and more popular than ever. With rules following the unique structure of the show, players learn valuable skills like reasoning and matching.

QUICK START, FUN AND ENGAGING: Open the box and you’ll find everything you need to play, including easy-to-follow instructions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Disney Charades
description:
You draw an "I am" and a "Who" card, then roll two dice to determine what Disney character you are miming and what they are doing. Your team has one minute to guess as many pairs of cards as possible. Players can mime and make noises, and the team can guess as many times as they like until they find the correct answer and get a point.

There's 25 cards in each pile and you keep playing until they run out. The team with the most points wins.

Contents:
25 'I am' Cards
25 'Who' Cards
1 Blue Die
1 Red Die
1 Timer
1 Set of Rules

name: Mathe-Meister
description:
Mathe-Meister is a free roll and write, print and play game, supporting one or more players. Players will dynamically create simple mathematical equations and attempt to solve their sums towards maximum victory points. However, players must be careful how they create each equation based on its location. Producing an odd or even sum in the wrong location, turns said sum into negative points! Over eight rounds, players roll dice, write operands and operators, utilize gameplay bonuses, and ultimately collect their victory points into a final score. The player with the highest final score wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Paper-and-Pencil

name: När då då?: Resor i världen
description:
A standalone expansion for När då då (The Best of Chronology) with cards containing trivia related to travel and journeys in history.

Gameplay is similar to the original game. On the players turn, an opponent draws a card from the deck and reads the text on the card. If the player successfully points out where the card should go in their current timeline, the card is added above the player Time lock and the player may then either decide to end the turn and move the cards above the time lock to the safety below it or try to get another card. If the player fails to place a card correctly, all cards gained in the current turn are lost, the turn ends and play passes to the next player.

The winner is the first player to win five cards.

When used with the original game, the cards from this game is added as another category. A new six-sided die and cardboard markers 1-6 are included to choose the category.

—user summary

name: レディファースト (Lady First)
description:
レディファースト (Lady First) is a shedding game from Japan, with each card controlling which successive cards may be played.

The game has a romantic theme, with one set of red cards themed for a woman, and a blue set for a man. Each cards carries various romantic lines (all in Japanese), that the players ought to speak as they play, such as

"Don't let me go"
"I'm glad to see you"

However, the game is designed for any adult players, not simply opposites.

The red deck has 12 cards numbered from 1 to 12 (and this player starts), the blue deck has 11 cards from 2 to 12. If the blue player can get the red player to play all 12 of their cards first, blue wins. Otherwise, blue loses.

On their turn, a player may draw one card from their deck, up to a hand limit of five, or play a card to the table.

Along the bottom of each card is a set of numbers, one for blue and one for red. These say what card can be played after this card. For example, the blue 5 can be followed by a blue 2,3,4 and 6 or by a red 4 or red 6-12.

As players go through their deck, they must carefully decide which cards to hold and which to play, in order to push more cards out of their opponent's hand.
user summary
publishers: 米光と抜群のゲームデザイナーズ (Yonemitsu to batsugun no gēmudezaināzu)

name: The Best of Christmas Game: Not For Kids
description:
OK, so we admit we're not famous for naughty games. Clean-cut family games - that's us. But occasionally a silly, hilarious and ever so slightly crude idea occurs to us that needs an outlet and here it is: Best of Christmas NOT FOR KIDS. It's a bit of light-hearted grown-up trivia that's just a smidgeon too naughty for the younger kids, but still full of the laugh out loud fun that makes the LOGO family a British favourite!

From office party antics and their aftermath to what time we first reach for the bottle on Christmas Day, Best of Christmas NOT FOR KIDS covers the messy, boozy, mistletoe-clad reality of Christmas for adults - and from our research, most of us are making the naughty list.

—description from back of box

name: Terre Pirates: Extension Capitaines
description:
English:
Discover 4 new characters with new Gameplay for more discoveries, tricks and deep interactivity. Play as jack Rackham the Seducer, Charlotte De Berry the Indomitable, Charles Vanes the Unstable and Henry Jennings the Corsair!

French:
Découvrez 4 nouveaux personnages avec de nouveaux Gameplay pour toujours plus de découvertes, de fourberies et une interactivité poussée. Incarnez jack Rackham le Séducteur, Charlotte De Berry l’Indomptable, Charles Vanes l’Instable et Henry Jennings le Corsaire !

name: Bankman
description:
Feel yourself in the role of the tycoon of the financial world of the early twentieth century! Trade with partners, buy enterprises, unite them into trusts and corporations! To win, develop strategic thinking, cunning, but most importantly - the flexibility of the mind and the ability to negotiate.

A great game for both a family vacation and a fun company from 2 to 12 people!

—description from publisher

On their turn, players can buy one enterprise from the market by paying a certain combination of different currency cards. Players can exchange currencies among themselves to collect the desired combination. The goal of the game is to collect as many business cards from one industry as possible. The game ends when the market runs out of all company cards and then the players count the points for the cards they have purchased. Each enterprise card brings a certain number of points to its owner, but if he has several cards of the same industry, then the points brought by enterprises in this industry are higher, and if the player has collected all the cards of one industrial branch, he receives the largest possible number of points from these enterprise cards for Monopoly.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation, Party Game

name: Dead Zone
description:
Everyone’s hungry in the Dead Zone.

A group of survivors must work together and stay alive in the dead zone. Dead Zone: puts 1-6 players in a colony of survivors in a world where humanity has been ravaged by a flesh-eating diseased.

Dead Zone is a cooperative survival game, featuring tactical base building, tower defence elements, with resource management and risk vs reward decisions. Player move around the dead zone gathering material and supplies to support and evolve the colony. This attracts the dead and the colony can soon get overrun. Players work together toward one common victory condition, but how that victory is achieved is up to each individual player as there are many ways to overcome the obstacles.

Dead Zone survivors must find the best way to work together to fight off threats in the zone, resolve crises, find supplies, and keep the colony's defences intact. Players will have to make difficult, heavily-thematic risk and reward decisions.

Each round a new event is revealed, survivors choose where and what to do, head deep into the dead zone looking for materials, or stay and defend the camp, start construction on a new project, or go hunting for food.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: The Ultimate Game For Couples
description:
Play with just your partner or with other couples in two different gameplays in this fun and engaging game! Spark meaningful conversations and learn new things about your partner or team up together to compete against other couples to see who really knows each other best.

TWO GAME CHOICES - Connect one-on-one your partner or play together with other couples in two different gameplays.
QUALITY TIME WITH YOUR PARTNER - Get to know each other better as you dive into meaningful conversations and perform funny challenges - perfect for date night.
COMPETE AGAINST OTHER COUPLES - Team up with your partner and play with other couples to see who really knows each other best.
BUILD DEEPER CONNECTIONS - The simple gameplay and easy rules allows you to quickly engage with each other.
REPLAY VALUE - 200 playing cards guarantees hours of replayability. Perfect gift for him and her - makes a great wedding, newlywed or anniversary gift.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Kakerlacula Mitbringspiel
description:
In the co-operative game Kakerlacula, players need to light all the candles in the rooms of the haunted castle — but Kakerlacula is dashing through the hallways trying to scare the children and force them to leave.

Players start the game with a number of garlic tokens, and on a turn, you launch one of the cockroach tokens on a catapult to see how it lands: Can you walk through the corridors, or will the cockroach scurry from one symbol to the next? If the cockroach crosses your path, you lose a garlic token. Can you complete your mission before you run out of garlic?

name: Wissen & Quizzen: Faszinierende Pferde
description:
A tiptoi quiz game about horses.

The four assistants "Käpt'n Quizzo" (KQ), "Jonny Joker" (JJ), „Wilma Weg“ (WW), and "Robert Ross" (RR) guide through the game with two difficulty settings.

Knowledge: Learn about horses as depicted on 26 different cards.

Trivia game: Players answer KQs questions and score victory points. KQ announces the winner at the end of the game.

Electronic: You need an electronic Tiptoi pen for the game.

name: Cold Cases
description:
One of the participants plays William Wisting and sits on one side of the magnetic, vertical game board. It's your job to track down the perpetrators and bring them to justice. Every time you lead one criminal to the arrest, you must give a handcuff piece to that participant.

Other participants sit on the other side and act as criminals. When you committed your criminal acts, you left traces. Now each of you must return to the crimescene to destroy the tracks so that Wisting does not get hold of you. You start with five track cards each on hand, one track card of each color. Every time you manage to get to one of your crime scenes, you have to leave that track card to Wisting.

If you as William Wisting get rid of all your handcuffs cards first, you win. But if a criminal manages to get rid of all his track cards, he wins. Everyone plays against everyone. The criminals constantly see how Wisting moves, but Wisting does not know how the criminals move.

Wisting must be strategic and try to calculate how the criminals move on the game board.

The battle is between Wisting and the fastest criminal. Should evil or good win?
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: EXITE Box: Asteroid Alert
description:
Do you have time to stop the asteroid that is heading for earth, before it is too late?

Escape room in a box.

The EXITE Box game concept combines the concrete objects and aids included in the package with the possibilities offered by the environment, the Internet and various media and means of communication. This multiplatform escape room game fits in a box, but there is much more.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Scepter of the Eternal Flame
description:
You are a small group of adventurers in search of the most valuable object of your journeys of discovery. Standing in the long-awaited entrance to the Cave of Ignis, you realize the most dangerous adventure ahead. The cave is about to explode. It's only a matter of time before the lava flows scorch everything inside it forever.

To win reach the exit with the Scepter before time runs out.
If the cave explodes while you are still inside, you lose.
If the cave explodes at the same time you leave, the game ends in a tie because you saved your life but lost the Scepter.

Decide each round together either to equip yourself by using the dice's abilities, that cleverly combined become even stronger, or head out before the cave explodes.
Use each character's individual skills to improve yourself!
Use easy to understand Dice Reference to make the right decisions and roll the dice along the numbers.
And when you're ready as a team, leave the cave as soon as possible.

Your decisions define your destiny! But together you can overcome the challenge!
mechanics: Action Drafting, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck, Resource to Move, Track Movement

name: Grimagia
description:
Grimagia is a card game where players take the role of "Grimeisters", summoners who capture monster girls using magical books called grimoires. Players win by capturing 3 of their opponents' monsters, or through eliminating each other player by reducing their HP to 0.

Players share the same 100 card deck. Each turn, a player may perform three actions: playing a monster from their hand, performing a union (combining two monsters to make one stronger monster), and capturing another player's monster using a grimoire (which works in a rock-paper-scissors fashion depending on the opposing monster's type). There are also relic cards with various effects which may be played at any time.

Afterwards, monsters may attack the other players or each other. All monsters have different stats such as health, strength, defense, and special abilities. Monsters who attack become Rested and are defenseless against attacks by other monsters until the player's next turn.

name: Volunteer Exile Programme
description:
Congratulations Pitizens! You and your families have been volunteered to help humanity reclaim the Earth by establishing a settlement in No-Man’s-Land. You have been resettled from the Hub to a promising location and it is now your duty to follow the Committees’ directive to ensure this settlement prospers. Should you be successful in your endeavours, you will be granted an official ‘Thank You’ from the Committee. Best of luck!

In Volunteer Exile Programme players take the role of a Pitizen “volunteered” to manage a new settlement in the wasteland (consisting of a tableau) in order to try and earn the approval of the Committee.
Each turn they follow the Committee’s directive and attempt to perform as many actions as they can or wish. The directive will include actions such as:
• Draw a card into your hand,
• Play a card into your Settlement or the Directive,
• Discard a card from your Settlement or the Directive,
• Place a Raider,
• Eliminate a Raider,
• Move a Pitizen

Adding locations to the settlement will provide the player with bonuses for building and attacking. Attracting Pitizens to those locations provide additional bonuses to the settlement and to the wider wasteland. Attracting Raiders, however, removes all these bonuses and renders the location usefulness.

As players are adding to their settlement, the directive and moving Pitizens and Raiders, the availability and usefulness of the available actions will change as well as limits on useable Pitizens, Raiders and your carry over hand size.

The game continues in rounds until the Committee approval process is triggered when a player meets one of the end-game objectives set at the start of the game. The players then sum up their Action points, their Settlement value plus any Raiders they eliminated and the player with the highest score wins.

-description from designer

name: Franche-Comté: Toute la Franche-Comté en 2000 questions
description:
A Trivia game about the Region of Franche-Comté in eastern France.
2000 questions in 5 themes covering:

History,
Culture and traditions,
Economy,
Geography & Tourism,
Sport & contemporary life


A player rolls dice and moves on the board accordingly. Depending on the color of the destination square, player draws a card and answer the questions of a different category. If the answer is incorrect it goes to the next player (or team).
The winner is the first player (team) to collect 5 colored "stage" cards.

It is possible to play in teams.
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Combat de Coqs
description:
Combat de Coqs is the benchmark for French culture!

1320 questions divided into 12 categories (Music, Cinema, Sport, Media, Fashion, Gastronomy, History, Geography, French language, Literature, Economy, Art)
There are questions about the great classics, but also questions about current affairs.

This game will perfectly accompany your evenings with friends, or your Sundays with family.

Goal:
be the first player to validate each of the 12 categories by correctly answering the questions.

Gameplay:

roll the dice
choose one of the 2 themes indicated by the dice
answer the question of the chosen category
Correct answer: validate the category and re-roll the dice
Wrong answer: pass the dice to the next player



If the dice indicate 2 categories already validated, answer the chosen question correctly to be able to re-roll the dice.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Frontier Valley
description:
In Frontier Valley you will hire workers, learn about their abilities and employ them as farmers to produce goods on your land, as craftsmen to make the building material you buy with your produce and as townsfolk to make use of your new facilities. You will need to make sure to make good use of the land so you are the player to better satisfy the market's demands. But beware: one misjugded applicant, one thoughtless land lease or one greedy building project could be all that is needed for the luck to turn towards your opponent!

Frontier Valley is a two-player 18 card game of deduction, market manipulation, building structures and powerful one-time actions. Each round you choose one worker card from your hand to use. This might sound easy, but as in Hanabi, you do not see your own cards, only the ones of your opponent, so make sure you make the right pick even when you do not have perfect information! You then use this worker as farmer to plant new crops and thus changing the price of produce on the market, as builder to erect new structures (if you can sell valuable goods) that bring victory points or as townsfolk to use powerful one-time actions on your already standing buildings. Then you will have to give your opponent some hints of her choosing toward the cards in her hand. Will you manage to outsmart your opponent by manipulating the supply of farming goods such that you always have the most valuable produce? Will you be able to hire a sought after seasoned architect to build the most impressive town buildings? Whoever has the buildings with the most victory points in total will be the winner of Frontier Valley.

The game features a beginner mode for learning the interactions of hints, the type of workers there are and the market dynamics. Once you played this at least once, feel free to add the one-time actions of townsfolk to the game for added complexity and challenge.

-description from designer
categories: American West, Card Game, Deduction, Economic, Print & Play
mechanics: Action/Event, Commodity Speculation, Communication Limits, Hand Management, Market, Memory, Set Collection, Single Loser Game, Worker Placement

name: Finger Guns at High Noon: "Stinky" Pete Boone Promo Card
description:
"Stinky" Pete Boone

Keeper.
When you gain this ally, give him to another survivor.

At the beginning of the round, if you have "Stinky" Pete Boone, lose 1 health.

The current owner of "Stinky" Pete Boone may target him with a SHOT action to give him to another survivor.

International Tabletop Day Promo and was available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple Kickstarter campaign.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Winding Vines
description:
A Simple yet strategic tile laying, pattern making competitive puzzle, for kids and adults alike. Be the first to arrange tiles in such a way that an unbroken line of your chosen color connects the outer tiles of the (three-by-three) grid. You will be placing, replacing, switching, rotating and blocking tiles during play. It is a puzzle to solve and a race to solve it first.

Gameplay

Players take turns placing tiles on an imaginary invisible grid of three by three (3x3) with the goal of connecting the lines on the tiles. You want to connect the lines of your color around the outer edge of this imaginary grid. And at the same time preventing your opponent from connecting theirs.

As you place a tile, if there are tiles on the table, you must place it adjacent to another tile, horizontally or vertically. As soon as there are three tiles in a row or column, this sets the outer limits. The end result should be a three-by-three square of tiles.

As you play, you could do other actions instead of placing a tile, like rotating a tile, switching place between two tiles or replacing a tile. In addition to these four actions (placing, replacing, rotating and switching) you may always lock a tile at the end of your turn. You do this by placing your player marker onto the tile in question.

The winner is the first to have an unbroken line of their color connecting all of the outer tiles of the grid.

-description from designer

name: Big Bang Burgers
description:
A highly strategic card came version of a food fight. Players take turns drawing cards and building burgers to earn money, the game ends once all the burgers have been finished. While you place delicious ingredients on your burgers your opponents will place ingredients like a cockroach or a severed finger!

Players may block opponents moves, steal ingredients, or even a whole burger. Gain a 5-star review and beware the health inspector or dreaded Bang Card.

Each Player is randomly dealt Bun Heel Cards that remain face up in front them. Then, Players are Dealt a 5 card hand. Each turn, players add Green (tasty) Ingredients to their own burger, Red (gross) Ingredients to another player's burger, or play a Blue Action Card to steal ingredients from another player. Once a Bun Crown is played, no more ingredients can be added or taken away. When all burgers are done, and the points listed on each of the ingredients cards and the player with the highest score wins!

name: Господин Великий Новгород
description:
Господин Великий Новгород ("Lord Novgorod the Great") is a Russian strategy games set during the times of the Novgorod Republic.

Each player becomes the head of a noble boyar family.

You can win in different ways:

get the highest elective position, mayor, and remain mayor for one turn;
become the most honorable boyar, or
win the most battles !

name: New Year Eve Dinner
description:
On the eve of the Chinese New Year, everyone will return to their parents' home for a reunion dinner. The New Year's Eve dinner represents family reunion, peace and good wishes.
In the board game "New Year Eve Dinner", you play the role of the "little host", trade other players' relative cards by memorizing theirs positions to invite as many relatives as possible to your seats. When all the dishes are served, whoever has the most relatives will win the game. The game challenges players' concertation and memory, and it also requires some of luck of cause. Come on, make a great New Year's Eve Dinner!
New Year Eve Dinner is a board game that combines Chinese New Year traditions, family constructions and typical dishes, and is suitable for family gatherings.
The game gives an experience of Chinese New Year vibe, and it is easy and fun to play for kids to elderlies, and also your friends.

name: Mosaic
description:
IntroductionMosaic is a territory game played on an initially empty hex board. Two players, Red and Blue, share a set of tiles, red on one side and blue on the other.



Place or flip tiles, but not bothPlayers take turns placing or flipping tiles starting with Red. You either place one tile with your color showing or you flip one or more enemy tiles to your color. You never both add and flip tiles in one turn. If you have a placement or flip available you must do one of them. Otherwise you must pass until you do have a move.



Tile placementYou can place a tile adjacent to an enemy tile or adjacent to nothing. You must never place a tile adjacent only to your own tiles. You must never place a tile that reduces your number of groups.



Tile flippingFlipping a tile must accomplish two things. It must decrease your number of groups and decrease the total number of groups - yours plus your opponent’s. Flipping is not mandatory, unless part of a multiple flip sequence (see below).



Multiple flip sequenceWhen you flip a tile, and while it’s still your turn, you may be required to flip additional tiles. If it’s possible to flip any tiles subject to the preceding section, "Tile flipping", which are adjacent to a tile flipped earlier in the same turn then you must flip one of them. If it’s still possible to flip more tiles adjacent to tiles flipped earlier in the same turn, you must flip another one, and so on. Your turn concludes when no more tiles adjacent to currently flipped tiles can be flipped. Tiles can be flipped in any order in a multi flip sequence. Which tiles get flipped in a multi flip sequence is not necessarily predetermined. Sometimes a player has a choice.



Object of the gameThe game concludes when there are no more legal moves available. NOTE: Tiles can still be flipped after the board has filled up. The object is to have the most tiles on the board when the game ends.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Peníze: Jak rozmnožit peníze
description:
Peníze ("Money") is a management game in which real Czech companies and banks are included. The rules of the game respect the laws of real business and securities trading. The game shows what economic conditions affect the values of securities, for which companies are better bet on dividends and for which it is worth speculating to buy and sell shares.

Players roll dice, then they move figure by that many spaces. When they enter company area, you check actual state of game, find of how much company dividents rise or decrease, then they can buy them.
When game ends players decide before actual game starts. Players can agree that game end at 2 hour timer and who will own most of money wins or they can agree on money limit to reach for win.

Peníze jsou manažerská hra, ve které jsou obsaženy skutečné české firmy a banky. Pravidla hry respektují zákonitosti reálného podnikání a obchodování s cennými papíry. Hra ukazuje, jaké ekonomické podmínky ovlivňují hodnoty cenných papírů, u kterých podniků je lépe vsadit na dividendy a u kterých se vyplatí spekulovat s koupí a prodejem akcií.
