Hráči házejí kostkami a poté o tolik míst posouvají figurku. Když vstoupí do oblasti společnosti, zkontrolujete skutečný stav hry, zjistíte, o kolik se dividendy společnosti zvýší nebo sníží, a pak si je mohou koupit.
Po skončení hry se hráči rozhodnou před zahájením skutečné hry. Hráči se mohou dohodnout, že hra končí ve 2hodinovém časovači a kdo bude vlastnit většinu peněz, vyhrává, nebo se mohou dohodnout na peněžním limitu, aby dosáhli na výhru.

name: Lottery Fever
description:
The object of the game is to either accumulate $1 million in winnings or match all six "Big Deal Lotto" numbers on their card.

Each player takes one score card that has three lottery games on it: Triple Play, 4-Play and Big Deal Lotto. They are then given $40,000 to start play.

Through rolling a die and moving around the board, players can play various lottery games in an effort to accumulate the $1 million goal, or earn or lose money on event spaces (i.e. - Auto Accident, Pay College Tuition, Inheritance, etc.). On each of those spaces, the amount won or lost is determined by the number they roll after landing on the space. If a player cannot afford to pay a penalty, they can either pay what they have or pay nothing and miss their next turn, but no player is ever eliminated from the game.

In Triple Play, a player pays $400 to the bank and chooses one of the Triple Play number sets on their card and roll three dice up to three times trying to match those numbers. If successful, their winnings are based on how many turns it took out of the three to match the numbers. If they are unsuccessful, they win nothing and their turn is over.

4-Play is the same as Triple Play, but with higher payouts, and the player rolls four dice up to four times. They also pay $500 to play it.

Big Deal Lotto requires a $1,000 payment, and the player rolls one die. If the roll matches a number on their card, they cover it with a chip and and are on step closer to winning.

Players may also join in on another player's lottery by being the first to shout "Big Money", but risk paying that player if they are unsuccessful in the lottery being played. There is also an "Investment" space where players can put up between $1,000 and $10,000 in an effort to multiply their winnings.

For a longer game, winning requires a player to both acquire at least $1 million, as well as match all six of their Big Deal Lotto numbers.

name: Burbuja
description:
Solitaire game for Piecepack in which a 5x5 square must expand into a hollow 7x7 square in 24 moves or less. The level of difficulty is adjustable by allowing second chances at certain moves.

The game will be won if the full square can be blown up as if it was a bubble (Spanish: ​burbuja) in no more than 24 moves.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Vous êtes dans une Auberge
description:
After exploring Dungeons filled with traps, facing Trolls & Dragons, and saved many Princesses, four Adventurers decided to relax in a Inn of the neighbourhood.

Once at the counter, they are greeted by Kurt the Innkeeper, who will serve them the best beverages of his establishment and enjoin them to spend the best evening possible.

Drink shots, meet customers, visit the inn, spend your gold! This is the program of the evening.

But the adventurers will be wary of each other, will avoid spending all their money and make sure not to attract the wrath of Igor and Stan, the two bouncers of the Inn. Only an adventurer as wise as festive can boast to be the one who has spent the best evening!

Goal :

It's up to you to collect "Inn" cards to score the most points in order to win the game.

But be careful, having the most cards does not guarantee victory. Make sure you get the most valuable ones.

Principles of "Vous êtes dans une Auberge":

Each player embodies one of the four adventurers of the game: The Knight, The Dwarf, The Elf and The Hobbit; each with their own money and talents.

In turn, the players will first go to the counter to order "drink" cards thanks to their purse money. Each purchase will allow them to also acquire "Sympathy" cards.

Then they will spend a good time acquiring "Inn" cards thanks to the various drinks and coins in their possession. Each "Inn" card has a value in victory points that will be counted at the end of the game.

Each player may also use "Skills" cards available to help his Adventurer to win, but also to prevent other players from reaching their goal.

All will have to pay attention to not abuse of drinks! To own too many "Drink" cards may attract the attention of the bouncers, Igor and Stan, who will put you out unceremoniously!

Players will need to think about keeping money and "Sympathy" tokens to help them get out of tricky situations, or even sacrifice cards to stay in the running.

The first player to buy 6 "Inn" cards starts the last turn of play. Those who have not played yet complete their turn, then each player counts the victory points recorded on the "Inn" cards in his possession.

The player with the highest score wins the game.

— description from the publisher.

name: Fotozoo
description:
Fotozoo is a very simple and family fun game, here, you will enter the Zoo to demonstrate your skills as a photographer, fulfilling challenges according to the characteristics of the animals, such as their habitat, species, diet, size, etc.

It is a real-time game, that is, all players participate at the same time and against the clock. Whoever collects the most points wins. As there are no turns, all the players play against the time, they can change their animal cards with the animal cards on the table or with other players in order to complete the set described in the objective card to win those points.

-description from designer

name: The Island of Dr. Moreau
description:
Classic literature/movies characters like the invisible man, the werewolf, the vampire, the phantom of the opera, Dr. Jekyll and others join forces in this cooperative game. Their objective is to take down Dr. Moreau, a brilliant but mad scientist who retired in a lost island to carry out atrocious experiments on humans and animals in an effort to create, in his lab, a super-being.
The game offers an unprecedented approach to traditional board game-play where technology, in the form of a very intuitive Web-APP, is introduced. Besides performing many random game functions a new very exiting feature was created: the Map Maker. As the game progresses the A.I. will indicate which new Map-Tiles are to be added to the Map Puzzle. This way, players will have to re-adapt their strategies according to the configuration of the map. All maps will be different and the chances that you will play a map twice is highly unlikely. Besides this, the Web-APP allows players to play (each with their own board game) remotely and in real-time.
Character and weapons upgrades, an underground labyrinth , over 50 weapons and inventory items, many actions to chose from, Attack / Defense tactics, the need to manage physical as well as internal resources and a compelling story-line are the main ingredients of this cyberpunk horror cooperative board game that is the first of an incredible trilogy where the line that separates humans from animals is blurred. Which side are you on?

—description from the designer

name: Tapas
description: Speedy Piecepack game of simultaneous set collection, played with only one hand. Players have got free rein to choose sets of three items ("tapas"), as long as they are original: when players describe their tapas at a final showdown, if there are several tapas matching the same description, all of them will be disregarded.

name: L'Alpinista
description:
L’Alpinista is a re-edition of a rare nineteenth-century game.
It reproduces the fascinating world of mountaineering: a sport that, in addition to healthy competition, has solidarity, help and friendship among its founding values.

Cross the Alps and complete a journey full of challenges and unexpected events.

What makes this splendid board game unique is the structure of the three boards.
Each board is cut following the outline of the mountains. Once assembled vertically, they will form the mountain range where the mountaineering players will move.

This modern edition of the game has kept the graphics and structure of the ancient edition almost identical, thus preserving the beauty of the original illustrations. The details and the nineteenth-century style allow players to immerse themselves in a romantic atmosphere, bringing them back to the era of the origins of mountaineering.
The rules of the game, on the other hand, have been revisited and are introduced by a story, with the aim of making the game not only fun but also educational.

It is a kind of goose game with 80 stages.
At each stage the player can be favored or penalized by the rules of the game: she/he can stop, proceed or even retreat.
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Non-Transitive Grime Dice
description:
Each player picks a dice and whoever gets the highest value wins. Seems fair, but in fact you will always be able to pick a dice with a better chance of winning-no matter which dice you friend chooses first! If you play 'best of ten rolls' you'll be the champion almost every time. The dice are not weighted, they roll perfectly fairly.

The secret lies in their unusual numbers.

Non-transitive dice set discovered by Dr. James Grime of Cambridge University. This set has ten dice, two each of five different colors. When rolled singly, green tends to beat red, red tends to beat yellow, yellow tends to beat blue, and blue tends to beat purple. So you might think green is the best die and purple is the worst. But here is the twist: purple beats green, so there is no best! Even stranger, with two of each color (ten dice total), the order of which color beats which reverses direction. The set of ten includes color instructions and a cloth bag.

name: Battlespace: SORD Operatives Card Pack Supplement
description:
An expansion set of 16 cards introducing the private military company known as SORD Inc (Special Operations Research Development). Specializing in asset protection and recovery, SORD’s operatives are recruited from around the world and are highly trained individuals of various military backgrounds.

The enemy cards in this set will push the SORD operatives to the limit when combined with enemy cards from previous releases. Your team will need to equip some of the new gear so they don't fall behind in this new era of tech and combat.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fée Toibelle
description:
Four pretty fairies are invited to the grand ball of the castle. But before spinning in a carriage dancing under the stars, each must retrieve their crown, necklace, fan and handbag.

—description from the publisher

name: Beyblade V-Force: Micro Tops Battling Game
description:
Let It Rip!

Drop in your power cores and get ready to battle! Send your Micro Top spinning and knock the power cores into the goals. You get to keep all of your opponent's power cores that you capture in your goal. But your opponent can keep any of your that he/she has captured. Be the first one to collect ten of your opponent's power cores and you win!

—description from the back of the box
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time

name: Air Master
description:
Win in one turn at any time. You’re never out of it. Features a novel scoring system.

Air Master is a unique Push Your Luck game, where you fly your way to victory by navigating favourable winds.

But catch the bad ones, and make no progress, or even be blown backwards!

Note the ones that work and find the easy routes to lift the SAVVY crown.

Occasionally during the game, strong headwinds occur, and any gains are lost.

In the final rounds, tropical storms can wreak havoc, and force you further back from where you started.

You have options though, of sitting out potential storms by backtracking, and waiting for it to pass. Or to backtrack at certain stages, and check out alternative flight paths.

You can see the wind strengths you face at each moment of your turn, represented by numbered playing cards.

Taken into consideration with the accompanying wind chart, which shows which cards have already been played, you can see before you call, the success of any choice you make.

The combination of chart and numbered cards make it a very exceptional, and accurate weather forecasting mechanic. Outcomes are based on known probability before you make a call and not random luck.

After each successful forecast, you can call again, and your plane can keep moving forward. However, you must judge when it’s time to bring that part of the journey to an end, as a subsequent wrong weather call will blow you off-course, and lose the progress you have just made.

Misjudging the weather for first calls on turns in the closing stages, equivalent to heavy storms will force your plane back, up to five rows from original starting positions.

There are also random squall areas where you must backtrack a row if wanting to shelter.

Being in the lead is not a given for success. Your progress is never certain, planes can go forwards, and backwards too. Any player can go on a run at anytime and win the game in one turn.

Due to the high average call success rate, (over 75%), it’s very easy to rack up quick points, but you have to put your main focus on when to stop and bank those gains.

Air Master is a non-confrontational game, apart from tactically leaving difficult weather cards for the next player to deal with. However, you are still competing against each other to hit the winning line first. Risks have to be taken, but when?

This is a simple game with odds judgement that will tax even the brightest minds, and levels of addiction that compel you to get involved with other player decisions.

You may find yourself encouraging players to go for it, when really you want them to blow out and drop points. Oh there’s humour alright.

But when the same players then go on long winning runs, you actually want them to succeed. There’s a natural impulse to take interest in other players turns.

Then there’s your playing style. Are you an odds calculator who plays the percentages?

(If you’re into maths and probability, this is right up your street, and you will find good methods of play).

Or are you an instinct player who gets the feel of the cards and plays accordingly?

(Sometimes you’ll see a lopsided number chart, and know a change is coming).

Or never mind all that, you feel lucky and call whatever comes into your head; it's your day right?

( Only when all the luck is with you!)

Or should you play a mix of all three?

Air Master is a game where you sometimes have to step outside your comfort zone, no matter what your base impulses are.
Have you got the nerve to go against your natural instincts if it may win you the game?

So back to the game, do you play, or pass and give the next player something to think about? No thanks there!

Get it wrong and there are penalties. Get it right and you’re on a roll.

Correct calls win points. Fifteen will win it. You can be nearly there, and then start dropping back.

Can you handle the sympathy?

Then there is the fantastic help from your fellow players.

If you want to follow it, dream on – you’re in the wrong game.

Banter has no boundaries here, and some of the advice on offer would make your progress very backward indeed.

Sometimes you will remember a game for the laughs you had, the winner is irrelevant, well nearly. That’s how game sessions go.

Lots of humour and constant dilemmas. ‘’Air Master’’is a one-off rollercoaster.

For 1-6 players, aged 8 and upwards, and a playing time of 30-60 minutes.

The solo mode is limited by the number of plays through the deck. Ten minute playing time.

All age groups can understand the easy game mechanics, and many game plans can be devised, from simple hunch and feel, to varying degrees of mathematical strategies.

Experienced pilots judge the moments well, win more and earn the SAVVY crown.

Components: Game board, number chart, Duo board, 36 playing cards, 6 planes, 6 position markers, 1 squall disc, 1 crown, 35 markers.
1-6 players, 8+, 30-60 mins.

Rules:

Setup: Look through the cards and note the first number from 10 to 14. Place the blue squall disc on this same number on the game board.

Place a plane and position marker on the zero row for each player.

Place the SAVVY crown on the Win row.

Shuffle the cards and put one card aside face down. Lay the deck face down and turn over the top card and place beside it. Cover this number on the chart using the green marker.

(When the deck is depleted during the game, shuffle all the cards, including the card put aside, except the last turned up card, which becomes the new starting point).

How to Play: Choose a player to make first call as to whether the next card is higher or lower. There is a smoother game flow experience if one player manages the cards.

Choose a player to manage the number chart.

After each successful call, move the marker one row forward. If you then make an incorrect call, the marker is returned to the plane, and no progress has been made.

After successful consecutive calls, you may choose to stop, and move the plane forward to join the marker.

After unsuccessful calls, the turn is ended, and play moves clockwise.

Rows 0-3:

You may call again after an incorrect first call, one Free Go per turn.

You may pass your turn on rows 1-3 without penalty.

Rows 4-9:

At the start of your turn, before calling, you may choose to change the top card. However, move your plane and marker back a row.

You mass your turn without penalty.

(If you change the top card and then pass, you will have moved back one row).


Rows 10-14:

If you make an incorrect first call, move your plane and marker back to row 9.

You may choose to change the top card but move your plane and marker back a row.

You may pass on your turn but move your plane and marker back a row.

(If you change the top card and then pass, you will have moved back two rows).

If you change the top card and then make an incorrect first call, you move back to row 9.

Blue disc: This represent a squall. If you elect to stop when on one of these rows, you move back a row.

If you want to pass or change the top card, and that action puts your plane back to a blue row, you move back another row.

The first player to reach the Win area claims the SAVVY crown.

—description from the designer

name: Witches
description:
'WITCHES' is a hand management game in which little witches struggle to become a cannabis.

Watch what card the other person is going to play, make predictions.
It's a game where you use your little witch card a little strategic and fun.

1. All players start with one witch card in each color, two fake cards, and three physical coins.

2. Mix the remaining witch cards well and center the 'Great Witch' card and 18 physical coins.

3. There are two more chances each turn for the player to have a witch card before attacking the 'Great Witch'.

4. Players prepare to attack the 'Great Witch' by combining 3 cards with the same color witch card and fake card.

5. Once all players have finished selecting their cards, they will release them simultaneously to attack the 'Great Witch' according to their decision.

6. Depending on the remaining physical strength of the 'The Great Witch', the player is attacked by releasing one or two sheets in order from the pile of witch cards.

7-1. When the 'Great Witch's physical strength is below zero, the player with the most physical coins wins (if the same physical coin, the person with fewer cards) and becomes the 'Great Witch'.

7-2. If all but one player loses stamina, the last player becomes the 'god witch' and wins!

name: Night Cricket
description:
Players play as batting side or bowling side on a game board that resembles a cricket field. The aim of the batting side is to score as many runs as possible before being bowled out, while the aim of the bowling side is to get the batsmen out for the lowest possible score.

To bowl, the bowling side throws two dice. The total of the two dice decides between which two lines to the boundary the batsman will hit the ball.

After the bowler has bowled each ball and determined the direction of the batsman's shot, the batsman throws one dice. This dice determines how hard the batsman has hit the ball between the two lines to the boundary determined by the bowler.

Components: 40 play cards; one pad of scoresheets; fourteen tokens (ten white, one red, one blue and two black) and a red Coca-Cola pencil.

name: Kampf der Infektion
description:
Memory game with dice and piece.
The game board is a bronchial mucosa (5x6).
The 30 laying cards represent 5 different immunological defense mechanisms. The setting stone is a large round wooden disc. The dice shows 1-3 and three special symbols.
Shuffle the cards and place them on the game board. Place the set piece on any square.
When it is your turn, roll the die. If the dice show a number, you can move the stone horizontally, vertically or diagonally by the number of dice points. If the set piece lands on a hidden square, the active player may guess which defense mechanism it is. If he guesses correctly, he gets the card and places it face down in front of him. Then it is his turn again.
If the guess is wrong, the card is shown to all players and placed face down on the field again. Then it is the next player's turn.
The dice has three different event fields in addition to the number fields. So it can happen that the player rolling the dice gets a card of his choice from his left neighbor or that you have to give your own card to your left neighbor. If the text "Abwehr-Kraft" appears, you can place the set piece on any square and then guess.

name: Ten Fish
description: The objective of the game is to combine 2 or more cards to create a value of ten. This is a very important early math skill. Many additional games can be played with the cards.

name: MosDingTo: Bloody War
description:
MosDingTo: Bloody War is an easy party game for 3 to 5 players set in the midnight of your bedroom.

In MosDingTo: Bloody War, players will act as mosquito for several time and human once. In both acts, players try to gain blood from the opponent as much as you can. Human will protect the body part and hit the mosquito to save the blood. Mosquitoes try to obtain information and target the unprotected human body part to suck blood.

In more detail, human first selects body parts to protect and leave the cards in the table. Mosquitoes have to dodge the human's intercept, steal the card and share the hints to companion.

Both acts will then select the body part from their hand to attack. Human goes first and mosquitoes fight back if they escape from human's attack.

The game ended when every player acted as human once. Victory is achieved by gaining most bloods!


Ability of mosquitoes may cause a tons of joy all over the war, let's have fun with blood!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Flicking, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Memory, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Take That, Targeted Clues

name: Don Q. und die unbekannte Yante
description:
Don Q. und die unbekannte Yante is an abstract strategy game for two, played on an 8 x 8 grid. Each player owns six pieces at the beginning of the game. The goal is to either reach one of the two designated fields at the opponent's base line without the piece being eliminated in the next turn; or to eliminate all pieces of the opponent.
A piece always moves exactly three orthogonal steps, with turns being allowed. If a piece reaches an opponent's piece's field, it captures that piece. Players can re-introduce captured pieces of the opponent on certain fields on the grid, but these pieces are marked; if they are captured again by their original owner, they are out of the game.

name: Betelgeuse: The Celestial Strategy Game
description:
Betelgeuse is an abstract game with a space theme; the 397-space hexagonal board depicts Betelgeuse in the center and six other stars near the corners. Players have a supply of stars in their colors.

On a turn a player rolls two dice and places one star with each them; the number rolled determines how many spaces away the new star must be from a printed star (at the start of the game) or a player's own star (later on).

Getting three of one's own stars adjacent in a triangle destroys opposing stars in a certain radius and prevents further play there.

Each player also has a single black hole which can be placed to cause additional destruction, and there is a neutral comet piece which also destroys things; the comet is moved when a player rolls doubles.

There is an advanced game in which players form "solar systems" by encircling empty spaces or the printed stars.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Pattern Building

name: Arma
description:
Arma is a chariot racing game where two players alternate “shooting” a wooden disc called a chariot around an oval racetrack. Each player attempts a lap and a half around the entire board without being knocked into the gutter. The first player to successfully complete five of these laps will win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Ten-Twenty Grand
description:
Players attempt to reach a score of either 10,000 or 20,000 through rolls of six dice. Players must roll a minimum score of 500 and roll at least a one or a five to start in order to continue scoring. Subsequent rolls may be taken, though a player risks their scores by doing so. With each successive roll, players must roll a one or a five in order to keep scoring points. Point values vary depending on what type of roll a player gets (three of a kind, small straight, etc.), except for rolling six fives or six ones.

In the case of rolling six fives, a player automatically reaches 10,000 points and becomes winner pro-tem. The remaining players each get one final turn in an attempt to beat that players’ score. In the event of rolling six ones, a player automatically receives 20,000 points, and gameplay follows the same as if a player rolls six fives. The player with the highest score exceeding 10,000 or 20,000 wins.

name: Kampen om Karlskrona
description:
Kampen om Karlskrona is a game about the Swedish city of Karlskrona. The mechanics is, roughly, a mix of Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit where most of the questions are about the city and it´s history.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Donions and Dragons
description:
It's a board game inspired by role-playing games.

Players will have to defeat the enemies of an imaginary dungeon using their fighting dice. It combines strategy, chance, social decisions and companionship. Perfect for an easy to start game with your friends.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Set Collection

name: Extreme Shogi
description:
In Extreme Shogi, although the pieces move the same way as in standard Shogi, which pieces you have, and the layout of the board changes from round to round. A game consists of three rounds.

Players each choose a board card and the two cards together determine the layout of the board. Then each player chooses a pieces card which determines what 5 pieces they will play with. The two players will not necessarily have the same set of pieces. A screen is placed across the center of the board and each player arranges their pieces however they like.

When both players are ready, the screen is removed and play commences. As mentioned above, pieces move as in standard Shogi. Whoever first checkmates the opposing king wins the round. The winner of the game is whoever first wins three rounds.

name: Dungeon Storming: The Cultist
description: This promo expansion can be used with a game from the Dungeon Storming or Cthulhu Storming lines of games, and consists of a metal miniature and a duble-face character sheet.

name: Tanto Cuore: Winter Romance – Kickstarter Promos
description:
The Kickstarter for Winter Romance also introduced new promos in the form of alternate text cards and a new private butler. The private butler is, as of this writing, the only private butler currently released.

PR43: Chapel (Alternate Text - Building) - Requires Tanto Cuore or Expanding the House or Winter Romance
PR44: After the Banquet (Alternate Text - Building) - Requires Winter Romance
PR46: Compromise (Alternate Text - Drama) - Requires Winter Romance
PR47: Hated (Alternate Text - Drama) - Requires Winter Romance
PR48: Loneliness (Alternate Text - Drama) - Requires Winter Romance
PR49: Growing Closer (Alternate Text - Drama) - Requires Winter Romance
PR50: Chance Meeting (Alternate Text - Drama) - Requires Winter Romance
PR51: Ross Allison (New - Private Butler) - Any Tanto Cuore Base game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Tanto Cuore: Eris Heartland
description:
Around the same time as the 10th Year Kickstarter a new private maid was released which you would receive for free with your order when purchasing from Japanime Games' online store. A foil version of her was available through the Kickstarter as well.

PR55: Eris Heartland (New - Private Maid)
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: The Last Forest
description:
After the final world war, we find ourselves in the last living forest on the planet.

A group of animals, blessed by the spirit of nature, will cooperate to face what remains of the devastated, mutant and depraved human race to maintain hope in the last vestige of life.

The Last Forest is a cooperative board game, in which the players are wild animals, who face the dangers that lurk in the last forest.

By combining the forces of their decks, they will solve different exploration challenges together and improve their abilities. In the final phase of the game, they must be ready to defeat one of the different bosses and save the last forest.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Set-up

name: Martian Merchants
description:
A Looney Pyramids pickup-and-deliver puzzle game

As interplanetary merchants, shipping and trading goods throughout the galaxy, you race to be the first to bring desired goods back to the inhabitants of your home planets.

Large pyramids represent planets, which form the planetary navigational grid on the playing area. Ships travel between adjacent planets on the grid, which expands as more planets are discovered. The planets of your color are your home planets.
Medium pyramids are ships, which you use to travel from planet to planet making deliveries and establishing stations. You control three ships of your own color.
Small pyramids are goods, which are the commodities being picked up and delivered by your ships. The inhabitants of each planet desire goods of their planet’s own color. When you deliver a good to each of your home planets, you establish stations there.
The object of the game is to be the first player to establish 3 stations, one at each of your home planets.

—description from the designer

name: Monkey Spank!
description:
Monkey Spank! is a simple adult themed pattern recognition game in which players try to find an image shown on two cards.

Each card in Monkey Spank! features eight different symbols, with the symbols varying in size from one card to the next. Any two cards have exactly one symbol in common. For the basic Monkey Spank! game, one card is placed face up in the center of the table and players are dealt the remaining cards face down. Players simultaneously reveal the top card from their decks and try to find the symbol in common with their card and the center card. Which ever player is first to yell out their matching symbol (for example, "ball gag!") places their card as the new center card. That player then reveals the next card in their deck and all players repeat the process. The first player that runs out of cards in their deck is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Real-time

name: Rolling Farmers
description:
Rolling Farmers is a dice game with a farming theme. Players have farm boards and draft field cards, fulfill order cards, and improve their technologies. They each roll their six dice simultaneously and can place them on their fields according to the numbers they rolled. The fields then yield crops, and with the income from selling these crops, more things can be purchased.

To fulfill an order, pay the required crops. Depending on the number of players, the game ends after a player has fulfilled a certain number of orders. Your score depends on money, technology, fields, and fulfilled orders. The player with the highest score wins.

name: Star Wars: Trading Card Game – Revenge of the Sith
description:
The fate of the galaxy is in your hands.

An epic struggle between good and evil continues, and now you must take a side - the light side or the dark side. The Star Wars trading card game lets you and a friend engage in full-scale battles. You can choose to embrace the power of the Sith Lords or to align yourself with the Jedi Knights and use the Force for a higher purpose.

Star Wars: Trading Card Game is not all that different from Magic:TG. Like many TCGs, Star Wars comes in two player starter packs, individual deck starters, and the obvious booster packs. Cards include characters, ships, devices, and all of the original, first edition decks deal with Star Wars Episode II: Attack Of The Clones.

To play your first real game you will need to collect (or print out) two decks of 60 cards, a set of six sided dices, a set of damage counters, two force meters and a playmat with 3 battle zones(space, ground and character areas).
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Cabbages and Kings
description:
Cabbages and Kings is a trick-taking game played with a 44-card deck. There are four suits, each numbered 1-11: kings, cabbages, ships, and shoes.

The deal will generally not come out evenly: extra cards are set aside and given to the winner of the first trick. Before the first trick each player passes three cards to the player on their left.

Play is standard trick-taking: players must follow suit and may play anything if they cannot. There is no trump.

Player start with 50 points and they gain or lose points based on cards taken. Kings are worth 2 and cabbages -1. In addition the "big ship" (apparently the 10) is worth 10 and the "old shoe" is worth -10. The first player to reach 100 points wins.

name: ASL Comp: Behind Utah Beach – The Battle for Hill 30 and Chef du Pont
description:
Before we hit you with the massive Utah Beach map … you need to get back to the paratroopers that secured …
Behind Utah Beach and Hill 30, Ian Daglish's (dec.) stylized opus.

This edition comes with an enlarged map on the lay-flat, hard boards.
The scenarios are in color and you get new color die-cut counters including all the paratroopers you need plus new Armored Train counters and more!

Scenarios:

Gavin’s Train – Chef Du Pont, June 6th 1944
You’ve Killed Us - Chef Du Pont, June 6th 1944
Maloney’s Turn - Chef Du Pont, June 6th 1944
A Long Way to Berlin - Chef Du Pont, June 6th 1944
Lost Battalions - Caponnet, June 7th 1944
Fire Brigade to Filiolet – Le Port Filiolet, June 8th 1944
Shanley’s Hill – Caponnet, June 8th 1944
Everybody’s Dying – Le Port Filiolet, June 9th 1944
Lifeline – Le Port Filiolet, June 9th 1944
Access Denied – Caponnet, June 9th 1944
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: ASL Comp: Scottish Corridor 1 – The Battle of Normandy 1944
description:
Scottish Corridor 1 - The Battle of Normandy 1944
The battle in the Norman countryside along and north of the Odon River.
This area was the sight of the ‘Epsom Offensive’ during late June 1944.
Montgomery’s offensive to capture Caen would draw a massive response from the cream of Hitler’s remaining SS Panzer forces in Normandy, including 12th Waffen SS Division Hitler Jugend. The offensive, attacked on three sides of the ‘Scottish Corridor’ failed to capture Caen. It did represent a strategic success, drawing off and bleeding off Hitler’s remaining armored fist. The Allied breakthrough would come soon enough, as would the German Rucksmarsch—the precipitous retreat to the Seine that followed the collapse in Normandy.
This module includes one new enlarged map that links to Scottish Corridor 2.

ASLComp Last Word Editions contain larger maps (with larger hexes), on cardstock, folding with no trimming needed.

Ownership of the ASL-RB, and any modules providing the Germans and British, plus standard system marker counters is required to play this historical module.

Scenarios:

Honey Trap – Gavrus, Normandy, June 28th 1944
Cameronians Crossing – Le Valtru, Normandy, June 28th 1944
Seaforth Objective – Le Valtru, Normandy, June 28th 1944
Looking for Trouble – Gavrus, Normandy, June 29th 1944
Hohenstaufen Left – Le Valtru, Normandy, June 29th 1944
Frundsberg Right – Gavrus, Normandy, June 29th 1944
The Flank of the Black Bull – Gavrus, Normandy, June 29th 1944
The Lost Platoon – Gavrus, Normandy, June 29th 1944
Order for the Major – Gavrus, Normandy, June 30th 1944
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: ASL Comp: Scottish Corridor 2 – The Battle of Normandy 1944
description:
Scottish Corridor 2 - The Battle of Normandy 1944
The battle in the Norman countryside along and north of the Odon River.
This area was the sight of the ‘Epsom Offensive’ during late June 1944.

This module includes one new enlarged map that links to Scottish Corridor 1.

ASL Comp Last Word Editions contain larger maps (with larger hexes), on cardstock, folding with no trimming needed.

Ownership of the ASL-RB, and any modules providing the Germans and British, plus standard system marker counters is required to play this historical module as well as Scottish Corridor 1 for the new AFV counters.

Scenarios:

Pip Robert’s Run – South of Cheux, Normandy, June 26th 1944
Justify the Losses – Le Haut du Bosq, Normandy, June 26th 1944
Siegel’s Stand 1 – North of Grainville-Sur-Odon, Normandy, June 27th 1944
Siegel’s Stand 2 – North of Grainville-Sur-Odon, Normandy, June 27th 1944
Position be Buggered! - Grainville-Sur-Odon, Normandy, June 27th 1944
Shout for Piats – Le Haut du Bosq, Normandy, June 27th 1944
Grainville-Sur-Odon - Grainville-Sur-Odon, Normandy, June 27th 1944
We Blessed Them – Belval, Normandy, June 29th 1944
Destruction of a Squadron – Belval, Normandy, June 29th 1944
DF 109 – Belval, Normandy, July 1st 1944
Wide Diamond - Grainville-Sur-Odon, Normandy, June 28th 1944
The Breakthrough – South of Grainville-Sur-Odon, Normandy, June 28th 1944
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Good vs Gooder
description:
Which good thing is gooder—Brunch Mimosas or Seeing a Bunch of Hot Air Balloons? Air Conditioning or A Clean Public Restroom? 272 Debate Cards and 36,856 possible pairings make up Good vs Gooder, a party game where teams create random matchups and debate which good thing is gooder. Let's share stories, laugh together, and start spreading some goodness!

All players divide into three teams and draw five Debate Cards. Two teams submit their favorite Debate Card. The third team flips over the two Debate Cards and judges Round 1. Teams try to persuade the judges with stories, jokes, real-life experiences, and fun facts. After a few minutes, the judges deliberate and vote for which team was more persuasive.

The winning team draws either a Good Card or a Gooder Card. All Good Cards are worth one point. Some Gooder Cards earn teams more than one point. Some are worth negative points. And some are action cards (like forcing your opponent to impersonate a celebrity during the debate). Teams must decide whether to play it safe or take a chance!

After Round 1, rotate which team judges and keep playing until you've completed 12 total debates. Whichever team has accumulated the most points after the last debate is declared the Goodest of All Time!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Player Judge, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: ASL Comp: GWASL V – Hapsburg Ambitions: Austria-Hungary
description:
A key player in the Central Powers, Austria-Hungary and its territorial ambitions represented a match to the tinder-box that become World War I.
The Hapsburgs, namely Emperor Franz Josef, dreamed the dreams of conquerors. Ever an expansionist, Josef’s latest conquest was Bosnia-Herzegovina. And it was a Bosnian Serb that assassinated Crown Prince Franz Ferdinand, in Sarajevo. The Austrian ultimatum to Serbia followed on 28 July 1914. On 1 August Germany declared war on Russia, the protector of the Slavs. Within a few days Austria declared war on Russia, then on Belgium on 7 August. By the end of 1914, Austria-Hungary and Germany would be at war with France, Britain and Japan, and later, following the attack on Serbia, Montenegro. There were setbacks in the campaign against Russia in Galicia. The Austrian army had more success in 1915, and by the middle of 1916 had conquered Serbia and Montenegro, pushed the Russians back from Poland and by the end of 1916 a combined German-Austrian-Bulgarian attack knocked out Romania. The Austrians also had to face Italian attacks on the South Tirol and the Isonzo River. It was the success of British and French reinforcements, reaching the Balkans and Italy, that forced the Austrian Emperor to sue for peace in October 1918. On 29 October, as the Austrian Army fell back from the Piave River, British and Italian aircraft fired into the fleeing columns.
The Austrian armistice took effect on 4 November 1918.
A total of 1,495,200 Austro-Hungarian soldiers died during World War I.

Ownership ASL-RB, GWASL I and all preceding GWASL modules are required to play.

Scenarios:

Polish Legion – Kostiuchnowka, Ukraine, June 8th 1916
Bread Not Blood – Radoszyce, Galicia, November 20th 1914
Brzo, Brzo! – Radoszyce, Hungary, November 17th 1914
Polish Hill – Kolki, Hungary, July 4th 1916
To The Very Last Hour – Przemysl, Galicia, March 20th 1915
Cossack Terror – Buczacz, Hungary, June 8th 1916
Opportunity In Bukovina – Okna, Austria-Hungary, June 6th 1916
The Rojische Bridgehead – Rojische, Ukraine, June 9th 1916
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: PrimEVO: Gods & Nightmares
description:
Gods & Monsters is the first expansion for PrimEVO and deals with Jurassic elements of play including more scenarios, more additional rules, 11 dinosaur species each with their own AI, and a system allowing your tribe to build their God as they see fit while periodically bringing them to the battlefield, all of which can be incorporated with everything in the core book.

- description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures, Prehistoric

name: Phoenix Command: Lock and Load Vietnam: 1965 - 1971 Supplement
description:
Clearly one of the defining military conflicts of our time, the Vietnam War pitted the military might of the USA against the willpower of the Vietnamese Communists. Political and military leaders on both sides struggled to dictate the direction of a new kind of war, a guerilla war on an immense scale. The lessons learned in Vietnam have been applied to countless battlefields.

It was the soldier in the field who provided the lessons, by learning them the hard way. This Scenario Pack allows players to re-create the Vietnam War as it was fought by the infantrymen of the forces involved: US Marines, US Army, South Vietnamese ARVN, ARVN Rangers, Regional Force/Popular Force, NVA Regulars, NVA Sappers and Viet Cong Guerillas.

Lock and Load includes seven scenarios drawn from the war: Jungle Patrol, Search and Destroy, Night Ambush, Street Fight, Fire Base defense, Rescue Operation, and Flank Security.

Each Scenario includes a pull page map designed for easy enlargement to any s8ize. Equipment Options allow the scenarios to be customized with Punji Stakes, Trip Flares, Barbed Wire, Bangalore Torpedoes, Booby-Trapped Grenades, and more. Pre-Generated Troop data provides complete Combat and Weapon Data for 59 types of Combatants with 13 Weapons, allowing players to quickly set-up and play any scenario. Included are m1/M2 Carbine, M3 "Grease Gun", M1 Garand, BAR, M-14 and SKS Rifles, M-16 and AK-47 Assault Rifles, M-60 and RPD Machine Guns and RPG-2, RPG-7 and M-79 Grenade launchers.

The Revolution in Game Design Continues!
- from the back of the book
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: Gnomotecnia
description:
A group of gnomes has gotten lost on their way home. It's getting darker, and the forest beasts are approaching. They must recall all the details of the road to guide themselves to safety before any beast surprises them...

Gnomotecnia is a twenty-card game in which each player represents one of the lost gnomes in the forest. At the start of the game, each player has in front of them four face-down pieces of a 2x2 map. To win the game, players need to correctly assemble a map using their famous good memory.

On their turn, a player can take two of these actions:


Look at one of their cards.
Exchange one of their cards with another player.
Change the position of two cards of another player.
Lock one of their cards until the end of the game, which means that no one can move it or look at it.


The game ends when a gnome announces that they have remembered a way home, meaning they have finished assembling their personal map. If they've done so, they win.

•••

Un grupo de gnomos se pierden camino a casa, está atardeciendo y las bestias comienzan a aparecer. Deben hacer memoria y recordar todos los detalles del camino para guiarse antes que alguna bestia los sorprenda desprevenidos.

name: Sternenschweif: Der silberne Stern
description:
The Silver Star is the brightest star in the twinkling night sky. Its power allows unicorns to live on earth. But suddenly Laura and her unicorn Star Tail discover that the light of the star is getting weaker and weaker. Help Laura and Starletail find all of the Silver Star's starspikes before its light goes out! Only together can the players make the magical star sparkle again and save all the unicorns.

In this game all children play together and try to beat the game by finding the prongs of the silver star before it reaches the end of the timeline and its light goes out forever. The game lasts about 20 minutes and is suitable for players aged 6 and up.

-translation of publisher's website

name: Justice League
description:
Unite to fight evil! Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman, Aquaman, Cyborg and Flash join forces to create the Justice League. Together they will fight evil with their super powers and free the world from the attacks of super villains. Advance from city to city eliminating the "Parademons" to reach the final square where only the survivors can face Steppenwolf and try to defeat him. The cooperative Superhero game where strategy makes the difference.
Can be played as a team or solo. A collaborative game against the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: No panic! Extreme
description: Draw a theme card, cross your fingers, then spin the wheel. Quick ! You must find as many answers as indicated by the wheel. So avoid at all costs falling on the extreme box! Keep your cool, time is on your side: the faster you will be, the further you will be able to advance on the board. Can be played alone or in teams. With over 1000 crazy questions!

name: Ah é, né?
description:
Ah é, né? is a card game for 3 to 5 players where the most important is to create the most creative history.

Each player has a hand of cards showing, each, a different object or person.
Each round one card is opened in the center of the table and, starting with these card, each player in sequence must continue a history adding one of the card he hold in his hand.
This way, each round the players have less cards to choose from and to attach to the history.
After every player use one card, everyone must vote who make the best piece of history in these round, but the player cannot vote in himself.
Each vote is one victory point.
After a certain amount of rounds, the player with most points is the winner.

name: Globetrotter
description:
Globetrotter - travel the world and the 7 seas.

Enjoy a fantastic travel around the world - and test your knowledge about all the countries on your trip!

Globetrotter is an entertaining family game, where the players participate in an exiting race across the continents answering educational questions about the world.

All players start in "Alaska" and follow the route across the continents. To continue on your turn, you must answer correctly to the question given from a country on the current continent the player is travelling through. A throw with the dice, determines both how far you can travel on your turn, as well as the difficulty of the question.

The "globetrotter" to reach "THE END" beneath New Zealand first, is the winner.

name: Play the Ancient Greek Wars
description:
From the Trojan War, to the Persian conflicts up to the Macedonian conquest, through great battles from Marathon to Issus.

Cradle of Western civilization, the foundations of modern thought were laid in ancient Greece, but also bloody battles and total wars.

It is the epic story of the hoplite, armed with a shield, helmet, and breastplates. And also of the Macedonian phalanx. By reviewing the most significant armies and clashes, on land and at sea, of a failed empire.

—description from the publisher

name: Forge of Nations: The Strategy Card Game
description:
A history-themed card drafting and city building game commemorating two hundred years of Singapore's history.

Player starts with a jungle, and your job is to grow it to a village, town and towards a city.

This can be done through growing the four developmental pillars of your settlement: Population, Economy, Governance, Infrastructure. During your turn, you can a) build your settlement, b) trade with fellow players or c) cause crisis situations to them. Grow your settlement while watching out for your rivals. First player to build the city wins.

Depending on the specific pillars you draft and build, grow your city to either a hippie tourism spot, economic bustling city with governance, or offshore gambling den... the possibilities of your settlement are endless!

name: Trapped: The Art Heist
description:
Escape Room Game Pack
Series 1, Room 1
Difficulty level: Medium

The Art Heist: Steal the Painting. Flee the Scene.

TRAPPED turns any room into a family-friendly escape-room adventure... In The Art Heist, the obscenely-rich Harrington family invites you to a display of their priceless art collection. Upset that his family hoards the wealth and he's not getting his fair share, youngest son Charles asks your team to steal a painting...

Fearing detection, Charles leaves only a series of coded clues to help you to find the right artwork. But you're not alone! Charles has also convinced one of the staff to help you escape... Can you find the painting, steal it, and flee the scene—all against the clock?

-description from the publisher's website

name: Isvaffelspil
description: The game consists of 10 pastel-coloured dice and 50 cards representing ice cream cones with one to five scoops. Each player receives 5 dice and a half of the cards, face down. Both players turn the first card from their deck at the same time and then roll the dice. They save the dice matching the scoops on their card, and may reroll any of the other dice as many times as needed to complete their ice creams. The player that first completes their ice cream wins both cards, and a new round starts. When the piles are exhausted, the game ends. The player with the most cards wins.

name: Darkness Within: Age of Fantasy – Narrative Campaign
description:
Darkness Within is a narrative campaign for Age of Fantasy that follows the story of Misha, a young princess who must rise to the challenge and reclaim her throne after a vampire uprising brings darkness to the realm.

This game expansion for Age of Fantasy takes players on an adventure across 10 missions which are tied together by an exciting story of epic proportions.
Rules for unit progression are also included, so you can watch your armies grow and evolve throughout the campaign.

Even though this narrative campaign was written with Humans and Vampiric Undead in mind, it is easy to imagine this type of clash to be happening between any of the other factions in the world, so feel free to swap them out with whatever armies you have available to play.

Note that to play this campaign you’re going to need the core rules for Age of Fantasy as well as some army lists, which you can find for free on onepagerules website.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Fantasy Battles: Ultra Simple Games
description:
Simple set of fantasy miniature wargaming rules available for free.

Turn Sequence:
Initiative Phase
Command Phase
Action Phase
Army Morale Phase
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: 3 Minutes to Freedom (or Death)
description:
This is a short card game for 3-8 players that pushes players to speak and interact with each other in unusual ways, to keep the play entertaining.

Players use cards to force a variety of effects on each other. Many of these have conditions (e.g. "Dance like a sheep for 10 seconds. If you don't, you die.") that must be fulfilled to not be eliminated from the game.

The last player remaining is the winner.

name: Suits & Daggers
description:
Players are assigned secret Statuses at the beginning of the game, deeming them either an Employee or Influencer. Influencers can deflect Sabotages and add bonus points to Collaboration, but using either power exposes their Status and Status cards are shuffled and redealt.

To earn points, players complete their assigned Objective cards by gathering the necessary Work cards into their hand. Without the right cards, players can still try to earn points by either “Slacking” (bluffing about having the right cards), or by collaborating with other players to complete Objectives-- selecting a partner who claims to have the cards you need and pooling resources to fulfill your objective.

Watch out though-- collaborating with the wrong player might mean getting Sabotaged (when your partner gives you any card(s) other than what you need), but collaborating with the right player (specifically, an Influencer) leads to seven (7) additional bonus points for the completed objective.

Some Work cards are also Undercut cards-- attacks that players can use against their peers. Players can use up to two Undercuts on other players at the end of their turn.

Sabotaging an Influencer by accident results in losing points, so be careful who you target! Regular Employees can also block Undercuts if they have an elusive Water Cooler card in hand at the time of an attempted attack.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Advantage Token, Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Tardigrade Wanderer Promo Card
description:
Munchkin CCG TCG Tardigrade Wanderer Promo DeSouza Art Free RPG Day Exclusive.

Hero Card.

DESCRIPTION:
Zap – Move 1 card from your discard pile to the bottom of your deck.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Ziiip
description:
Players play cards from their hand (3 cards in each category).
Cards are divided in 4 categories:

SERVICE
RECEP-DEF
ATTACK
STAR


Gameplay:
Player A plays a card (indicating a number of dice to roll and some bonus) and player B tries to match it, until it one wins the point.
i.e. player A plays a "Service" card, player B has to match it (with a roll Recep/defense card), if B doesn't, A scores a point. If B matches.
If B does match it (or better), then B can play an attack card that now has to be matched by A...

This goes on for every point until one of the player reaches the required winning points.

name: La Baraja Mutante
description:
In a remote place there is a Pyramid that hides in its interior a Dazzling Treasure. Four Peoples embarked, a long time ago, on their search. The People of the Valley, the People of the Forest, the People of the Mountain, and the People of Space. Four lonely heroes, bored of being so lonely, decided to join the quest: the skeleton, the robot, the barbarian and the mermaid.
Thus was born the authentic and original... Mutant Deck I

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Supernova
description:
Command an elite group of death-defying spaceships desperately harvesting energy from a dying star before it explodes in this game of orbital mechanics. Utilizing a unique spiral gameboard inspired by the ancient Egyptian game of Mehen (previously reconstructed and released by the same game designer, Zach Horton), Supernova requires you to make tough choices, as all of your ships must share the same energy allotment, and it is never enough to power them all at once.  The more you power, the fewer Boost Points each one receives, restricting its maneuverability.  This is a high-stakes tradeoff, as the star's gravity pulls all of your ships ever closer. You'll need to boost your orbits to keep from burning up.

Ships move in a counterclockwise spiral toward the star at the center, while the star releases energy bursts (cubes) that travel clockwise toward the edges of the board.  The core of the game lies in the interactions between the energy cubes and ships as they collide.  Different types of cubes behave differently, but all are dangerous and all are valuable if you can capture them.  Clear and yellow cubes can be stored and used as energy to perform special actions, while yellow and red cubes count as victory points at the end of the game.  These energy cubes serve as your primary obstacles, primary goal, in-game currency, and victory points.

Players take turns deciding how many ships to power and then moving each one according to both gravity and Boost Points.  Ships can form special formations to help protect them, block your opponents, and collect energy cubes.  After players have taken their turns, each round ends with a "star action" that moves the cubes on the board and releases new ones.  The sequence of star actions is determined by randomly drawing cards when you set up the game.  Thus every game is completely different.  Players can only see the star cards for the current and next rounds, and therefore have limited information about future conditions.  Despite this element of long-term uncertainty, however, there is no other luck in the game.  Players have complete control over the outcomes of their actions.

Supernova is relatively easy to play, but exceptionally difficult to master, as it asks you to think in spiral rather than linear geometry.  The game's mechanics offer many possible ways to achieve your goals, but far more options become available when you begin to work with rather than against the spiral: sometimes the most efficient path from A to B is the long way around...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Movement Points, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Bystre Główki
description:
A memory game for big and small! Smart Heads is a card game that trains memory and concentration. The player's task is to remember the pictures of the played cards and tell about them in the correct order.

There are also few special cards that change the direction of the card, give player bonus card or challenge players to tell about the last three cards in the reverse order.

name: SideHustle: The Party Game for Entrepreneurs
description:
Players are given a random word business name and category and have to come up with and pitch a brand new business idea to other players. Both "Funny" and "Fundable" pitches are rewarded so multiple play styles can succeed.

It's Like Shark Tank meets apples to apples.

How its played:
-Split into 4 teams. 1 team starts as the "Investor", the rest as "Entrepreneurs"
-The investor pulls a SideHustle Card with a random business name that doesn't exist on it (ie. Goose Booster, or FlipStak) and rolls an industry die to pick the category (ie. Food & Beverage, or Health & Wellness).
-The Entreprenuer teams then brainstorm a brand new business or product and take turns each pitching their version of the Side Hustle to the Investor Team.
-The Investor then hands out a Funny card and a Funny card as they like based on the pitches/presentations of the Entrepreneurs.
-The roles then rotate and first team to 5 cards, wins

SideHustle essentially creates parameters for creativity for the players and plays to many different player styles. Silly Ideas and presentational styles may win the Funny card, while analytical and methodical approaches may win the Fundable card.

The materials are family friendly and because the ideas come from the players, it's a different game every time.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Economic, Educational, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Player Judge, Team-Based Game

name: Halloween Party: Memento Mori
description:
Expansion to Hallowen Party (2019)

Halloween Party: Memento Mori includes:

-2 (3 via KS Stretch Goals) additional playable characters w/ associated reference cards (1 per character, with 1 in Spanish and 1 in English translation...6 total)
-10 Minor Spell Cards
-2 Major Spell Cards
-18 new Creature Cards (+3 additional from KS Stretch Goals)
-15 Ritual Cards
-3 Halloween Pet Cards (via KS stretch goals)
-12 reference cards (6 in Spanish, 6 in English translation)
-1 rulesheet (1 side in Spanish, 1 side in English translation)
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Take That

name: Corfù 1716
description:
Corfù 1716 is a wargame for two players simulating the last Venetian victory against the Ottoman Empire.

After the Morea War and the Passarowitz Peace (1699), with the Venetian reconquest of the Peloponnese area thanks to the great Doge Morosini, the Ottoman Empire seeks its revenge.
In 1715 the Empire is ready and with the Second Peloponnesian War, it recaptures, thanks to some fortunate events and the lack of competence of the Venetian Generals, all the Aegean islands and the whole Peloponnese.
Now the Ottoman Empire is ready to strike the Adriatic Sea, the Venetian Gulf itself.
Only the island and fortress of Corfù is guarding it.
It is defended by about 5000 soldiers, mostly German mercenaries, lead by Marshal Schulenberg, the Venetian Commander in Chief. 30000 ottoman soldiers tried to storm the fortress but after 20 days of heavy combats the Ottoman Army withdrew.
It would have been the last victory of the Serenissima, as it is called Venice. Antonio Vivaldi would have composed the oratory Juditha triunphans devicta Holofernis barbarie to celebrate this great victory.

In Corfù 1716 you will find 12 Venetian combat units, divided into 6 German Mercenary units, 3 Italian infantry units and 3 Ultramarine infantry and 20 Ottoman combat units, divided into 4 Janissaries units, 9 Kapikulu infantry and 7 auxiliary Serhaddkulu units representing the regiments and units employed during the siege.
There are two Morale chits for a total of 34 pieces, 2 d6s, a map, 9 Special Event Cards and the rules.

The map represents the area where the battle took place; it is used to register the orders and the consistency of the two armies.
The map is divided into Area, where to deploy the units and where the actions take place during the 20 turns.
There are the Combat Tables, with the result of the Combat and the Morale Track, which registers the Morale level of the two armies and the Turn Table.

—description from the publisher

name: Dampflok-Spiel
description:
Players move their steam locomotive by dice from a depot to one of the two stations, pick up a railway wagon and deliver this wagon to the other station. The railway track gives opportunities to overtake other trains or to use an abbreviation.
After this work is done, the player to arrive first at the depot wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Aloha Earth
description:
In Aloha Earth, players take the roles of alien "Experts of Human Things" to debate the details of a now-extinct (due to...something?) human civilization. Every earth-year, the Human Summit meets to debate important topics such as whether a "Triple Vegan" is a "Transcended Human Being" or a "Sports Pass performed only with a Cabbage".

The whimsical improvisational style puts all players on an even playing field. Because the alien experts don't know what humans were actually like, they can infer results that might be based on complete nonsense. Because YOU are the expert, however, no one can say "You're wrong!"

The scoring in the game inspires collaborative storytelling. After a debate, all players vote on someone who told the most convincing backstory for the object or reference. That player scores two points, but then must award a bonus point to another player who best helped them come to that conclusion!

name: Cronk Chess
description:
This is a mashup of chess and checkers. Set up a normal chess game but with 8 checkers on each side where the 8 pawns normally go.

The chess pieces move, attack, and capture as they normally do, including castling. The checkers move and capture (jump) as they normally do, diagonally. Checkers that reach the other side get kinged. If a checker can jump another checker or chess piece (or double or triple jump etc.), it must jump those pieces. If your checker must jump your opponent's piece(s), but you're also in check, you must get out of check instead of jumping with the checker.

The game is won by checkmating the opponent's king either by an attack from a chess piece just like in chess, or threat of being jumped by a checker piece that the king can't avoid.

I invented this game and the first time I tried playing it (about 15 years ago), I didn't think it would be any fun, but I was pleasantly surprised. It broke my brain as I mixed the two games in my head. I had to play chess while making sure my chess pieces weren't lined up in such a way that they could get double jumped! I also liked the fact that I could force moves on my opponent by placing pieces in position to be jumped by one of their checkers. Let me know if you find any rule collisions that I have missed.

—description from the designer

name: 黄色の天球 (Kiiro no Tenkyu)
description:
黄色の天球 (Kiiro no Tenkyu) is a memo deduction game from Japan. A series of murders take place in a mountain villa. The players try to resolve who is the murderer by working out who was with the victims. It is possible that one of the players is the killer or an non-player character (NPC).

The villa is represented in the game by an eight-sided cube. Each side has a transparent window and internal walls with doorways. The player pieces are put inside the cube and during the game it is turned about. The pieces move around, some to one room, some to another.

As players are moved around, they can collect evidence cards from a corresponding plan of the villa. Each player has alibi cards face down in front of them that they can look at. By meeting up in different rooms, a player can see cards held by other players or NPCs.

A murder takes place at 9pm, and each turn is ten minutes in the game. On the hour, another murder, then a third until the game ends at midnight.

The players must try to deduce who is committing the murders and with what weapon, where and when. As the game progresses, players can make their claim by passing and becoming the start player. They score points if they identify correctly the hidden info for each crime.

Finding the murder weapon in the room is very hard but possible too.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points is the winner.
user summary
publishers: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: アザトース (Azathoth)
description:
アザトース (Azathoth) is a card game from Japan mixing anime and Cthulhu themes. A variation on Old Maid, players are trying to form up pairs of cards to empty their hands. Some of the cards are for the Old Gods. The cards have text on them, and the Old Gods have special abilities. Players must always keep Old Gods cards in their hand (they start with one), and if they are found without one, they draw a penalty.

The main cards are anime, with letters of the alphabet, such that a player asks another for an A or a B and so on. Making up sets lets the player discard them.

The special abilities of the Old Gods restrict how those cards might be played.

Like many Loserdogs games, the game is sold in a large ziplocked bag with minimal production. The cardstock is thin but playable.
user summary
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Religious
mechanics: Hand Management, Hot Potato, Set Collection

name: 太陽と雨と虹  (Sun, Rain and Rainbow)
description:
太陽と雨と虹 ("Sun, Rain and Rainbow") is a card game. The cards consist of 36 cards in 7 color suits. Each suit has either a Sun or Rain(s). The color of suit can be recognized by the card back. The box comes with 4 games (with their rulebooks): "Sun Rummy”, "Rain Go Out", "Rainbow Trick" and "Weather Line".

"Lamii of the Sun"
Put the card in your place and make a role. By recombining the cards in the field and making good use of the special effects of the roles, you can create a role with a higher score and aim for a higher score by rising faster.

"Rain go out"
I will put out cards of the same color or continuous colors face down. I don't even know if it's "rainy" or "sunny". By reading and intuition, I will compete to get out of my hand as soon as possible.

"Rainbow Trick"
An anomalous trick-taking game where you control the points you earn. The winner will take the card by comparing the strength of the cards issued by everyone. Repeat this process, calculate the points you can get with the cards you get, and compete for points according to the points.

"Weather line"
Cards are put out alternately to make a four-row line. Compare the number of "own teams" for each row, and the one with the most will conquer that row. Compete for victory or defeat by the total number of conquered rows.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Ladder Climbing, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trick-taking
publishers: iop games (イオピーゲームズ)

name: Introduction to (Drawing) Graph Theory
description:
In this game, we will draw simple graphs using resources available to us: vertices, edges, and Eulerian (this resource acts as currency). To draw a graph, we need vertices and edges. We use Eulerian to use the effect of an active Extra Power card.

Each round we will choose one resource card from the ones available in that round, one resource card usually contains a number of two different resources. There is also Extra Power that we can use for that round. This Extra Power changes every round.

name: Trypsylon
description:
The game is in the tradition of the abstract connecting games like Hex and consists of 36 identical tiles showing a route in the shape of a "Y". At the beginning, all tiles are arranged face down forming a large square. On your turn, pick a face down tile and push it from the border into the square with the Y face up.
The player who first has a complete route from his side to the opposite side wins.

—user summary

name: Hyex: In the name of science
description:
Better keep your hands off this game if you don't want to get your hands dirty! If you are brave enough to involve in this experiment and willing to mercilessly sacrifice your creations in the name of science, you will become the scientist in a laboratory and hybridize and harvest your living samples. Care about your species and slaughter them at the right time to gain more points than your opponent. Be careful to avoid getting the experiment out of control.

Players take turns to spawn and hybridize the samples and harvest them at the right time to gain more victory points which are necessary to win. Each turn chose from following actions and after reaching 12 points game ends.

(at first is increased age of each living sample)


Draw a sample – draw a card
Harvest one living sample – gaining points from placed cards and discarding
Hybridize two samples (attempt with dice rolling) – possibility of placing of 2 cards as one sample, combination of both cards gives the sample unique ability - the most important for gaining victory points
Spawn one ordinary sample (also after unsuccessful hybridizing) – placing one ordinary sample (one card) which provides low amount of points
Play an alternative action (also after unsuccessful hybridizing) – play action shown along left side of the card


—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Farming, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Layering, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Antiquity of Mars
description:
Billions of years ago…
Mars was a flourishing planet teaming with life and vast seas. As the magnetic field over Mars weakened, radiation began to dry up the seas and solar winds caused the atmosphere to deplete. This in turn reduced the planet’s ability to maintain heat. After centuries of research, Mars’ leading scientists have developed a way to slow the depletion of oxygen and the cooling of the planet; however, it’s too little and far too late. It’s only a matter of time before the planet becomes completely uninhabitable. In this harsh environment, the few remaining races of Mars dangle from their last thread of existence.

Overview
Each player will represent a leader of one of the remaining races of ancient Mars. They will struggle to maintain the morale of their populace, while helping to keep the planet survivable for as long as possible. Players will also need to maintain control of lands to provide food, water and other resources—a task which may require force. Players will take turns placing multi-use cards on action spaces. The action space chosen will determine which part of the player’s card is activated (political, civil, or military). As the game progresses, players will expand their influence to gain more powerful actions, develop technologies to help combat the planet’s condition, gather resources to help keep their populace happy, and train armies to maintain their lands and resources. Each race is equipped with a unique ability allowing for various approaches to victory.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Lauschwunder
description:
A memory game in which you don't have to find pairs of pictures but pairs of towers that sound the same. The towers are filled with material such as shells, pebbles, sand and much more.

The towers can also be filled with your own objects.

–user summary

name: Pregame of Majority 2
description:
Pregame of Majority 2 is a 2 player card game from Japan. It is a simplified version of the game The Majority 2

Welcome to the "Dark Council" in Nagatacho, the demon world! In this parliament, which is the center of the demon world, non-humans are still dying for their own benefit. And now, some have formed factions to gain a lot of money and power. Numbers is also power... If you gather like-minded friends, you may be able to dominate Congress. How powerful a faction can you create?

This game is a simplified version of The Majrity 2 with the theme of making factions. It is a two-player draft game played with three types of cards, and has simple rules and a unique play feeling that can be settled in five minutes. Enjoy a light game.
publisher's summary

name: 魔幻特攻 (Magic Special Attack)
description:
魔幻特攻, roughly translated as "Magic Special Attack", is a two player game where the players compete to score the most points.

The players are illusionists erecting barriers in an arena of limited space. When a player erects a barrier, they earn a gem of that color. In lieu of placing a normal barrier on their turn, a player may also pay a gem to place a special barrier of the corresponding color.

If through either type a barrier placement a player creates a 1x1 isolated space, they may earn a bonus gem.

One round ends when one of the players cannot place an additional barrier. The game lasts over four rounds and points are awarded for earning a certain number of gems of each color and for sets of gems. The player with the most points wins.

The game was originally released as part of the 2021 150BG.con convention in Taiwan, where games sell for 150 TWD, roughly $5 USD.

name: Learn with Eddu
description:
What can I spend my money on? How should I invest to increase my income? How much can I spend from my salary? How can I manage my money in the best way?

When it comes time to manage the money that you have every month, many questions arise. But here is Eddu with his advice to give you a little help to take care of your money now and in the future.

Learn with Eddu is a board game whose objective is to give basic notions of the administration of personal finances to young people of school age, as well as to initiate conversations that clarify the doubts on these subjects.

Eddu's game is an initiative of “Falabella Financiero”, and is part of its Financial Education Program that develops various activities, including educational interventions for young people between 12 and 15 years old whose objective is to improve the basic skills of the notion and administration of the money.

—description from the designer

name: 英雄对决 (Hero Battle)
description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.




A trading card game published by Chinese collectible card publisher Kayou.
In this game, players can use heros from Ultraman Universe or Marvel Universe to fight with the opponent.
At the start of the game, each player draw 9 cards and set 5 of them on the field, other 4 cards are their hand. In each turn, player should choose a card on the field to fight the opponent, the player who has 5 heroes defeated will lose the game.

So far, the series has published two Marvel basic packs and two Ultraman basic packs, as well as three Marvel booster packs and two Ultraman booster packs.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dinosaur Hunting!
description:
In the 1920's a valley was found full of Dinosaurs.
Soon hunters were heading there to try their luck at BIG big game hunting.

Lead a small group of hunters and see who can get the most trophies or indeed just survive.

Ideal for 28mm figures but will work with any size of figures just use what you have available.

Turn:

Randomly determine the order in which the players activate each turn.
The dinosaurs all activate after the players.
