On their turn a player activates each figure which can make two actions (move, fire, load or observe) They can do the same action twice if they want but there may be penalties for doing this.


–description from the publisher and the rulebook
categories: Adventure, Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Doobidoo
description:
Doobidoo makes everyday life a party and the party even more festive. There are no occasions that do not get more fun and happier with Doobidoo. Like music is all that is required. But are you also quick-thinking, an undiscovered Monet or do you sing like a god? Then you will love Doobidoo.

Collect letters by scoring points on the different squares on the board. Sing, draw, answer questions,
think fast and guess. Do not hesitate to let go and set the tone - that's the way to success. It made that
first manages to form the word DOOBIDOO with its letter tiles wins!

name: PitchCar: Foam Rail
description:
The Foam Rail features an adhesive that allows for it to be re-positioned and reused several times.

Need more rail to unleash your imagination? Create a Bridge, Tunnel, or Gap!

Includes: 1 meter length foam rail.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Racing, Sports

name: Koniki!
description:
On the nearby meadow a competition in horse jumping is being held. Pick your horse, pick your rider and compete! The player with highest score will gain a trophy and the title of the Master of a Meadow. Will you jump only over small puddles, or over the fence behind the barn? It all depends on your strategy and a bit of luck.

The modular board makes each play unique. Horse jumping obstacles have different score and player decide on which one to try. The dice roll reveals if it will succeed or no and if it will be possible to jump over more obstacles in one turn. The game develops the math and strategy skills for young children.

Bright colors and easy rules makes this game fit for the young kids like preschoolers and early schoolers.
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Whodunnit?: Mystery at the Museum
description:
Two crimes have been committed at the National Museum. Can you be the first to figure out WHO took WHAT priceless treasure, and hid it WHERE within the Museum? How are your detective skills?

Who Dunnit? Mystery at the Museum is a classic deduction game with twists and turns along the way. Put your detective hat on and go head-to-head to determine who, what and where to figure out the crime before your opponent does.

Put your thinking caps on, learn to ask the right questions and get to the bottom of the case first becoming a master detective!

name: Take It Serious: Stadt Land Unseriös
description:
Categories / scattergories board game with 72 different and innovative categories for great fun, played according to the classical scattergories rules. The aim is to collect as many points per round as possible in order to win the game after 12 rounds. But beware, there might be two winners in the end: one with the most points and the player who has best predicted his target number of points before the start of the game.

Das Stadt, Land, Fluss Spiel mit 72 abwechslungsreichen, lustigen und innovativen Kategorien für großen Spielspaß. Verpackt in einem praktischen DIN-A4 Block mit 50 Spielbögen. Gespielt wird nach den klassischen Stadt, Land, Fluss Regeln. Ziel ist es, möglichst viele Punkte je Runde zu sammeln, um das Spiel nach 12 Runden zu gewinnen. Doch Achtung es gewinnen zwei Spieler, der mit den meisten Punkten und der Spieler, der vor Beginn des Spiels seine Zielpunktzahl am besten vorhergesagt hat.

name: Operation Market Garden: Scenario 1 – XXX Corps Breakout: For Rapid Fire! Rules
description:
All the information needed for the first scenario from the Operation Market Garden Battlegroups and Battlegames book published in 2020.

This game simulates the initial breakout by the Irish Group under the cover of the rolling barrage.

The PDF also includes vehicle and gun statistics for the Reloaded version of Rapid Fire rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: ぺたぺた (Petapeta)
description:
ぺたぺた (Petapeta) is an area majority game where the players attach stickers to seven areas on a sheet of paper. The game includes several board variations, and the areas of each board are different sizes for different player counts.

The actions in the game center around a rondel. Each space allows the player to place one or two stickers in a single area on this game's board. Some stickers are a player's color and others are a neutral color.

The game ends when all players cannot place additional stickers. Points are earned for the number of large colored stickers placed; number of different areas with colored stickers; and most colored stickers in each area. The player with the most points wins.

name: Flames of War: Bagration – Axis-Allies: Hungarian, Romanian and Finnish forces on the Eastern Front 1944
description:
This book contains:

Background on the Finnish, Hungarian, and Romanian Armies during the epic battles for the Eastern Front in 1944 and 1945.
Instructions on how to build a Finnish T-26 Armoured Company, Sturmi Assault Gun Company and Infantry Company, or a Hungarian Panther Tank Company, Tiger Tank Company, Turán Tank Company, Panzer IV Tank Company, Zrinyi Assault Gun Company, StuG Assault Gun Company, Hetzer Assault Gun Company and Rifle Company, or a Romanian R-2 Light Tank Company, T-4 Medium Tank Company, TA Assault Gun Company, and Motorised Rifle Company.
Painting and Basing guides.
Three new Bagration themed Missions.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: ハリネズミは時計回りに (Hedgehog go around clockwise)
description:
ハリネズミは時計回りに (Hedgehog go around clockwise) is a puzzle-like board game from Japan that mixes elements of the traditional game Mancala and drafting dice. The game has polyhedral dice in different colours (d6, d10, d20). Players are alchemistic hedgehogs who go around collecting dice on their spines, to deliver them to their storerooms and laboratories. Each hedgehog has their own circuit, moving dice around in a way similar to mancala games.

The dice are then combined to make more and more creatures, which earn the hedgehogs gold coins and victory points. By combining different sets of d6 dice, the hedgehog gains certain d10 dice. Then, combining those in sets earns d20 dice, which lead to the most rewarding creatures.

At the end of the game, the hedgehog with the most points is the winner.

The publisher says:
A sensational new game woven by drafting dice around a mancala, mixing them to complete formulas and build up victory points!

You are a hedgehog alchemist. Every day you deliver magical materials to the Alchemist Guild for a rich old age.
Your small hands are not enough, so you can carry the materials around by sticking them into the needles on your back. Collect snails, frogs, and small dragon materials and deliver them to the guild to earn gold coins.

After delivery, turn around again and return the materials one by one to the storage. Mixing the colors of the dice is the key to acquiring new materials (dice). To get an orange frog (decahedron), you need red and yellow snails (hexahedron) and so on! The guild will give you gold coins when you deliver the materials you have acquired. After delivery, store the rest of the material (dice) in the storage.
user summary
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Mancala, Set Collection

name: Keys to Riverdale High
description:
Keys to Riverdale High is door flipping madness. Race your favourite character from the Archie comics down the halls of Riverdale High, where behind every door awaits a surprise. Just don’t let Mr. Weatherbee catch you, or it’s straight to the detention room. Gameplay is based on our best-selling tile game Keys To The Castle.

Keys to Riverdale High is a tile-based game of strategy and luck. Players must open and close doors (the tiles) to move along a path and be the first to cross to the other side.

Special cards are played to hacksaw through barred doors, use a skeleton key to unlock padlocked doors, throw a net on a player to stop them in their tracks or use secret passageways to maneuver your way to the other side.

The game is easy to learn and quick to play. With the tiles acting as the "board", there is a new outcome to each game every time the tiles and cards are shuffled.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Take That

name: ロストレガシー:文絵のために (Lost Legacy: For Fumie)
description:
ロストレガシー:文絵のために (Lost Legacy: For Fumie) is a card game from Japan, in which you can enjoy the world of 文絵のために (For Fumie) by using the system of Lost Legacy.

This title contains two games, Kanai Version and Kisaragi Version. Both of them can be played like Lost Legacy, but adjusted to be enjoyed with different approaches.

本作は「ロストレガシー」のシステムを利用した、「文絵のために」の世界を楽しむことができるカードゲームです。
本作は「カナイ Ver.」と「木皿儀 Ver.」の2作を収録しています。どちらも「ロストレガシー」のように遊ぶことができますが、それぞれ別のアプローチで楽しむよう調整されています。
user summary

name: Wonder Woman: Road Trip
description:
In the dead of night, an attack was carried out on the soil of your homeland. The full extent of the damage is not yet known, but the Amazonian archives have been ransacked and many sacred items are missing. Whispers of an ancient prophecy begin to swirl & one that warns of an unrelenting evil. It is believed the artifacts were stolen and are to be used to release this terrible evil on the world of Man. Sworn to protect the earth, you head out to reclaim these ancient relics and put an end to this threat.

Travel through the game board collecting information on the missing artifacts. Carry out board actions, collect HIT TOKENS, and acquire TOLL PASSES while you take out enemies in BRUTE BATTLES. Gain access to ENEMY ALTARS in your search to reclaim the Amazonian artifacts. Return the artifacts to your TEMPLE to stop the prophecy and save the Earth. The first person to complete their SCORE CARD by acquiring 4 unique ARTIFACT TOKENS and return them to their TEMPLE is the winner.

name: Cut Throats Tavern
description:
Cut Throats Tavern is the second adventure in the Zadorf series of mini solitaire card games, but can also be played as a stand-alone game.

Gamble, cheat, and risk your life in a variety of games as you try to raise the stake money required to enter into a game of Duel against Big G – the proprietor of Cut Throats Tavern.

All games are card based and you must work out the best strategy to increase your 3 Zeds (the currency around here) to 10 Zeds.

Gamble on the outcome of fights, try and outfox Roxy, and risk it all in a game of Russian Roulette against Mad Jack.

If you raise the 10 Zeds required you can then enter into a game of Duel against Big G. Win and you will gain weapons to aid you in your final adventure against the evil Lord Zadorf at a later date, lose and you will forever be in Big G’s debt!

Be careful how you tread, it’s not called Cut Throats Tavern for no reason!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deck Construction, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Ballen met stieren
description:
In Ballen met Stieren players make their own selection and draft action cards. Then, they draw a hand of five cards from their own decks of bulls and action cards. Taking turns, they play a bull and an action card in order to execute an attack or defense. The game is won by the first player to score five goals, or the player who has scored the most goals at the end of the game. You also win immediately if your opponent gains three red cards.
A few tactical effects of your actions: when you gain a red card, you have to keep it in your hand, reducing your options from five to four.

In Ballen met Stieren, almost anything is allowed, including matchfixing, sliding and headbutting. However, you do risk penalties from the referee or the VAR.
Tactical options: substitutions, using different bulls, counter, etc.

In total, there are 28 different action cards in this game, which can make the difference in combination with the attack and defense power of the bulls themselves.

As they say: the ball is round, the meadow is filled with holes, you never know how the ball rolls or how a cow catches a hare. In short: be ready for a lot of soccer humor, fun and suspense...

—description from the publisher

(The description from the publisher uses various Dutch proverbs that do not translate well to English.)

name: Guessed List
description:
A fun fast party game for all where you choose a List Title and then shout as many answers as you can in 30 seconds to try to guess a specific name on the Guessed List and win the card.

Each list contains 6 names. Roll a die to determine which of the 6 names, you will have to guess. You have 30 seconds to make a correct guess and win the card. The player who has won the most cards after 5 rounds is the winner.

—user summary

name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Litterära klassiker
description:
BEZZERWIZZER Bricks is a series of small quiz packages in a variety of subjects. The game is a perfect gift for the football fan, fantasy nerd or movie lover.

Have you also cried for Gösta Berling and Don Quixote and laughed with Madicken and d’Artagnan? Have you followed Raskolnikov through St. Petersburg and Heathcliff out into the heath? Here is the quiz for all of us who have Camus, Christie and Kipling on the shelf.

name: Proverbiamo
description:
The most famous folk sayings become a fun and original memory game for everyone.
Put the proverbs back together and surprise your opponents by combining tiles in a new, comical and hilarious way!

Memo dei proverbi The maps are spread out and covered on the table. The youngest player begins. He discovers first a red map and then an orange map. If he manages to compose a proverb, he wins the couple and always continues in the same way, otherwise he puts the covered maps back on the table, leaving them in the same position. The game continues counterclockwise. Warning: if a competitor finds the black map, he puts all the maps he has conquered back in the middle. The game continues until there are no more maps on the table. Whoever has the most pairs wins.

Creative memo It is played the same way, but in case you discover two maps that do not form a proverb, you stop for a turn. However, this penalty can be avoided if the competitor manages to justify, with a brief and reasonable explanation, the "new" proverb that she has formed. If the motivation is accepted by the other players, the competitor does not stand still for a turn, but passes his hand and puts the covered maps back on the table. For example, “He who sleeps does not catch. .. "" a treasure "can be a new proverb because ... or" Between husband and wife do not put ... "" money "can be a new proverb because ...

—user summary

name: Dieci
description:
Between funny characters, forced exchanges and twists, whoever loses the five tokens is eliminated. Who will resist until the end?
A card game for everyone with an engaging mechanism, from 4 to 10.

Each player is given five tokens of the same color. The oldest player shuffles the cards well and places the deck in the center of the table. The objective of the game is not to remain at the end of the round with the lowest card in hand.

Starting with the player to the right of the one who shuffled the cards, and proceeding counterclockwise, each competitor draws a card from the deck, observes it and keeps it face down in front of him. The player who drew the card first begins and, based on the value of the card drawn, he can decide: to keep the card, because he believes it is a high card; • to exchange a card that he considers low with the player to his right, who cannot refuse to accept the trade, unless he is in possession of one of the highest five cards (6, 7, 8, 9, 10), which he must reveal to block the trade. The round continues counterclockwise and ends when all the competitors have made their trades. The last player of the round (the one who shuffled the cards) can decide whether to keep the card he drew (or received from an exchange), or he can make the exchange himself by drawing a card from the top of the deck. Once the play has been made, he reveals the card and invites the other players who have not revealed theirs to do the same. At this point the player who owns the card with the lowest value among those revealed pays a token. If two or more players have the same lowest card, they pay one token each.

The game continues by playing another round in the same way. The deck is shuffled in turn (counterclockwise). * When a player loses all five tokens in his possession during the various rounds, he leaves the game. The others continue to play until there is only one player left, who is the winner of the game. If, at the end of the game, there are two players left with only one token and, at the end of a round, both have the same card, neither of them pays a token and we proceed indefinitely.

If, at the end of a round, at least two players discover a Jolly Cat, none of them pays a token and the players eliminated during the previous rounds will be able to return to the game with a token!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Contatto
description:
Who will be the first to chain all their tiles together?
A language skill game in which the goal is to establish lexical links between words.
A little logic is needed but also a lot of creativity and imagination!

The winner is the one who gets rid of all their tiles first or who, if there are no more tiles to draw, has the least.

Each player spins the spinner. He draws or doesn't draw tiles according to the result. At this point he tries to place one of his tiles next to one of the sides of the starting tile (including those just fished), respecting the rule that the words placed side by side have a logical-linguistic link (the other competitors they can evaluate the relevance of the connection and possibly decide by majority vote to reject it) The second player proceeds in the same way: spin the spinner, draw 1, 2, 3 or no tiles and try to put his own tile next to both the first and the second game.

If a card is placed next to two cards, the logical-linguistic connection must obviously be with both cards. If a player manages to bring one of his tiles to two or more tiles on the bank, he is entitled to play a second tile of his.

Joker cards If a competitor owns or has drawn a joker card, he can play it by writing on the card itself, with the erasable marker, a useful word for the game.
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Emotions
description:
What do you think about when you see a gift? You are happy Amazed? Or are you sad because you think about the gift you haven't received yet? In this party game both the guesser and the one who makes guess the right emotion win!

A player acts as the narrator: he draws an inspiration card and places it face up on the table clearly visible to all. He observes the card for the time necessary, thinks about a real or imaginary fact that aroused one of the emotions on the appropriate board and chooses the card corresponding to the emotion he felt, placing it covered in the appropriate space on the board. He then gives him a clue by briefly recounting the fact or describing the situation he imagined, avoiding pronouncing the emotion or making too explicit references to it (otherwise the turn is blocked and we proceed with another heat).

Immediately afterwards, the other players try to guess the emotion felt by the narrator, placing a vote-token on the board, near the square that represents the emotion that each one believes has been experienced and chosen by the narrator. You can use them for voting tokens of value 1, 2 or 3 depending on how convinced one is of one's intuition. Players vote one at a time, starting with the player to the right of the narrator. Once the voting is finished, the narrator turns the emotion card showing it to everyone and the bets are checked and any progress on the scoreboard is carried out. The turn passes to the next player starting a new game round. The first to complete two full laps of the board wins.

If only one player guesses correctly, the narrator advances by a number equal to double the token bet by the player he guessed right. • If two or more players guess the emotion, the narrator stands still in his position. • If no one guesses the emotion, the narrator goes back three boxes,

name: Palo Largo
description:
Bidding game in which the bids consist of a certain amount of matchsticks; the combined length of the matchsticks gives the height of the bid. Bids remain on the table during play and are affected by later actions during the game.

The game will be won by the player whose highest remaining bid after the last round is lowest.

—description from publisher

name: Revolutis
description:
REVOLUTIS is a deck based on the Spanish deck, modified in design to generate games that are richer in history and in possibilities of complexity.

The first thing you will notice is that the suits are well differentiated and it is because they represent 4 estates of medieval times. The game contains rules for traditional games, and also contains rules for new and revolutionary games to play with the deck of cards.

Players assemble characters with three cards (one for the head, one for the torso and one for the legs). They will also have two classic jokers and a special one for each suit; in addition to the inclusion of the character of "Devil". The player with the most points wins.

—description from publisher

name: 90-luku: Vuosikymmenen peli
description:
How much do you know about the 90s, that decade of the Internet and mobile phone breakthrough, the recession and Finland's first hockey World Cup gold?

200 cards with one question per card and the answer on other side. There is either multiple choice question from one of the five categories or kind of text recognition task.

Players take turns asking questions. The first player to get five correct answers wins the game. Multiple players can get points on a round.

—user summary

name: Furioso: The Italian Wars
description:
This supplement to the Furioso rules takes a more in-depth look at the Italian Wars of the sixteenth century. One of the main sections of the book covers a number of the major battles of the period and provides scenarios for such battles as Fornovo, Pavia and Ceresole. The historical scenarios provide player with army lists for each battle, maps to allow players to set up the terrain and show deployment areas and also provides special rules specific to each battle. Using these scenarios players can explore these famous battles and compare their efforts to the historical outcomes of the day.

Another prominent section of this supplement covers mercenary units and generals. Here players can really get into the spirit of the Italian Wars by hiring famous mercenary units to include in their armies. However, players will have to bid against their opponents to get the best units and must be prepared to lose their favourite unit to the highest bidder. Each of these renowned mercenary units will have its own profile and special abilities so generals will be keen to include them in their armies.

What is also included in this supplement are rules for solo play. Solo play allows players to fight battles on their own against an opposing army which is controlled using the solo mechanism, a mechanism that will be trying equally hard to destroy the player’s army as the player is trying to destroy their opponents. Using the solo play rules players that are new to the game have an enjoyable and interesting way to familiarise themselves with the rules processes before trying the game out against their wargaming friends and opponents.

The last main section of the rules covers the Da Vinci inventions. Those with an interest in the Renaissance period will be familiar with the marvellous and evocative drawings of strange craft that have endured through history. These fantastical and improbable creations are given ‘life’ here and players can now include them in their armies if they wish (and can of course purchase the models such as the Da Vinci Tank from Alternative Armies). But don’t worry, these inventions are unlikely to over-power more conventional forces. They are sometimes as unstable as they look, often providing more amusement than fear as they break down or crash out of the sky. Enjoy!

To complement these weird and wonderful inventions is a new breed of soldier trained specifically to fight them. Armed with new weapons, new tactics and near suicidal bravery, Renaissance warfare really is entering a new phase of destruction and brutality.

In addition to all this, for a little extra period ‘flavour’ there is a section that deals with blessings and divine intervention. Commanders can call upon whichever religious authority their army ascribes to for a little ‘extra help’ when it really matters. No guarantees of course - but if successful, the results can be most entertaining.

And finally I have included a section that answers some of the frequently asked questions that players have about the Furioso rules. Hopefully this will provide extra clarity and clear up a couple of points that escaped my attention first time round.

So as you can see, this supplement contains both serious and silly elements. I hope players enjoy both as I found both aspects equally entertaining when writing and testing out this supplement.”

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Tour de Pyramide
description:
Tour de Pyramide uses Looney Pyramids as components. It's a game for 1–6 players and the playing time is 5–10 minutes per player. It's intended for non-gamers, beginners, and family gamers.

The players are cyclists who participate in the cycling race Tour de Pyramide which runs through the French mountain chain Pyramide Montes. The height differences are challenging even for the best cyclists in the world and many are the cyclists who fail to complete the race.

A deck of standard playing cards is used in the game. Players draw cards to move (luck), negotiate slopes (basic probability calculation: draw one card and pay or draw a second card to pay less at the risk of paying more), catch up (basic probability calculation: basically Black Jack), overtake (basic probability calculation: basically Black Jack), and take their chances with an event table (luck). The players also have 10 stamina tokens which represent their physical endurance, and they need them to negotiate slopes and redo movement. A player who can't negotiate a slope is out of the game.

The game ends when a player manages to complete three laps. That can be a rather difficult task, so if no one manages to complete three laps, the player who has reached the farthest wins.

—description from designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Escape Box: Risk
description:
Just before giving the order to attack, the aide de camp of the general enter the tent and with him the blowing wind. All the scouts and spies reports fly around. He is not very happy with you.

You have one hour to sort this mess.

From 3 to 7 players, including a game master (GM). The GM, by himself, chooses a scenario, he setup the board/room, he setup the cards that have to be visible for the players. Hide those that they should look for (keeping in mind where the sabotage cards are), and makes available some pen and papers for the players to take noted. Once the players are back, the GM reads the intro and start the countdown.

The players can assume different role:
Colonel: Can ask the GM a question that have to be answered truthfully bey yes or no.
Spy Master: The only player that is allowed to use any electronic devices to do research, calculate, etc.
Scout: The only player that can provide two answers for his riddle
Military engineer: He can cancel the sabotage card on any other player
Mercenary: He can ignore the first sabotage card that he gets
Diplomat: Once per game he can ask the DM if a component contains a sabotage card.

The players wins once they are able to resolve all the riddles within 60 minutes.

name: Meidän sakki
description:
A co-op game where players try to fulfill missions in order to lead their characters to the campsite before the storm breaks.

Players move their characters by doing acting, explaining and drawing. If the task fails, the players get 1 point, for a good performance the players get 2 points and for an exceptional performance they get 3 points. Points are then spent to draw movement tiles, which are then used to move.

The game is a race to finish. Players win if they reach the end of the track and lose if there are three thunder tokens on the board. Thunder tokens are added depending on the cards drawn from the weather deck after each turn.

The aim of the game is to get the players to know each other better. The game is sold to support foster care families in Finland.

—user summary
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Line Drawing, Race

name: Daring Contest: Penalty Box
description:
Daring Contest too easy for you? This expansion adds some harder Dare cards and a whole lot of extra penalties! Includes 20 Dare cards and 30 Penalty cards.

—Description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Follow, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Daring Contest: Drunking Contest
description:
If Daring Contest wasn’t daring enough, this expansion will add some extra drinking to turn your dares extra sloppy! Includes 20 Dare cards and 30 Penalty cards.

—Description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Follow, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Daring Contest: Modifier Pack
description:
Want to get more creative with your dares? This expansion adds some easier Dare cards, and plenty of modifiers that will help you create unique dares each time you play! Includes 15 Dare cards and 35 Modifier cards.

—Description from publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Follow, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: 'Round the Clock
description:
This game is an English pub game based on Shut the Box. This variant uses numbers 1 to 12 representing the hours on a clock face.

Players take turns rolling dice to mark off hours of the clock based on their sum, product, or individual values. When a roll cannot mark any numbers, the sum of the unmarked numbers is your score. The lowest score wins.

name: Affenstarke Zahlenbande
description:
At the beginning of the game, an elephant stands on a wobbly palm tree roof at the beginning of its route, divided into the numbers 1-100. Jokers, elephant cards and jumping cloth are laid out. You play a monkey card and place the monkey of this color on the palm tree or move it to a valid number in the number space; you take a number according to your own monkey card or the result of addition or subtraction of two numbers on your own or other people's same-colored cards. Then you may move the elephant with one of your cards. If the elephant reaches the jumping cloth without the palm tree toppling over, everyone wins together; if one of the animals falls down, however, the game is lost for everyone.

—user summary

name: L'échappée Infernale
description:
L'échappée Infernale: Race tactics and strategy

Become sports manager and target your objectives according to your team (puncher, sprinter, climber) and the route (plain, hilly, medium and high mountain).
Set the record straight:

Jump on the right breakaway, The Infernal Breakaway, the one that will bring you to the finish line.
Manage your energy capital as a great tactician:
Here is the red flame of the last kilometer, already the finish line ... Start the sprint ... Watch out for falls ... victory will be played with one wheel ...
Once you have crossed the finish line, it's time to do the math: Calculate the time of your runners and their places in the general classification.


For this new edition, the game has been modernized: The old Cofalu riders have been replaced for some much more modern-looking specially designed for this game. The board has changed too. Now it features different sections for high mountain (red), medium mountain (pink), up-and-downs (yellow) and plain (blue).

The rules have changed too. Now they are a little more complex. We have different kinds of riders (climber, sprinter, "puncheur") and consequently we also have different types of terrains, four different types in fact (In the 2001 version of the game all riders were similar and there was only a climb in the board).
mechanics: Events, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement

name: Karten Kniffel
description:
Card Yatzy is not played with dice but with 52 cards (values 1 to 6, 2 times each in 4 suits and 4 jokers).

Each player receives 6 cards and places one of them face down in front of him. The player whose turn it is can either draw a card from the deck face down and lay a hand card face up or draw a card face up and lay it face up. In the 2nd case, a hand card and a card from the deck must also be placed face up.

A round continues until each player has 5 cards in front of him. When evaluating the combinations achieved (different point values), only the highest combination of each type is scored. For example, if there are two doubles of 4, only the highest one counts and the other player can only score a double of 3.

After nine rounds the game ends, the player with the highest score from the combinations wins.

—user summary

name: How Many Stars?
description:
In How Many Stars, players are 'Bidding' to get as close as possible to the answer to a question, such as "How many stars are in the Milky Way" or "What % of Brits like Simon Cowell", without going over.

Bid or Pass?

Players take it in turns to ‘bid’ on the answer, where the next bid must be a higher answer than the previous. If a player thinks that the answer has got too high, they can pass.

Reveal!

Once all players have passed except one, the answer is revealed. If the final player's answer is at, or below, the correct answer, they score points. If the answer is even just a fraction above, all the other players score points.

Confident?

Think you know the exact answer? Then slap your hand on the Star Card while shouting out the answer. If you're exactly correct, you score lots of points! If you're wrong, however, all the other players score lots of points! Risky.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Diesel Overlord
description:
GRAB YOUR MINIS.
SET THE TABLETOP ON FIRE.
RULE THE WASTELAND!

Welcome to Diesel Overlord, the explosive, easy-to-start post-apocalyptic tabletop miniature skirmish game. No more 100-page rulebooks with dozens of diagrams. Everything you need to know to begin a game is written on a single playing card.

Just because it’s easy to get going doesn’t mean it’s simple. There are deep strategies and tactics built throughout the game on the cards you'll hold in your hands: different types of unit cards to represent your models, upgrades to make them uniquely powerful, explosively combustible terrain rules to build an interactive battlefield, and mission cards to help you achieve victory—and declare yourself Overlord.

—description from the publisher

name: Dark Syndicate
description:
Dark Syndicate is a 1 to 4 player area control game that takes place over the course of 6 rounds. Each player will control a unique Gang that represents a specific Supernatural Faction. The player will use Cash to increase their control over the City, buy resources and information, and recruit unique Criminals to protect and expand their dark empire. Each Gang will gain Reputation and the first to 40 Rep wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Income, Interrupts, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Victory Points as a Resource, Zone of Control

name: Haute Kuhture
description:
Every year in autumn the farmers of Kuhmatten present their cows on the catwalk trying to earn appreciation for the most beautiful ones.
Each player has two small stacks of front and rump parts of the animals. And getting dressed the cows not always achieve matching front and rump clothes which would be most valuable. So, there are always different ratings. After the rating each player has to remove one card that is saved adding to his final result.
These missing cards change the possible ratings for the following votes which will take place one after another recyclying used stacks until one of the stacks is totally empty.
The winner is the player with the highest sum of numbers on his saved cards.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring, Memory, Physical Removal, Sudden Death Ending

name: 红桃四 (4 Hearts)
description:
In this traditional Chinese card game for four players using a standard 52 card deck, players aim to get rid of their cards as soon as possible. The players are dealt five cards with the first player receiving six. The person with the Heart 4 begins the game, and must first play a single number, at least two identical numbers, or at least three ascending numbers that include the Heart 4. Below are the general rules for the cards that can be played.

1. Single number (2 is biggest, 3 is smallest, Jokers are sometimes used).
2. At least two same numbers of differing suits. Example: Heart 3 and Spade 3.
3. At least three numbers in ascending order, the suit does not matter. Example: Heart 3, Spade 4 and Club 5. Note that playing 2 (the biggest card) followed by the 3 (which is the smallest) is invalid in this case since it is not ascending.

Notes:
1. The combination 4-4-5-5-6-6 can also be played, and the same suits do not apply.
2. Occasionally players can be extremely lucky and have six sequential cards, such as 4-5-6-7-8-9.

name: 5150: Fighter Pilot
description:
Fighter Pilot! It's not a job, it's an adventure!

Simply put, you're a Fighter Pilot trying to stay alive while completing your Missions.
They say the Star Navy is the tip of the Gaea Prime spear; well that makes you the tip of the tip!

Your enemies are many.

The Empire is hungry and growing, and that means you're always at war.
As a Star Navy Fighter Pilot you'll be fighting other humanoids, alien races and things that don't fit into either class.

5150 Fighter Pilot has four Factions and over 16 different fighters to choose from.

And the nice thing is:

no two Missions (games) will ever play exactly the same.
Totally playable solo with rules for a Campaign with a simple way to gauge how well, or bad, you’re doing!


Playable with minis or the color counters we provide!

–description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Speedy Doc
description:
Speedy Doc knows everything about everything! Will you be able to outsmart him?

In this fast-paced electronic game Speedy Doc proposes a topic. Each player has to find something that matches the topic.

But be careful! Speedy Doc is unpredictable and likes to change the rules at any time. A piece of advice: stay focused and answer him quickly! If not, you will get a ZERO.

At the end of the game, the player with the least zeros wins. Laughter guaranteed – no two rounds are alike! Included are more than 500 topics to play with family.

Screen reader support enabled.

name: Kutyatár kártyajáték
description: DOG COMPETITION - The bigger puppy takes the smaller ones! But watch out, Lili takes every dog. Who will have the most dogs? DOG MEMO - Find each dog's mate. Whoever has the best memory will have the most cute puppies. WHO HAS LILI? - In whose hands is Lili left? Put the pairs down and draw each other with a poker face! Who will Lili stay with? DOG KENNEL - Lili adopted a puppy. Just answer yes and no to your partner to help you figure out which doggie it is! Game rules in the box!

name: Garibaldini, all'attacco!
description:
Garibaldini, all'attacco!, Garibaldini, attack! is a three-dimensional wargame rulebook.
It is designed to recreate the battles of the Risorgimento period.
It is a simple and agile system, suitable for small / medium sized games, playable in a short time, even in multiplayer.

The combat formations are the brigades, made up of the tactical units typical of this period (infantry battalions, cavalry regiments, artillery batteries).

The player, in command of a brigade, must maneuver better than his own opponent if he wants to prevail in this type of war that alternates moments of studied preparation for furious assaults!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Garibaldini, all'attacco! Espansione
description:
This expansion of Garibaldini, all'attacco!,Garibaldini, attack! lets you play with armies who fought in the battles of the Risorgimento period.

In this volume you will find historical battles, clarification of the rules and the army list for the Bourbon troops.

This volume does not contain the rules, in order to play ownership of the basic rules "Garibaldini, attack!" is necessary.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Hatamoto
description:
Hatamoto is a simple ruleset that aims to reproduce and play great medieval and Renaissance battles in the Far East involving two or more players, within a reasonable time.

The philosophy of the game is to make players use the various types of troops according to their actual use on the battlefield, without overloading the game with myriads of different factors for weapons and armor.

This volume includes the basic and optional rules for playing and the Army Lists to recreate the Japanese armies of the Late Middle Ages and the Early Renaissance.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Book, Medieval, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Mantel
description:
Mantel is a trick-taking game for exactly three players which uses suit-less cards. Each player receives an identical set of rank cards which they place face up in front of themselves and a random selection of colored cubes which they will place on the cards to determine the specific combination of rank and suit which they have played to a trick.

After receiving their cubes, players will bid on how many tricks they expect to win, and after three rounds of play, the player with the most points wins.

name: Coalitions: Ancien Régime Expansion
description:
Europe is in turmoil! The emerging Prussian Kingdom under Frederick the Great moves to expand and consolidate its power at the cost of Austria while the Franco-British struggle for global primacy has already engulfed Spain and leads both nations to seek new allies on the Old Continent. Will Russia and the Ottoman Empire, two seemingly disinterested parties, continue to watch from afar or will they join in this struggle for the dominance of Europe?

Ancien Régime is a major expansion for Coalitions, a game of negotiation and alliance-building for control of Europe. It comes with a new distinct game board, a 7th playable nation (Spain), and a variety of new components and mechanisms. This is not a standalone expansion; it requires some components from the Coalitions core box.
Up to 7 players engage in an exciting area control game of shifting alliances and coalitions, of intense back-stabbing diplomacy and bold military actions set in an era defined by the immense Seven Years’ War.
Like in the Coalitions core game, the Ancien Régime Expansion uses the Wheel of War mechanic to make downtime non-existent, while the innovative Activator system introduces a new level of dynamic interactions between the players.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Negotiation, Variable Player Powers

name: Richard Simmons Sweat & Shout Party Game
description:
In this fun, fast party game, players choose a unique action (Sweat) and saying (Shout) based on the chosen Topic Card - you'll need to remember your opponents' actions too!
Flip your cards over, and watch for matches - if you match an opponent, you need to do their move first to win the card!
Keep an eye out for objects matching the Slap Card...if you slap it first, you get the Fitness Instructor Sweatband, and can make your opponents SWEAT!
Be the player with the most victory cards at the end to win

name: I Leoni delle Ambe
description:
I Leoni delle Ambe, The Lion of the Ambe

The rules are intended to represent combats in the colonial era, conducted by the Italian Royal Army in East Africa (1880-1900).

This is a Brigade / Division level tactical game.
Units are at the level of Infantry Battalion, Cavalry Regiment or Artillery Group.

It is recommended for 15-20mm figures.

—description from the publisher

name: Animal Alliance
description:
In Animal Alliance felines are doing their felonious best to steal toys and canines are returning toys to the lost and found. The twist is each player takes control of a cat and dog team who live in the same house, they have different goals but a combined score.

Players roll 2 dice and assign one to their cat and another to their dog for that turn (purr points and paw points). Using these they traverse the board, pick up, drop off, give and take toys, steal toys from other pets and even increase the value of their toys. Whenever a pet tries to steal from another, dice are rolled to determine the 'reflexes' and 'stealth' for each to determine whether the theft was successful or not.

Special Actions linked to each number on the die allow players extra abilities which are slightly different for the cats and dogs so pay close attention when assigning your dice to each pet. Special Actions can allow diagonal movement, move toys on the board, add new toys to the board, increase or decrease the value of toys by flipping the token or take a cat nap to save Purr Points for use later in the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Take That

name: Det dårlige selskab: udvidelse #3 – Ekstra sort!
description:
A new expansion with 240 extra dark and inappropriate cards.

Includes 10 blank write-yourself cards, so you can include your own stupid cards and three types of bonus cards.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Monkey Tree
description:
Remove the sticks from the tree, be careful not to disturb the monkeys!

On their turn a player will roll the die and then pull out the corresponding coloured stick. If the monkeys fall they collect them.

The game ends when all the sticks have been removed.

The player with the least amount of monkeys wins!

name: auto+reise
description:
Players travel on vacation in their car and can use 3 different routes to do so, the highway, the state road or the country road. Different maximum speeds apply on the routes: 6 / 5 / 4 dice points can be used as a maximum. In addition, there are different event fields for each route. The player who arrives first at the vacation destination and has not forgotten his fuel and rest break wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Tremember
description:
Tremember is a combination of Memory (find 2 identical cards) and elements of the game Labyrinth. The display of the cards is shifted in each turn. Whoever finds a pair gets 1 to 3 points (3 if the tiles are adjacent sideways, 2 if diagonally adjacent and 1 if the tiles are not adjacent). Found pairs remain face up on the board to allow the cards to continue to be moved. The player with the most accumulated points wins

—user summary
mechanics: Memory, Modular Board, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Hexenhaus: Abenteuer
description: The mini expansion consists of 20 additional cards.

name: Código Secreto: Expansión promocional Argentina
description:
10 cards with 20 typical words from Argentina.
This promo pack is produced by Devir and it was given as a promo in exchange for a donation to the "Donaciones Encausadas" program of the Asociación Argentina de Juegos de Mesa.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Memory, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Race for the Cup
description:
A game of chance and skill based on the America's Cup theme.
For two to four players.
The object of the game is to be the first player to complete the eight leg race.
"Race for the Cup" will challenge the yacht racing enthusiast, educate the sailing novice, and prove entertaining for fan of the sport of sailing.

The board is a cloth with squares marked on it. There's a triangular race course printed on it. The pieces/sailboats move around the course, square-by-square based on a die roll and playing cards. There are card for the Start that might give a player some advantage or hindrance; Upwind cards for that portion of the race, and Downwind cards for that portion. A card is taken by the player at the start of their turn and played immediately. The players race around the course 8 times and the first to finish is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Manitou
description:
In Manitou, you are an intrepid explorer discovering and developing new islands in a watery world. But powerful forces are at work against you. Other eager adventurers are trying to distract you from your mission and wreak havoc on your carefully laid plans. Anticipate their actions, set up your defenses, and plan your attack! In a battle of wits, will you be the one to create the most populated island?

Players play cards from their hand to develop or destroy islands. In Manitou, you play cards of your own color as well as of your opponent’s color which creates a unique aspect of gameplay. Specialty cards (Whirlpools, Lighthouses, and Bridges) add an additional strategic element enabling players to take either an offensive or defensive posture.

After all the cards are played, the winner is the player with the single-most populated island. An island is one or more cards of the same color which share at least one adjoining edge. Each card has a number in the center representing its population and the population of an island is the sum of all the cards that make up the island.

—description from the publisher

name: Armies and Scenarios for Centuria
description:
Army List For Centuria

29 new army list fully playtested.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Those Who Seek Death
description:
Those Who Seek Death is a quick playing set of rules covering Asian fleet action naval warfare between the 10th and the 16th century'

The aim of these rules, which draw upon techniques and concepts from LFG’s Inferno and Glory rules has been to develop a set that focusses on the Imjin War, fought between Korea and Japan fought in the late 16th century - the era of Admiral Yi Sun Sin and his famous “Turtle Ship” - but rules, ship data and information is provided to cover earlier wars in the region back to the 10th century.

The fast play nature of the rules allows large fleet actions with multiple squadrons a side or more to be completed in a couple of hours or less.
The rules cover the main ship types involved across the period, including a number of unusual types encountered in Asian naval battles, and encompasses not only action afloat but also forts and shore-based troops.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Medieval, Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: ドルフィーファイブ (Dolphy Five)
description:
Dolphy Five is a dice game that produces dolphins in a certain aquarium. Become a trainer and raise your own idols. There are 30 types of individuality in all. A gentleman's dollar trip, a chara Paris pilka, a brutal idol fin ...

Every time you play, a wide variety of dolphins are born! Make full use of the effects of the helping animals to outperform your rivals and aim to become the No. 1 dolphin!

name: Battle of Hansan Do (Hansan Island): August 14th-15th 1592 – A scenario for Those Who Seek Death
description:
A scenario for Those Who Seek Death in which a Korean fleet under Admiral Yi Sun Sin attacks a Japanese fleet at anchor during the first phase of the Imjin War, August 1592

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Zot van Vlaanderen
description:
Which Belgian Beer is also a duck sound? Is there chicken meat in Kipkap? Experience Zot van Vlaanderen at home. Laugh, sing and reminisce with the Zot van Vlaanderen Companionship Game. Players compete against each other and must reach the Flemish cobblestones by guessing songs, answering questions and collecting chips. Knowledge of Flanders, tactical insight and, not to forget, building bridges, are the keywords for this fun game.

Like Trivial Pursuit, players roll dice and answer trivia questions matching the icon on the space they landed. Players must move through three tiers of questions to land on the cobblestones in the middle of the board and win the game.


Welk Belgisch Bier is ook een eendengeluid? Zit er kippenvlees in Kipkap? Beleef 'Zot van Vlaanderen' bij je thuis. Lach, zing en haal leuke herinneringen op met het 'Zot van Vlaanderen' Gezelschapsspel. Spelers strijden tegen elkaar en moeten doormiddel van het raden van liedjes, beantwoorden van vragen en verzamelen van fiches de Vlaamse kasseien zien te bereiken. Kennis van Vlaanderen, tactisch inzicht en, niet te vergeten, bruggenbouwen, zijn de steekwoorden voor dit plezante spel.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: The Little Flower Shop Dice Game: Daily Goal Pack
description:
This promotion pack was provided to Kickstarter backers and is separately available directly through Dr Finn's Games. The pack has 7 daily goal cards and 1 rules card. At the start of each day, a daily goal card is flipped. The first player to complete the goal scores a bonus point.

—description from the publisher

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Dark Seamstress
description:
Promo settlement event and unique gear cards included with the Pinups Of Death II that is not part of the base game.

Enclosed in a deluxe matte wrapped box, this collection contains 1 settlement event, 4 unique gear cards, art cards for each pinup, and 11 highly detailed hard plastic models.
A pinup collection containing all 11 Pinups from the first Kingdom Death: Monster Kickstarter.

Each box makes 11 miniatures and contains:

Optional Kingdom Death Monster Settlement Event Dark Seamstress. A special event that can occur in your settlement.
4 pieces of optional gear to be used in Kingdom Death Monster: Lantern Brassiere, Leather Bodysuit, Rawhide Corset, and Teeth Bikini.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Alt Art Monster Traits (Butcher and King's  Man)
description:
Promo alternative monster trait cards with the Pinups Of Death III that is not part of the base game.

A new pinup collection containing 13 miniatures originally offered in the Kingdom Death: Monster 1.5 Kickstarter campaign. Enclosed in a deluxe matte wrapped box, this collection contains 3 alternative monster trait cards, 6 unique universal cards, art cards for each pinup, and 13 highly detailed hard plastic miniatures.

Each box makes 13 miniatures and contains:

3 Monster trait cards with new artwork. These can be used as a fun and illustrative replacement for the trait cards in a monster's respective AI deck. This includes Battle Tempo and Familiar Face for the King's Man and Berserker for the Butcher.
6 Unique universal cards graced by the art of pinups from this set.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Alternative Monster Trait (Dung Beetle Knight and Manhunter)
description:
Promo alternative monster trait cards that were included with the Pinups Of Death V that was not part of the based game.

A new pinup collection containing 11 miniatures originally offered in the Kingdom Death: Monster 1.5 Kickstarter campaign. Enclosed in a deluxe matte wrapped box, this collection contains 3 alternative monster trait cards, a double-sided poster, art cards for each pinup, and 11 highly detailed hard plastic miniatures.

Each box makes 11 miniatures and contains:
3 Monster trait cards with new artwork. These can be used as a fun and illustrative replacement for the trait cards in a monster's respective AI deck. This includes Baller and Separation Anxiety for the Dung Beetle Knight Expansion and Tombstone for the Manhunter Expansion.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Seesaw
description:
Seesaw is a Draughts-inspired elimination game, played on a hexhex board of size 4 or 5. Each player needs, in their own color, a large number of stackable tokens and tiles.

Rules

Overview:
In Seesaw the players command opposing armies of soldiers that can promote. Your army starts out as a single soldier in the bottom corner. This soldier stands on a tile of your color. This tile is your initial promotion area, and it will evolve as you deploy more soldiers. Every time a soldier promotes it grows - first into a 2-stack, then a 3-stack, and so on.

The central idea of Seesaw is the 2-fold significance of stack-size:
(i) Odd-sized stacks move forwards and even-sized stacks move backwards, and
(ii) on any given turn, a stack can take as many steps as it likes from 1 up to its size.

This results in soldiers seesawing up and down the board as their strength increases to the point where the game is forced to conclude in one side completely eliminating the other.

How to play:
On your turn, you must either move a stack, or place a new stack.

1. Placing a new stack:
A newly placed stack will always be of size 1. You may only place a stack on an empty cell next to a cell with a tile of your color. These cells are promotion cells, and each time you place a new stack you first place a tile of your color on that cell. A cell with a tile on it is not considered empty, but tiles never count toward stacks-size.

2. Moving a stack:
You only ever move one stack per turn, but that stack may be able to move several steps or capture several enemy stacks, depending on its size.
The number of steps a stack may take is the number of pieces in it, i.e. its size. A stack may never step onto a cell containing a stack of its color.

2.1 Noncapturing moves: On turns where you do not have to capture an enemy (see below) all the steps a stack takes is either constrained to the 3 upward directions ("forwards") or to the 3 downward directions ("backwards"), depending on the parity of the size of the stack. Up and down have their standard meanings for games where players sit on opposite sides of a board, like in Draughts and Chess.

2.2 Capturing moves: If one or more of your stacks can reach an enemy by lifting the restraint on direction, you must capture such a reachable enemy by replacement. If that stack did not spend all its steps reaching the captured enemy, you can, before you end your turn, spend the left-over steps by making a noncapturing move. However, if yet an enemy is in range immediately after you have captured (counting only the steps left over), you must capture again.

3. Promoting: Your odd-sized stacks promote when they end up on a promotion cell belonging to your opponent at the end of your turn. Your even-sized stacks promote when they end up on a promotion cell belonging to you at the end of your turn. When a stack promotes, you add 1 piece to it.

The object of Seesaw is to capture all your opponent's soldiers. More precisely: If, at the end of your turn, your opponent has no stacks on the board, you have won the game.

name: Wahlkrampf
description:
Face off in a unique election campaign. Bribe your fellow players, buy power or instigate an insurrection. Everything for the victory!

This card game has three phases in which you must first use your financial resources wisely in order to get the most votes in the final ballot. A variety of mini-games that even integrate your mobile phones provide a varied gameplay experience.

In the first phase you must collect your card deck. Use your money wisely to bid on cards, trade with your fellow players and get lucky in the challenges.

In the second phase your card deck is finalized, you have to pay back loans and hidden goals are achieved.

In the third and final phase you use your cards in a trick taking game. Whoever gets the most card stitches wins the game. A "Stop the Count!" mechanic allows you to end the round early.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Negotiation, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Bribery, Deck Construction, Negotiation, Open Drafting

name: Toxic People
description:
It looks like poker ... it feels like poker ... but this poker is toxic!

Toxic People combines a unique blend of draw poker and action cards to bring office politics to a whole new level. You'll need a combination of luck and strategy to emerge the winner in this easy-to-learn party game for 2 to 6 players.

Beat your opponents with a winning hand in a classic game of draw poker. Just don't get too comfortable as a bad bunch of action cards like the cheater and troublemaker are going to mess things up!

You even get to draft the action cards that will be played during the game. Choose the bluffer card if deception turns you on. Choose more sabotage cards (like the bully) if you like to undermine your buddies. Every game can be customized so you'll need different strategies to win.

After the mayhem caused by the action cards, the winner will get to pass the loser a toxic token. The first player with 3 toxic tokens is crowned the loser!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Single Loser Game, Take That

name: Get Past & GO!
description:
Get Past & GO! is a competitive, family-friendly card game for 2-4 players. Race against your opponents to be the first player to reach the end of their path and overcome the mysterious 'Final Hazard'.

Through turn-based play, dash along your path of cards as quickly as possible - turning over each step as you go. Use Tool cards (like a torch or a tin of sardines) to get past a series of Hazards set by your opponents, or place Hazards on their paths to slow them down! Give yourself an advantage or frustrate other players with Action Cards or once-per-game Bonus Cards!

Get Past & GO! is a standalone game with 90 illustrated cards and rule variations for 2-player showdowns.

On you marks, get set, GO!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Race, Take That

name: Not Parent Approved: Expansion Pack #1
description: 80 NEW cards for the Not Parent Approved card game (60 red answer cards and 20 blue question cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Not Parent Approved: Expansion Pack #2
description: 80 NEW CARDS! With 60 red answer cards and 20 blue question cards
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Racing Ogres
description:
Racing Ogres is a fast paced game of bluff and prediction for all ages. Up to eight players receive their very own deck of Ogre Cards. Each round, players will simultaneously select an Ogre from their deck to enter the race. Each Ogre has it's own speed and limit. The speed will determine how far down the race track you travel, and the limit is a restriction of how many of that type of Ogre is allowed at one time.

Will you risk playing a faster Ogre with a small limit, or will you play it safe and creep along the racetrack slowly.

There is also a pile of Training Cards available for a 'take that' element to give players the edge.

By far the best part of this game is the simultaneous decision and turns. The game does not slow down with bigger numbers and can play up to eight players easily.

—description from the designer

name: Bakken Bears Basketball: The Card Game
description:
In Bakken Bears Basketball: The Card Game you take on the role of a basketball team, trying to outsmart your opponent buy playing different cards.

Every player has different abilities like blocking, scoring, stealing etc. and its up to you to combine those strengths to leave the court as the winner.

A player wins the match, if he reaches 10 points or if his opponent fouled 4 times.

On a turn each player has two actions. Those can be drawing a card, or playing one as for one of its abilities. To score a player has to combine certain cards. Before attempting a 2p or 3p shot, he has to play an assist card first. After an attempt a players needs to block or rebound.

name: Speed Tangram
description:
Each player receives the same complete set of colorful tangram pieces. 30 playing cards contain laying tasks, the figures, mixed from the correct colors and black parts.
One card is turned face up and the player who first correctly laid the figure receives this card. After that, the next cards are played. The player who has collected the most cards wins.

Note: The game Tangram Race is designed similarly, with the difference that there are no colors given in the pieces to be laid.

—user summary

name: Dicelympics
description:
A free print&play dice game for 2-8 players where players compete in 10 different events.

Each of the 10 events will have one or multiple winners, the player who wins the most events will take home the Golden Dicelympics Medal

Luck, dexterity and picking the right opponent are all required to win.

—description from the designer

name: Terra Colonia
description:
Do you know your way around Cologne? And if not? Never mind! In this game, you can also get ahead by guessing - even if it's only by guessing your fellow players well. Discover the megacity on the Rhine in a playful way!

Cologne offers in 86 'Veedeln'(quarters) much known, but also surprises. However, if you already have a clue, you have good chances to score a lot of points: What is the largest brewery in Cologne? When was the chocolate museum opened? Which neighborhoods have an area code other than 0221? And how many employees does Cologne-Bonn Airport actually have?

One player is the guessing master, and only he has to answer the question posed to him by his challenger. All the other players decide whether they think the answer is right or wrong. But beware! The estimation master can also reject the question. In that case, the challenger must take the guessing stone in his own hand - at a higher risk, of course. Who accepts the challenge?

—description from the back of the box (translated)

Those who already have a clue, however, have a good chance of scoring a lot of points. The player with the most points wins.

name: Legends of the American Frontier: 3 Card Special Adventure Set
description:
Three card set included with all Kickstarter-backer copies of Legends of the American Frontier, packaged outside the sealed game box.

Includes:
Architects of the Underground Railroad (Back East)
Rescue the Donner Party (Far West)
Build One of the First Homesteads in Ohio Territory (Frontier)
categories: American West, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: DUELS "au temps de la Grande Peste"
description:
DUELS "au temps de la Grande Peste" is a simple skirmish miniature wargame that allows 2, 3, 4 or 5 players to compete to recognize their rights to the loot of an honest plunder.
Each lord accompanied by a loyal captain and 9 warriors will have to implement a subtle strategy to get hold of the wealth scattered on a table of 1.20 m on the side.

The goal of the game is to control the maximum amount of loot at the end of the game.

Each session is played in four fixed turns at the end of which the victory points are calculated.
Player start by placing peasants and loot on the table.
Depending on the initiative of your troop, you will choose your table edge. The last to choose his edge of the table will be the first to deploy but the first one to play in each turn.
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Vintage Steam: A Heritage Rail Game
description:
In Vintage Steam, players are managing a heritage railway. They will need to try to make it as appealing as possible, with a long track, plenty of locomotives and interesting scenery. Because at some point they will have to show the railway inspector just how good their railway is.

Every round players draft one card for every player. They can either play this card for it's effect or discard it for £2. Played
cards are either added to a players tableau or just used for some special effect like visitors to the railway.

The tableau is made up of track cards and complimentary cards tucked behind those cards. Players aim to be the first to have at least 5 track cards and a tucked locomotive so that they can play an inspector card to end the game.

Every body adds up the victory points on their tableau to discover who has the best heritage railway.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – Thousand Sons
description:
The Thousand Sons advance into battle amidst gouts of kaleidoscopic warpflame and bolts of raw sorcery. At their heart stride the Rubricae, implacable warriors who level salvo after salvo against the foe, marching at the command of the mighty Sorcerers who rule their fractured Legion. Around them come shrieking herds of Tzaangor, chanting cultists, twisted war engines, and immense beasts whose very presence triggers madness and mutation.

Led by the towering figure of the Daemon Primarch Magnus the Red, these sanity-blasting hosts surge into battle to work the will of Tzeentch. Everything they do furthers the labyrinthine plans of their deity. To fight the Thousand Sons is to battle the entangling strands of fate itself, never knowing whether you’re serving their inscrutable ends, even in victory.

In war, the Thousand Sons combine the might of stalwart Chaos Space Marines with throngs of cultists and mutated beasts. At their core, the Thousand Sons’ mastery of sorcery means they fight a war of flesh and blood, but also of psychic mastery – only the strongest enemy psykers can hope to match their potency.

This 96-page book will give you everything you need to launch a crusade of eldritch terror across the galaxy, and make the most of the myriad units available to you. In addition to the rules, you'll find loads of deep lore, stunning art, and expertly painted models to inspire you.

Inside this book, you'll find:

- The history of the Thousand Sons, including their role in the Horus Heresy, their current strength in Warhammer 40,000, and sanity-shattering background on their master, Tzeentch
- A detailed description of the organisation and iconography of the Thousand Sons and the various Cults in their ranks
- A Thousand Sons bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
- A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
- Rules for units that are available to the armies of the Thousand Sons – including 25 datasheets
- Stratagems, Relics, and optional secondary objectives that define the unusual tactics of the Thousand Sons
- A Crusade section providing Agendas, Chaos Boons, Psychic Fortitudes, Requisitions, Battle Traits, unique Discover the Arcane rules, and Crusade Relics for your Thousand Sons to collect
- Loads more

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: A Means of Peace: Grand Tactical Wargame Rules for the American Civil War
description:
A Means of Peace is a free supplement to the Napoleonics ruleset He Did What Heroes Do.

Even with some changes in technology, armies in the American Civil War were remarkably similar to their European counteparts from the start of the century.

The game continues to focus on command and control; you will still be ordering around divisions but the nature of the fighting is even more brutal.

You will need the base rule set to use this product.
The turns continue as normal, but there are a few special rules that will affect play.
The standard system of orders, Initiative and combat is fairly unchanged.

Designed to be played with 2 to 6mm, but can be adapted to other scales.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: ムーミンボードゲーム： ニョロニョロフェスタ (Moomin's Board Game: Nyoro Nyoro Festa)
description:
ムーミンボードゲーム： ニョロニョロフェスタ is a Japanese game based on characters created by Finnish children's author, Tove Jansson. Nyoro Nyoro is the Japanese name for Hattifatteners.

One day, a hoard of Hattifatteners suddenly appears in Moomin Valley and starts causing trouble. But when a witch teaches valley residents how to deal with the intruders—and also a way to get their hands on some treasure—an even bigger ruckus ensues.

Players catch the Hattifatteners and exchange them for treasure cards. The player with the most points from their collected treasure cards wins the game.

Players can exchange as many Hattifatteners at once as they wish for a big payout in treasure…but if they are too greedy and capture too many Hattifatteners or if they have been forced by other players to catch Hattifatteners, their fate will be ultimately left up to the roll of a die. The player who takes a risky gamble in moving around the Hattifatteners might very well end up being the winner!

The game is a mix of a sugoroku (or a “snakes & ladders”-esque board game) and a battle to collect Hattifatteners. On each turn, a player rolls a single die and moves forward the number of spaces corresponding to what was rolled. If a player lands on a space with a Hattifattener, he or she may move one of the Hattifattener pieces on the board (either from the Hattifatteners Island or within the Moomin Valley).

When moving a Hattifattener from the Hattifatteners Island, the player rolls a die and moves a single Hattifattener the corresponding amount of spaces to the number rolled.

Eventually, players will move into the Moomin Valley and catch the Hattifatteners.

In some cases, a player may land on a “Go to Hobgoblin” space. He or she moves his or her player token to the Hobgoblin space and draws a card from the Hobgoblin card stack.

In other cases, players may land on the A, B, or C spaces which enable them to immediately enter the Moomin Valley.

When in the Moomin Valley, players roll the dice to (1) move a Hattifattener and then (2) move their own player token. If a player lands on the same space as a Hattifattener, they can capture it. Some spaces may have multiple Hattifatteners.

After capturing Hattifatteners, players try to move to the Treasure Card space in order to exchange their Hattifatteners for treasure cards. A player can only draw from the Treasure Card stack if they roll the die to a number greater than or equal to the amount of Hattifatteners they have currently captured. If successful, a player draws the same amount of treasure cards as the amount of Hattifatteners they hold.

Treasure cards have differing point values and movement events.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zirafa
description:
Zirafa is a children game of dexterity and memory. To be the tallest giraffe you must win the neck parts finding equals flowers. Then you have to place them one on the top of others being carefully because if the giraffe collapse, you have to built it back or you will lost your next turn.

—user summary

name: Hit & Run
description:
With cards simulating a slot machine, in this game 2 players push their luck to form combinations of symbols that can potentially give them high scores and low penalties.

Additional components required: 2 dice and 3 coins.

Each round, both players will roll their die, and then take cards based on the die rolls. If both players roll the same number, remove one of the 3 coins from the game and roll again. Once players have taken all possible cards, the next round begins.

The game ends when the last card was taken or the last coin was removed from the game. Points are tallied and the player with the high score wins.


Released in the August 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

name: Memo Loto Shop
description:
It is a introductory memory game and chance for young children.

It's time to go shopping! You have to grab all your four items from your shopping list. Go to different stores and use your memory. Grab a card from the shop, if it is on your list you can pick it. Else you have to put back and other player can take if they remember where it was.

The first player who complete the shopping list will win.

name: Battle of Cajamarca, 1532
description:
Battle of Cajamarca, 1532 depicts the climactic “battle” between Pizarro’s conquistadors and the cream of the Incan empire.
