Players can tailor their battle fleets selecting the number and types of warships, their individual special equipment and the quality and skills of their commanders and crews.

—description from the rulebook
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Movement Template

name: Showcase
description:
2 player traditional card game in two phases. In the first phase play 13 tricks to draft a hand of cards for round two. The winner of a trick take a face up display card into their Showcase row, while the loser takes the top card of talon into their hand unseen. Then another display card is dealt. After thirteen tricks, in the second phase, the last thirteen tricks are played out exposed using the previously won cards in each's Showcase row.

There are several unique constraints that guide the flavor and strategy of the game: Phase 1 is played "All trump": a player has to follow suit but if they can't and play another suit that card automatically wins. Only these ruffed tricks count as points in the first phase. In the second phase, the player with the least points in the first phase gets to choose trump (among any of the four suits, no-trump, or a repeat of the all-trump of the first phase). All tricks count 1 point in the second phase. The other interesting constraint is that if a player leads a suit that the other player has in their showcase row, the other player must follow suit. Otherwise they may play any card.

name: Vadmentők
description:
Animals need brave rescuers now. Defy a thousand dangers, help free the protected animals, take them back to the savannah and the primeval forest! You will have to deal with evil hunters along the way. You have to cross the Nile, which is teeming with wild hippos. You are flying over the barren Sahara. You can only count on the help of caravans. Who will be the first to bring back and feed all five animals?

Game rules: The object of the game is to return the animals to their habitats, the winner is the first to return five animals. They rescue an animal at the camp site by taking an animal card with them. They roll the dice, choosing their own route to get the water and food that will be right for the animal on the way, and then take it back to its natural habitat. When entering a caravan field, we get help cards, when entering a poaching field, we have to draw obstruction cards - unless we have handcuffs, in which case we can take the poach to the hunter.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Texto 2.0
description: Texto is back in a new version, playable alone or combined with the first version. You will discover 10 new themes to complete or renew your game.

name: サバンナラッシュ (Savannah Rush)
description:
サバンナラッシュ (Savannah Rush) is a placement game from Japan.

Will it be the elephant or the lion that rules the savannah? The giraffe? A monkey? Rats?
You are one of the gods of the savannah. Your job is to bring the animals to live there. Place your favourite animals in the best places!

This is a battle game where you have to place the animals on the map. The game is played with five different types of animals, and the aim is to place them in such a way that the two animals you are in charge of will have an advantage and you will score more victory points. Use the other animals to your advantage.

サバンナを制するのはゾウかライオンか？それともキリン？サル？ネズミ？
あなたはサバンナを司る神々のひとり。 動物たちをサバンナに住まわせるのが仕事。 贔屓の動物をより良い土地に住まわせよう！

マップ上に動物コマを配置して対戦する陣取りゲームです。
５種類の動物の特徴を活かして、自分が担当する2種類の動物が有利になるように巧みに配置し、より多く勝利点を獲得することを目指します。担当以外の動物もうまく利用しましょう。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement
publishers: iop games (イオピーゲームズ)

name: Catan: Die Stoffräuber
description:
The second set of accessories in the Catan Goodies line (the first Catan Goodies set consisted of the Catanimals) features a set of three plush robber figures. These three figures are plush representations of “Teuber’s Robbers”: three characters named Chief, Lucky, and Bert, who together are the personifications of the robber in Catan. The robbers were originally envisioned to be hapless and ultimately harmless characters who are constantly being vilified by the people settling on Catan.

As with the Catanimals, the rules of a scenario using these plush figures was made available, although in this case the rules were only made available in the German language from the Catan website.

Rules:
In a 3-4 player game, only two of the plush robbers are used. In a 5-6 player game, all three of the plush robbers are used.

At the start of the game, none of the plush robbers are under the control of any player. A player may take control of one of the plush robbers if they have one of their hand cards stolen as a result of robber movement.

Once all of the plush robbers have been claimed, whenever a player has one of their hand cards stolen as a result of robber movement, the player having their card stolen may take a plush robber from the player stealing the card. If the player stealing the card does not have a plush robber, they may take a plush robber from any other player.

A player with control of one plush robber has their hand limit increased by three cards (they do not lose resources unless they have more than 10 cards, instead of the usual 7).

The robber may not be moved to any hex where there is an adjacent settlement or city belonging to a player with control of two plush robbers, unless that player is in sole possession of the most victory points.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Victory Points as a Resource

name: BattleTech: Field Report 2765 – CCAF
description:
2765 Field Report: CCAF describes the state of House Liao's Capellan Confederation just before the events described in Historical: Liberation of Terra (Part 1), including the overall military and logistical condition of one of the Great Houses that would eventually survive the collapse of the Star League and face a new age of endless war.

Field Report 2765: CCAF closely follows the format of Field Report: CCAF but with two new WarShip designs also included along with record sheets for each.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Vatikan
description: It's an abstract game similiar to Round Chess. The game is played in turns on a Circular board with one player playing as red and the other as green. Players move their pieces between spaces according to the rules of the piece being moved. There are seven different pieces. The goal is to be the first player to bring your Cardinal to Vatikan (center of the board) through the opponents half or to remove the opponents Cardinal.

name: Suipi
description:
Suipi is a classic Samoan card game played using a standard deck of cards, similar in play to "Casino" or "Scopa".

Play starts with four cards being laid face up in the middle of the table, and eight cards being dealt to each player. The goal of the game is to capture the most points by matching cards and building stacks of cards. While regional rules may slightly alter how the game is played, some standard rules apply.

To gather a card from the table, players play a card from their hand which matches a table card in number, or matches the sum of two table cards (if the player has a 9 in their hand, they can gather a 5 and 4 from the table for example). Additionally, cards can be stacked (built) and taken as a stack on the next turn, but only if the player has the stacked number in their hand (for example, a 7 could be built onto a 3 to create a 10, allowing a player with a 10 in their hand to gather the whole stack on their turn). Face cards have no value and can only be gathered using matching face cards.

Additionally, if a player plays a card which matches several cards, stacks, or sums of individual cards on the table, the player may take all those cards. For example, if a player plays a 10 and there is on the table a 10, a stack of 3 & 7, and individually a 6 and 4 the player may take all of those cards as their 10 matches the first individual card, the total stack number, and the sum of the individual 6 and 4 cards.

If a player can not gather a card, they must 'drop' a card onto the table from their hand. If all cards are removed from the table, the player who removed the last card immediately scores 1 point and proclaims 'Suipi!'. The other player must then drop a card to continue the round. "Suipi" is played over 3 rounds, with each round ending when both player's hands are exhausted. Cards on the table remain there between rounds. At the end of the 3rd round, when cards run out of players hands', any cards remaining on the table go to the player which completed the most recent match.

Points are scored per round as follows:
Most cards = 3 points
10 of Diamonds = 2 points
2 of Spades = 1 point
Most Spades = 1 point
Aces = 1 point each
Each Suipi = 1 point (scored during the rounds)


Note: depending on the village the game is learned in, scoring may be slightly different

name: Horror Trivia Part II: Deeper Cuts
description:
150 game cards, each featuring two horror film trivia questions (with answers on the back) and one of five weapon icons in the corner.

A trivia question is read from the card and the currently active team attempts to answer. If successful, the next question is read and they attempt to answer it also. If both answers were correct, they collect the card. Play passes to the next team.
The first team that collects 3 different weapons wins the game!

name: Guca 3
description: Be the first to use all your cards to form trios, ladders or logical relationships (greater than/less than). Modify the groups already on the table, use some of your cards to create new ones, even use the joker to make combinations and modifications. Even use the joker to make combinations and modifications. Play, think and above all enjoy!

name: Doktor Snuggles: Kvartettspel
description: This card game contains eight families with four cards in each family. Each turn a player asks another player if he/she has one particular card. If the other player has that card he/she has to give it away to the one asking for it. Then the player can continue asking for cards. If a player don´t have the card you asking for, the turn go over to the other player. When you have all cards from one family you can put it down in front of you. The goal of the game is to collect as many sets of families as possible. The game is based on the character Doctor Snuggels created by Jeffrey O'Kelly.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Memory

name: BattleTech: Historical – Reunification War
description:
In 2570, the six Great Houses of the Inner Sphere united to create the Star League, promising to bring an end to the generations of warfare that engulfed the worlds mankind now called home. Shortly thereafter, to seal their alliance, they turned against the various independent realms of the Periphery. Over the next twenty years, the so-called Reunification War would rage, claiming more lives than the savagery of the Age of War before it, all to realize House Cameron's dream of a united humanity--at any cost.

Historical: Reunification War describes the first grand military campaign of the newborn Star League against the collected realms of the Periphery. Covering each of the four major campaign theaters in detail, this book provides a hard look at the formative years of the first Star League, and the fateful decisions that led them to usher in a new Golden Age for mankind by unleashing their armies against its most far-flung worlds.

name: Babar
description:
A competitive memory game using a standard 52-card deck.

The goal is to be the player with the lowest score at the end of each round by exchanging cards face down with the other players. You can't look at a card and keep it at the same turn, so you better remember it!

The game ends as soons as one player reaches 77 points or more. The player with the lowest score wins!

name: Den stora skattjakten
description:
Each participant places their game figure on one of the four colored starting fields and the obstacles are placed on the red squares. The one who rolls the highest number on the die begins. The participants move their figures as many fields as the die show. You can choose which path you want, but it is not allowed to jump over obstacles. They can only be cleared out of the way if you end up directly on the square where the obstacle stands. Then you can put the obstacle where you want, preferably so that it stands in the way of the opponents. If you end up in the same field as an opponent, the opponent must start over. The one who first ends up directly on the square with the treasure chest has won.

The game was included in "Kalle Anka & C:o", no. 39, 20 September 1996.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice

name: Fyll säcken med skatter!
description:
The treasure marks are placed on the game board - anywhere except on the squares along the edges. The participants each take their game figure and a sack and put them in their respective corners on the game board. In the bag you collect the treasures.

Roll the dice and move as many squares as it shows. You can go in any direction you want, except diagonally. NOTE! If an opponent gets in the way and you end up in a square with an opponent - you have to start over! The goal is to end up in a square where the treasure marks are, collect the treasure and put the mark in the bag. The game is over when the last treasure mark is put in the bag. The one who has the most treasure marks has then won.

The game was included in the comic book "Kalle Anka & C:o", no. 39, 20 September 1996.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice

name: Cluedo Batman Edition
description:
In this game we find ourselves playing the opponents of the superhero. The title includes up to a maximum of four players, who can however choose from the most iconic villains of Gotham City: Bane, Joker, Catwoman, Mr. Freeze, The Riddler and Harley Quinn.

Each villain will have a Criminal Plan to carry out, developed in different missions (such as taking control of specific territories or making certain results with the dice). Achieving a certain number of objectives will activate the character's special powers, giving the player various advantages during the rest of the game.

While the villains compete for the districts of Gotham City (following the traditional RisiKo dice-rolling mechanic!), our hero is not standing idle. When five 1's are rolled during a turn, Batman goes into action, clearing one or more territories on the board and wreaking havoc in the fight for control of the metropolis. Especially in the initial stages it will not be easy to watch, but it will always be a great emotion to swoop into our opponents. It will be less pleasant when it's our turn to face the Dark Knight, but that's part of the challenge too.

In addition to conquering all of Gotham, you can take home the game by completing one of three objectives, common to all participants. However, every time a criminal empire is definitively defeated, the player who accomplished the feat can choose to eliminate one of the conditions.
mechanics: Deduction, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Trains of Europe
description:
On a map of Europe, you build track to fulfill your contracts.
On his turn, each of the players chooses one of 6 action phases and triggers it. All players act while the triggering player has an advantage (like in Puerto Rico). In the contract phase, you choose contracts that include a start city, a destination city and sometimes 1 or 2 in between. It says which type of locomotive you are allowed to use and which and how many wagons.

In the building phase, you connect any 2 cities by paying for the track you build. In the market phase you buy locomotives and wagons, in the auction phase you must offer at least one locomotive or wagon that is not yet part of a contract. In the reward phase, you get money for your connected cities and in the state subsidy phase you receive a locomotive or wagon for free. At the end of a round all players receive income according to their partly or completely fulfilled contracts.

After a player has an agreed amount of fulfilled contracts, the game ends and you get points for fulfilled contracts, income and connected cities and minus points for contracts not at least partly fulfilled.

—user summary
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Connections, Contracts, Income, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Phase Order

name: Age of Journey
description:
Age of Journey is a "slightly" different kind of worker-playing game in which you develop a forgotten village in the mountains. The game is based on the idea that workers (warriors) and resources (livestock) are two sides of the same coin. If you send a large number of people to raid an area, you will earn more money, but you will have fewer actions to perform. In addition, the dominance of the colours over the area makes the management of your warband very difficult. Use the sale market to sell your livestock at a high price and invest in various cards to get rich!

Worker pieces are double sided. On your turn, you choose a number of workers to send to a given space. One worker occupies the space, triggering it's while the remaining workers flip over to become the depicted resources. These resources can then be sold on a variable market, allowing you to buy skills, more workers, and Estates, which are the main source of victory points.

The player with the most victory points after 3 rounds (short & solo games) or 4 rounds (long game) is the winner.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, City Building, Economic, Farming, Medieval
publishers: Southern Cross Games (サザンクロスゲームズ)

name: Cafe Chaos: Animator Pack
description: This pack include 34 cards all based around characters from the YouTube series. It has 9 characters with their own actions, plus 8 foods, 2 toppings, 2 conditions, 2 bonus actions and 2 events.

name: J'y Crois Pas: Supplément Salades
description:
In each round of Fake That! , the player in the role of "Gullible" will ask a wacky question. Each of the other players must answer either the crazy truth or...a big fat lie! Will the liars prove convincing enough? Will Gullible succeed in uncovering all of them without pointing out the right answer?

J'y Crois Pas: Supplément Salade is an expansion containing hundred new questions to renew and extend the discoveries.
It requires the base game.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Guerra de Tronos
description:
Guerra de Tronos is a war and strategic board game set in the Game of Thrones universe.

The game develops a war conflict that takes place on the continents of Westeros and Essos, divided into 54 territories. Each faction has a goal to meet, and to do so, they must expand domains, attack and defend against adversaries, mobilize armies and establish alliances.

In Westeros, the death of King Robert has created a power vacuum, and the Lannisters, Baratheon and Stark compete for the Iron Throne.

Meanwhile, in Essos, Daenerys Targaryen attempts to dominate Slave Bay and cross the Narrow Sea. The Free Cities seek to consolidate their independence, and the Wildlings cross to the south of the Wall fleeing death ...
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Negotiation, Novel-based, Political, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Same Difference
description:
Object
To win tricks, especially by playing two cards with the greatest possible difference between them. For this purpose cards have numerical values from Ace = 1 up to King=13. Thus if the cards you play are King-Ace the difference between them is 12 (=13-1), while if they are equal the difference is zero.

Each trick must contain exactly one card of each suit.

name: La Vetrina
description:
For an ordinary deck or a Scopa deck. For the first ten tricks, players compete to win display cards ("jewels") from the talon by winning tricks. Display cards are placed into a row in front of each player known as their showcase ("la vetrina"). Winning showcase cards gives you points, but at a cost: it if a player leads with a card matching a suit of a card in your showcase, you must follow suit for that trick. Moreover, cards from your showcase may only be used to follow, and your opponent sees your cards. For the second ten tricks, once the talon is gone, you play out your hand and showcase. Preparing your evolving hand to win more points overall is a cerebral conundrum.

Some unique features include that in the first half it's easier to lose tricks than to win them (since phase-1 is played "all trump": any card of an off suit wins). Simultaneously, the showcase allows the leader to determine if their opponent must follow suit or not-- so for connoisseurs of trick games there are new interesting puzzles.

—description from the designer

name: Inter-Rail
description:
The game of Inter-Rail is about traveling around Europe, by train, experience as much as possible, buy souvenirs to take home, and in that way get most points to win the game.

You do this by rolling the die, move around the board, and land on spaces to draw city or chance cards. This goes on for a specified amount of time, usually 1-2 hours, and when you get home to Start (Oslo), you draw point cards to see how valuable your purchased items are.

The player with most points wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: UNO: Space Jam – A New Legacy
description:
Play out this special edition of the UNO card game inspired by the 1996 original movie Space Jam and 2021 sequel Space Jam: A New Legacy. This pack and cards are adorned with graphics of Looney Tunes animated characters and basketball stars from the movie. The special 'Welcome to the Jam' wild card could let you discard two cards or draw two cards, depending on which way the 'ball' bounces! When players have only one card left, they must yell 'UNO!' Colors and decorations may vary.

- This special edition of UNO, everyone's favorite card matching game, features images of Looney Tunes characters and basketball stars.
- Game play is the same as classic UNO, but there's a special rule unique to this deck the Welcome to the Jam wild card with a very special 'jump ball' rule.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: 4-PLE
description:
A 3 dimensional 4-in-a-row game. Players use cubes or cylindrical game pieces to be the first to get 4 in a row up, accross or diagonally on any level in any direction. That's it.

The game board is a 4 x4 grid. On your turn, place your gamepiece on any space of the grid or stack it on top of any piece that has already been played.

It starts out simple but quickly creates many opportunities to win... or lose.

On the flip side of the board, play alternate versions. "The Wall" is a straight version that plays just like Connect Four.
"Stonehenge" is a circular version. All have the same rule of 4 in a row in any direction.

—description from the designer
publishers: (Self-Published), Family Games, Inc., Fourple Game Company

name: Decs Building
description:
The whole neighbourhood competes to see who can decorate their house in the most tasteful, elegant display of brightly- coloured lights in the run-up to Christmas. Every square metre of your house has to be blasting out light if you want to stand a chance of out-Holidaying the Joneses!

2-4 players compete to put on the most impressive Christmas lights on the front of their houses by spending cards to build their decks, install power lines and put up decorations, drawing their display out on individual grids. When the big day comes you don't want to be left with unpowered lights or empty walls.

Decs Building is intended to be printed on the inside face of a Christmas card to friends or family, and in addition to the self-contained card, requires only components many families will already have around their houses: coloured pawns from e.g. Ludo or Pachesi, a couple of decks of regular playing cards, and a pen or pencil and paper for each player.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Worker Placement

name: The Morning Show
description: In this game, it's a battle of the radio stations as you try to make your station's morning show the best in town! Play songs from a constantly rotating request line deck que. Play cards from your hand to line up the sponsors and guests and remote locations. The more you give the listeners what they want, the more points you score and the most points wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Open Drafting

name: Blanc-manger Coco: La Gaule
description: Blanc-manger Coco 4 - La Gaule is a game with 600 new cards on the theme of France, from Vercingétorix to Xavier Dupont de Ligonnès, consanguines with cagoles, sauerkraut with honey pipe ...
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Blanc-manger Coco: Au fond du trou
description: Blanc-manger Coco 5 - Deep in the Hole is a game with 600 new cards on the theme of Sex and Death. An explosive mix that creates hilarious combinations, the height of black humor
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Ehita linnus
description:
Each player builds his/her own castle with different characters like princess, knight, cat, ghost or dove.
But only the players with the most characters/completed towers score points at the end of the game.

Each round players choose one card from the table and place it on his/her castle face up to make it higher of face down to make it wider. All patterns must be continued on each adjacent card.

If the deck is exhausted the player with the most characters in each type / completed towers scores 3 points. The player with the 2nd best scores 1 point.
Player with the most points is the winner.

Different variants for playing and scoring included.

name: Morning Coffee Dungeon: Night At The Museum
description:
Morning Coffee Dungeon is a dungeon crawling puzzle that can be completed with your morning cup of coffee. Limiting randomness to the treasure/loot drops, each delve into the dungeon is more a series of calculated decisions. Will you be able to complete the campaign with the most victory points?

Night At The Museum" There’s a bit of trouble at the museum and they’ve sent their best paranormal investigator to take care of it. Watch out for that frog creature! It really hops.

What Do I Need to Play:

1d12
1 hero marker
1 monster marker
3 bullet chits / markers
5 Victory Point chits / markers
10 Time chits / markers

Rules / How to Play

You may move your character to any spot. It may not move diagonally, through walls, or piles of rubble.
Your character may only attack a monster by shooting it.
If your character enters a new “jump” area, the monster jumps to a new spot.

Battle Rules (Complete in Order)

SHOOT: Your character may only shoot if it has bullets. Every bullet subtracts a Bullet.
SUCCESS: A successful shot is determined by rolling 1d12. It is successful if that value is larger than the distance between your character and the monster (shortest path, no diagonals, ignore Line of Sight rules). Success earns 1 VP.
JUMP: Any kind of shot, successful or not, results in the monster jumping to a new spot.
RELOAD: Replenish your Bullets to the maximum, but doing so forces the monster to jump.

MONSTER JUMPS

Roll 1d12 to determine where the monster jumps to. Whenever the monster jumps, you lose 1 Time.

—description from the designer

name: Sylaby: Nauka czytania
description:
Sylaby is an educational game for children, helping to learn to read using syllables.
The game has 2 decks of cards. One with syllables, the other one with consonants.
In a basic game, every player is given 5 cards, the rest in a drawpile. We open one card and players starts a game. In his turn, a player can either put a card on top of the open card, as long as he is creating a proper word. If he can't or doesn't want, he needs to draw a card. Winner is a player, who will get rid of his/her cards first.

The advanced variant introduces the second deck of cards. The rules are the same, but players are making more one syllable word.

Cards can also be used as a help for recognizing letters and used to introduce children to reading.

—description from the designer

name: Farben Spass
description:
Attention - color wanted! The clown's red nose is missing. And the blue of the ball is missing. Now there ist a big hole, where the color was. What now? Very simple: If you put the cards on the correct colored area, the color quickly comes back... and the clown's nose is red again. Dice fun for everyone who already knows the colors and can observe them well. Different play options always provide variety.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Achtung - Farbe gesucht! Dem Clown fehlt die rote Nase. Und aus dem Ball fehlt das Blau. Wo die FARbe war, ist jetzt ein großes Loch. Was nun? Ganz einfach: Legt man die Karten auf die richtige Farbfläche, kommt die Farbe blitzschnell zurück... und schon ist die Clownnase wieder rot. Ein lustiger Würfelspaß für alle, die schon die Farben kennen un gut beobachten können. Verschiedene Spielmöglichkeiten sorgen immer wieder für Abwechslung.

—description from the publisher

name: Three Norman Battles
description: A set of miniature wargames rules published in Wargames Illustrated 31 for refighting battles from the 'Anarchy' civil war period of English history, where forces loyal to the King and Empress fought each other for control of England.

name: Guédelon: Le Moulin
description: This is a mini-expansion that came with the Kickstarter version but is also available for download from Asychron games. The mill is an additional building that increases the difficulty and extends the visitors' tour of the premises.

name: Bought Red Handed
description:
The outrageous story-telling game where you battle to put together the world's most unfortunate shopping cart.

Forget window-shopping, it's time to splash the cash and hit "checkout" in this messed-up game of materialism! Filled with 400 item cards - anything from duct tape to 1,500 live lady bugs - players battle it out to submit the funniest combination of items for the purchasing scenario listed on the situation and trap cards.

Will you have to buy a wedding present for your ex-partner for under $20? Or pick up supplies for a romantic getaway within a short time limit?

Once you've selected your items, get ready to weave a funny story to explain your choices and win the round!

name: Wanna Bet? 2
description:
Roll the die and try to perform an active or passive challenge, according to the space on which you land. The other players bet on whether you’ll be successful or not, while you win the same amount if you manage your challenge!

Comes with a Wanna Bet ball and a handy target for performing the challenges!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: For the Love of Honey
description:
For The Love Of Honey is a game created just for couples!

This game gives you the chance to turn off the TV, hide your phones, and just have FUN together.

There are 2 stacks of cards with 4 categories so you can play this game over and over!

The categories are:

Who Knows Who Better
Trivia
Compete
Don't Be Scared


If you know a couple that loves games, works too hard and could use some quality 1 on 1 time, or just loves having fun, this is perfect for them!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Get Out of Bed
description:
This super fun card game tests how well you know your partner, with a twist!

If you like getting competitive and could use a fun way to sneak in a little workout together, this is the perfect game for you!

There are 2 deck of card with a mixture of 'Two Truths and a Lie' cards and 'Would You Rather' cards. Guess what your partner will say and if you're wrong, you have to do the penalty on the card!

Laugh, have fun, and learn something new about one another!

—description from from the publisher

name: Cowpie Catapults
description:
It’s Cow Pie Catapults – the poo flippin’, cow tippin’ battle of the barnyard! Arrange your cows on your side of the barnyard, load up the catapults, and let the fun begin! On 3-2-1 poo is launched through the air and lands with splendid splats. First player to knock over all the opponent’s cows is the winner!

-description from publisher's website

name: 80's Rewind
description:
Did you love the 80's? Think you know more than your radical significant other?

Compete in this custom made game for 2 to find out!

Full of laughs and surprises along the way!

Great to surprise your partner with, great gifts for anniversaries, birthdays, showers, holidays, or just because a hard working couple deserves some fun!

—description from the publisher

name: Magpie
description:
Magpie continues the trend of Roll and Write Revolution doing out of the box ideas. In Magpie, players play as a magpie who is collecting items (Sticks, Eggs, Worms, Seeds, and Shinies). Each of the players has a hidden bonus card that will enable all players to score points for certain collections. The players will also have a plus or minus value for the Shinies, which are totaled to provide a score.

Further, the magpie players are also fighting for control of the 6 areas. They may instead of destroying the hex space to gain a resource, write in their own player symbol. The player(s) who have the most symbols in each area will score points.

Magpie forces up to four players to really gather in tight as they will all be playing off of the same sheet. Wild interactions will occur and you may wonder if your friends are bird-brains or actually clever.

Also includes a solo player variant where the player is against Martha Magpie and her love for Shinies!

Magpie plays 1-4 players in 30-60 min; Language independent components!

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: Lagniappe Games, Roll and Write Revolution

name: Boj o Velku Moravu
description:
Boj o Velku Moravu ("The Battle for Great Moravia") is an original Slovak strategy game that will take you back to a time when there was a relentless fight between the armies of the Eastern Franks, Western Slavs and old Hungarians in our region.

Each of the players will be one of the nations and strive to occupy as much territory as possible on the playing field with the help of their military party. By occupying settlements in battles, players gain points that they can use to develop their army and settle free territory. Each nation has its own characteristics, so on the road to victory, everyone must use a slightly different strategy. The winner is the player who has the largest territory at the end of the game, but the victory can be sided with the occupation of a strategic place or the size of the army.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Around The World
description:
Each players has to send six postcards from different cities to win. To move to each city, they can walk the streets or use boats, airplanes or trains.
It is very important to optimize the movement to win.

—user summary

name: Qui veut gagner des neurones?
description:
Who wants to train his neurons? In this trivia game of 450 cards, you can explore 5 themes (sciences, general culture, puzzles, vocabulary and intelligence quotient), and 3 difficulty levels.

The first player take a card, read the theme and the question and select one or several players to answer it. If a challenged player has the correct answer, he wins the points written on the card and take a card to challenge the others. If nobody can answer, the player who asked the question wins the points of the card, multiply by the number of challenged players. The person who reach first a certain amount of points (previously defined)is declared the winner.

name: FAQ: Frequently Asked Questions
description: You’ve been given all the answers, but can you come up with the funniest question? A hilarious party game that gives you the answers where players come up with questions. You must come up with the funniest, most awkward, or downright insulting questions to win the game! For every round one player becomes a judge and reads out an answer from a card. The other players have to come up with the funniest question to the answer within the time allowed.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Over Dose!!
description:
Over Dose!! is a push-your-luck card game from Japan. Players are scientists trying to awaken a beast in a cave. But the scientist who injects too much, gets eaten. The players are trying to edge on their competitors to get eaten, so they leave with all the credit.

In the depths of an abandoned mine, a Hexenbeast, described in an old book, was sleeping in a state of suspended animation. One day, a group of mad scientists discovered it, but they were not satisfied with just examining the beast in its dormant state, they wanted to wake it up and observe its activities.

However, according to the literature, a large amount of activator is needed to wake up a Hexenbeast, and the waking Hexenbeast will immediately eat the person in front of it.

The scientists are not on the best of terms. The fewer people who take their findings home with them, the better. This is the perfect opportunity to kick off a ridiculous game of chance!


とある廃坑の奥、古い文献に記された魔獣が仮眠状態で眠っていた。ある時狂った科学者集団がその魔獣を発見したのだが、仮死状態の魔獣を調べただけでは飽き足らず、目覚めさせてその活動を観察したいと考えた。

　しかし、文献によれば、魔獣を目覚めさせるには大量の活性剤が必要で、しかも目覚めた魔獣は即座に目の前の人間を食べてしまうという。

科学者たちは決して仲良しではない。得られた成果を持ち帰る人間は少ないほうが良いのだ。これを機にライバルを蹴落とそうと、とんでもないゲームが始まった！
categories: Animals, Card Game, Fantasy, Science Fiction

name: Sparrow: A Game of Triumphs
description:
Sparrow: A Game of Triumphs is a trick taking game using four plain suits (black, green, red, and yellow) along with an extra suit of 22 triumphs or trump cards. The Sparrow is the lowest ranking triumph.

Each player receives a hand of 12 cards with an additional six cards being dealt to the kitty. Players bid to become the declarer by stating how few cards they wish to exchange with the kitty.

Sparrow is a point trick game. Each card is worth a point value indicated by the number of stars. Instead of trying to win the greater number of tricks, the declarer's side tries to win the majority of card points taken in tricks.

name: Monster City: karty dodatkowe
description: This promo pack for the polish version of Quietville, obtainable in the publisher's contests, adds three new cards and a new endgame scoring mechanic - number of buildings bonuses, to the main game. After each monster attack, the player chooses one of the cards and saves it in the ruins deck, face-down, rather than removing it from the game. At the end of the game, each person with the most cards of a certain colour (or the most value in case of a tie) in their ruins deck gains the appropriate bonus card, and 5 points at the end of the game.

name: The Voting Game: After Dark Edition
description:
The Voting Game After Dark Edition is a group card game that uncovers the sometimes disturbing, sometime risqué, but always hilarious truths behind your friendships.

Play again and again—gameplay varies dramatically based on the friends you play with.

Get to know one another—personal stories are often shared after a revealing vote.

name: Sniper: One shot
description:
Sniper is a one player PnP game where you take control of one of the famous snipers in World War 2.
You take your sniper through different terrains and missions to try and achieve the stars for each one. The sniper's main aims are to stay hidden, survive, but to take out as many enemies as possible in the process.
Each turn consists of choices between hiding, moving or shooting. You will want to try and get close to the enemy lines top have the best chance of killing the officers and get the most points possible.
But in turn, you must also take care not to be seen! Even a successful shot can spell danger for you if this has been seen by a fellow enemy as they will return fire!
Complete the objectives given in your mission and stay alive.

—description from the designer
categories: Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: I Saw It First!: Jungle
description:
Three hundred jungle animals populate the board of this carefully engineered game. Some are familiar, like the leopard or the hippopotamus, others less so, like the eyelash viper or the giraffe weevil.

Pull a counter from the bag featuring one of the 300 animals in this game and be the first to spot that animal on the board! Coming in a triangular box with a hexagonal double–sided board, this game features charming illustrations by Caroline Selmes. Simple to understand but addictive to play, this fun and challenging game will delight adults and children alike. The player who spots it first, wins the token.

The player with the most tokens at the end of the game wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Oscar & Max
description:
Oscar, the king of the jungle, has to gather all his subjects. But the zebras, hippos and parrots don’t answer his call… Help Oscar to find as many animals as possible, but beware of Max: the evil monkey who’s always wreaking havoc! A wonderful game of luck that will delight little ones and test their memory.

It is a children's game based on memory.

There are some animal pieces. The player tries to say which animal is on the other side of a piece. If they are correct, they take it otherwise they put on the jungle board over other previously placed pieces on the player board.

When on the piece there is Oscar the Lion the player can say in the right order all the pieces on the Jungle Board to take all them.

If Max the monkey is on the choose piece, all pieces on the Jungle Board are lost.

Contents: 1 ‘jungle’ board, 37 wooden pieces (10 zebras, 10 hippos, 10 parrots, 6 Oscar the Lion, 1 Max the Monkey)

name: Imuri
description: Imuri was invented independently by Klaus Munro, who later became a famous writer and composer, and in so doing became less interested in defending whatever rights he may have had to the game. The grid is 30x30, which would be significantly deeper than Randolph's 24x24, but the production quality was much better for Twixt.

name: Rentnerjagd: Erweiterung
description:
Rentner Jagd - Erweiterung expands the cooperative strategy card game Rentner Jagd. In turn-based battles you compete against the game as a team of 1-4 players (5 players with the optional Overlord mode). Random elements in the game setup and during the game always present you with new challenges, even if you play the same missions multiple times.

The expansion features fresh retirees and missions, an additional team of retirees hunters and an all-new Overlord game mode. The Overlord game mode is optional. With the contents of the expansion, you can continue to fight the game together. The new pensioner hunters can be freely combined with those of the basic game.

In the future everything will be networked - including retirees. Their countless high-tech implants and prostheses form a gigantic computing network, in the depths of which an artificial pensioner intelligence - or R.I. for short - goes unnoticed. - grows up, who seeks revenge on the youth-mad society because of miserable care conditions and a lack of respect for old age. As an overlord, a player takes control of the masses of retirees and, equipped with numerous special skills, competes alone against a team of retired hunters.

name: Curb Your Enthusiasm
description:
A PRETTY, PRETTY, PRETTY GOOD PARTY GAME: In this hilarious party game, players compete to be the ultimate Larry David; When you're Larry, uncomfortable run-ins are inevitable; For 3-6 players ages 17 and up.

MAKING EXCUSES: It's your excuses that separate the winning Larry from the others; See if you can pair the best excuse with familiar situations from Curb Your Enthusiasm and have a prett-ay prett-ay good time while you're at it.

TRY AGAIN, LARRY: Find yourself in a variety of cringeworthy situations from the show and push for your excuse to win the round; The first player to collect 5 Situation Cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: 1-48TACTIC: Lanzerath Ridge – Hold at all costs!
description:
A mission pack expansion for 1-48TACTIC, set in 1944, during the Ardennes offensive, based on the real Battle of Lanzerath Ridge which was fought on the very first day of the Battle of the Bulge, near the village of Lanzerath, Belgium, along the key route for the German advance on the northern shoulder of the operation. A small group of US Infantry facing a whole German battalion of Fallschirmjägers try to hold off overwhelmingly superior forces for as long as possible.

The US forces here plays an outnumbered defender that must delay the German attacker as long as possible. The German forces are overwhelmingly superior and will eventually prevail, but the limited amount of AT available greatly limit the ability of the German player to exploit his superiority in men and firepower. Moreover the attackers have to move to reach their objective, while the defenders can use most of their Actions to fire on them.

pack includes:
• A 52 pages full color booklet with all the rules;
• A special metal figures of a German Fallschirmjäger armed with a rifle grenade launcher (25mm round plastic base included);
• A special resin figures of a US soldier firing a .50 M2 machine gun (two models of which are also included);
• Resin models of a small log hut, a camouflaged timber pillbox and a dug-in armored jeep.

Requires items from the base game to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Die Olchis: Das Spiel zum Film
description:
A muffle fart cool memo game:

Cheesy stinker sock, it smells quite rotten in Schmuddelfing! The Olchis have until 12 noon to free the small town from the bad smell. Then begins the citizens' meeting, at which the future of the dirty finger dump, the home of the Olchis, is decided.

Go together with the Olchi children in search of fine herringbones, toady slippers and crisp batteries. You have to roll in order and reveal cards. As soon as three cards of the same waste are revealed it is automatically selected. But be careful not to accidentally get a voucher for the wellness hotel. Because then it's time to Yikes, off to the bathtub, take a bubble bath, and that costs valuable time!

The game starts with an area of 4 times 6 hidden tiles with the player token in one corner and the vouchers in the others.

Roll a dice and either increase the time if the dice shows a clock or move depending on the result 1-3 fields with a single player token. Ensure that the final field is revealed and add a chip on all three tiles with player tokens if they are equal. For the next turn hide the tiles without chip again if you leave it and the next player tries again.

You win the game if the clock shows less than 12 o‘clock and there are chips on all waste tiles otherwise you loose.

name: マチナミトリテ (Machinamitorite)
description:
This is a fashionable open terrace cafe.

Today, traveling is gathered with friends who have a hobby.
If you bring a nice picture of the cityscape you took while traveling and let the memories of each fun trip bloom ...

Suddenly, a gust of wind blew the photo away!

I picked it up in a hurry, but the photos fell apart, and I have no idea who took them or where.

Get more photos of the same cityscape than anyone else!

[Game Play]
Matinami Trite is a trick taking game. There are 4 suits (value 1~5) and one additional special trump (green) suit (value "A" or 0). Players have to follow the lead suit in a round. The game has a set of special designed cards with different terrace card back of a card. Players have to win tricks and collect cards of different terrace so that they can get high scores at game end.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Once Upon a Crime
description:
Not long ago, in Happily-ever-after Village , the situation had become extremely complicated, corruption and crime taken over what was a dream city. Laureate storytellers wandered looking for different tricks to survive in this savage world. The city was in deep chaos, every night a new crime took place, a complicated job even for the most suspicious. Are you aiming to solve them?

In the game, the players must be divided by teams. One of the first team became the Forensic and will do a story with one card of each category on the table. The players, by teams, will try to solve the Forensic case. At the beginning, the Forensic will provide the name of the case, the victim’s name and the time of death.

Starts with the Forensic rival team, the teams will try to solve the case making inquiries about the possible killers, weapons, crime scene and motive. The Forensic will determine how many mistakes have been made in each of the attempts and will reveal different pieces of evidence that can clarify the event.

After several attempts, one of the teams will have solved the case. The winning team will be the one that reaches 12 Points.

—description from the publisher

name: BattleTech: Tamar Rising
description:
Tamar Rising is a BattleTech sourcebook providing full details of the events in the former Clan Jade Falcon Occupation Zone from 3151 to mid-3152. Included are a full historical summary of events in that region of space, personality and unit profiles of key players—many appearing here for the first time, and game information to bring it all to your BattleTech tabletop.

Note: Includes a Campaign Map, which with the physical book is a 26” x 38”, double-sized, laminated poster.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Multiple Maps, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Dead'n Slaaash
description:
In Dead'n Slaaash every players control a survivor crew and has to take the right decisions in order to ensure a safe future to their owns. Strategy, bluff, alliance ant treason are on the schedule of each game, because in this cruel world your survival will have to pass before that of the others.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution

name: クレッシェンド (Crescendo)
description:
Crescendo is a 3 player trick-taking game.

It is played using a short deck with cards A-5 in four suits plus one joker.

Each hand is divided into an Auction Phase and a Play phase. Only one player will be eligible to score points in a hand. The auction determines who will be the "soloist" and choose the trump suit in the play phase. The other two players will play against the soloist.

Play is standard must-follow trick-taking. Tricks are won by the highest card in the lead suit, or the highest trump card if any trump cards are played.

The soloist wins points for tricks, attempting to win the amount that they had bid in the auction phase.

The player with the most points after several hands wins the game.

name: Monopoly: Asterix
description: Move your characters - the most famous characters from the popular series about the two Gauls Asterix and Obelix - across the field. You bring the most important moments of the comic classic to life. Build as many huts and hostels as possible on the fields to win. The instructions on the Potions and Community Cauldron cards will get you there quickly. But beware: they also have one or two surprises in store.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Denk mich: Wer tickt so wie ich?
description:
This is an association game with 55 cards with 6 different questions each.
One player reads the first question and all players write the first word which comes to their mind. All players read their words and the players who selected the same word score 1 point. Now it's the next player's turn who reads the second qustion.
After 3 cards, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

—user summary

name: Beast in Show
description:
Fantasy monster pet deck builder. Create the ultimate team of monsters, beasts, and cryptic to compete in pet competitions. Collect pets, companions, and abilities of different elements and combine their powers to win the most trophies.

Each player starts with a deck of ten starter cards, and a starting pet. Your pet stays out on your player mat, ready to compete using its Beauty, Brains, and Brawn stats! Each turn, draw 5 cards from your deck. Some cards will add points to your pets' Beauty, Brains, or Brawn statistics. Others have money that let you buy more powerful cards or pets from the marketplace. Cards can also contain abilities that let you improve your hand, improve your pets, or sabotage your competitors! All cards also align to one of four elements. By pairing cards of the same element, you can activate even better abilities and add extra pets to your game board to help win competitions. After buying cards, placing pets on your mat, activating abilities, or any combination of those things, place your hand in the discard pile, and draw a new hand. As the game progresses, your deck will grow more and more powerful!

Once the pets on your player mat, with the assistance of any cards in your hand that turn, have enough Beauty, Brains, and Brawn, go claim your prize! Each trophy has a unique combination of statistics required to claim, and once you've claimed a prize no one else can claim the same one. Trophies also give you victory points to win the game. But be careful. Once your pets win a trophy, they retire and you will need to purchase new ones for the next competition.

Play until all the competitions are claimed, then add up victory points from your trophies. Be strategic: some cards, including pets, also contain victory points that count towards victory. So don't assume the person with the most trophies is always the winner!

—description from the publisher

name: Escape Adventures Adventskalender: Die verwunschenen Eisruinen
description:
Probably the most exciting Advent season ever! Join adventurer Edda on the greatest journey of discovery of his life.
You have only 24 days to find the exit with Eddas faithful companions Spike and Luna, trapped in an underground ice ruin. Manage your rations well, open doors and deactivate frosty traps to get closer to escape. Meet mystical creatures, icy sculptures and solve a mystery of a long forgotten culture every day.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Match These Bones
description:
Become an expert fossil hunter. Race to uncover 25 dinosaur skeletons and pair them with the living creatures. Is that a pterodactyl or an archaeopteryx? Cab you spot the difference between a brontosaurus and a diplodocus? Find the matching dinos as fast as you can!

On your turn, choose a card from the grid. Try to find the card that matches, Dinosaur to Dinosaur Skeleton. If you succeed, collect both cards. If you fail, both cards are flipped back over for the next player's turn. The game ends when all cards have been collected, and the player who collected the most pairs wins.

name: Olympus Loonacy
description: Olympus Loonacy is a rapid fire card game in which players race to be the first to empty their hand by matching one of two images on each card in their hand with the images on the open piles in front of them. The number of piles varies depending on the number of players, and if players ever reach a moment in which no one can play, everyone draws a card and it adds it to their hand at the same time, then the game play resumes.

name: Emerald Kingdom
description:
You will play as the chief of one of the major Celtic clans, vying for the high crown of the Emerald Kingdom. You win by gaining the most Renown (Victory Points) over the course of 7 rounds. Gain Renown by expanding and upgrading your clan buildings, raiding and weakening your opponents, and completing unique quests.

Throughout the course of the game, you will encounter remnants of the Tuatha De Dannan's power. Arcana cards can instantly change the flow of battle and their powerful Artifacts give you a permanent upgrade based on ancient Irish gods, such as Lugh, the Dagda, and more.

Each round has up to three Seasons. During the Building Season, you can place and upgrade the buildings on your clan board. The Harvest Season lets you gather much-needed resources based on which buildings you have. Finally, the Raiding Season allows you to attack your opponent's clan, or attempt a quest through simultaneous action selection.

The key to victory is to outthink your opponents and send your Warriors where they can earn the most Renown, but be careful not to leave your precious buildings unprotected.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Tile Placement

name: The Elusive Pimpernel
description:
It is 1793, and France is in the throes of bloody revolution. Every day the Committee of Public Safety carts dozens of aristocrats and royalists to the hungry guillotines. But a mysterious hero, the Scarlet Pimpernel, has been rescuing dozens of condemned Frenchmen and their families, whisking them away to the safety of England. Nobody seems to know who he is, for he and his League of supporters are masters of cunning and disguise. But can they continue to outwit agent Chauvelin and his guards who are determined to stop them?

Based on the novels of Baroness Orczy, this card game sets each player a secret identity and a different win condition. The Scarlet Pimpernel and his League try to rescue as many prisoners as possible, against Chauvelin and his agents for the Committee for Public Safety who try to execute the condemned. Depending on the player count, there may also be a corrupt guard, out to make as much bribe money as possible, or a tricoteuse (knitting woman) who simply aims to be near the heart of the violence.

The game is played over a maximum of seven rounds, corresponding to seven prisoners to be rescued, each with unique rule variations so that no two rounds are the same. Within each round, players must simultaneously place face-down cards containing coins, pimpernel flowers or swords at one of two potential rescue locations. Once all cards have been played, the location with the most bribe money (coins) is where the rescue attempt takes place, and at that site the fate of the prisoner depends on whether there are more swords (executed) or flowers (rescued). Players must use bluff and cunning to deduce the identities of the other players, then work with their allies to swing the outcomes to their favour.
categories: Card Game, Novel-based, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Inn-Fighting: Drunken Caravan Guard mini promo
description:
This is a promotional mini that was given out in random booster sets of D&D War of the Dragon Queen as well as conventions in 2007

Drunken Caravan Guard HP:2 +1 damage with Chair attacks
Aberrant Lurch: (Attack misses, but Drunken Caravan Guard hits his head and forgets who his allies were. Every player rolls a d20, the highest roller gains control of Drunken Caravan Guard.

The mini is just a bonus.

name: Free Man
description:
Free Man is a 78-card tabletop game for 2 to 4 players. It is based on the 1967 television series "The Prisoner". The objective of the game is to escape from The Village and become a "Free Man".

This entails following the route detailed on one of ten "Route Cards", collecting cards along the way, placing some face up in a "Declaration Pile" (to satisfy different route requirements) while keeping others hidden and using them to gain abilities and/or thwart other players. Winning requires a combination of skill, luck, and cunning.

The game is won when the final card required for a player's route (a special card called a "Victory Card") is placed in that player's Declaration Pile.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Network and Route Building, Race, Variable Player Powers

name: Astroforce: Away Team
description:
In Astroforce: The Away Team expansion you have so much more to deal with, not just the mission in hand, but also organising and surviving an Away Team mission too.

This expansion adds a whole new dimension to Astroforce: The Dice Game

NOTE: You need a copy of Astroforce the Dice Game to use this product

—description from publisher

name: Pax Stellarum
description:
Pax Stellarum is a spaceship Tabletop Miniature gaming ruleset designed to be able to represent ships from any Sci-Fi universe.

Players are not limited to just designing ships, but can also develop their own fighters, weapons and troops. This allows players to design different forces for each race they play with, thus better representing the diversity found in Sci-Fi universes.

name: Guardians: Necropolis Park (the So Far Western It's Eastern Expansion)
description:
Expansion for Guardians (FPG).
Adds new creatures, spells, items, shields and terrains to the game.
Also adds the Necropolis Park Stronghold with 2 upgrades & 1 downgrade cards and 2 new Vierkuns, Eisnmir and K'Hutek.

name: La Aventura de Olivia y Cukito
description:
Cooperative game. Scour the neighborhood to find what each project calls for before time runs out. The challenges will be proposing different complexities. The ticking clock will be a very important factor to add excitement and fun!

Olivia and Cukito's adventure is the ninth title that we have produced from El Espejo, and it is of great importance to us as it is our first specifically cooperative proposal. It is an invitation to the game for early childhood, with a neighborhood theme where we seek to work on the issue of waste, trying to problematize the idea of ​​"individual environmentalism" (see section), emphasizing the importance of cooperative work and proposing as a challenge build works or "manufacturable" objects from said waste. With the premise of promoting group work, throughout the game the challenges intensify in difficulty and in the forms of communication between the players.

Olivia, along with Cukito and her friends, are thinking about what to do with so much waste that is scattered around their neighborhood. It occurred to them to put together Projects to recycle, turning some waste into useful objects or reusing them in different ways. To achieve this, they must move at full speed, locker by locker, lifting those elements that serve to complete the projects.

name: Gira-Gira
description: A memory card game where a number of cards are placed face up in a circle and players must memorize them. A tree, flags, ants, the world and an infinity of beautiful images. You will have to remember where each one is to take the cards!

name: 4 přírodovědné hry
description:
A folder of four game plans with dice and figures. Games for young schoolchildren, which introduce children to the world of animals, evolution and European birds. When they play, there is room for creating their own stories.

The folder is laminated on 2 mm thick cardboard and has a size of 98 x 34 cm when fully unfolded. The package includes a bag with a wooden cube and 4 figures and a set of chips made of hard cardboard.

The Poaching Game is a cooperative game where a team plays against poachers who steal animals. The goal is to secure a given number of animals on all continents and free the stolen animals from poachers. Players travel the world and save an animal when they enter a field with the particular animal. However, there are also hordes of poachers on the route, over which you have to win in dice fights, otherwise the animal will go into captivity. The tension in the game can be increased by putting more animals in captivity at the beginning. The game plan with the animals is set in a real map, so non-violent learning about the continents and their animals is ensured.

The Bird Game is a contribution to refreshing our birds knowledge. Players travel in concentric circles to a nest. You overcome cats in battles and run away from a storm, hawk or ornithologist. To enter the next circle, the player must collect 4 tokens, which you get when entering the squares with birds.

In Evolution, players run freely around the game board and on evolutionary accelerators you gain and exchange different parts of the body in exchange offices. The goal is to collect the body parts for the animal you choose and bring it to its field. At the end of the game you have the honor to describe or draw a monster in which you would evolve using all the body parts you have collected.

Crazy Animals is a simple game in which children compose torn sentences about animals in Czech and English. This is how sentences like "I am a green giraffe singing in the fridge" are created.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Multiple Maps

name: SHASN: Rome 40 BCE – Fall of the Republic
description: This Campaign deck with Rome 40 BCD theme, change the ideology cards included in SHASN base game to immerse the players in the politics of ancient Rome.

name: Vengeance: Overkill Promo Pack
description:
Kickstarter Exclusive bag of vengeful goodies in the shape of the Overkill Promo Pack to all pledges of Vigilante pledge and above.

This Kickstarter Exclusive pack includes unique Lubbers, Turczi and Calleja Boss Cards and a custom made Dice Tray!

name: The London Pub Crawl
description:
The London Pub Crawl is easy to pick-up-and-play so that new and old friends can join in quickly. The game board has includes a simplified set of the rules for those more forgetful pub crawlers...


Start the Crawl - Roll the die to discover where you start on the game board and pull your first Pub Card.
How to Crawl - Start each turn by pulling a Crawl Card, read it aloud and play the action on the back.
Where to Crawl - Then roll the die and take any path you wish to reach the location on your Pub Card.
Crawl to Victory - when you reach your first Pub, draw your next Pub Card and continue playing until you become the first player to reach three pubs and declare *burp* victory!


—description from the publisher

name: Heads Up!: Adult Expansion Pack
description:
The Heads Up! Adult Expansion Pack with 200 all-new cards works with any version of the popular party game, Heads Up!. While Heads Up! is a fun family game, the Heads Up! Adult Expansion Pack is something to whip out at your next adult party.

Four racy categories include Adult Supervision (1), Adult Supervision 2: Even Adultier, Adult Supervision 3: Bad Behavior, and Adult Supervision 4: Bachelorette Party. In the Adult Supervision (1 & 2) and Bachelorette Party categories, you guess words based on verbal clues. In the Bad Behavior category, you act out words for your teammate to guess. How would you act out Mud Wrestling, Pole Dance, or Sobriety Test? Those are just a few examples of what we can safely mention here.

Race the timer to guess the adult words you're wearing on your headband, based on your teammate's verbal clues. Or watch them act out the words and guess the answers before time's up!

The Heads Up! Adult Expansion Pack is a salacious supplement to the Heads Up! Game (sold separately). With 200 new cards (the same amount as in the original game), it's a whole new game that adults only are invited to play!

--publisher's description
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Action Timer, Deduction, Memory, Real-Time, Team-Based Game

name: Wheatford Court Castle
description: A storytelling game based in a mysterious castle. There are three variations on the rules: In the Explore the castle variation, players take turns contributing to the story using the cards in hand; In the discover the secrets variation, players aren't offered the choice; in the investigate the mystery variation, one player is the perpetrator of the crime, and the story is structured around that.

name: Fingerlings: Treetop Fall Game
description:
You're good at keeping your Fingerlings on your finger, but can you keep them from falling out of the tree in the new Fingerlings Treetop Fall Game?

This is a classic skill-and-action game where players take turns pulling branches out of the tree without letting any of the monkey pieces inside the tree fall out. You've got to spin the spinner to find out what color branch you should remove, or maybe you'll get lucky and spin the skip space so you don't have to remove any branch that turn. If any monkeys fall to the bottom of the tree on your turn, you keep them. Once all the monkeys have fallen out of the tree, the game ends and the player with the fewest monkeys wins.

name: Black Stories Junior: Pferde Stories
description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: horse stories includes fifty cards with riddles for you to puzzle out.

In these horse-powered riddles about fake coat colours, spooky ghost horses, exploding dung heaps, botched riding holidays or ponies in mortal danger, you have to combine things smartly and think cleverly around corners to uncover their secrets.

name: Blanc Manger Coco: Plein les Urnes
description:
Blanc Manger Coco - Plein les Urnes is the Blanc-Manger Coco extension on the 2022 presidential elections. More broadly, it addresses the subject of politics from an electoral angle.
The association of question cards and answer cards makes it possible to create discrepancies, and therefore to laugh.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Political, Word Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Escape Box: Chtulhu
description: Through 3 scenarios, with several levels of difficulty, the Escape Game settles in your living room. Hide the clues in your home, and above all, try to solve the riddles to save the world of the Ancient God in less than 60 minutes.

name: Feats of Cheese
description:
In Feats of Cheese, physics and your fine motor skills are put to the test. Players take turns stacking cheese wedges to create tall towers. The taller the tower, the more points you earn. It takes a careful hand and an eye for balance to accomplish this feat.

Stack a cheese wedge on the matching color platform and add a mouse if you can. If you knock over the tower, your opponents score points and you score nothing! To score, players multiply the number of mice in the tower by the number of cheese wedges that match the platform. The player with the most points at the end wins!

name: Dungeon Doodle Duel
description:
Dungeon Doodle is a two-player roll & write game in which one player takes on the role of Dungeon Lord to design a dungeon behind his player screen, while the other player plays the Hero trying to conquer it.

As Dungeon Lord, roll your dice to draw your Dungeon. Place Traps, Doors, Treasures and Monsters. Protect your Crystals. If you snatch all of your opponent’s Health Points, you’ll win immediately. At the end you will earn Victory Points by protecting your crystals, treasures, and Health Points you have earned from the Hero.

As the Hero, roll your dice to assault your opponent’s dungeon.
Move, fight Monsters, find Keys, and Treasures. If you find your opponent’s 3 Crystals you’ll win immediately. At the end you’ll earn Victory Points for stealing treasures, defeating monsters, conquering Crystals and the Life Points you keep.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Το Τρίγωνο της Γνώσης (The Triangle of Knowledge)
description:
A trivia board game for kids

The board is a big triangle with 36 smaller triangles in it. Each triangle has one or two numbers inside.

On his turn, each player first put a pawn in a small triangle of his choice, then draws a card and answer the same number of questions as the number in the triangle. If the answer is correct, he puts a triangle tile in notch and moves to another triangle otherwise it is the turn of the other player.

The game ends when one of the players put all of the triangle tiles of his color on the board or all the 36 triangle notches are occupied.

Every tile gives you 10 VPs. If you shape a hexagon with the same color you take 30 additional VPs. The player with the most points wins.

name: The Dukes of Hazzard
description:
An extremely fun and rare board game, based on the famous TV series. It was released in Greece during the 80's by Tjitji Toys. It can be played from 2-4 players.
Before start, each player gets 30$ from the bank. Then, everyone in his turn, roll the 2 dices (the usual one and the colorfull one). When you roll the usual one, your move your pawn (General Lee) the exact number on the board. Then you roll the colorfull one and you move the pawn with the police car. The police car can be moved back and forth. When a player reaches a spot where stands another player, he must pay him 5 dollars and stay in the previous spot. When the police car hits another player, the player who has been hitted, must pay 5 dollars to the bank. In case, that a player must pay the bank and he has no money, as a result he returns to the starting point.
Furthermore, when a player reaches a spot with a question mark on it, he must take a card and follow its rules.
The winner is the player who reaches the finish line, with the exact number on the dice.

—user summary

name: Airships and Automatons
description:
In Airships and Automatons players play as an Automaton that can convert into an Airship and back again. They will be traveling around their city sheet completing tasks with dice rolls. Certain areas require the player to be an Airship while other tasks require the player to be an Automaton. Further still, there are two spaces that can be used by either.

Players will have to move each turn, 1 space as an Automaton or up to 2 spaces as an Airship. They will use their dice to Convert, move an extra space or two, or activate their area of the City. Players also gain powers and create combos by completing tasks in the City.

Opportunities arise for players who are playing quickly to trigger a bonus by moving back into Area 1 of the City which allows all players to Convert, but the triggering player to earn a special bonus.

The game plays over 12 revolutions of the City sheet. Each revolution will last a number of rounds determined by the players. Will they play fast? Will they play slow to do all of the actions? The choices are plenty!

Scoring is done for each area with the players having a grand total at the end. The winning Automaton will have to master the clock as well as plan ahead each time focusing to maximize areas so they can outscore their rivals.

Airships and Automatons can be played solo or with up to 4 players. There are suggestions for how to combine the airships and automaton cards, but with this print and play format, players can create any number of combinations they choose. Additionally, printing out a set of cards for each player allows them to choose their own combinations and see if their own skill can beat their opponents when using the same Airship/Automaton combination!

Get ready to roll and write in this all new Steampunk game!

—description from the designer
categories: City Building, Dice, Industry / Manufacturing, Print & Play, Transportation

name: 5 sekund Junior 2.0: edycja 2019
description: 5 Seconds Junior Edition 2019 is a specially prepared edition of the iconic 5 seconds game with kids in mind! Surely you can easily name 3 flavors of jam - but can you do it under time pressure? Hurry up, you only have 5 seconds

name: Das Gespenst in der Schule
description:
Small escape room adventure directed to children. Your friend has disappeared, and it is rumoured that there is a ghost in your school.

A deck of 34 cards, including story and puzzles to solve along the way.

name: 24 Hours Escape: Lupin der Meisterdieb und der große Coup
description:
The skills of Arsene Lupin are needed to solve an art counterfeiting case in Paris. The story follows a book format, where puzzle solutions tell you to which page you should continue. The book can be played through in a single session, or it can be split into two sessions at a recommended spot.

This escape game is full of tricks, creative ideas and criminal energy. Each puzzle is illustrated and puts the master of crime, France's most notorious crook in a brilliant light. Accompany Arsène Lupin alone or with up to four players through a unique escape game through the winding streets of old Paris.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Escape Room: Spillet 2
description:
Race against the clock: you have 60 minutes to enter the correct keys on the Chrono decoder to escape. It will count down remaining time, and emit intense sounds to let you know you’re almost out of time. Can you escape?

4 exciting escape rooms with varying levels of difficulty. Work together to escape from Murder Mystery, Secret Agent, The Dentist, and Space Station.

Note: This is the Norwegian version wich contains an additional case, The Murder Mystery wich seperates it from:
Escape Room: The Game (Escape Rooms II)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: ZOKU
description:
Fast and Fun game where players act as Bosozoku gangs chiefs. First they send their Zokus (represented by meeples) to take control over Tokyo districts.
Then, they resolve fights between gangs by throwing the Zokus in the box !

Whoever gets more influence in Tokyo is the winner.

name: Match Ball: The Game After the Match
description:
Card game simulating the exciting back and forth of a tennis match. Scoring is similar to real tennis, complete with aces and smashes.

Game play requires strategic timing of countering your opponent’s cards. Each card has a level of hierarchy, and choosing the right moment to play or keep each card in your hand presents a new challenge every turn.

First player to win best of three sets (like in the physical sport of tennis), wins the game and receives a trophy card for each set won.

Great family game for any tennis player or fan of the sport. It helps to know actual tennis scoring before starting a game, but can be picked up easily by anyone after a few tries - and can even help teach the sport itself.

name: Pocket Sports Darts
description:
Pocket Darts replicates a typical game of darts. Using seven custom dice, you roll to reduce your score down from 501 to zero, but you must end on a double.
