Throw the dice, score 180 or maybe you got a bad lie. Work your way down to a double but try and get to one of the favourite doubles to give you more chance of checking out. How to finish from a particular total? Don't worry about that, there is a handy checkout guide to help you out.

name: Asteroid Empire
description:
As the CEO of a new asteroid mining space start-up, your job is to make the most money from exploring nearby asteroids for precious resources. Coordinate your ships and their crew to claim and extract everything they can from these asteroids and return them to Earth for the biggest profit. The more you control the supply of one type of resource the more money you can make. But watch out for other competitors who want to expand their asteroid mining empires too!

Asteroid Empire is a 9 card game that puts rival CEO's of asteroid mining start-ups against each other to make the most profit. Can you make the most money and expand your space mining empire?
The aim is to be the mining start-up with the most money once all of the nearby asteroids have been mined and the game ends.

The game is played over a number of rounds in which players can explore or mine each asteroid. The player with the start token goes first, once they have placed a ship their opponent gets to place a ship and play continues to alternate until both players have placed all their ships (to either explore or extract) and the round ends. Once a ship has been placed in a round it cannot be moved or returned to the players hand. At the end of each round both players will retrieve all their ships and the start token is passed to the other player who will then go first in the next round. The remaining asteroids are not shuffled and left in the same order.

Once the last asteroid is claimed to be mined then the game ends and the materials extracted can be counted to determine who generated the most income. The income each resource is worth depends on how many cards of that resource each player has and is listed on each asteroid card with that resource type.

name: Rackare! 3
description: Expands the base game with another 600 600 new cards that deal with everything from pandemics to electric scooters. 400 white cards and 200 black cards. Though this expansion can be played as it is without the base game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Wódz plemienia
description:
Wódz plemienia ("The Tribe Chief") is a very interesting adventure game that will attract everyone. You have to prove that you are the best candidate for Chief of the Tribe.

A true leader must be resourceful, well-planned, charismatic, and committed to trading. Candidates take a test to select who best meets the above criteria. In addition to entrepreneurship and strategic skills, the character and talents assigned to your character are also important. In addition, your village is struggling with the adversities of nature, and fate brings surprises and opportunities that are worth taking advantage of.

THE COURSE OF THE GAME

The game takes place over the course of the year, and the passage of time is the movement of the pawn along the path of time. During each month, all players go through 4 Phases:

PHASE I - GROWTH
In this phase, all players successively: multiply their inventory, take 1 inhabitant, and take the crop from their crops.

PHASE II - TRADE
During this phase, all players buy or sell their 4 inventory tokens. Additionally, whoever has a purchase can go to it and sell tokens there, regardless of the general trade.

PHASE III - CONSTRUCTION
In this phase, players can perform one of the three actions: set up a crop, build a store, or train a buying staff.

PHASE IV - FATE
In this phase, the players roll the dice. Whoever gets an odd number of spots skips fate. Whoever has an even number of spots - he draws the "Fate" card for himself and is used to write it. If having a specific character trait gives you extra prots, it is written on the card and then we follow this notation.

The description of the actions in each phase is additionally written on the board.

After the end of the 4 Phases, we move the time pawn to the next month and start the queue again.

MAGICAL NIGHT
When the movement pawn reaches the MAGIC NIGHT space, we read aloud what happens to the entire village. The record on the card applies to all players. If the holder of a character trait is treated specially, it is recorded on the card.
After following the instructions on the Magic Night card, move the pawn to the next month.

EXCHANGE
If, as a result of writing on the card, one player has to pay something to the other, but he does not have the appropriate amount, he returns the inventory tokens to the bank, exchanges them for $ and pays the opponent. If one player has to give the other an inventory token, but he doesn't have one, he pays the equivalent of $ ($ 1 for 1 inventory). If, as a result of writing on the card, one player has to give the other a citizen token, but he does not have one, then he pays the equivalent of $ ($ 1 per 1 inhabitant).

CORONATION

After the time pawn reaches this space, the points are scored
individual players.

name: Eispicker
description:
This fun game of skill can be played in two different versions with 2-4 players. Carefully remove the ice blocks from the ice wall with the ice pick or show off your skills on the ice tower. Your skill is tested in both of these exciting versions, because if the penguin falls, the game is over!

1.Version: Ice wall The game starts when the ice wall is set up and the penguin is in position. You can play this game with 2-4 people. The players take turns to carefully pick an ice block out of the wall with the small hammer (ice pick). Players always have to keep an eye on the little penguin, because if it falls off the wall, the game is over! The player who makes the penguin fall off loses the game.

2.Version: Ice tower Players now take turns to pull out a block of ice from the tower with their hands. The same applies here: If the penguin falls, the game is over and the player who caused it loses the game!
mechanics: Physical Removal, Single Loser Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: Pensum
description:
A trivia game where all players are asked questions from a card, one question (A-E) at a time.
If at any time a player chooses not to answer, or answers wrongly, they do not get to answer the rest of the questions. When all questions have been asked, or when all players are out, players move on the board depending on how many correct answers they have.
At certain points on the track, the players need at least a certain number of correct answers, thereby giving the other players a chance to catch up.

—user summary

name: Pop-A-Tops: Pet Factor
description:
Pop the top to “roll” the dice and choose the category, then race to collect the cute animal piece you think will score highest!

The player with the highest score that matches the dice roll keeps the card. Player who collects the most cards at the end wins!

Which adorable pet is the cutest, cuddliest, biggest, rarest or the most famous?

— description from the publisher

On a player's turn they roll the die which shows a category (cuteness, cudliness, size, rarity, fame, player's chioce). Immediately each player has to grab a pet with the highest value of the indicated parameter. When each player grabs one card, they flip them and chech the value. The player that chose the best pet keeps the card. The first player to keep 5 or 7 cards (depending on the number of players) wins the game.

— user summary
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Nico Burger
description:
Nico burger is a quick and light balance game that also offers two other 2 player only modes of play.

In the main balance game for 2-6 players (Nico Burger Tower) players will take turns drawing an order card and stacking the burger components in one large central stack. Orders can vary from a "no meat burger" to a "special nico burger" that includes tomato, cheese, lettuce, meat, and a bun. The deck also contains "volume up" cards that only add a single component such as onion or cheese. Watch out for tong cards which will force you to use the slippery tongs to fulfill the next order rather than your hands! Much like Jenga, the game ends when someone topples the burger tower. That player loses the game.

In addition to the balance mode, the game also comes with two 2 player modes, Nico Burger Cooking and Nico Burger Sandwich

Nico burger cooking is a speed variant in which players reveal several order cards then race to build and wrap up the burgers with the included paper wrappers. The fastest player wins.

Nico burger sandwich is a checkers/chess like variant played on the included paper board where players move their markers a single space orthogonally in an attempt to capture opponent's pieces by "sandwiching" an opponent's piece between two of their own.

name: Ascension: Realms Unraveled – Oziah's Familiar Promo
description:
Promotional card released with the Ascension Year Four Collector's Edition.

Cost: 4 Runes

Enlightened Hero

Defeat a Monster with cost 4 or less without paying its cost.
Multi-Unite: Repeat this effect.

2 Honor
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: トリック・オア・トリート (Trick or Treat)
description:
トリック・オア・トリート (Trick or Treat) is a card game from Japan. It uses a rock-paper-scissors mechanism to collect chocolate or sweets whilst going Trick Or Treat.

Players have three cards in hand, Trick, Candy, Chocolate, and choose one to place face-down. When all players have chosen, the cards are turned up and resolved.

If a majority have chosen candy or chocolate, then cards are collected from the sweets deck. But if a trick card is in play, that player can take cards from the others. The different majorities are resolved in different ways.

There is a deck of sweets shuffled and placed face-down. Depending on who won the round, cards are turned face-up and collected from the deck. these cards include candy, chocolate and ghosts. Players are trying to collect sets of candy or chocolate to win.

If a ghost turns up, it is set aside but the payer gets to steal cards from their neighbour.
user summary
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Horror, Humor, Party Game

name: A Little Dinghy
description:
You have just been made captain of the failing merchant ship Cat o’ Nine Sails. Congratulations! Unfortunately, you may have celebrated too much; you have a series of deliveries due all over the archipelago in a few short days, and in your revelry you managed to destroy your only set of maps. You need to figure out where you are headed, and fast, or else… well, the previous captain did not exactly retire.

In A Little Dinghy, one or two players work together to re-build a map and plot a successful trade route. Each turn, one player must add a card to the map, making sure to obey certain restrictions. Once all cards have been placed, the players must be able to trace a trade route across all the islands in the map that doesn't cross over itself. There is, however, one catch; the players must keep all cards in their hands at all times, including the map itself. If a player ever lets a card drop, they immediately lose the game. If players can build the map successfully and plot out their trade route, they win the game!

In addition to the base game, A Little Dinghy comes with nine scenarios that add unique rules and challenges to the game, and a career mode that can be used to chain multiple games into a campaign.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Maze, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play, Transportation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Map Addition, Network and Route Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Dead Theorists: A Card Game for Disillusioned Philosophers and Aspiring Academics
description:
In this turn-based card game, the ghosts of Simone De Beauvoir, W.E.B. Du Bois, Michel Foucault, and Karl Marx have returned from beyond the grave to complete a bit of unfinished business. Become the specter of one of these four great (but deceased) thinkers as you seek to recruit your last great protégé from the ranks of students on one college campus. But you’ve encountered two challenges you didn’t expect: First, the forces of neoliberalism have been hard at work dismantling the education system. It will be tough to train your final pupil from within today’s profit-oriented university. Second, you’ve got competition! Other spirits have also awoken and they’re dead set on halting your progress and advancing their own ghostly agendas. Can you train your protégé in order to complete your unfinished business — and be the first one to do it? Satirical, educational, and a ton of fun for battle-hardened academics and philosophical novices alike. Includes 81 cards and the rules in an attractive box set.

—description from the publisher

name: Hunt A Killer: The Melancholy Killer
description:
In this story by Peter Gillespie (America’s Most Wanted), a convicted serial killer mysteriously leaves you his belongings after being murdered in prison. Thousands of people believed he was innocent, and as protests erupt around the country, it is up to you to solve the mystery of the Melancholy Killer.

In this all-in-one box, you’ll examine the life of Edward Lee Dwyer and the prison riot that led to his death. Enjoy 5-7 hours of gameplay, no subscription required.

Solve puzzles, examine clues, and decrypt ciphers to unveil the truth about the coast-to-coast murders.

The Melancholy Killer’s personal briefcase will be delivered to your door. Examine official prison documents and other personal belongings from the hands of the serial killer.

Difficulty: 5/5 - Hard

-description from publisher's website

name: On the Hunt
description:
In this game players take on the roles of hunters, each competing to have the most valuable collection of deer, moose and elk at the end of 5 years!

A roll of the dice determine which animals are available to hunt, then each hunter fights for control over the best hunting grounds to shoot their prized mounts.

Each round you start by increasing you priority for mule deer, moose or elk. The higher your priority, the more likely you are to be given permission to hunt that animal. Next, you all take turns placing your hunter meeples on the 6 different hunting areas. Each hunting area has different animals with different point values. If you have the most hunter meeples in a hunting area, you get to shoot first!

A final roll of the shooting dice determine whether you hit your animal or not! Each hunter meeple you have in the area is an extra shooting dice you get to roll. Will you play it safe? Or risk it for the big haul?

—description from the designer

name: Battle Command Volume I: The Battle of the Bulge and Operation Crusader
description:
Building on the innovative gameplay of his Fast Action Battle (FAB) Series, designer Rick Young has reimagined the best parts of FAB to introduce a new game system: Battle Command. The goal of the Battle Command system is to provide a fresh and engaging way for various conflicts across different eras to be fought with minimal time wasted on setup and complex rules, making this both a great introductory system for new and veteran players alike.
Each Battle Command volume includes TWO different games in one box. Volume I brings players to the forests of the Battle of the Bulge, and the sun, heat, and sand of North Africa during Operation Crusader. The design emphasis has been placed on making the game very player-friendly and manageable in its level of scope, difficulty, and time of play. With a low total counter count and density, these quick playing (though still realistic) simulations present players with deep strategy meriting contemplation. A system of map areas has been adopted, and movement has been streamlined.

For those who prefer to use a paper map, or who would like to be able to set up both games side by side, we are including a double-sided paper map along with the double-sided mounted map. This is for those of you who have 3 friends who would like to play, or play at conventions, or just plain prefer a paper map.

Battle Command (BC) is a refinement and simplification of the old Fast Action Battles (FAB) game series. Those familiar with the FAB games will recognize that the scope is the same, with higher echelons, artillery, events, and combat assets that can be assigned as available. FAB however was rules intensive and procedural, and those elements have been streamlined in the BC series. Most players do not need to pick up the rulebook after the first turn or two, as everything you need to play has been printed on the map, including a flow-chart with extended sequence of play so that no turn segment will be overlooked, and your attention will be placed solely on the battle at hand. Special rules needed for each event are printed directly on the event cards, so you can play them and forget them without having to refer to the rulebook.

Components:
Two Rulebooks
220 playing cards (110 per game)
1 double-sided mounted map (34"x22") with one game on each side
1 double-sided paper map (34"x22") with one game on each side
2 counter sheets
4 Player Aids
2 dice

-description from publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Movement Points

name: Hush: Evergreen Pass
description:
March 2022 episode for Hush.

Includes:

Map postcard: Evergreen Pass
Character card: Czibo
Nocturnal Creature card: Zoella
Spirit card: Skeleton Spirit

name: The Awakening of Cerberus
description:
In Greek mythology, it is said that a young man named Orpheus used the "tone of the lyre" to put Cerberus to sleep, and in The Awakening of Cerberus, all three heads start the game asleep.

The two players want to collect all the souls of their allies while not losing their own lives in the process. To that end, it is important for you to co-ordinate your strategies since Cerberus may wake if the strategy shifts. An awakened Cerberus head will attack to re-capture the souls it has collected, but you can possibly send it back to sleep. Due to the darkness of the Netherworld, however, free communication between the players is restricted.

name: Donieck Airport
description:
This small game for the Battles of the XXI Century system covers the fierce fights for the Donieck Airport in the 2014-15 between Ukraine and Donbas separatists, supported by Russia.

There are two scenarios for the game, covering fights in 2014 and 2015. These are not covering all the fights, but showing one day of combat from each stage of the battle. Players are allowed to extend each scenario to make it longer.

Game uses B-XXI system rules and ownership of at last one of the boxed games of this system is required, because of the rules, markers etc.

Game was published in the 45 issue of the TiS magazine in both Polish and English editions.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Dígalo con Memes: Pack de Expansión #1
description: Expansion Pack #1 with "new" memes and "new" situation cards for Dígalo con Memes. To complement the original game or pretend dementia and play with this mini version.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Awk-Word
description:
Act fast and shout out in the game of Awk-Word from Ridley's Games!

In this hella cool game, you'll want to collect the most chips by shouting words really fast.

So what's the 411? After the dice have been rolled, players take turns shouting words that fit a topic. For example, if the topic is PIZZA TOPPINGS, you might shout “Pepperoni" or "Olives" or “Anchovies” BUT you can’t shout a word that begins with any of the letters showing on the dice! When you shout a valid answer that the referee approves, you get to take a chip.

But be quick with your answers (like, two seconds max), because if the referee feels you're taking too long, they can ring the Awk-Word bell on you and you'll be out for that round! You'll be totally buggin, but don't worry, you'll be able to play again in the next round.

Play continues until each player has been the referee three times, and if you have the most chips, you win! Booyah!

Perfect for groups of friends, families and 90s lovers, it's suitable for ages 13+, 2-7 players and has an average 15 minute gameplay.

-description from publisher

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Ashen Shears and Cleavage X
description:
Glossary Card and Gear Card that were included with the Pascha First Run Collector's Edition that was not part of the based game.

The First Run Collector's Edition is enclosed in a hand-stamped kraft box includes:

Photoresin Pascha
1 x Hard Plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round insert and base
Large Matte Art Print
Character Art Card
Beta Rules - 1 x Glossary Card, 1 x Gear Card
First run collector's edition: Signed and numbered authenticity note
Deathgrey edition limited to 250: Deathgrey authenticity note

Pascha is a survivor from a settlement that primarily hunts Ashen Lagomorphs, also known as Milk Rabbits. What they lack in intelligence, they make up for in viscousness and a high capacity to breed. Milk Rabbits never stop growing, and their appetite increases with their size. Most die from madness, others from their front teeth getting so long they curl under their chin and cut their jugular.

Milk Rabbits have poor eyesight and scent, wearing fabrics and makeup made from their fur and fat is a great way to confuse them while on the hunt.

Pascha’s shears are specially made to cut dense Milk Rabbit fur that is so fluffy and matted it acts as a layer of armor!

Her settlement lives in fear and respect for the monster, often holding festivals to promote health, fertility, and a healthy body.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Geen JA geen NEE: mini spel
description:
You say Yes or No more often then you think.

But in this game this will be punished immediately. Your opponents try's to get a Yes or No by asking smart questions.

But if you keep a clear head and answer clever, you win the card.

Who has the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Turns -n- Time
description:
Turns -n- Time is a Mechanism from the World of Bedlam. A world where humanity has evolved beyond the need for morality and the individual is protected as a productive unit within The Society.

An approved Mechanism, Turns -n- Time ensures Compliant Conflict Resolution without appealing to superstitious concepts such as morality or justice from humanity’s primitive past.

Turns -n- Time is an In-Hand Game, in which players attempt to disable their opponents mechanism before their own is disabled through tactical choices across 3 registers (direction, action, and element).

name: Phantom Ink: Extra Secret Objectives
description:
A promo card for Phantom Ink that can be obtained by registering your game on the Resonym website.

Adds six new words:
Cookie
Chimney
Ribbon
Birthday
Reindeer
Vacation

name: Fast West
description:
You know when in the middle of the far west someone pulls out a gun? Here, you are in the middle of the far west and someone pulled out a gun ...
Dodge, reload, use the revolver or the shotgun, keep your eyes on everyone to anticipate the moves and play your cards right to bring home the skin!

As fast as the speed and immediacy of this card game: everyone plays a card, everyone turns it, the shooting starts and all hell breaks loose!

West as the wild place without rules, full of twists, timeless phrases and duels in which we all at least once wanted to participate ... all that remains is to choose your gunfighter, take up the revolver and jump into the fray!

name: Devil Dots
description: The game consists of 36 dice (six dice in each of six colors). Each player draws three random dice from a bag to start the game. Players take turns choosing to roll 1, 2, or all 3 of their dice and then adding those to a growing grid of dice so that all the colors and numbers of dice in each row and column are either all the same or all different. Players score one point for each die in every row and column to which dice were added on their turn. Players replenish back to three dice at the end of their turns. Play ends when the bag is empty.

name: Schollen treiben
description:
The animals in the Arctic are bored. That's why polar bears, seals, ice gulls and even the odd orca have arranged to play a fun little game: floating on the ice floes.

So without further ado, the animals jump around happily on the ice floes and try to form the largest possible groups with conspecifics. The orcas help where they can and the other animals pass the time cheerfully in the icy Arctic Ocean.

In this fun card game by author Martin Schlegel, 2-6 people aged 8 and up must have good eyes.

In each round, the aim is to find the best possible place for the newly revealed card in order to form the largest possible groups of animals of the same species.

How is the game played?
At the beginning, 2 cards are placed in the middle, whereby it does not matter whether their islands fit together sensibly or not. The remaining cards form the draw pile.

Then turn over another card, place it in plain sight for everyone to see, and start a 1-minute countdown.

Now the "let the heads smoke" phase begins:

Which of you will find the best place for the new card? You should make sure that as many animals of the same species (polar bears, seals, ice gulls) as possible come together on the newly created floes.

If an orca can be seen on both maps, the points are doubled.

Within the 1-minute countdown, everyone now looks for the best place for the new map and you all note down the highest possible score.

At the end of the minute, you compare the numbers and whoever has the highest number of points has to prove that putting on the card also brings in the corresponding number of points.

If this is successful, the person receives 3 extra points in addition to the number of points he or she has written down; all others receive the number of points they have written down.

If this is not successful, the person goes away empty-handed; all the others receive their points and the card is discarded.

In the game instructions you will find 2 more variants: One where you outscore each other by calling out the scores, another with an hourglass. The scoring remains the same in both cases.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Predictive Bid, Real-Time, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Speed Matching, Tile Placement

name: M.E.A.T.: The Cult
description:
M.E.A.T.: The Cult is a card and board game in which the most important mechanics are: drawing, drafting and playing cards. Significant elements of the game are also: selecting tactics, in which players decide on the arrangement of cards, the order and type of plays, as well as randomness - random selection of cards and the use of dice rolls in the game.

The main goal of the game is to bring the opponent's (or the opposing group's) VITALITY points to 0. This process is possible due to the advantage achieved in subsequent game rounds.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Indian Wars, American West, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme, Zombies
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Planet Voyagers
description: Each player manages a hand of five cards. Each round, players simultaneously play one card from their hand. The cards are revealed and resolved. Players earn points from the cards in different ways --- by moving their rockets across the solar system; by researching planets; or by receiving the points shown on the cards themselves. Hands are replenished at the end of the round. The first player to reach Neptune or to earn 12 points wins the game.

name: Cavity
description:
Cavity is a finite Go variant with an elimination goal – a bit like Mark Steere's Redstone, but without red stones.

Like Go, Cavity is played on the points of a square grid, and groups and liberties are defined the same way.
An empty region is a group of empty points, and it is said to be adjacent to a stone if any of its points are.

Setup:
Starting with Black, place one stone each on any empty point.
The setup is over as soon as the players have one stone each on the board.

Play:
On your turn, place a stone of your color on any point in an empty region that's adjacent to a stone of your color.
After placement, first remove all enemy groups that have no liberties, then remove all friendly groups that have no liberties.
In this phase, as soon as one player is the only one with stones on the board, the game is over and that player is the winner.

The game is balanced with the pie rule, or with pass-komi. Pass-komi is a whole number of points awarded to White as compensation for going second. White can spend such a point instead of placing a stone.

—description from the designer

name: Stalemate
description:
Stalemate is a unique set of miniatures rules which captures the true flavor of World War I trench warfare. Within this game system are elements as; hand-to-hand fighting, artillery vectors, machine-guns, flanking maneuvers, and much more. It is the sincere hope of the authors that you derive many hours of enjoyment from this publication.

—description from the rulebook
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Simulation

name: War of Salus
description:
A hex grid war game that utilizes a dice-based action mechanic alongside largely deterministic combat to put as much agency in each player's control.

Player's fight for control over command posts and to destroy each other's power generators while also managing their own reinforcements, shared defensive abilities, and each unit's unique abilities.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Die Icon Resolution, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Turn Order: Auction

name: Chaos im Museum: Die Antwort liegt auf dem Tisch
description:
A quiz game for the whole family with different game variants for young and old. The next big exhibition is coming up, but what is it? All 300 exhibits are lying all over the museum. What a crazy mess! Help the museum director and answer exciting quiz questions in three difficulty levels from five different categories, such as history, culture and technology. Find the right object in this chaos and collect it for your own exhibition. You win the game with the biggest and most beautiful exhibition. So go in search of the greatest treasures in world history and be celebrated as famous museum experts! A fun family quiz with different game variations for young and old.

—description from the publisher

name: Star Realms: Stingray Promo Card
description:
Name: Stingray
Type: Blob ship
Cost: 2
Attack: 5
When you recycle the ship you gain 2 tokens.

Promotional card given out on a Wise Wizards giveaway via a social media platform.

name: Cat-Tastrophe!
description:
Oh no! The cat's stuck up in the tree, and the firefighter can't get him down! It's a catastrophe!

Grab your handy pole and carefully push out the tree's pegs to help lower the feisty feline back down to Earth. But be careful: don't let kitty fall, or you lose!

name: Matik
description:
A puzzle game that requires tactical planning and reacting to the actions of the opponents.

During one game, each participant will perform only 9 actions. Therefore, it is worth considering each play carefully, especially since the opponents are only counting on your error. Fast gameplay, tactical decisions and a strategic approach to the moves made - this is Matik!

HOW TO PLAY ?

Add a tile or a pawn to the board.
Watch the movements of the other players.
Earn points for tiles next to your pawns.


Gra logiczna wymagająca taktycznego planowania oraz reagowania na poczynania przeciwników.

W trakcie jednej gry każdy z uczestników rozgrywki wykona jedynie 9 akcji. Warto zatem dobrze przemyśleć każde zagranie, zwłaszcza, że przeciwnicy tylko liczą na Twój błąd. Szybka rozgrywka, taktyczne decyzje i strategiczne podejście do wykonywanych ruchów – to właśnie Matik!

JAK GRAĆ ?


Dołóż na planszę kafelek lub pionek.
Obserwuj ruchy pozostałych graczy.
Zdobywaj punkty za kafelki przy swoich pionkach.
